author: {'steamid': '76561198046645611', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 663, 'playtime_at_review': 1979, 'last_played': 1710803262}
review:
Before you start playing: [b]CREATE A PARADOX ACCOUNT!!!![/b]
The second time you start the game, it will get stuck on a account login screen, if you login as guest the first time.

If you got this bug, follow this:
- Uninstall the game and then remove the Registry Folder at (regedit)
[i]Computer\HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Behold Studios\Pen and Paper[/i]
- Delete the Behold Studios folder or just Pen and Paper (but deleting all files is recommended)
- then it resets everything including this bug.
(Credits for the solution from a reddit post.)
-------------------------------------------------------------

Replaying this game 10 years after its release, I'd it's... Fine? A 6/10 most.

The game is showing its age, with old jokes, repetitive and grindy gameplay. It's not terrible, but just go for the second game instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970396267', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1710447748}
review:
In the end I can't recommend this game because it turns into a grindy waste of time. You travel from point a to z over all the letters inbetween just to get a short monologue that sends you right back. Sometimes you will get attacked on every little step on the way while doing that. You also run into situations where you are outleveled from one fight to the next. This happens on the last mission. You will be arround level 35 and can beat the final missions. But for the last dungeon the recommended level jumps to 65!? It is just dumb. So you would need to grind and grind to be able to keep playing. This game needed more polish to be enjoyable. But sadly it is abandoned. It has a bug that crashes the game on start and it has broken achievements (I got the achievement of getting 3 People to level 30 but not the achiements for getting a single person to 15 and 30).
Do not buy this. Even on a sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198120274473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1708630552}
review:
The game itself is very fun and I was very excited to play. But it's unacceptable that a major bug that breaks the game hasn't been fixed after several years. It's a pity but I'd rather not play instead of going through the pain of fixing this. 

I also removed Knights of Pen and Paper 2 from my wishlist because I don't feel like supporting something like this.

If you can still get this game refunded you should do that. As of now it's just a waste of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103953421', 'num_games_owned': 3703, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 2552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2552, 'last_played': 1611539905}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper is one of the better games in the parody RPG niche genre. It does a good job of marrying classic JRPG mechanics and tropes with their Western ttrpg inspirations for a nice retro aesthetic that is clearly meant to be a loving parody.

One of the nice things about this game is its replayability and customizability, through the many different characters and build options. You can make virtually any kind of party you like, though I usually go for the classic cleric, mage, fighter, thief composition myself. But there are many different kinds of magic users from the arcane to the divine, rangers and rogues and monks too. You really can do whatever you want.

The game has a pretty barebones story, but it's there if you look for it. It's really more about capturing the feel of a classic heroic fantasy game than trying to tell a compelling narrative, and that's fine.

No complaints about the pixel art, which is often pretty fun, or the chiptune soundtrack, though that could have a bit more to it. But a lot of indie games don't have huge soundtracks, so fair enough.

The one major complaint I do have for the game is that it can become quite grindy at times, which makes the game take longer than you expect. The game isn't necessarily difficult so long as you have an alright grasp on how things work, but sometimes fights or dungeons or areas of the map can be a slog as you work to level up. This game took me 25+ hours to finish on the last attempt, and it probably could have taken 16 and felt just as fulfilling. But at least this is somewhat mitigated by giving some decent enemy and location variation, so not every fight feels the same.

If you're in the mood for a casual-ish JRPG with a fun retro theme then this game is for you. Just don't expect a masterwork of gaming and you'll probably have a fun time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035188248', 'num_games_owned': 1546, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1646, 'last_played': 1699788476}
review:
Don’t get fooled, this is a mobile game with excessive pay to win elements that just got ported on PC with no improvements (but at least the cash shop was disabled), so if you decide to play it this is what you will get:
[list]
    [*] The most power you get is not from leveling but from shops. Yes, you need to get a required level to equip an item, but their bonuses are just insane. And how is it bad, you ask? Well, you need money for it. And since you were expected to buy money with real cash - all the drops and quests barely give anything. So if you want to play this game - prepare to grind.
    [*] And since grinding is an alternative to paying money in this game, the process of grinding is made horribly tedious. Everything takes too long. Every animation, blinking, GM phrases, everything takes too much time. The same goes for combat, the enemies that you can farm have bloated HP so you will waste a lot of time only to get a few coins.
    [*] Combat is unbalanced. To put it simply - you are even further motivated to invest cash into the game, as you will either waste a lot of time on grindy enemies to level up characters and gear, or you will straight up die from enemies that you will need to kill to go further in plot. There are enemies that will stunlock your heroes, there are enemies that can AOE half HP from your party. So go grind dear customer, or just buy some gold to acquire XP potions from our shop.
    [*] Ok, so let's assume you grinded enough and now you want to craft weapon upgrades. Good luck with that as weapons and armour are not just crafted, they have a CHANCE to craft. While on higher levels there are ways to reduce failure chance to zero, if you want it earlier - go grind some more, cause with 35-55% chance to craft you will not get it fast. 
    [*] Well, enough about this, what about RPG elements? Well, they aren’t good. While you do have 5 characters in your party, they only have 4 skills each. Said skills are basic and don’t have any deep mechanics going for them. You can unlock more classes but they differ so little in their role that you will barely notice the difference.
    [*] Everything I didn’t mention is also of rather low quality. Quests mostly consist of “Kill X enemies”, plot is 90% references to everything and everyone, map is just a set of nodes that just waste your time as you are often forced to move between locations and go back only to advance the plot. The sound is abysmal. The visuals are dull and uninspired. 
[/list]
Conclusion: just don’t bother. This thing is a bathroom game for mobiles, not a game for PC that you could actually enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967561784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1700437135}
review: Normally pixel games don't captivate me much, but this game is really fun! It's got a lot of references, puns, is funny as heck. Also very intriguing, it's basically like a group of people playing D&D or something at a table. Actions based on rolls, classes, specs, etc. Seems fairly grindy and linear but I like it a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000698735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 3486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3072, 'last_played': 1700208899}
review:
Overwhelmingly positive, should be. Hasn't been the same since this one. Been a fun stroll going back through it again.

Also, some of the reviews claim this game is very grindy but that doesn't actually have to be the case. Story quests provide percentage of next level XP up, and there are potions of XP you can buy for fairly cheap. If you play straight through, there's not much grinding required. The speedrun is about 3 hours long, so a casual playthrough could run you 10-15 if you really knew what you were doing. Just because you can grind to get the cool stuff early doesn't mean you have to.

author: {'steamid': '76561199263771965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 3039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3039, 'last_played': 1698992987}
review: Knights of Pen and Paper +1. This game is a good game, i won't say that this game is outsdanding or something like that, game is ok it has rpg system you level up, then you upgrade skills. The drawback of this game is that it is way too grindy even final fantasy II pixel remaster wasn't as grindy as this game was quests give you a lot of exp but very little money the only way to solve this problem is to buy THE silver ring but to equip you party member needs to have a level of 29. Story aspect. There is no story, you just get sucked into different world and that;s it  you complete quests to either travel to one place or to collect some stuff or kill some enemies  untill you get to final dungeon and defeat the final boos and that is pretty much the whole game. I wish there was a button to be in a middle that i would be neutral about this game, because i can't recommend this game nor i cannot recommend it is just a basic game with a lot of grindy stuff and a hard achievement that you have to complete game in 365 game days, i didn't bother to complete this achievement because this game in my eyes is complete and that's it. If you expecting really interesting fights and boss fights then you will get some fights, but this game will become boring in the long run. Buy this game only if you are not in a hurry to finish this game because this game is long since you gonna need to have to buy everything on the table and then focus on the main game. I cannot recommend you this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031572826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1516, 'last_played': 1696390460}
review:
I adore this game! It's retro yet modern, and so full of fun secrets. :)
It's great for both fans of old-timey RPGs and tabletop RPGs. Not too grindy, either. Worth every penny!
Likes:
Good humor & pop culture references
Good difficulty level
Simple yet fun character leveling & upgrades
Cons:
Have to level new characters from level one
Gold can be kinda hard to come by
Could have a more overarching story

author: {'steamid': '76561198392560842', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 389, 'playtime_forever': 1179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1179, 'last_played': 1696278403}
review:
Petit jeu style RPG au tour par tour avec des éléments jeu de rôle, sympa mais avec beaucoup trop de défauts pour que je le recommande.
-graphismes nuls
-pas d'option pour changer taille et résolution du jeu
-trop difficile
-trop de grinding
-pas de raccourcis clavier pour jouer (à part la barre espace et échap dans certains cas)
-très peu de musiques et ultra courtes + répétitives
-trop peu d'ambiances sonores

Dommage il y avait tout les éléments pour en faire 1 jeu très sympa : équipements, classes, exp, monstres originaux, histoire, skills, upgrades...

author: {'steamid': '76561198066541492', 'num_games_owned': 2247, 'num_reviews': 271, 'playtime_forever': 1923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1923, 'last_played': 1429488821}
review: I think Knights of Pen and Paper is good, as long as you don't mind grinding. This is a good podcast style game, where you mostly play it in the background while doing other things. It's fine but not something worth fully focusing on, which is best reflected from its origins as a mobile game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198970749983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2344, 'last_played': 1692282813}
review:
Divertente, con citazioni al mondo nerd, dedicate soprattutto ai vecchi player come il sottoscritto. Il finale è un po' dedicato al grinding, nel senso che si deve farmare equp e comprare oggettistica forte per poter battere il boss finale ed il suo dungeon. Ma alla fine con un po' di fortuna non si deve farmare eccessivamente avendo sconfitto il boss finale di lvl 65 con il party al lvl 44. Direi che anche la fortuna batte i numeri :p 

detto questo, lo consiglio a tutti gli amanti dei Gdr in pixel art che preferiscono una storia divertente ad una grafica altisonante. Consigliato!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992333250', 'num_games_owned': 1040, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1686, 'last_played': 1691511072}
review:
O jogo é extremamente mal portado e completamente baseado em gold, como a versão do celular. 

Você ganha muito pouco e torna o game extremamente cansativo, pois foi feito para ser pay-to-win (tendo em vista que a versão de cel tu conseguia comprar gold).

Deviam refazer isso aos moldes do segundo, que recomendo à todos. Fujam desse, pois é preguiça total dos desenvolvedores. (O jogo nem se encontra mais na PlayStore, mas aqui sim...)

review: Having not touched this game in years, I was surprised to find that there is now an account log-in for the game. While it is not necessary to make an account to play the game, it's one more instance of developers wanting a player to make a bunch of accounts when part of the appeal of Steam is not having to do that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198799584474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1396, 'last_played': 1699925780}
review:
Jogo muito divertido no começo e meio, no final fica repetitivo, so não negativo pq me diverti mais com o jogo do que fiquei entendiado, mas o final do jogo de fato é repetitivo e cansativo grindar como ja falaram aqui e olha que eu sempre gostei de rpgs e grindar. Outro ponto negativo é que vc chega no final level 30 a 35 e o ultimo Dugeon é acima demais desse level, o jogo te forçar a grindar mas o xp vindo dos monstros é pouco, não é balanceado o grind no final e você fica matando os mesmos monstros que dão pouca xp por horas.
Mas como eu disse me diverti mais do que me frustrei, então indico esse jogo pra quem gosta de RPG de mesa pq é isso que esse joguinho é, um simulador de RPG de mesa, nesse momento estou indo começar o Knights of Pen and Paper 2 que parece mais polido  com mais opções nas mecânicas.

author: {'steamid': '76561199026301558', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 2777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2424, 'last_played': 1703700033}
review: Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition é uma experiência incrível de RPG de mesa virtual, repleta de humor e nostalgia. Com mecânicas envolventes e um sistema de combate estratégico, o jogo cativa os jogadores por horas a fio. No entanto, a ausência de uma trama mais complexa pode deixar alguns jogadores ávidos por um enredo mais profundo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972238713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2238, 'last_played': 1688396083}

author: {'steamid': '76561198843210400', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1689465715}
review:
Gráficos 0
Jogabilidade 0.5
História 0.5
Diversão 0.5
Trilha sonora 0.5

Nota final: 2/10

Me diverti jogando nas primeiras horas, enquanto tudo era novidade. E fiquei lá jogando pensando que já estava perto de zerar, mas depois o jogo ficou extremamente repetitivo. Só não dou nota 0 porque gostei um pouco do começo.
Não recomendo esse jogo pra ninguém. 
Ao jogá-lo você sente depois de um tempo que está em um loop infinito, fazendo missões parecidas repetidas vezes ao ponto de cansar. E no fim vê-se que é perda de tempo.
Porque se for pra ocupar seu tempo livre, que seja com um jogo melhor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066289147', 'num_games_owned': 762, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 2024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2024, 'last_played': 1689438209}
review:
Jogo bem divertido e com bastante opção de customização, muito bom como eles representam uma mesa de rpg, sempre fazendo piadas sobre os participantes da mesa.
 Em relação as conquistas para o 100% é um pouco trabalhosa, pois é preciso zerar 2 vezes, porem facilita um pouco pois tu carrega todo dinheiro que foi farmado e as customizações da mesa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198238014262', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1286, 'last_played': 1688790899}
review:
Kopp+1 é um excelente game, com cerca de 20h foi possível platinar, um problema que encontrei foi o fato que o jogo não te da XP o suficiente, perto do fim eu já havia feito todas as missões do mapa e estava ainda com a party em nível 35 enquanto a missão do Boss final estava [spoiler] nível 65  [/spoiler], forçando  o jogador a fazer dungeons infinitamente para subir o nível, algo que é um problema porque existe [spoiler] somente 2 dungeons no jogo [/spoiler] , portanto o jogo te força a fazer a mesma dungeon diversas vezes, o próprio jogo sabe disso e coloca uma conquista por fazer 50 dungeons, logo foi algo planejado.
Acredito que por o jogo ser pequeno os desenvolvedores queriam estender o tempo que as pessoas passam jogando ao adicionar esses desbalanceamento no XP ganho, assim parecendo que o jogo durou mais. 
Eu acredito que RPGs devem ser bem balanceados e algo assim deu um gosto amargo em uma experiencia que eu estava gostando muito.
7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289200795', 'num_games_owned': 1144, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 2179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2179, 'last_played': 1686528803}
review:
Really fun d&d-like game.
The classes and characters are all quite unique and there is a lot of humor in this game.
I played this game after I played a lot of the sequel on my phone and I must say that there are quite annoying systems, like not being able to see what abilities do at a glance and an awful inventory system, but it is still really fun to play.
There are a bunch of fun and interesting classes which you can mix up with different traits that can be extremely useful. There are also some items you can buy to equip to your character or permanent and consumable items in your room itself.
There are so many fun references to all kinds of things, like Steam, Pac-man and way more (don't wanna spoil too much here ;) ).
Really worth your time! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561199013814051', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1842, 'last_played': 1685194195}
review:
I think it's decently fun, but it definitely is not for everyone. Maybe a 6.5/10
There are things that are a pro for some, a con for others
These things include:
-The game is pretty heavy on the grind
-Good for when you need something to do while watching stuff etc.
-Designing team synergies, because unless you grind until you are almost OP, which takes a lot of time, you need to have a good team that serves one another. This game isn't for people who just want a power trip.

I should mention that only doing the main quests has pretty uncomfortable leaps in difficulty and level requirements. Some of the RNG can also get frustrating, losing a few equipment upgrade 50/50 throws in a row and losing all your money is very annoying. 

Finding every pop culture reference is also fun. It's cheesy but entertaining.

I may update this review when I get through the 2nd game and compare the two.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007343154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 448, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1390923344}
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147861397', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 1415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1415, 'last_played': 1676955358}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper isn't exactly unique or deep by any means, but there's something very gratifying about how [i]fast[/i] combat is in a genre that is so typically slow. 

It's reminiscent of old-school RPGs— limited progression, limited animations, and a largely basic plot, but it's a nice mash-up of callbacks and features that make for a fun enough experience.

Customization is lacking; classes have four spells, with many classes performing best when you focus on just one, which means that combat can become boring after a while. I found that building a team focused on damage over time was very powerful, which can be boring at times, but I think there's [i]just[/i] enough to keep it interesting for the shorter (by RPG standards) playtime. 

I occasionally return to this game, not because it's exceptional by any means, but because it's fun in short bursts and plays pretty well while doing something else as the entire game pushes you toward a somewhat mindless treadmill of fighting and gearing/leveling up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201246082', 'num_games_owned': 3221, 'num_reviews': 1486, 'playtime_forever': 2213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1708974942}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition, Behold Studios tarafından geliştirilen bir RPG oyunudur. Oyun, masaüstü rol yapma oyunlarının (RPG) klasik unsurlarını içerir ve oyunculara farklı karakter sınıflarını seçme ve düşmanlarla savaşma fırsatı verir.

Oyun, kendine özgü bir grafik tarzı ve retro hissiyatı sunan birinci kişi bir bakış açısına sahiptir. Oyunun temel mekaniği, oyuncuların bir karakter yaratmaları ve oyuna katılan diğer oyuncuları da kontrol etmeleridir. Oyuncular, geleneksel RPG oyunlarındaki gibi farklı karakter sınıfları arasından seçim yapabilirler ve karakterlerini özelleştirebilirler.

Oyun, bir grup maceracının, farklı yaratıklar ve canavarlarla dolu fantastik bir dünyada gezinmesini konu alır. Oyuncular, görevleri tamamlamak ve düşmanları yenmek için savaşa girerler. Savaşlar, oyunun dört farklı zorluk seviyesinde oynanabilir ve oyun ilerledikçe daha zor hale gelir.

Oyunda, karakterlerin yetenekleri, eşyaları ve diğer özellikleri, oyuncuların verdiği kararlara göre gelişir. Karakterler, savaşta kullanılan farklı silah ve zırh türlerine göre de özelleştirilebilirler.

Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition, retro tarzı grafikleri ve geleneksel RPG oyunlarına olan sadakatiyle dikkat çekiyor. Oyun, ilginç bir hikaye ve oynanışla birleşerek, RPG oyunlarını sevenler için harika bir deneyim sunar. Oyuncular, oyunu kendi hızlarında oynayabilir ve kendi karakterlerini yaratıp özelleştirebilirler.

Sonuç olarak, Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition, retro grafikleri, geleneksel RPG oyunlarına olan sadakati ve ilginç hikayesiyle, RPG oyunlarına ilgi duyanlar için harika bir seçimdir. Oyuncular, farklı karakter sınıfları arasından seçim yapabilir, karakterlerini özelleştirebilir ve farklı zorluk seviyelerinde savaşabilirler. Oyunun esprili hikayesi ve farklı seviyeleri, oyuncuların keyifli bir deneyim yaşamalarını sağlar.

review: I initially thought it was a charming little game. Sometimes I enjoy spending time on some grindy games since it is nice to zone out and wind down. However the grind required for this game is repetitive with little reward. There is no sense of progression: character levelling makes no difference since every battle is the same and all the quests involve killing x number of monsters. I feel the game does not respect my time and so I recommend spending your valuable time on something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068269860', 'num_games_owned': 1067, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 993, 'last_played': 1668292624}
review:
This game mocks me, as the LV 20 frozen dungeon keeps flashing on my screen in the showcase reel as I write this review. I know this game used to be a micro transaction phone game and you can really really tell when you hit the LV 20 frozen dungeon. It was the paywall to break the strongest of microtransaction wills. 
All my characters are level 40 with the second to last blacksmith upgrades and maxed accessories. Something that already took way to much grinding to get all the coins for especially since blacksmith is random chance and your spending 450 coins a pop to try to upgrade even with chance boosting accessories it takes me around 3 attempts to get. 
But experience is the true problem as I have 100% all the available side quests and any other source gives you barely any XP. The only one I haven't done is the level 70 quest which either means I'm around the games half way point or that's the your have played this game too much quest. I shouldn't feel under leveled after all the money grinding done. Especially since the recommended level of the frozen dungeon is LV 20 and I'm double with almost maxed gear. 
Max enemy number of ghost dwarves appear and in first combat round instant downs my tank and every round after takes out 2 more party members. The only thing I can think to do now is chug potions like a food challenge Youtuber and grind even more coins for preparation. I am in much awe at the ridiculousness of this previous paywall I had to write a review.I can't support phone developers that just dump their games on steam like this without rebalance as there's no way this section wasn't specifically planned for micro green harvest.
I recommend getting Epic Battle Fantasy 4 on steam instead. Another humorous turn based RPG, hand drawn with character customization. Outfits and weapons you find not only changing your elemental damage and resistances but how the characters in your party look. Characters also have separate skill trees not just 4 abilities that you make number go big. Used to be an old flash RPG I played on high school computers before Flash player went away and a lot of them ended up on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025174481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1665672306}

author: {'steamid': '76561198119547024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 962, 'last_played': 1676617655}
review:
I've seen an abundance of people defend this game. I do not know at what price it is currently being sold, but it is too high. There are infinite issues that i should only touch on, to avoid arthritis suddenly flaring. 
1. This game is ALL grind, no progression. Enjoy fighting X amount of Y 100 times, it'll happen more than once.
2. The story. I personally could not connect with the many pages of dialogue I had to click through to get to play again. It's a barrier in the way of grinding ya have to do anyway.
3. The smithing system. It's like a gotcha game, but you only pay with your time. Enjoy rolling for smithing stones,( about a million needed btw), and then returning to roll for gear purchases you may or may not succeed on.
4. The upgrades. Every upgrade is tainted by an unnecessarily heavy toll. Wanna do more damage as a mage? more mana. Wanna do more healing? More mana. Wanna give mana as a druid to your team? MORE. MANA.
5. The enemies. Too reliably the same. Just character models all fueled by an elite vs. non-elite system. Can't sleep a boss but you can the minions ad infinitum. Sure, that IS fair considering it's an elite. However, enjoy fighting full parties of elites and having certain characters be useless. Imagine this were an actual tabletop. Would YOU have fun being useless as a class against all bosses and hard enemies?
6. The upgrades again. This time I mean to your decorations, table, and even D.M. All take time playing and all are underwhelming considering the grind of the game.
I've played such a long time, and while i'd love to tell you that this game has brought me closer to my recently motherless son, I can't. 3/10 max for what is essentially paying your time instead of enjoying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055467996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2132, 'last_played': 1663536645}
review:
Fairly simple yet fairly decent RPG that takes tropes and gimmicks from the genre and takes a big comedic spin to it. It never takes itself seriously but gives enough of to keep you engaged. The in game systems are fairly basic, and quite easy to grasp and utilise.

The problem is it's a fairly simple game. The mechanics and systems the game has that makes it easy to pick up, begin to get old fairly quickly. It gets fairly grindy later in the game and the same simple mechanics begin to get irritating. The incredibly simplistic nature of the game is made even worse in the battle theme of the game. It's simple, mind numbingly so. It has the same 5 second sound look with minor tone changes to it that is okay at first, but really gets on your nerves since it never changes or mixes it up. Having the same battle track for the entire game isn't necessarily bad since the original Final Fantasy did that, the difference is the original Final Fantasy's battle track is infinitely more interesting to listen to than this is, and that's saying something since it's 26 years older than this game is.

Overall a pleasant experience overall. Fun and engaging enough and much longer than I expected it to be, which is both a strength and a major weakness considering just how simplistic the game is overall. It's able to hook you in early with how quick you are able to understand the mechanics, but this is also a fault since it doesn't innovate or build on it at all throughout the game aside from making everything a grind to progress. Despite it's glaring flaws, I do give the game a tentative recommendation. 6/10

Seriously, the battle music has to be the weakest part of it for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198236555546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 952, 'last_played': 1661355356}
review:
A lot of fun if you understand what you are getting yourself in for

You need to do quests to level up as pain free as possible, grinding is for gold to upgrade blacksmith (you can spam move between default town and the first cave to pick up blacksmith grinding stones for 'free' if you got time instead)

You need the holy trinity (but classes you pick are up to you)

You need at least 1 HP sponge tank with threat abilities to take the hits, (i prefer to use 2, 1 pally 1 warrior), a healer (cleric) and 2 dps (mage for aoe, rogue for single target dps)

Since mobs have various resists your party should have a combination of damage types (resist = 50% dmg), which the above formation would help with

Not all hero skills are equal and there's no way to get your points back so i would tell you to carefully pay attention to what you are using on each hero per turn and boost that and any passive skill with priority and let the other active skills you don't use, just stay low level/mp use

You need to buy 4x the item in the shop that reduces blacksmith cost by 20% each (have to equip it on the character who will interact with the blacksmith for the discount)

This will change your game in terms of using the blacksmith to upgrade weapons and armours (as they have a % to succeed and failures at the 100% cost will set you back a chunk of time, but at 20% cost, you can spam it until you get it upgraded!)

Try to have +2 to luck rolls (one from the shop items to change the table/room decor, one from the +luck necklace) so you can avoid all travelling combat between stops (outside of quests) which will make life less annoying on your travels

author: {'steamid': '76561198006973716', 'num_games_owned': 1272, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1661746778}
review:
I ended up forcing myself to beat this game and get all the achievements purely out of spite because it made me so angry that I didn't want to quit and let it win.

At a certain point in the game the difficulty curve becomes vertical and unless you want to spend ages grinding, it forces you to buy items from the in-game "Shop" which essentially gives you the ability to cheat. I only got to the end of the game by purchasing loaded dice and luck necklaces that allowed me to roll 19s and 20s on every roll, thus skipping most of the final third of the game. Being forced to cheat your way to the end of the game is not fun.

This game is not worth your time or your money. The concept is interesting enough but the execution is pretty bad and playing it is painful, grindy, and repetitive. Don't make the same mistake I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037370836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1658492426}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper is really fun, in the beginning. The battle system is simple but enjoyable, the animations are cute and really fit each class. If you make a druid its gameplay will feel like a druid, same for any other class. The quests are generic but funny, many references and jokes. Lvling up doesn't take too long and as you level your skills you feel the change. Seeing the damage number go from 50 to 53 might not seem like a lot but you really feel the progress of your characters in the fights. Also it's not just brain dead leveling up the spell you like, the MP cost goes up as well and you feel it. One level can turn a spell from being spamable to being used only once or twice in a fight. You have to think about how you level spells which adds a little complexity to a simple game like this.

The issue with this game is the late game. You will have a great time lvling up to about 42 (I've read some people hit this rodeblock as early as 35). You will look at the map and see that all the quests are finished. Every area is explored 100%. Only 2 are left that aren't. One is a dungeon where the last boss is located. This dungeon is marked lvl 65. The other is a sequence of dragons you need to fight. This quest is marked lvl 70. Let me remind you, after finishing everything else I was lvl 42. There are no areas with lvl 50 or 60 monsters, or maybe they are hidden somewhere that I haven't figured out but I doubt it. You have to fight the forty something monsters over and over to grind. This is awful design. The last boss isn't hard, it just has big numbers. It's like they forgot to create areas (and questlines) for about 20 lvls. It would be ok for the boss to have hard mechanics, or even to be so high lvl to demand a little grinding or some item. But asking me to grind 20 levels (arguably more then a third of the game) is ridiculous. I've seen discussions  of, I did it at 40 blah blah blah, buy feathers and upgrade gear, get gud, and so on. That doesn't change the fact that you need to grind the gear upgrades, and feathers and all the crap. And even then I don't think you can easily kill the boss. At lvl 40 most classes get one shot by the boss so even if you cheat the system and get to the boss by using the luck amulets (you skip all fights before the final boss of the dungeon) you still skiped lvl 40 something mobs (because they are hard and boring) to fight a lvl 65 boss. It makes no sense. It might be doable but video games aren't supposed to be doable but fun and having the difficulty spike from a 2 to a 11 isn't fun. They are missing a third of the game, that doesn't make the game challenging it makes it incomplete.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049672986', 'num_games_owned': 611, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1658318158}

author: {'steamid': '76561198183406253', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1996, 'last_played': 1656873004}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper +1 is a nice RPG if you're searching for less complicated and linear gameplay. The pixel art is beautifully created and there are a decent roster of characters to choose from. I also enjoyed the humor. From time to time the music gets repetitive and boring but other than that it's a decent game.

Rating: B

author: {'steamid': '76561198079386093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 2811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2803, 'last_played': 1656961322}
review:
Fun 'lil DnD RPG game where you are both the players and dungeon master
quests and writing can get a 'lil repetitive and dry later on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113581790', 'num_games_owned': 2359, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1655656342}
review: Knights of Pen and Paper is a charming little RPG that has fun dialogue, an enjoyable battle system and no need for grinding... well, until the last quest of the game. Unfortunatly the devs for some reason decided it would be reasonable if the last quest jumped from level 35 to level 60, with no quests inbetween. This unfortunately does put a damper on the experience as you're forced to grind for the last couple levels and makes the last quest feel like a slog. Overall though, i'd still recommend it to fans of RPGs, it's quite a fun game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040451631', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1396, 'last_played': 1653446546}
review:
Overall: A neat 2D pixel DnD game, with plenty of nerdy references scattered about to make a grin crack on your face.

This game was very fun, even though near the end I had to grind and grind and grind and grind. Managing my party was fun, and the customizability, while not great, is decent because they let you choose people and class separately. The people themselves have passives, while the class you give them determines their actual skills. It took me a pretty long time to beat this game (I have 23 hours in it as of writing, and I just completed the main campaign), but I didn't dislike most any of it. I was pretty frustrated at how fragile one of my characters seemed to be, but that was most likely my fault anyways.

Recommended for DnD enjoyers, people who like controlling a party of people, and nerds in general.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040005010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 487, 'playtime_forever': 2353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2303, 'last_played': 1651336342}
review:
El segundo juego de la saga que probe (pues, debute con la secuela) y debo decir, que este es realmente bueno.
 Tiene de todo para un basico juego rpg:
 +Gran cantidad de clases y personajes, con estadisiticas diferentes.
 +Eventos Randoms al moverte de lugar en lugar
 +Gran cantidad de misiones
 +Unico DLC con buen contenido
 +Jugabilidad sencilla, pero adictiva.
 Pero siempre habra algo negativo:
 -La banda sonora es chirriante. Hay una saturacion del MIDI que me incomoda
 -¿CONEXION A INTERNET Y UNA CUENTA APARTE, ES EN SERIO? Mientras que los demas juegos de esta saga, no lo requieren. Este abusa de ese concepto. 
 Ni hablar, si quieres conservar tus partidas guardadas y llevarlas a cualquier lugar. 
 Aun asi, puedes jugar como invitado, pero....Si le pasa algo a tu pc. Pues, ¡CHAU !

 8/10 Si. Me gusto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143078989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1649767887}
review:
No estado atual, não recomendo para ninguém: impõe Termos de Uso além dos que já temos que aceitar da Steam, pede para acessar ou regitrar uma conta com a empresa para jogar, embora possa jogar como Convidado, tem uns botões de Curtir no Facebook (chamados "Like" no jogo) uma rede social nociva à Humanidade e responsável por muitas mortes humanas abafadas, o jogo não está completamente traduzido, e cada língua está em um estado diferente de tradução, contendo termos em Inglês em todas...
Parece que não sabiam direito se faziam um jogo para PC ou um desses cheios de propaganda para usarem em Android. Ficou no meio do caminho, mas se algum dia completarem as traduções e tirarem essas besteiras todas, para ser um jogo que se joga em paz no próprio computador, poderá valer a pena um dia.

Resumo: Poderia ser um jogo gratuito para navegador, do jeito que está.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046881436', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1645022697}
review:
There are very few games I quit half way through, but this is an exception. 

This game is extremely shallow, grindy, and repetitive, down to the Nth degree. 

The main story has very little substance, most side quests are either fetching, battling, or 'escorting' and they hardly deviate beyond extremely simple means. In fact, despite supposedly being modelled off of D&D, no other aspect bar combat is ever explored. You can't do dice rolls for stealth, charisma, luck, or anything, every quest simply devolves into a combat encounter. The game is interwoven with plenty of pop culture references, but this is hardly a drawing point for the game.

Nothing musically stands out, most pieces are very simple, looped tracks which feel a bit generic. Graphically competent but that's not saying much for a pixel game.

Inventory system is a joke. You can only hold twenty or so items and even at max capacity you can still obtain quest rewards only for them to go to the void. With the rate you encounter enemies in this game, you'd best pray you don't randomly win a great piece of loot at full stash capacity, because it's gone for good. Have fun grinding out a thousand more fights for the chance to get it again.

My biggest complaint is the characters, combat and gameplay loop. This game is an absolute chore to play. Hardly any of the classes have AoE skills making fights tedious clicking matches against single opponents. Those who do have AoE skills suffer drastically reduced damage output. I played with a rogue, warrior, cleric, druid, and mage, and I have never encountered such simplistic and monotonous combat in a party based game. Every single fight I pitted myself into reduced itself to one of only two strategies, and neither were mentally engaging enough to even consider them strategies. Despite being pretty high levelled pretty quickly, basic mobs half my level still outchecked my initiative, resulting in encounters that never feel like your characters are developing. 

On top of this, you have two types of enemies; basic and elite. Every single elite enemy I encountered resisted debuffs and special effects like stun, sleep, or freeze, negating up to 33% of my characters available skills and specialisations. What is the point of gearing a character around stun and physical debuffs if both of these are tied to a single skill that is negated, purely by enemy type? Of which, every class has 4 innate skills, any number of which can be passives. The Barbarian for example, has only ONE single combat skill, which makes you lose targeting. Enjoy doing 50k battles with only one skill you can use, which you will need to do if you want to earn any money and levels, which you absolutely MUST do if you want to enhance your gear at the blacksmith, with his stupid extortionate prices for a bloody CHANCE to improve your gear. I failed ten improvement checks in a row based on a 60% chance to succeed at 300 gold a piece, that's 3k gold, which equates to roughly 15-30 fights of grinding, just to fail a level 1>2 upgrade for my rogue. 

To further reinforce the hollow feeling behind the characters, there's no way to actively measure health, you're only given a total and have to guesstimate off of a red bar. Honestly, I've never played a game that just feels so meaningless for absolutely no good reason. On top of the piss poor gameplay loop, the story being so damn basic is the biggest insult, because what incentive do I have to play this game if not to see how its narrative pans out? 

To know that no matter how much time I invest into this game, that its conclusion will not payoff, is the biggest shame of all. This game is the worst type of repetitive, it's the kind that just maliciously wastes your time, and it knows it. Well, not anymore. 

Hardly a game that has any standout moments or features. An extremely average run of the mill, turn based adventure that has little reward or payoff for your time and effort. Avoid, even on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966876517', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1142, 'last_played': 1640125667}
review:
[h1]The first game of the Pen and Paper family[/h1]

This is a fun and tough game with plenty of funny moments. Unlike its sequel, it looks a bit more dated but can still be played correctly.
The most enjoyable parts are overcoming its challenges.
You will need to grind a fair bit to get enough level to advance the story so don't expect a game where you can breeze through chapters. You can get bogged down in some uninteresting farming, obviously you could maybe avoid it if you are a strategist god with perfect min maxing skills!

The RPG side is quite simple and the main attribute of the Pen & Paper games is the fact that [b]YOU[/b] decide the adversary in most encounters, you could make many small and easy battles or do a big huge one with more XP payoff.
It's a tough game and will require plenty of time investment to finish the story.
Speaking of which, it's an interesting one with some twists, especially breaking the fourth wall and fits enough the theme of the game!

Graphics are cute with nice pixelated art, it serves its purposes and at least you can differentiate all the NPCs and adversaries.

I would recommend this game if you played and liked other games from the same Studio, otherwise I would recommend to play the sequel instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207373281', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1639745034}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058163605', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 986, 'last_played': 1637881932}
review:
Jogo legal, simples e cheio de referências nerds.
O jogo tem uma simplicidade muito grande, porém divertida.
A história do jogo é legal. Tem muitas quests pra fazer e muitas referências pra prestar atenção.
Você consegue liberar mais classes ao longo do jogo. 
O som do jogo deixa a desejar. 
Acho que o jogo tem potencial e o preço numa promoção vale a pena. Principalmente pra quem já jogou rpg de mesa e gosta de ver ou ter referências pra poder usar nas mesas.
Recomendo. Estou jogando o 2 e ele já parece muito mais polido e com muito mais mecânica. Darei meu review dele quando terminar o 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198338963324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1637422665}
review:
Il timer dice 4 ore, ma solo perché dopo un po' mi sono stufato e sono uscito dimenticando acceso il pc.
Ho speso solo due euro e spiccioli per questo gioco, ma ho lo stesso l'impressione di aver buttato i soldi.
dopo un'ora di gioco in cui hai una parvenza di buona progressione, ti ritrovi di colpo nella situazione per cui se vuoi aggiungere un quinto giocatore al tavolo devi spendere 200 monete , ma ogni combattimento te ne da 4-5, quindi dovresti ripetere una quarantina di volte lo stesso noioso combattimento, perché 4 giocatori a livello 6-7 non sono abbastanza per avanzare sulla mappa nella quest principale. Un pessimo port per pc di un gioco che ha tutte le caratteristiche di un odioso ftp mobile. Da evitare come la peste, anche scontatissimo, due euro per un'ora di gioco sono davvero troppi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306785420', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2416, 'last_played': 1636152184}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper é um jogo que puxa a essência dos RPG de mesa e mistura isso com gráficos retrô, a história do jogo é simples mas muito legal de acompanhar e ver o desenrolar da trama. O sistema de criação de personagem é muito interessante e te faz parar pra analisar qual classe combina mais com qual personagem e etc, a gameplay é simples e permite com que qualquer pessoa possa jogar. O jogo foi desenvolvido por um equipe brasileira, o que fica bem notável quando você lê os diálogos com gírias e até mesmo quando você chega na quest do Saci, sem falar das inúmeras referências ao universo geek.
 A campanha principal requer que seus personagens estejam bem preparados e pode ser necessário que você gaste algumas horinhas pra grindar e subir eles de nível e comprar alguns itens, por um lado deixa o jogo mais massante mas desacelera a progressão e faz você dar mais atenção aos detalhes, ao finalizar a campanha você pode jogá-la de novo com o Newgame+ que deixa os inimigos numa dificuldade maior e sem perder seus personagens e itens de antes e permitindo que você upe ainda mais os níveis deles. Recomendo se você já jogou RPG de mesa ou se sempre teve curiosidade em saber como era.

author: {'steamid': '76561199049434784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 1516, 'last_played': 1710870968}

author: {'steamid': '76561198169085960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 5345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1460, 'last_played': 1663502656}
review:
Reviewed edited at 40 game play hours and 40/42 achievements.

I recommend this game because it checks off some of my boxes and I like turn-based games. I don't think this would win awards, but it has some humor, making me laugh several times so far. Although a lot of the humor will be lost on younger people due to a lot of references to the 80s. It has a good variety of characters to choose from (instead of race), quite a few classes, a good number of items to activate in your "gaming room" and on your characters, and quite a bit of consumables.

Also, you keep your unlocked characters & classes, accumulated gold, and things you buy in the Shop for other saves. Which makes starting another save game much easier and gives you a good head start. Which is important since you probably need that to get the speed run achievement. But unfortunately, the blacksmith upgrades do not carry across the save games. That probably would have been a game breaking advantage.

Speaking of game breaking, I haven't found any bugs in the game other than the achievements.

Although there are only 3 save slots, I eventually figured out that you can overwrite save slots by selecting New game. I wouldn't let me overwrite my save slot where I finished the game, but it would let me overwrite a save slot that I had started to experiment and didn't want to keep playing. So, there isn't an option to delete save games from the Load option, but there is a limited ability to overwrite a save slot from the New option.

BE WARNED, if you are an achievement hunter and perfectionist and don't like multiple play throughs and grinding to get all the achievements, this probably isn't a game for you. The achievements are definitely bugged, in general. You will get game notifications of getting an achievement and then it doesn't record. Or you will get achievements before you are supposed to. Some achievements seem bugged for everyone, based on the discussions page. You can't get all the achievements in one play through and you need to grind/farm for a couple of the achievements, which, if you don't like grinding won't make you happy. There is a locked achievement that you will need to consult a guide to figure out to make sure you get. I was able to get 40/42 achievements in my first save game, but that involved a lot of grinding, I couldn't beat the last enemy (which isn't necessary), and it took me over 1500 game days. The speed run achievement is somewhere in the 400s for days. You accumulate days when you rest, every combat, and traveling the map.

But a nice feature for the speed run is that the main quest line has a start next to the choice to help you just follow the main quest if you want that achievement. At least that is helpful.

This game is not much more than turn-based combat and it isn't very tactical or strategic. You don't walk around, rather you move between points on a map. And did I mention grinding. I don't happen to mind grinding, but I usually prefer it when it is optional, not a necessity.

This game has a little replay value if you want to try different combinations of characters and classes. And from what I have experienced, you might not get to do all the quests during a single play through and you definitely won't get all the achievements.

This game isn't one that I will keep coming back too, but still, for me, this game was worth the few dollars that I paid for it.

I will update this review if I discover anything significantly new or if I manage to get all the achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056110895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1633377889}
review:
Spiel ist ja schön und nett, ein wenig Nerd Humor hier und da.
Das Klassensystem ist auch recht komisch, der einzige der Schaden macht ist der Magier,
Paladin steckt nur weg, Krieger macht mittelmäßig Schaden, der Heiler und Druide sind eher Supporter,
der Schurke macht nur auf ein einziges Ziel halbwegs Schaden. Steckt alle Punkte in den Meteorit und Mana rein.
Der Druide taugt eig nur als Manaspender. 
Die anderen Klassen die man freispielen kann ? Keine Ahnung, bei den Fallen und Todesmechaniken macht es zu wenig spaß um weiter zu spielen, die Motivation ist schnell futsch.
Schnellverkauf von mehreren Dingen gleichzeitig ? Nein
Das System in der Kanalisation z.B. ist ja schön und gut, aber auf einen Endboss in einem Level 12 Gebiet zu treffen ?
Party tot, zu wenig Gold zum Wiederbeleben weil die Quests und Drops auf dem Level totaler mist sind.
Nach einigen Jahren mal wieder Lust bekommen es zu spielen und joa... einpaar Stunden später....
Naja wer weiss, vll in 2-3 Jahren mal wieder wenn die Langeweile überwiegt.

author: {'steamid': '76561199032623397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1601753486}

[h1]Repetitiveness, the game[/h1]

Music? yes, it's repetitive.
Grindy? of course, YES.
Is combat interesting? OF COURSE NOT!

Every. single. fight. would be played. more or less the same.

[strike]This game has less spice than fresh tofu.[/strike]

author: {'steamid': '76561198063797852', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1696607123}
review:
Having played KoPnP 2 first, the natural tendency is to compare the games to each other. The game mechanics in this game take a little getting used to. The quests are not obvious, and there are not always quests available at your level, so you may need to fight monsters to gain xp, in order to move on to other quests. I like that you can abandon a quest and return to it later. I don't like that you might start one quest from another, and the second quest will be 5+ levels higher than the first, so that you have to quit that quest, and re-do the first one, too, because it was the trigger for the second one.

I recommend this to those of you, who are into old games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069105815', 'num_games_owned': 857, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1628784828}
review:
Я начал знакомство с серией со второй части, поэтому, если вкратце, разработчики развиваются, в этом проблема первой части. Множество неудобных моментов, которые потом были исправлены. Ну и старенький я, от пиксельной графики глаза уже устают, если её так много. 
А так, геймплей нормальный, не считая пары скучных моментов, по типу гринда для прокачки и долгого восстановления маны персонажей во сне. 
Во второй части это чуть-чуть пофиксили. Рекомендую вторую)

author: {'steamid': '76561198003543245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1629156068}
review: If you've ever played Dungeons and Dragons you'll like this game. Knights of Pen and Paper deftly combines the feeling of sitting around a table with your friends, rolling dice and enjoying friendly banter with the Dungeon Master while your characters fight monsters and go on adventures.  The game is packed with fun pop culture references and cheeky in-jokes about RPGs and gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198425417', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1625635405}
review: Simula muito bem um RPG de mesa, tem uma historia "bobinha" bem estilo aquilo que jogavamos nos anos 90 em classico d&d. Em promoção com certeza vale a pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067644381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1896, 'last_played': 1651424117}
review:
Game bem divertido, no geral dou mais pontos positivos do que negativos. 
Jogo é simples, evolução dele é boa, poucas habilidades porem ja me deixaram satisfeito pois até prefiro poucas habilidades do que viver me perdendo do que é melhor upar. 
A historia é bem básica, praticamente uma tipica aventura de D&D com comentários dos personagens e mestre para quebrar o gelo.
Único ponto baixo é a dificuldade, o game no geral é fácil, ele só começa a te apertar justamente na ultima dungeon e a ultima side, fora isso é bem tranquilo.
No geral é um game que pode divertir todas as idades e você assim como se quiser focar nele ou também pode jogar ele como um passatempo, ouvindo musica, comendo etc..

author: {'steamid': '76561198104374512', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1263, 'last_played': 1625516268}
review:
Baby's first poorly made RPG. Way too grindy than it needs to be. Combat is boring and repetitive at best. Quests are horribly unbalanced and aren't labelled correctly to level tier. Just when you think you have everything figured out, the game slaps you down with another difficulty spike that can only be remedied by, guess what? MORE GRINDING.

I got near the end and gave up when the enemies started healing more than I could dish out. F*** this game. A big waste of time I could have spent with games that actually respect the player's time put in

author: {'steamid': '76561198165619197', 'num_games_owned': 863, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1623269049}
review:
The game is a parody of classic tabletop RPGs, and even has a game master.

And now the question is - how can you ruin any fantasy adventure?

That's right, add various aliens, spaceships, and in the end, completely merge the game world with the supposedly real one. The last third of the game is disgusting. scriptwriter is so talentless that they couldn't come up with medieval lore with monsters. Seriously, they should have hired a real tabletop game master instead.

But I liked the first two-thirds of the game, so thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072202973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1625360746}
review: This game is silly and combat driven, much like a good DM's campaign. As you progress through quests, you are able to better equip your adventurers or invest in furniture for the game room (group bonuses). The combat can be a little repetitive but the option to customize each encounter helps. If you have experience or interest in table top RPGs, you'll get a kick out of this game. Bonus points for inclusion of many feminine characters in a cultural space that is often dominated by men.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034205986', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1643393241}
review:
Some disclaimers: You WILL need to grind. It's not optional for parts. No spoilers, but you will be asked to fight the same enemies a ridiculous number of times near the end of the game.

This game is a fun, brainless RPG game. There is little else I do later in the game then just spam the same abilities in the same order for each fight. That being said, I did enjoy the majority of the game. The ending feels padded out for no other reason then to increase the level requirements. I almost lost interest and feel that I need to grind some random quests in order to complete the last dungeon area. There is some interesting designs for enemies, and the tongue-in-cheek humour is great. If you play D&D or similar tabletop RPGs and enjoy grinding that comes with most japanese style RPVGs, then you will likely enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073812623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 4301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4212, 'last_played': 1620662254}
review:
As an long-time fan of AD&D, I liked the many references to classic DMT (door-monster-treasure) I used to play when I was young.
As a man born in the 70's, I liked the many references to the pop-culture I bathed in when I was younger.
But It's not enough to make a really good game.
I enjoyed it a lot in the beginning, when all the story plots were fun.
But It soon gets a lot repetitive and at least the third last of the game was only grinding while only the last boss remained to defeat.
That's why I can't give it a thumb up.
I'd rather give a "not really good but not really bad" mark but Steam doesn't allow it, so it's a thumb down.
I'm still willing to try knights of P & P 2 and Galaxy of P & P aswell.

En tant qu'ancien joueur intensif de AD&D et en tant que vieux routard né dans les années 70, j'ai adoré les références en pagaille qu'on trouve dans ce jeu.
Mais les références, ce n'est pas suffisant pour faire un bon jeu.
Je me suis accroché pour le finir mais je ne peux pas le recommander.
Très vite, ça devient très répétitif (toujours les mêmes action dans le même ordre) et j'ai passé le dernier tiers du jeu à faire de la chasse au XP et à l'or pour gonfler les héros dans le seul but d'affronter le dernier boss.
Si on pouvait mettre une note mitigée, c'est celle qe je donnerai. Comme Steam ne lle permet pas, c'est un pouce en bas.
Cela ne m'empêchera pas d'essayer Knights of P&P 2 et Galaxy of P&P.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090038179', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1889, 'last_played': 1684782141}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025229286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3544, 'last_played': 1695320227}
review:
It's more than a little silly, but it also recreates the feel of playing Basic D&D. Don't expect fancy graphics, because it also has the feel of an 80's RPG video game, despite actually being a bit more advanced. 

If you've ever played real D&D and miss it, it's definitely worth rolling up a gaming group and giving this game a try.

review: Весьма увлекательная аркадная игра не тему настольных игр. Если нравятся настолки и хочется чего-то легкого - то рекомендую эту игру!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994476740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3577, 'last_played': 1445581492}
review:
Dumb, goofy, nerdy fun.

The jokes may not land very well (especially since the D&D cartoon jokes were dated when the game launched almost a decade ago), but this little meta RPG gem is a good quick bit of fun. There's tons of unlockables and builds you can work on and the game can be completed quickly so you can dive back in and try the game with a different set of classes. The game isn't super easy, but it's simple enough that just about any build combination can work. So, it can be fun to just go through with randomized parties or whatever you feel like. Good for a long weekend alone if you want to just have some good old school turn-based RPG fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025089345', 'num_games_owned': 2174, 'num_reviews': 2932, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1614917908}
review:
[h1]<骑士经理+1版>游戏有汉化且支持成就，摸了8小时过了剧情？？[/h1]
但是感觉剧情很懵逼，有感觉剧情没结束的样子~
类似桌游吧？直接桌面上纸上谈兵！召唤各种英雄！
连任务都是自己创建的，收集、旅行、杀怪、救援任君选择！！
[h1]~哦哦~带五角星的是主线任务~[/h1]
可以在商店里买各种装饰和零食，每个英雄都有各自的装备，装备在铁匠铺升级，商店里购买更厉害的升级道具，地图上移动丢骰子随机遇敌人~非常桌游的RPG~还有各种购买选项~

~是个有钱能使鬼推磨的游戏~只要有钱啥都没问题~
~剧情也很简单，主角一行坐在桌前开始玩桌游咯~
~然后再桌游的世界里解决了国王的事情，还消灭了可以穿梭到现实世界的黑巫师！
~结果到了现实世界黑巫师变菜鸡了直接被秒杀~
~然后任务结束，最后好像要去某个地方接后续任务，但没后续了···

author: {'steamid': '76561197996919908', 'num_games_owned': 1529, 'num_reviews': 869, 'playtime_forever': 1698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1698, 'last_played': 1609705227}
review:
[h1]Papier- und Würfelglück [/h1]

Achja, Pen & Paper. Wenn man sich in der Gruppe trifft, es so richtig vergeigt und Freundschaften zerbrechen.
[quote]*Die Gruppe steht in einem schmalen Tunnel*
Mitspielerin: Ich möchte gerne „Feuerball“ wirken!
SL: Möchtest du deine beiden Mitstreiter vor dir warnen?
Mitspielerin: Nein! [/quote]

[b]Gameplay[/b]
Wie der Name wohl schon verrät, erleben wir hier ein Würfelabenteuer wie man es selber vielleicht schon von „Dungeons & Dragons“ oder „Das schwarze Auge“ kennt. Der Spieler kann hier eingeschränkt frei agieren und so kämpfen wir nicht nur gegen irgendwelche Goblins, bei Bedarf können wir auch Blödsinn anstellen und z.B. eine Tavernenschlägerei beginnen und uns durch viele Haupt- und Nebenquests arbeiten. Wir spielen mehrere Charaktere gleichzeitig und ja, generell kann man gelegentlich mal ins grinden abrutschen. Aber die Klassen und Fähigkeiten sind insgesamt schon ganz gut balanciert und ermöglichen recht spaßige Rundenkämpfe.

[b]Story[/b]
Unsere Helden entkommen zu Beginn einem Gefängnis: „The older Scrolls“ lässt grüßen. Die Hauptquest ist ganz interessant, wirklich gut sind jedoch die unzähligen Anspielungen auf gängige Mechaniken von Rollenspielen sowie die Kommentare der Spielfiguren. 

[quote] Ich wollte euch die Feinde ja richtig schwer machen, aber die würfeln ihre Schüsse gerade so, wie Stormtrooper schießen!
-Mein Spielleiter[/quote]

[b]Grafik/Sound[/b]
Der Pixel-Look ist zwar einfach als Programmierer, hier wurde er aber auch gut umgesetzt. Grafische Meisterleistungen kann man zwar nicht erwarten, aber zusammen mit der epischen Heldenmusik und der Tatsache, dass die Spieler immer mittig am Tisch sitzen, ergibt sich hier eine gemütliche Atmosphäre. Die Grafik passt einfach zum Stil. Die Musik kann man durchaus hören, nach einer Weile ging sie mir dann aber schon ein wenig auf die Nerven.

[b]Fazit[/b]
„Knights of Pen & Paper +1“ nimmt das Prinzip des Rollenspiels gut auf die Schippe, sorgt jedoch gleichzeitig für das Gefühl, man würde gerade in einer guten alten Runde von D&D stecken. Witzigerweise habe ich es das erste Mal gespielt, bevor ich eine Runde eines Pen & Papers hinter mich gebracht hatte. Aber auch beim zweiten Anspielen hat mir das Spiel sehr gut gefallen. Die Idee ist gut umgesetzt und wer ein kleines RPG sucht, der wird hier nicht enttäuscht sein. Der einzige Negativpunkt ist jedoch das sich eher wiederholende Gameplay.


Etwas weniger Pixelgrafik, dafür aber mehr Haudrauf? In [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Drakeschool] meiner Steamgruppe[/url] habe ich viele weitere Spiele reviewt, darunter natürlich auch das ein oder andere RPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164634633', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2707, 'last_played': 1610907009}
review: There really isn't much good to say about this game. The classes are bland. The powers the classes have lack imagination. It's very grindy. When you do almost anything you have numbers tell you how much damage you are doing, how much damage you take. However your health bars, mana bars have no numbers to indicate how much you have in total. Your enemies health bars are the same thing. Which is infuriating!!!!!! Why give me numbers for a random encounter and not where it really matters. How much mana and health my team has. I cannot recommend this game to anyone. There are better dungeon crawlers out there. Avoid this one!

author: {'steamid': '76561197964735295', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 1180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1180, 'last_played': 1541819664}
review:
At its core, Knights is just a combat game with lots and lots of grind-y battles to fight. You'll get levels and equipment, and there is a story that is primarily a cheesy spoof on the tired tropes of the role-playing genre. Those things, however, are secondary to the real meat - slaying legions of pixelated foes.

This game would probably be better on a phone, where you fill idle seconds with monotonous grinding and aren't looking to get too involved. But when you want to engage with games on a PC, there are deeper experiences out there. This game, with its paper-thin and simplistic combat, just isn't worth the time investment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053531044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 1038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1418565861}
review:
If I could write a review for a game with a sideways thumb, this would certainly be a game I would put into that category. I spent a fair amount of time with this game, and certainly wouldn't argue that I got no enjoyment out of it. The game makes genuine effort (and succeeds, to some extent) to iterate on the classic turn-based format. The threat manipulation mechanics are neat. The status effects are meaningful (perhaps [i]too[/i] meaningful/effective, at times). But as I look back on this game years later, the experience feels hollow. There are games I can play to kill time that at least leave me with pleasant memories, but there's none of that with this game. So much of it feels empty and lifeless, looking back.

I don't hate Knights of Pen and Paper. I would even say I have a very slightly positive outlook toward it. But this game is absolutely not worth it at full price, and I wouldn't ever consider recommending someone buy it without a huge discount. Even then, though, with so many games out there -- what I'd really recommend to a friend is that they spend that $2 on something that will give them something pleasant to reflect on down the road. I think a cup of coffee might have more lasting joy than this game (not that this is a fair comparison; a cup of coffee is obviously far more expensive).

author: {'steamid': '76561198200429703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 966, 'last_played': 1608400057}
review: A proposta de Knights of pen and Paper foi o motivo de ter comprado o jogo. Inicialmente, a variedade de classes e personagens prendeu a minha atenção durante algum tempo. No entanto, conforme eu avançava, o jogo ficava cada vez mais repetitivo pelo fato de que você ter que farmar ouro e experiência para avançar para as próximas fases. O ferreiro é outro ponto que piora a situação devido ao alto custo e à baixa taxa de sucesso no aprimoramento de armas e equipamentos, praticamente obrigando o jogador a gastar ouro para evoluir o NPC. Muitos não irão ver isso como problema por gostarem justamente dessa dificuldade de evoluir e não se importarem com a repetição constante do mesmo conteúdo, geralmente jogadores de RPG das antigas (hardcores). Se você pertence a esse grupo que acabei de citar, KoPP é uma ótima opção para passar o tempo e se divertir. Caso contrário, ainda é possível aproveitar o jogo, mas o grinding excessivo pode atrapalhar um pouco. Concluindo, a experiência depende do perfil do jogador e do que ele espera encontrar durante a jogatina.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041512403', 'num_games_owned': 1837, 'num_reviews': 2457, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1605423721}
review:
테이블 RPG

영웅들을 고용하여 테이블에 앉힙니다.
영웅들의 본체에 따라서 패시브 스킬들이 1개씩 고를 수 있고
직업마다 고유한 4개의 스킬 존재!

영웅을 고용한 뒤 테이블에 앉아서 진행자를 통해 전투, 휴식, 퀘스트, 거래 등을 이용할 수 있습니다.
전투를 통해서 몬스터들을 사냥해 경험치를 얻고 성장할 수 있으며,
골드나 아이템을 수집할 수도 있죠.
경험치를 얻어 레벨업을 하면 스킬 포인트를 얻으며
각 클래스별로 주어진 4개의 스킬 중 하나를 성장시킬 수 있습니다.


골드는 당연히 거래에서 사용되며 거래를 통해 획득한
아이템들은 장착하여 효과를 적용받거나
체력, 마나 회복 등에 사용할 수 있습니다.

또한, 다른 지역으로 이동이 가능한데 이때 주사위를 굴려서
안전 범위내 수치이면 아무 일 없이 이동할 수 있고
안전 범위 외의 수치가 되면 적들의 공격을 받아서 전투를 수행하기도 하죠.

퀘스트를 수행하면서 스토리도 감상하고 성장시키면서 진행

아쉬운 점
-한글이 고프다아아아
