author: {'steamid': '76561197996273719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 797, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1606420060}
review:
[h1] Information / Review English [/h1]

Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition is a tactical RPG developed by Behalod Studios.

[h1] Gameplay / Story [/h1]

At the beginning of your adventure, however, you will first find an empty table with a dungeon master who will guide you through the story. Immediately afterwards you determine two people and also choose your favorites from the many different classes such as knight, druid, paladin, magician or villain, with whom you then sit down at your table. Later it is of course also possible to increase your troop so that up to five people can sit at one table. The more people and classes sit around a table, the more diverse tactical possibilities open up for you. But once you have chosen your starting class, it starts right away and the classic pen & paper round with your friends begins. The minimalistic, round-based combat system that just consists of an attack, a class-specific attack, items, defense and escapes immediately catches your eye. Despite the minimalism of possible actions, it becomes clear later that the various skills of your comrades offer enough tactical depth to keep you happy. At the beginning everything is broken down a little more to the bare essentials, which is by no means bad and slowly introduces you to all possibilities. Later, however, you can use the various attacks, characters and items to tactic a lot and thus experience all the classic facets of an RPG from the 90s. Your playing field, i.e. the table as such, also always stays in the same place with your character stats, which underlines the feeling of a real D&D game.

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ RPG meets party
+ funny humor with charm
+ motley retro style
+ likeable pen & paper flair
+ lots of spells, monsters and special attacks
+ motivating upgrade & decoration spiral
+ a lot of unlockables
+ Trading cards and achievements

[h1] Contra [/h1]

- few tactical options in combat
- monotonous background music

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition offers you a cuddly adventure in which charm and humor are at the top and reminds of former times.


[h1] Information / Review Deutsch [/h1]

Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition ist ein taktisches RPG, welches von Behalod Studios entwickelt wurde. 

[h1] Gameplay / Geschichte [/h1]

Zu Beginn deines Abenteuers erwartet euch allerdings erstmal ein leerer Tisch mit einem Dungeon Master, der euch durch die Geschichte leitet. Gleich danach bestimmt ihr zwei Personen und wählt zudem aus den vielen verschiedenen Klassen wie beispielsweise Ritter, Druide, Paladin, Magier oder Schurke euren Favoriten aus, mit denen ihr euch dann an euren Tisch setzt. Später ist es dann natürlich auch möglich, eure Truppe aufzustocken, so dass bis zu fünf Personen an einen Tisch sitzen können. Umso mehr Personen und damit Klassen an einen Tisch sitzen, umso vielfältigere taktische Möglichkeiten eröffnen sich euch. Wenn ihr aber erstmal eure anfängliche Klasse gewählt habt, geht es aber auch schon direkt los und die klassische Pen & Paper Runde mit euren Freunden beginnt. Dabei springt euch das minimalistische rundbasierte Kampfsystem direkt ins Auge, welches lediglich aus Angriff, einem klassenspezifischen Angriff, Items, Verteidigung und Flüchten besteht. Trotz des Minimalismus an möglichen Aktionen, wird gerade später deutlich, dass die verschiedenen Fertigkeiten eurer Kameraden genug taktische Tiefe bieten, um euch bei Laune zu halten. Zu Beginn wird alles ein wenig mehr auf das Nötigste heruntergebrochen, was aber keineswegs schlecht ist und euch langsam an alle Möglichkeiten heranführt. Später allerdings könnt ihr durch die verschiedenen Angriffe, Charaktere und Items durchaus viel taktieren und erlebt somit alle klassischen Fassetten eines RPGs aus den 90ern. Euer Spielfeld, also der Tisch als solches, bleibt zusätzlich mit euren Charakter-Stats auch immer konstant an derselben Stelle stehen, was das Gefühl eines echten D&D-Spiels nochmals unterstreicht.

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ Rollenspiel trifft auf Party
+ witziger Humor mit Charme
+ kunterbunter Retrostil
+ sympathisches Pen&Paper-Flair
+ viele Zauber, Monster und Specialangriffe
+ motivierende Aufrüst- & Dekorationsspirale
+ viel freischaltbares 
+ Sammelkarten und Errungenschaften

[h1] Kontra [/h1]

- wenig taktische Möglichkeiten im Kampf
- eintönige Hintergrundmusik

[h1] Fazit [/h1]

Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition bietet dir ein knuffiges Abenteuer, in welches Charme und Humor ganz oben steht und Erinnerungen weckt an frühere Zeiten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046505548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1150, 'last_played': 1604103730}
review:
Jogo bem simples e divertido, com vários memes e zoeiras no roteiro, ótimo pra descontrair. 
O sistema de batalha e do jogo em geral é bem intuitivo e fácil de se aprender. 

Únicas coisas que me atentei pro lado negativo foi que achei o jogo um pouco mais longo - e consequentemente repetitivo - do que esperado, com muitas missões sem muita sensação de serem recompensadoras. O sistema não é muito convidativo pra você usar as novas classes que você abre, já que para isso você tem que trazer um personagem novo pra mesa, ou se tiver com a mesa cheia, retirar um - que provavelmente estará level alto - por um level 1, tendo que grindar XP pra que chegue num nível parelho à da equipe. Seria mais interessante se houvesse alguma opção de poder trocar a classe de algum personagem já da mesa mantendo o nível dele, ou que o sistema fosse tipo de fazer missões pra "evoluir" sua classe para alguma melhor, podendo escolher entre 2 alternativas... Entendo que pode ter sido proposital para uma possível fator replay, de jogar com uma mesa com novos personagens e classes, mas por mais divertido que o jogo seja em geral, não me deu vontade de passar por tudo de novo só pra curtir essas novas perspectivas.
Outra coisa bem chata foi o sistema de evolução de equipamentos... Achei entediante a velocidade e forma de adquirir as pedras de amolar, além de que, se você quer usar os itens que dão desconto ou mais chance de conseguir evoluir a arma sem quebrar, tu tem que ir tirando e botando esses itens pra cada personagem, de um em um, pra depois que evoluir, botar os itens antigos de volta... Tira um pouco da vibe casual quando tem uns encontros com mecânicas "travadas". 

Tirando esses pequenos detalhes, recomendo o jogo sim e vale a experiência!

author: {'steamid': '76561198150386770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5142, 'last_played': 1603530704}
review:
Compré el juego porque lo vi muy barato, pero me echaba para atrás que pareciera algo infumable o muy malo; pues me equivoqué.

El juego es una maravilla, un Pixel Art bastante bien llevado aunque con gráficos algo mediocres y una música normalita, pero su mayor virtud es su jugabilidad, te engancha desde el principio y sin ser una maravilla en ningún aspecto en concreto, es bueno en todo.

Para comenzar su originalidad que es el sello de calidad de Behold, es un juego RPG pero simulando que estás jugando una partida de RPG real en tu casa. El humor que tienen, las bromas, las referencias a otros aspectos de la vida e incluso la historia o el guión con algunas idas de olla están muy bien.

La dificultad es adecuada, la historia interesante, hay mucho texto que leer pero no se hace pesado siendo una historia bastante lineal.

No hay muchas opciones en el juego, combates, misiones, viajes, mazmorras, equipo... Nada muy complicado, es bastante sencillo pero no pierdes el intéres. Su rejugabilidad es regular, es cierto que hay más personajes y combinaciones, pero lo veo como una carga al tenerlos que subir de nivel desde la nada, aunque repetirlo para conseguir el logro de completarlo en menos de 1 año es entretenido.

Como resumen, es un juego que está muy bien para su precio, merece la pena y aunque a priori no parezca una maravilla, lo vas a disfrutar mucho, por su historia, por su originalidad, por sus sorpresas... Podría ser más complejo, pero está muy bien llevado que parezca que estés en una verdadera partida de rol dentro del propio videojuego. Le daría una nota de BIEN.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998886660', 'num_games_owned': 2524, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 2273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1089, 'last_played': 1602571967}
review:
I enjoyed the game until i reached level 33 and then the game would no longer load.  On starting it would just reach the loading screen with spinning hourglass and had to be shut down using task manager.
It appears this is a known problem that has been ignored since release back in 2013.  There is a workaround to fix the problem by downloading a beta version of roughly 20MB.  How could it still be a beta after so many years - the game has obviously been abandoned.
When you change to beta any special characters will revert to standard characters and lose all abilities - the points will still be there but will need to be respent on the different character.
Will be abandoning this game until i feel like restarting from scratch again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014383949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1601440170}
review:
Rather charming (humor, references, graphics) at first and rather addictive, but the grind (unlocks, items, leveling, ...) and repetitivity set in fast. It would've been more tolerable if you could play from the couch with a controller and the battle controls were optimized to play fast and repeat common actions. As it is this is JRPG-like combat with mouse control only. It doesn't help that said combat and the RPG system it's based on is very barebones. Each character has four abilities plus their character passive, and that's it for the rest of the game - you only get to make very incremental upgrades to those four abilities.

Maybe I would've soldiered on if the story was better written and more clever, but even what the DM and the players say gets repetitive, and the joke of all quests being written exactly like a lazy DM would wears thin fast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049020554', 'num_games_owned': 4130, 'num_reviews': 373, 'playtime_forever': 1380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1380, 'last_played': 1598028158}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper +1 actually turned out to be a surprisingly fun game.

The game is set in an environment where you are essentially playing D&D within a video game. What I mean by this is that the game is narrated and played through to simulate a D&D scenario (e.g. game master and players). Because of this, sometimes there is some witty conversation/banter that goes on. Aside from that, the gameplay is a typical RPG style game where you have levels, skill, equipable items, and upgradeable items. There are also "Store" items which can upgrade your D&D experience that give perks, such as table upgrade, furniture, pets, etc. This actually made the game significantly easier (especially once you get the one that makes abilities last 1 turn longer - stun lock 4 enemies at a time!) Because of the D&D nature as well, you can select from a variety of characters and classes (which you can unlock more of) that gives different perks and playstyles. I personally ran 1 mage, 1 tank, 2 DPS (archer/rogue), and 1 cleric for healing. The lineup worked really well for me and I was beating enemies much higher than my level. For the gameplay, you battle enemies in a turn based combat system and hope from region to region completing quests. There are plenty of enemies and the difficulty scales relatively well as you go on.

Now for the downsides. The game itself is pretty fun, but it can start to get very repetitive. You essentially end up battling the same enemies over and over. Lots of quests are basically the same - go battle 7 enemies, escort someone to another place, collect drops, etc. Aside from the main quest, the side quests are not memorable at all and get boring pretty fast. The other downside of the game is the weak endgame. Although the beginning was fun, and it was cool exploring new regions, getting upgrades, and seeing yourself progress... the endgame just feels like a grind. The difficulty really spikes as you get close to the end, so you actually have to spend some time grinding even with the +1 turn stun cheese I used.

Overall, fun game that I would definitely recommend playing, even if the endgame is a bit slow.

Rating: 7.5/10
Recommend Price: $8.99 (because of the slow endgame, I would recommend getting it at least 10% off)

review: Pen and paper 2 is superour in every way - the first game is too grindy, battles are too long - both npc and pc have lots of health and low damage - that prolonge the battle without actually any challenge. Upgrade system is total gambling - you gamble 1 hour of grind to one try - with 45% it failed for me 4 times in a row. Everything is super expensive in terms of game gold - take that you get extremly low gold as a rewards. That make gameplay boring to me - only way to progress is to grind low level enemies - try you luck with upgrading and when you fail repeat the process from a begining. This destroys the pacing tottaly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071026728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1591831046}
review:
Avant de tester / jouer plus en profondeur. Deux ou trois choses qui justifient cette évaluation négative en a priori :

- Un login vis un compte tiers (Paradox) : oui, on s'en fiche, mais ça me casse les pieds cette évolution du jeu vidéo, si on paie pour un jeu, on a peut-être le droit à la tranquillité/liberté de pas avoir à donner des infos persos. Je joue pour me détendre de façon égoïste et auto-centrée, pas pour faire partie d'une quelconque communauté dont j'ai autrement rien à faire (restons poli) et que je ne connais ni d'Eve, ni d'Adam. Vous voulez quoi ? Un like sur Facebook en plus ? Je n'ai pas Facebook !
- Un mode plein écran forcé sans option dans le menu interne. Euh, je ne suis pas sur mon téléphone, tu vois... Alors, vu le type de jeu et de graphismes, je m'attendais à pouvoir le lancer en mode fenêtré avec un autre jeu en parallèle, mais non, pas d'option dans le menu, et les conditions de raccourci (-windowed -sw -w xxxx) que ce soit par steam ou raccourci extérieur ne fonctionnent pas non plus.*
- La musique en 8-bit, c'est sympa environ une seconde et demi... surtout quand on cherche une solution à ce problème de résolution.

* Finalement en cherchant un peu, en lançant le jeu en appuyant sur alt on a un launcher tiers (type Unity) qui permet d'activer le mode fenêtré et de définir la résolution, ouf... Mais pourquoi ne pas le laisser accessible en défaut ? Bon au moins, la configuration est mémorisée entre chaque session, ça va, je ne vais pas être forcé de retrouver où j'ai remisé mon écran 14 pouces d'il y a vingt ans pour tester enfin la vraie valeur du jeu.

Le jeu (enfin le studio, le jeu il s'en fout d'être payé, il n'a pas de conscience) a de la chance que je sois persévérant [strike]ou trop procrastinateur pour tester un jeu dans les deux semaines suivant son achat, ahem[/strike].... Avec ces conditions, il était le candidat idéal pour une demande de remboursement, malgré l'envie qu'il peut susciter (thématique) par rapport à son prix relativement élevé (pour ce que c'est, un portage mobile).

Voilà, tout ça pour dire que c'est ennuyeux (pour être poli) quand on lance un jeu avec le plaisir et l'attente de la découverte, d'être ennuyé (encore) à devoir créer un compte tiers — ce qui inclue de devoir aller vérifier un mail qu'on n'utilisera jamais pour valider la création du dit compte — puis de devoir bidouiller et relancer dix fois l'application pour tester un autre paramètre sans résultat en se disant que ce coup-ci on n'oubliera pas de couper cette amusante petite musique qui commence vraiment à être agaçante (toujours) tout en épluchant les discussions Steam pour trouver une nouvelle solution alternative. Et quand enfin celle-ci fonctionne, le son finalement coupé, avec à peine plus qu'un peu de bave aux coins des lèvres, on s'applique à rédiger cette évaluation en souriant en pensant à ces braves et gentils coquins de développeurs (idem).

HS : *[i]repasse le revers de sa main sur ses lèvres[/i]* On peut avoir un barbare dans le groupe, au fait ? Gnnnn...

NB : À voir si je change mon évaluation après un temps de jeu plus effectif, mais pas sûr : l'évaluation globale est déjà très élevée et avec ce début loupé, il faudrait que le jeu soit vraiment exceptionnel pour compenser ça. Et puis, si mes bêtises (là, là, politesse) peuvent aider quelques joueurs à avoir une meilleure expérience ou à s'en éviter une désagréable, ça restera au moins utile ce contrepoint.

PS : Restons poli et courtois, et comme je dis toujours : §♠$%√Ω©‼

---

PPS : Après un peu de jeu, je suis plutôt satisfait du contenu, l'humour est présent, les combats un peu stratégiques bien que très répétitifs et le développement des personnages malgré son caractère simpliste n'est pas dénué d'intérêt. Je déplore quelques lenteurs, notamment le temps de présence à l'écran des panneaux victoire / quête accomplie qu'on ne peut passer et la lenteur des déplacements entre les zones (mais on peut les accélérer via l'achat d'objets, mais cela reste des temps morts malgré tout). Actuellement niveau 22, j'ai peur aussi que ces lenteurs se fassent encore plus sentir quand j'arriverai en fin de partie, quand le [i]grind fest[/i] risque de devenir encore plus prononcé.

Point de détail encore : j'aurais préféré des compétences de joueur/maître plutôt que des personnages pour les incarner. [spoiler]Avoir un wookie ou une ET à sa table de jeu ou Splinter, je trouve que ça casse un peu le trip de rôliste (alors qu'au contraire, je trouve ça amusant de combattre des tortues ninjas, mais quand ils sont dans la partie)[/spoiler], mais peut-être suis-je rabat-joie et trop fermé à cette mise en abîme pour y adhérer.

Alors, globalement le jeu répond à mes attentes, mais l'imbroglio du début, le manque de configuration interne et les longueurs me laissent quand même un goût mitigé et me poussent à rester sur une évaluation plus mesurée que l'avis général.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122389049', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1590089480}
review:
It's OK for a mobile game (from which this game is ported),
but for PC game it's way too repetitive and grindy.
Overall, it's OK to get from a bundle or on the deep sale and play it for an hour or two.
If you play it more than that it becomes too tedious.
Since I also bought it on sale I can recommend it for a few hours.

The game has a cute stylish pixel graphics, a fun story, full of irony over the table-top RPG genre cliches and self-irony.

But be warned, you practically do the same thing over and over again. 
if you did one quest, then you saw everything in this game. 
after that you will do the same, just the enemies will have more HP+skills.

and yes, about the grind. to do one quest you need to kill not 1-3 enemies of one type, but 10-20 enemies of this type.
what makes the repetitive game even more repetitive, considering that you need to do it by batches of 3-7 enemies at the time.
same with collecting gold for an upgrade: you get 5-30 coins per battle on average when upgrade costs 150-750 coins.

So you can play it for a while before it becomes overly repetitive,
but don't expect too much. 
The is no gameplay development or play-style changes during the playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992880692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1589590175}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper is a simple Pixel Graphics turn based RPG in a fantasy setting, with the added layer that you are actually a bunch of table top gamers playing and RPG. There is an emphasize on simplicity and jokes.

TL;DR No Story, some pay to win elements, felt like a clicker/incremental, humor is fine, gameplay is fine. Cannot recommend, didn't feel like there was a reason to grind.

I wanted to like this game but after an hour of play (and a bit of online research to see what I could expect if I played further) I decided to refund. 

The gameplay is very, very simple. There is a lot of things to upgrade but its all pretty linear, there are not really decisions to be made just another upgrade to grind towards. Reminds me of a clicker or incremental game in a lot of ways but with simple RPG combat between upgrades instead of just waiting or clicking.

The humor is fine as well. It's a lot of jokes about DnD and RPG tropes. It is like browsing memes, the jokes aren't connected and don't further anything, but they'll give you a chuckle here and there (and don't get me wrong, I love memes! Just not a game based on them :/ ). I contrast this with a game like "Card Hunter" where the DM and Players have defined personalities and the jokes come from them interacting with each other and there is an actual story (not much of one, but what little there is helps!).

The graphics and quality of the game is fine, I didn't have a problem with that either. My problem lies in the complete lack of story. Players and the DM are completely interchangeable, spouting one liners and jokes but never behaving as a group. When I realized that you could upgrade your DM by switching to a totally different one, is when I decided this game wasn't for me. I could not get invested in the RPG group they were simply another upgrade, disposed of when a better version is available.

Lastly, I bought the "deluxier" version which was a mistake because it immediately made me feel like I had paid to win. In the deluxier version you get access to some better characters, more gold, and a place to quickly grind at the beginning of the game. It did not provide  more content (or at least very little), really just a way to skip the early game grind... to get to the mid game grind.

I cannot recommend this game unless you are ok with a incremental/clicker style game, with some pay to win elements and meme like jokes to prop it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054674251', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 337, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1589707693}
review:
Mobile port grind-a-thon. 

The way this game works might be more acceptable on mobile, if you have a daily commute for example, but as a desktop game, it's not worth your time. 

The game isn't badly made, it's just that the game is made to take A LONG EFFING TIME to accomplish ANYTHING AT ALL. It's boring to do the four-five quests with the samey joking NPC names for three hours, let alone the hours on end this game intends for you to play.

If I'm going to play a game for hours upon hours, which I admit to having a low tolerance for anyway, I want to be invested in the world and characters, or at least my ability to improve my armor without going endlessly back and forth to caves to "mine" grindstones.

If you're interested, buy this game on mobile. I don't recommend it on Steam.

review:
Ótimo jogo! Até certo ponto, bastante viciante! Remete muito aos RPG's convencionais de mesa, com fichas, magias e tudo mais. Forrado de referências de universos como Senhor dos Anéis, Hobbit, e até outros games.

Dá para gastar umas boas horas jogando a história, sem contar as diversas quests secundárias que o jogo possui. Gráficos, músicas e efeitos sonoros que remetem justamente à proposta do jogo: um 8/16 bits muito fiel. 

Enfim, mais um excelente trabalho da Behold Studios (Chroma Squad, etc).

author: {'steamid': '76561198396012370', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1588719431}
review:
Das spiel ist nichts weiteres als ein Simpler Port eines Handy-Games, und ein schlechter noch dazu.
Spiel lauft dauerhaft im fullscreen, noch dazu in einer miserablen auflösung, und man hat sich nicht mal die mühe gemacht bei einem PIXEL game das antialiasing abzuschalten. Was dazu führt das die pixelschriften alle schwammig aussehen, und generell einfach alle grafiken sich nicht "natürlich" anfühlen. Ganz zu schweigen von den problemen von sehr kleinen und filigranen pixel-icons, die werden nämlich einfach zu einem pixelbrei.

Sehr schade, das game sah ansonsten ziemlich gut für den zeitvertreib aus. Und dafür dann 12 bis 19 Euro zahlen? Niemals wieder.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279456895', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1587172092}
review:
It's a great game (I played on console, that's why I have so few hours on this game). It's solid fun, it's a well-made RPG with a meta story and a lot of humor based around tabletop games, video games, and role-playing.

However, towards the late-game, once most of the side quests start to get exausted and the main quest starts heavily ramping up in difficulty, and can become a real drag. Lots of grinding at the very end and no great way of doing it because by then you've either already been grinding for hours or have done every notable side quest. Couple this with the fact that most late-game quests are just doing simple actions like travelling somewhere you'll never go again and it ends up feeling like they're just padding out the gameplay.

Overall, it's a good game, well-balanced and humorous with a neat story, but the gameplay towards the end leaves a lot to be desired.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209118511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1595625972}
review: Um pouco da experiência do RPG de mesa através de modestos recursos virtuais, este jogo é um relaxante convite para um mundo de fantasias e diversão, contendo diversos easter eggs que homenageiam o nosso cotidiano.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220694752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1094, 'last_played': 1587441025}
review: Um, yeah, this is an excellent game for fans of RPGs, (like, I mean ALL the RPG styles) and at LEAST fans of Chroma Squad.  It's exactly as creative and spirited as Chroma Squad with a little bit of serious table-top element, and anyway Chroma Squad was awesome for every one of it's own obvious reasons.  The hardest, plain RPG I've ever played is Final Fantasy 1; no room for creativity in that game if you want to finish it within a human timeframe.  Same here, in that you can't really play around with the characters' offensive abilities, otherwise you'll be stuck with oddball high and low stats leaving the party no effective offense.  It's not as hard as the Dark Soul's stuff because you won't get as far as that game let's you get before it whips out it's ace cards.  And of all the weird things in this game, I still can't believe Phoenix birds are damaged by flame spells.

author: {'steamid': '76561198327552734', 'num_games_owned': 1798, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1623131282}
review: I had to stop playing this game after an hour because this low resolution, pixel art game was causing my laptop fan to go into overdrive. I have played RPG's, RTS's, and 4X strategy games with tens to hundreds of units moving at a time on this laptop (i7-7700, 8gb RAM, GeForce 1050-Ti) with no problems. I'm no expert, but maybe this game has not been properly optimized for PCs. Especially for this game to only be a RPG-lite. I do enjoy the meta-game *idea* of the game. I wanted to like this game (I bought it after all). But luckily, the sequel to the game, Knights of Pen & Paper II, does everything this game does even better and runs like a dream on my machine. I'd recommend that one over this one.

review:
Gioco divertente e con tantissime citazioni ed idee geniali.
PRO:  
-atmosfera
-livello di gioco e livello dei giocatori (tartine, tavolo etc)
-grafica carina
-tante possibilità e, se piace il genere, anche una discreta rigiocabilità cambiando i personaggi ed i giocatori

CONTRO:
-o io non l'ho trovato o non è spiegato da nessuna parte a cosa servono i vari valori. alcuni sono autoesplicativi, altri per niente
-pochi dungeon

FINALE:
Gioco meritevole e divertente!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057103167', 'num_games_owned': 3580, 'num_reviews': 782, 'playtime_forever': 2984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2984, 'last_played': 1584140969}
review:
Tres tres bon jeu avec des mecanismes simples mais rodes , le jeu est tres bon et on se prends vraiment a savourer les details ou les clins d oeil venant d autres jdr ou de films , bref , si vous etes fan des jdr , vous serez en terrains connus !
Avec des scenarios tres courts (style salle , tresor , monstres) on retrouve le grain de folie connus de tout joueurs et maitre de jeu lors de vrais parties de jdr !!! L hommage d un hommage : c est absolument savoureux et jouissif ! bref ! ne manquez pas cette perle !
Attention les graphismes sont du pixel art mais ils sont tres bien faits !

Interet : 17/20
Realisation : 17/20

author: {'steamid': '76561198042009736', 'num_games_owned': 1166, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1586, 'last_played': 1430594825}
review:
I liked it until I didn't. The early stages are fun, but then it gets increasingly grindy. At the same time as it starts getting grindy, the humor breaks down, and becomes repetitive and stale. They rely too much on running gags and brick jokes. There are few moments that actually surprised me.

The dialogue and plot feel like excuses from the start, and serve as a weak foundation for it's later attempt to build some sort of plot involving the characters starting to interact with the dungeon master's world, probably inspired by that one movie that does the same thing. It doesn't work well.

The whole game has disconcertingly offensive elements as well, that gradually become more disconcerting until you put your finger on them and realize that they're not joking about being 'sexist'. They actually are.

I cannot recommend this product at any price. I cannot recommend any product from Behold Studios. Do not buy this product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046895031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1626143592}

review:
Una muy buena forma de jugar el clásico juego de mesa. Puede que resulte repetitivo luego de unas horas de juego pero se compensa con los desafíos a través de las criaturas y escenarios. Sencillo y económico, más que recomendado si esta en oferta (para los amantes del RPG por turnos).
No esperen secuencias de video ni gráficos increíbles, es un pixelart apropiado y medido para la propuesta.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993251936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1574474802}
review:
Sad to say that while the advertisements and the graphical style are cute, the game itself is kinda lackluster; questing quickly becomes a grind, and the written content (and even the character rosters for players, dungeon master and even NPCs) are needlessly crude and cringeworthy, reflecting the 80s and 90s just a LITTLE BIT too accurately with rampant elements of casual sexism and racism. There's so much more they could have done with this without consistently plucking the lowest hanging fruit of the genre.

While the concept was good, the execution of these aesthetic choices with the increasingly repetitive gameplay made this flop for me. YMMV based on your own tolerance to (or entertainment in spite of) the worst side of the gamer subculture, but I'm done with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056698823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 2477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2219, 'last_played': 1572395285}
review:
it's a turn based RPG with a simplistic approach, relying more on the pop cultural references to carry the story that tries to be comedic and use as many puns as possible. The game can be quite long if you try to do every single quest in the game but it's an enjoyable journey for the most part and the grinding in the game can be close to non existent if you don't care about the last weapon and armor upgrades and if you use a relative cheap set of items to make the costs of the upgrades until then just small pocket change.

The game is quite rich in the amount of potions and items you can purchase that are single use, from crit buffs to exp potions. Some people won't use them for the most part which is a viable option as well.

Overall I enjoyed my time with the game and the only nitpick I had with the game was how I messed up my build the first time. I still had fun, I just could have done things a lot smoother since I didn't know how the skills scaled with the stats the first time I played it. I could have reset my skills at the bar but I didn't ^^". 
I still think it's a good purchase if you get it on sale and wanna play something that isn't too hard that and is inspired by D&D and has pop culture references.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067563194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 1638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1413, 'last_played': 1627190794}
review:
Okay, so here we have the final version of the game [i](Thankfully! The original actually had real currency purchases for an edge playing)[/i].

[b][ramble][/b]
The game itself reminds me, and probably everyone else of the 8 bit era, and if it doesn't... Go play some 8 bit games!

So it is not an RPG but rather a quite funnily scripted hack and slash, much like the early table top games.
[flashback]
DM: You see a group of creatures, what do you do?
Party: KILL THEM! KILL THEM ALL!
[/flashback]

For some reason it reminds be a bit of [i]'Knights of Xentar'
https://youtu.be/5XE8BY2JUOY
[/i]...
I really don't know why.
Maybe it's the humour?
[b][/ramble][/b]

Anyway...

So, a relatively easy to learn game which pretty much holds your hand with which direction to take and what to do.
Combat is standard turn based, with the variance of initiative rolls placing everyone in pretty much random starting places.
Tiny party inventory and only 4 item slots on each character.
A good thing is the gold collected is shared across any and all games you have.
You can change through the various characters at certain locations that have an [b]inn[/b], curious who will get that table top gaming joke.

The game itself is more of a limited interactive story than a game, and the story itself...
Amusing, and entertaining.

Suggested to purchase when on sale [i](preferably with the sequel)[/i] to add to your collection.

Recommended: Yes
Replay ability: Yes, to a point
Drawbacks: Nothing detrimental

author: {'steamid': '76561198273896954', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1443, 'last_played': 1568003726}
review:
TL:DR - Skip this one and play the sequel instead, it’s better in every way compared to this one.

This isn’t a horrible game and isn’t too bad as it brings back 8-bit nostalgia RPG games. However it becomes very repetitive and painfully grinding as the game progresses. It gets to the point where it just becomes mind numbing and I stopped paying attention to the dialogue and just tried to finish the game. Equipment upgrade relies on RNG and heavy investment in gold which again you have to grind to farm which just adds to the pain of this game. The creators must have paid heavy attention to the reviews and criticism of this one as I have played the sequel and it is vastly far superior and corrects the many mistakes that this game has. So I would consider games from them in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198442096941', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1459, 'last_played': 1703362758}

review:
Das Spiel ist zwar Grafisch kein Augenschmaus, aber inhaltlich genial.

Ein hoher Unterhaltungsfaktor und das Verlangen das Spiel nochmals zu spielen, mit anderen Klassen-Skillungen und unterschiedlichen Zusammenstellungen ist bei mir tatsächlich aufgekommen.

Das Spiel bedient humorvoll die Klischees von Pen & Paper-Runden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026911544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1491, 'last_played': 1570132103}
review: I absolutely love this game. I play it on my phone all the time. It has charm, humor, and polish. That being said, I cannot recommend this game because I contacted the developers about the game running at two or three thousand frames per second back around 2014. Different computer four years later, same problem. Sorry, but when my computer works harder at playing a 2D retro rpg than a modern fps, something is wrong. I should not have to go out of my way to install additional software just so I can stop your game from making my processor melt itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975080377', 'num_games_owned': 2195, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1561394172}
review:
This game is not suitable for modern machines at all and will run at 900+fps unless you use a third party solution like nvidiaProfileInspector to limit the frame rate. There is no in-game setting to set vsync and Nivida Control Panel doesn't work at all.

Technical hurdles aside, the game itself is entertaining but incredibly grindy. The 'final boss' is actually a mid-boss, and to see the game's ending and credits you'll probably need to grind up to level 40+.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140864061', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1672815969}
review: Este é um ótimo jogo. Seus gráficos são propositalmente retros, o que dá um charme único em sua jogabilidade. Não é necessária experiência alguma com RPGs de messa para jogar este. O jogo é bem simples, com mecânicas fáceis de se aprender e uma interface bem intuitiva. O enredo é cativante e você cria gosto com os personagens (jogadores). Aqui você age como mestre: Determinando que missões serão aceitas, quantos e quais monstros aparecerão. Uma única coisa que me incomoda é a questão dos equipamentos. A dinâmica de você melhora-los com o ferreiro e não poder mudar as armas, pessoalmente, não me agrada. (isso foi mudado em seu sucessor). Porém, eu tenho sempre grandes experiências com esses jogo e realmente recomendo muito.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077222956', 'num_games_owned': 2275, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 910, 'last_played': 1561838752}
review: While I don't think there's anything terribly revolutionary in Knights of Pen and Paper, it has enough charm to make it all seem fresh, and there's a depth involved that belies it's cute facade. It's a game that I feel falls into the "Waste Time and Unwind" category of game, but the importance of games like that is severely underrated. Definitely worth your precious gaming hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995129622', 'num_games_owned': 3088, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1565519518}
review:
Very fun game! Just goes to show you just need a lot of imagination to create great stories. Like the DnD-alike mechanics

EDIT: Adapting the review. At start, this game is really fun. However, I'm level 30+ right now, and this game has one of the worst & boring grinds I've ever played. And I like to play Neptunia games, so I'm oddly fine with grinding otherwise.

I'm level 30+ and unlocked all possible extra classes, but this game really loses its charm later in the game. 

Also very annoying that sometimes you need to go from place A to place B, then back to place A for quests or additional grinding. So what do your characters do? Complain all the time that you always visit the same place.

I was a fan at start, but I got to a point I uninstalled when I saw that the huge grind to level 30 wasn't sufficient - I'll need about the same effort to reach 10 levels higher to MAYBE be able to finish the story. screw that

3/10 game is fun at start but becomes a HUGE and boring grind after a while

author: {'steamid': '76561198093350917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1629778068}
review:
This is a game for Munchkins, pure and simple. Min-maxing in the name of the game and you barely notice the monster/loot except for the numbers. THAT SAID there's a lot of humor and fun here! The developers clearly love the genre and my hardened heart did beat a little faster in battle with The Swamp God or Heart of Ice with their inventive sprite designs.
The charming music can get repetitious, but then you just turn it off and switch on your own tunes.
Dungeons/fights can get repetitious, but you can just switch off the game for a bit. This is a game you can pick up and play for a couple of rounds or marathon to a disturbing degree if you set your own goals on levels and skills.
It's appealing, entertaining, simple and yes the gold grind gets a little annoying but you can just pour your initial gold into buying table items that boost your gold anyway. This would have made for an irritating mobile game, but as a browser game on Steam? Just good fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198288902940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2162, 'last_played': 1533268667}

author: {'steamid': '76561198254641881', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1274, 'last_played': 1558815539}
review:
Análise do jogo *platinado*

Esse jogo me prendeu pacas. Essa é literalmente a frase que define minha experiencia. 

Knights of Pen and Paper é uma simulação de um rpg de mesa, onde você controla os personagens da mesa, ao mesmo tempo em que segue a narrativa do meste.

Esse tipo de experiencia é incrível, e proporciona ao jogo um toque exclusivo quando se comprara aos demais. Uma das suas principais diferenças é que, em varias missões, você pode definir o nível de dificuldade de cada luta, que sera proporcional a sua recompensa final. Isso, embora estranho a primeira vista, deixa o jogo bem dinâmico. Além disso, quando joguei pela primeira vez e completei 100% do jogo, em nenhum momento fiquei travado precisando farmar xp e gold, isso vem de uma forma bem natural. Entretanto, em outros saves, para completar as conquistas, devo admitir que foi um pouco tedioso.

De qualquer forma, seja pelo grafico ou musica, esse jogo é anwsome! Recomendo todos a comprarem, e em algumas promoções ele fica mais barato que um pastel! Apenas compre, de verdade. Mal posso esperar para adquirir a sequencia ^^

Espero que se divirtão.

nha~~

author: {'steamid': '76561198080025698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5425, 'last_played': 1558118491}
review:
Não existe a menor chance de não recomendar esse jogo.

Para toda uma geração que cresceu jogando RPG de mesa com amigos e que acompanhou o mundo dos games esse jogo vai ter um apelo fantástico, como teve pra mim. Os gráficos propositalmente simples passam até a ter um certo charme.

O jogo é recheado de referências à cultura nerd, a progressão de nível não é demorada, as conquistas são agradáveis e coerentes. O jogo foi desenvolvido por brasileiros, e eu não me arrependi de ter comprado. Frequentemente entra em promoção, aumentando ainda mais a lista de motivos para não deixar passar. A ideia do jogo de representar um grupo de amigos jogando é boa, a forma como a história se desenrola também, apesar de não ser nada profunda (propositalmente).

Para jogadores casuais é uma boa opção, e para a galera hardcore há um ou outro desafio interessante no jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123006740', 'num_games_owned': 688, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 1380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1380, 'last_played': 1466606612}

author: {'steamid': '76561198112936760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1557727030}
review:
Let's cut to the chase: despite the charming aesthetic and the many flavorful references this game has multiple problems:
[olist]
    * Not particularly deep story or gameplay wise.
    * Quests are simplistic, repetitive and most often thinly guised kill X amount of Y assignments. For many questions you choose yourself how many enemies you wish to engage in battle at once which takes away the challenge. o
    * Easier quests are often unlocked by finishing harder ones. You might finish a level 22 quest to unlock a level 9 quest which at that point is trivial.
    * The game is very grindy, repetitive and most usefully stuff (including classes) is locked behind a gold grind.
[/olist]

All these points suddenly make sense when your consider that this game started out as an iOS title with **micro transactions** which were since removed due player backlash. What you get is still a game designed around enticing people into spending money to cut corners without actually being able to do that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990755148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 822, 'last_played': 1397567611}
review: This is a port from a mobile game, in which the (removed) microtransactions model is more and more apparent the longer you play. Each task is more tedious than the previous one, and the enjoyment decreases, replaced with repetitiveness and gratuitous unfunny references. I gave up before the end. Life is too short to waste time with this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110716907', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1556378337}
review: This is a super cute, fun game to play on a Saturday night (or any day or night, for that matter) when you're missing your real-life pen and paper RPG buddies. It seems simple, but it's easy to customize to your own tastes and preferences for your party and questing experience. It's basically like playing all sides of a Dungeons and Dragons (or Pathfinder, etc.) game from the comfort of your couch. Perfect for introverts or people new to RP games, or for people who prefer to run their own campaigns but don't want to put in hours of work to create their own story line. I personally love it, and it's very addictive and easy to spend hours on. Great little game for lovers of fantasy and RP genres. 10/10 for the type of game.

review:
Having played this game for quite awhile, it is very easy for me to recommend it. 
This game is very addictive and has great humor.
My favorite thing about this game is probably the immersion it provides, despite the pixel graphics. I find myself sinking large amounts of my, very limited, free time into playing this game further. 
My only complaint is that I wish the pricing/different versions of the game were more clear.
I purchased the +1 edition hoping that it meant I had all the content for the game, but all it added in were a few minor changes that I ended up paying an extra $5 for when I could have spent $8 more the for "Deluxier" Edition and gotten the content I then had to pay an extra $5 on top of the $5 I already invested.
9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198274484258', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 195, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1553051684}
review:
Me llamó la atención por jugar rol en mesa y  decidí probarlo.
 Es un juego que tiene cosas buenas pero tampoco es la panacea, ni los conceptos más originales. Al inicio me pareció divertido pues  para matar el tiempo esta bien, pero tiene  algunos defectos al ser un juego repetitivo donde pasas de una batalla a otra, el asunto es que si juegas bien puedes subir de nivel rápido pero si te equivocas, ya sea por estrategia, o por enfrentarte a un enemigo con un nivel superior, puedes perder todo tu dinero rápidamente, y recuperar ese dinero se hace complicado por algunas mecánicas  propias del juegos. Así que se convierte en un conjunto de  repeticiones,  de aciertos, y errores, el asunto es que luego de cierto  tiempo tiende a hartar y eso sucede rápidamente en muchos casos. 
Disfrute el juego por un tiempo, y por eso le doy un positivo, pero no es un juego para todo el mundo, si te llama la atención píllalo en una muy buena promoción, no creo que valga la pena pagar un precio completo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198309298089', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1590207114}
review: É o início da série, eu joguei esse depois de ter jogado o 2, e não vi nenhum tipo de conexão entre os jogos que me desse spoilers dele, e eu joguei como se fosse o 2 pois são poucas as diferenças no geral, Gostei muito do sistema de progressão de personagem e me diverti fazendo 100% nesse jogo, o que não é difícil, o ponto negativo fica apenas em relação às DLCs, tive que comprar para os 2 jogos 1 DLC que ficou faltando para fazer 100% em ambos. Mas isso não diminui a diversão (pouca, pois terminei em 4h), por isso recomendo o jogo,

author: {'steamid': '76561198048148054', 'num_games_owned': 1279, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 1306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1306, 'last_played': 1548952712}
review:
[b]Knights of Pen and Paper +1[/b] is a lovely Turn-Based (Dungeons 'n Dragons-like) Game that has got alot of charme to it.

The thing that keeps you entertained most is the humour, I'ma tell you that right of the bat.
But, it just generally does everything right that it should as an 8-bit RPG-ish game that might wake some nostalgia feelings.
The humour, the general RPG-Features of leveling, skilling and different classes, and the D&D-base are what keeps you going and made me get over the fact that KoPaP can get boring and repetitive quite vastly, which is the worst part of this game.
Yet, if you find points to keep you going nontheless, this game is lots of chill fun.
The general game offers about 12-15 hours of gameplay, achievements might take some more.

Very pleasant game that is recommended on sale, as I myself had lots of fun with it and kept me playing for 7 hours in a row like no game did the past months.

Personal rating: [b]8/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198848145649', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1614391126}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001223915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1551562995}
review:
I'm actually enjoying this game, but I can't honestly recommend it. You play as a group of people playing D&D and it has a ton of meta references which are funny and the atmosphere is really great. 

Let's get to the good:
+Lots of character classes
+Lots of gear
+Tons to do and explore
+Pop culture out the wazoo

Now, the reasons I can't wholeheartedly tell someone to buy this game:
-Grammar -- this is a big one to me. The developer speaks Portugese natively, which is fine, however there is a LOT of broken english in the game. Instead of "let's go to the cave of instant death!" the game may say "going to cave of instant death! yuhu!"
-Grindy as all get out. Each character only has 4 skills, and you can unlock all 4 in  5 minutes, so why make me grind 10+ hours leveling the same skills just to see bigger numbers?
-Incomprehensible plot to the point that you just tune out and stop caring halfway through the game.
-VERY limited skill selection with very little strategy to the battles.

Overall, it's a fun little romp, but I don't feel like spending more than a dollar or two on this is a wise decision.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161295659', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1546444274}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037853137', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 5851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5042, 'last_played': 1557607753}
review: The publisher of Knights of Pen and Paper +1, paradox interactive, is absurd.  After owning the game for years, they make changes requiring you to agree to a 17 page privacy policy ( https://legal.paradoxplaza.com/privacy/privacy-policy-2018-11-02?locale=en ) to use their necessary proprietary system.  If they can't sum up the privacy policy with the words "You bought a single-player game that has no reasonable need to connect to our servers, and we will not harvest your information for any reason and will not change this policy after the time of purchase", then they don't deserve the business.  The game was ok, but even if it wasn't for the data mining, the in-game advertisement for DLC is just weak.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079949578', 'num_games_owned': 734, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 3697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3621, 'last_played': 1545655812}
review:
Лет пять назад, когда я только увидел Knights of Pen and Paper, мне показалось, что это просто шикарная задумка - запилить игру про игру, насовать туда кучу пасхалок, шуточек и немножечко сюжета, да не простого, а с целым поворотом!
Я считаю так и сейчас, но теперь я вижу и недостатки:

[list]
    [*]Занудные квесты к концу игры убьют почти все удовольствие - однообразное стуканье мобцов утомляет.
    [*]Часть доступных персонажей практически бесполезна, а еще пара-тройка становится ненужной уровня эдак после 10-го.
    [*]И с предметами та же история - из богатого ассортимента магазинов по-настоящему полезны только вещей 5-7. 
    [*]И ради всего этого приходится гриндить! Лут с монстров и боссов даже в высокоуровневом подземелье полон сюрпризов - за победу над полчищем врагов могут дать яблочко, восстанавливающее 3 хп. 
    [*]Мелкие баги карты и подземелий.
[/list]

В 2013 году я не жаловался. И спустя пять лет тоже ставлю лайк.

[b]7 Нейбов Гьюэллов из 10![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198045336457', 'num_games_owned': 1185, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 989, 'last_played': 1659283483}
review:
¿Has jugado algunas vez al rol? Pues este juego es lo mismo pero en PC. Y cuando digo lo mismo me refiero a que manejas a cinco "personas" que estan jugando al rol en una mesa dirigidos por un master...
La historia original, la música retro (aunque la de combate llega a cansar), frases graciosas, guiños a películas y series... Todo lo que uno puede esperar de un "pixelart".
Vas comprado con el dinero de la partida objetos del "mundo real" que te da bonificaciones. Una mesa de madera, una puerta, una máquina recreativa, un "master" nuevo o una pizza.
Los únicos inconvenientes es que los combates se llegan a hacer muy repetitivos, sobre todo a nivel alto donde tienen bastante vida.
Para los logros, yo recomiento jugar dos veces. Una haciendo todo sin preocuparte del tiempo y luego en la segunda partida, gastarte todo el dinero que has acumulado para comprar items, comprar frascos de experiencia y mejorar equipo, y si os cogéis a los personajes de Betu, Gui, Ronaldo, Saul y Hugo podéis haceros facilmente el logro de velocidad (menos de 365 días) y el de pasártelo con los desarrolladores.
Para el logro de "combinación extraña" te vas a la taberna, dejas un personaje y te haces una "abuela maga".
Para el de "seguir jugando después terminar el juego", lo que hay que hacer no es terminar el juego, es acabar el juego, es decir "game over", tienes que quedarte sin dinero y dejarte matar  a todos los personajes (se puede hacer al principio), al no tener dinero para resucitar, saldrá "game over" y si das a continuar te salta el logro.

review: Não se engane pela aparencia simples. Esse jogo consegue simular e fazer voce revivencia momentos de gloriosos RPG de mesa. Muitas referencia a cultura pop e tambem ao mundo real. É realmente divertido como o game te coloca nessas situações. É importante saber que você será o mestre e os jogadores, quantidade de inimigos e aonde ir será dita por você, mas as falas e como a historia se desenvolve o game irá lhe guiar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086154682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1626565833}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper é um dos melhores joguinhos pra passar o tempo. Ta na minha lista dos meus preferidos, pois segue a linha do RPG de papel, te dá total liberdade de aprimorar seus personagens quanto suas habilidades de classe e você também pode comprar itens para cada personagem, também pode melhorar o ambiente para facilitar na jogatina.
A historinha do jogo tem a dinâmica bem engraçada, com todos os jargões de um jogo de RPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989728476', 'num_games_owned': 1167, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1553141890}

author: {'steamid': '76561198277348670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1521321441}
review: O jogo é simplesmente incrível! A sensação de imersão em estar presente com amigos em uma mesa de D&D é completa. A jogabilidade é simples, porém casa perfeitamente com a proposta do jogo. Os momento das piadas possuem um tempo certo mantendo o jogador sempre cativado pela história e suas personagens. A franquia toda está de parabéns, desde o KoPaP 2 e Galaxy of Pen and paper. Espero que a equipe continue mantendo o nível e traga novos jogos ambientados nos mais diversos temas possíveis!

review: Every couple years I fire this game up and do a playthrough. It is simple fun with a good sense of humor jabbing at pen and paper games. Character builds are pretty simple but you can build some neat synergies (Fast witch sleeping enemies for a massive backstab which drains all the mana the backstab took,  neato). I'm pretty picky these days but somehow this game stays mostly fresh though by the end you will probably be blazing through. Overall great work by the devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053206036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1595, 'last_played': 1537226920}
review:
그림체만 보고 캐쥬얼한 게임이라고 착각해서 산 게임입니다.
노가다성이 짙은데 전투는 재미없는 게임이라는 점을 우선 알아두셔야 합니다.

전투는 지루하며 카타르시스를 느낄 수 없습니다.
초회차는 무조건 퀘스트 중심입니다.
공략을 찾아봐도 퀘스트 따라가라는 말이 없어서 마을에서 사냥만 하다가 세월 다 보냈습니다.
스킬도 마구잡이로 육성하지 마시고 공략 찾아보고 하세요.

한줄평
- 스팀에 쌓여있는 게임 리스트에 미안해서 플레이했다가 나한테 미안해지는 그런 게임

author: {'steamid': '76561198077324004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 847, 'last_played': 1536946728}
review:
My feeling about this game were ambivalent in the beginning, because... well, it's not THAT bad. But the longer I play, the clearer I see all the disadvantaged.

I mean: idea is good, the story is acceptable, but after first few hours I started to realize that this game offers player a fight...

...and a fight...

...and another fight...

..and even one more fight...

..and - surprisingly! - yet another fight.

To be precise: travelling and dungeon crawling systems are trivialized, there is in no decision making element and story is not good enough to compensate staying in one room for the whole time (in fact, no character has a... character). Jokes are cheap and recurring ("surprising" fight after doing quest is not so surprising if it happens in half of quests, meeting game devs is fun once) and all the quests are: travel, fight, travel+fight and collect.... which is equal to fight. What more - althought around 90% of the game is fighting, fight system is really basic, providng only 4 skills per character, so after some time, you just repeat the same tactic again and again... And one more thing to mention: blacksmith system is absolutely terrible and frustrating (who the hell had an idea of randomized success combined with very high blacksmithing costs?!?!?!).

Summarizing: the game is not that bad in first few hours, but after this time, it just becomes boring. Because constant fights must become boring earlier or later.

Buy a better RPG, there are many ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979892505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1690156438}

author: {'steamid': '76561198234516860', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 430, 'playtime_forever': 1890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1890, 'last_played': 1503718725}
review:
Good for casual RPG-ers and those who aren't very confident in their adventure-gaming abilities.
I'm sure it's also fun for experienced RPG-ers.

Funny jokes, amusing storylines, great ending.
Simple to figure out and get into the swing of the game.
Simple to upgrade each character's equipment, so you don't have to sit there trying to decide which weapon is better - it's a linear upgrade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035599199', 'num_games_owned': 1969, 'num_reviews': 493, 'playtime_forever': 1383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1248, 'last_played': 1535226593}
review:
Very enjoyable game.  If it wasn't already evident it's an RPG where you control the players and the dungeon master in tandem.  The fantasy land the game the characters are playing is evoked and played out in the background.
You go around, solving quests, leveling up characters, getting loot, and upgrading your real-world DnD den surroundings. It has everything a standard RPG has, but with the extra bit of 4th wall breaking.
The game-play was solid, and the variety of classes you can play with was high.  The abilities within each class is small and focused, but it's evident you get more powerful over time, with the starting area rats evaporating as your level 40 characters bulldoze through.
Takes about 18 hours or so to play through near 100%.  I'll admit it was pretty mindless at times but it was the perfect game to chill and have a beer with.  I admit it did start to get a bit samey in the last few hours but then a suitable challenge arises in the endgame to make you sit up and pay attention.
The only issue I encountered was sometimes it looked like text should have been appearing but didn't, so it felt like I was missing parts of conversations.  I'm not sure whether these were just placeholders you needed to click through that were there for if you had certain characters/classes in your party, but either way it was jarring enough to encounter, but it happened quite a lot.
Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985672769', 'num_games_owned': 1817, 'num_reviews': 448, 'playtime_forever': 1283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1283, 'last_played': 1533901704}
review:
Sorry guys, your game is but fun but there are critial Problems.

This Game lacks of CLOUD SAVES!

After my first run of 6 hours, I eventually got bored after hard grinding.
At my Second Run, a few years later I had quite fun to try various tactics and to max out every good upgrades and Items.
Just now, and without any reason, my savefile of 15 hours does not exist anymore.

And thanks to missing cloud saves they are gone for ever.

This is not a new issue as I found some sources even on their own Website which were posted 24 days ago.
They either take really long time to fix mandatory functions of their games or they stopped caring.

Sorry guys - on the other Hand it was a quite unique experience! But this Issue just kills the game,

I DO NOT RECOMMAND AT THE CURRENT STATE!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010420880', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1533586724}
review: у разрабов была отличная идея, но они сделали из нее мало того что тупую гриндилку, так еще и сделали очень плохо. Сюжет не интересный, персонажей запоминающихся нет, юмора нет, ничего интересного нет. Представьте себе гриндилку с плохой боевкой: персонажи никак не комбятся вообще, артефактов нет, уровень сложности несбалансирован, единственная рабочая тактика очень муторная, артефактов почти нет. Просто незачем играть в это днище, разрабам желаю научиться реализовывать свои идеи хотя бы на троечку, т.к. пока это неуд.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044687300', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 1979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1979, 'last_played': 1532840563}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition — пошаговая инди-РПГ от Behold Studios, подарившей нам такие инди, как [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/251130/Chroma_Squad/]Chroma Squad[/url] и [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/349790/Galaxy_of_Pen__Paper/]Galaxy of Pen & Paper[/url]. KoPaP представляет из себя настольную РПГ - мы сидим за столом и разговариваем с комментатором (ну или кто он, я не разбираюсь), который и будет нашим всем. Игра очень огромная и разносторонняя, куча классов, куча персонажей, куча квестов и куча способов ее прохождений (можно регулировать количество и "качество" противников).
Я не могу сказать про игру много, поиграл в нее мало и мне она не понравилась. Купил я ее очень давно, дивился прекрасной графики, но играл очень мало. Дальше 3-4 уровня я не докачался.
Но это не мешает мне рекомендовать игру, ведь в ней нет ничего отталкивающего. Она добротна и хороша, расстраивает отсутствие локализации. Горячо рекомендую сыграть в KoPaP любителям пошаговых РПГ, она достойна вашего внимания. На момент написания обзора, цена на игру составляет 199 рублей. Честно признаюсь, это слишком много за такую "мелочь", советую ждать скидок или, если есть возможность, урвать ее на халяву.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070617941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1532402647}
review: Stuffed with pop culture references and parodic humour. The game is easy to play until the end, when there is a sharp increase in difficulty (from level 40 to level 65 enemies, to be exact), but it's easy to solve: buy enough Luck amulets to always roll within the "Treasure" range during exploration, then you can spend a couple minutes ambling around the final dungeon to get rich quick and buy all the XP potions you need to beat the final boss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068461193', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1693025923}
review: It's a pretty cool representation of a generic tabletop DnD game. The graphics are nice for pixel graphics as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066014979', 'num_games_owned': 606, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1430076017}
review: Knights of Pen and Paper é um jogo de RPG que tem como objetivo simular um RPG de mesa, ou seja, as conversas são como "encenadas", o numero de inimigos é escolhido pelo jogador e etc. O jogo é divertido se comprado em um preço certo e não é necessário grandes conhecimentos em RPG uma vez que a jogabilidade é simples.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982482873', 'num_games_owned': 2153, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1398087620}
review: Addictive! But only fun for a short time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198336757964', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1168, 'last_played': 1531254940}
review:
Esse jogo é maravilhoso!
Tudo se consiste numa partida de RPG de mesa, onde você controla tanto o mestre quanto os jogadores, podendo escolher com quantos monstros duelar, quais habilidades usar, classes a escolher, itens a comprar, equipamentos a se melhorar, historia a se seguir, entre diversas outras coisas.
Única reclamacão é o sistema de ouro.
Mas o jogo é nacional, da um apoio pro mercado nacional ai.

author: {'steamid': '76561198391404776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1594440701}
review:
Normally, I would make fun of people who play this game, relentlessly. Most role playing games like this are not even worth my time, let alone money. I will say, however, that this one is different. The quests keep you engaged (although at times it can become quite tedious to level up, especially near endgame), there are lots of characters to choose from, and plenty of items to boost your players skills. All of the different types of enemies and rewards you get for beating them most certainly keep even the most repetitive of missions full of surprise and loot. 

Main Point:
For everyone who thinks that RPG's are super gay, and only for those who purposefully frop the soap in prison, they are. Except this one. This game will make you more happy than OG Mudbone makes his casting partners.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158097479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1556, 'last_played': 1530963942}
review: ¿Siempre has querido saber como es una partida de rol?, ¿quieres volver a recordar las partidas con tus colegas?, este es tú juego, a un nivel muy básico cumple con lo que su título nos dice que es, una partida de rol con lápiz y papel. Pero eso si, no es un juego apto para todos los jugaodres, si buscas gráficazos o jugar a rol al estilo Baldur´s gate, este no va a ser tú juego. ¿Lo recomendaría?, según, tendría que conocer al comprador en potencia y reconocer en él a un antiguo jugador de rol de los de lápiz y papel. Para el resto de la gente dudo que sepan apreciar lo que es este juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355896078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2479, 'last_played': 1530190966}
review:
I just recently dipped back into the game to grind the last few achievements and after just completing the whole campaign i feel like I can finally review.

Throughout I did feel like general grind was slightly demanding but I also feel like this is up to a person's discretion since some people can play the waiting game better than others. As well as that I also felt the experience gaps were too large since at the 
end I was playing with a lvl.28 necromancer in a  lvl.40-42 party: perhaps have a more plentiful exp boost in the late game maybe?

Other than that though, I did enjoy the very down-to-earth rpg and D&D mix that this game is. It's quite enjoyable to play around with buffs, proritization and carefully select how to build your party with skills, layouts and classes - it's also very rewarding at the end to sit back and appreciate how you've grown your party considering that they grow as slow as ivy throughout exploring the large amout of content the game offers.

Overall I would recommend this as a simple RPG which even with primitive standards of fights and customization, manages to charm due to the challenges presented to a player in boss fights and the, in my opinion, slower endgame.

[b]8/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197988742738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 735, 'last_played': 1650344874}
review:
Enjoyable game. 12 hours for me to beat the main storyline with most side quests.
Becomes very grindy. Most progression is early game, after unlocking characters and abilities. 
After that, everything scales pretty steady without any new skills. Experience increases your skill levels.
Blacksmith upgrades cost quite a lot, and it very RNG based for upgrading gear.
Great story if you're into it. 
I bought this on sale for 2.50 USD. It was definitely worth it- but I don't think I'd pay much more for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146450963', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1620, 'last_played': 1525901341}
review:
Grab your friends, order some pizza, get your choice of drink, sit down, relax and let’s play a game where we embark on an adventure of fantasy and nonsense in Knights of Pen & Paper.

[h1]The Good[/h1][i]You can choose how you want to play the game.[/i]

The overall adventure for Knights of Pen & Paper is an interesting one. By that, I refer to the fact that you can play the game at your preferred style. The game’s quests doesn’t start unless you accept them and nothing stops you from choosing to fight monsters or going to all of the other locations in the world instead.

The game is also creative with item purchases that you can make whether it’s from the shops in the game world or getting something from the other shop in the “real world”. No, I’m not talking about micro-transaction, there’s another shop outside of the game world where you can buy additional stat boosts, perks or buffs.

[h1]The Bad[/h1][i]Not being able to change classes with your initial characters.[/i]

When you start a new game, you have 6 classes to choose from at the beginning, and later on, you can unlock 6 more classes to give you the option of adding new members to your party with those new classes.

While this is a great way to vary the different options for your party, it bothers me that you can’t change the classes for the characters that you have already created. Because of this, when you want to have a character use whichever new class that you want to use, you’ll need to create a new character with that chosen class, start at level 1 and grind away until it reaches your other character’s level.

[h1]The Ugly[/h1][i]A few stats aren’t shown or aren’t in the game.[/i]

There’s a few stats that are missing from the character’s stat sheets that can potentially dampen their playthrough. The stats that I’m referring to are the character’s current health, not maximum health, and their defenses.

Now, the player’s current health might not be that big of an issue, but not knowing how low your character’s health when preparing your next moves could bring a few problems. As for defense, the fact that there is no defense stat shown questions how durable the characters really are. Do levels have something to do with their defense? Or does another stat influence it? A few more stats wouldn’t hurt. Just saying.


Knights of Pen & Paper is a good game. It may not be the most impressive game, but it’s far from terrible and it does have a charm that doesn’t make it boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050431430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1526886641}
review:
Kights of Pen and Paper é um jogo curioso.

Partindo da premissa de uma jogatina de RPG de mesa, uma grande aventura se inicia, e nela todos os elementos de uma fantasia medieval fictícia estão presentes, de Magos a Guerreiros, de Masmorras a Castelos.

A dinâmica de jogo é bastante simples, o Mestre de Jogo conduz a aventura e o time de 5 personagens vai vizitando cada uma das Cidades, Castelos ou Masmorras cumprindo as missões, missões essas que são repletas de sacadas humorísticas e referências a cultura Pop, assim como os cenários.

As mecânicas de jogo são bastante simples, deixando a complexidade mesma na formação e gerenciamento do time e Ouro. 

Além dos ítens o Ouro deve ser utilizado pra aprimorar as armas no Ferreiro e mudar a Decoração do Quarto, a final é apenas uma jogatina entre amigos.

Apesar da simplicidade Kights pode ser bastentes desafiador, uma vez que se pode ajustar a quantidade de inimigos, e apensar da grande quantidade de missões em algum momento o encanto se perde e o foco fica apenas no combate e exploração em busca de novas classes e equipamentos. Um jogo sem dúvida interessante, por mais que não seja o melhor RPG que existe, sem dúvidas vale muito a pena adquirir para incentivar o mercado nacional, aqui na forma da Behold Studios!!

Que tal experienciar uma aventura com os amigos?!?!

Aquele abraço e até mais!!! o/

author: {'steamid': '76561198382550611', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1526164228}
review: Being a fan of tabletop D&D this game's premise intrigued me so I picked it up on sale.  At first I enjoyed myself and found the game funny and entertaining.  However, after a few hours the game's humor gets old and the gameplay wasn't compelling enough to continue playing.  On surface level what seems like a neat turn-based/party-based/JRPG style combat system quickly became a monotonous grind of just clicking the enemies until they died.  IMO, there was no penalty to failure in combat besides losing a few gold pieces and restarting the fight instantly, which contributes to not feeling invested in the gameplay.
