author: {'steamid': '76561198005245489', 'num_games_owned': 1056, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2720, 'last_played': 1451146166}
review:
Si algo caracteriza a Knights of Pen and Paper +1 es por ser un juego adictivo, adictivo y repito, altamente adictivo. Creo que conviene empezar por este aspecto, porque es uno de sus puntos fuertes aunque no pueda parecerlo a simple vista. ¿Y por qué digo esto? Porque no nos encontramos con un juego AAA de última generación con graficazos acorde a los tiempos que vivimos, sino que la pequeña compañía que ha desarrollado este juego, Behold Studios, intenta plasmar todo lo contrario. Para los fans del género, decir que estamos de suerte, vuelve lo retro. Y es que lo mejor de todo es que tanto este como muchos otros juegos de desarrollo independiente no lo necesitan para convertirse en auténticos juegazos. 

A la vista queda que KOPP+1 se ambienta en un mundo de 8 bits donde el rol clásico será la tónica imperante durante lo que dure tu aventura. Aventura, por cierto, llena de epicidad y de humor por todos los costados. A pesar de no ser un gigante como decimos, su apartado técnico es más que notable, desde los diversos escenarios a una música de estilo retro pegadiza y que le viene como anillo al dedo.
El juego tiene ese corte (evidente por su título) de los juegos clásicos de lápiz y papel, donde cada jugador de la vida real adquiere el rol de un personaje, o héroe, con todo lo que ello conlleva: desde sus habilidades, indumentaria, hasta su forma de pensar y actuar. Todo ello se plasma en las constantes conversaciones que realizarán nuestros personajes, que son otro punto insignia a favor del juego, pues transmiten una gran sensación de inmersión y tiene un humor rolero 100%.

El sistema de combate es el típico de estrategia por turnos en equipos compuestos por cuatro héroes, donde podrás enfrentarte hasta un máximo de 7 enemigos. Resulta interesante que puedas gestionar los enemigos a los que te enfrentas, salvo en algunas misiones y en mazmorras, cumpliendo la regla de cuantos más enemigos, más looteo y exp. La variedad de personajes es amplia, teniendo cada uno sus habilidades únicas, por lo que tendrás que probar todos los personajes para conocer sus aptitudes y sus desventajas, con el fin de encontrar tu formación ideal, dentro de un combate que presenta variaciones de estado claves (curación, stun, sangrado, resistencias, protección, etc.) 
 ¿Y quiénes serán nuestros héroes en esta épica aventura? Contamos con 12 clases en el juego base (Paladín, Ladrón, Nigromante, Bárbaro, Caballero, Bardo, Druida, Guerrero, Clérigo, Mago, Cazador y Chamán) a los que se suma la Bruja del DLC Haunted Fall. Un DLC por cierto, que si bien se agradece que amplíe un rato más la aventura, puesto a que lo mejor sería que no acabara nunca, no supone un gran desafío para los niveles altos.  En este punto, tenemos que citar otro acierto del juego con la inclusión de Personajes (con maýusculas) bastante característicos, donde cada uno tendrá una pasiva única que afectará a las cualidades de los mismos, aunque no son muy definitivas ni útiles salvo algunos casos puntuales. 

En resumen, escogiendo tu personaje y tu clase tendrás listo tu épico héroe de lápiz y papel para enfrentarte al elenco de enemigos que presenta este videojuego. Un mundo de fantasía medieval que incluye todo lo que podríamos pedirle: desde dragones, caballeros negros, yetis, hechiceros, a los más típicos esqueletos, arpías o bandoleros, hasta monstruos deformes e incluso pixelados, completando un bestiario de un nivel excelente.  
Por último debemos hablar de aspectos de personalización de personajes y de los bonus que podemos obtener a través de distintas funcionalidades, desde la mejora de armas y armaduras en el herrero, la obtención de equipamiento en la tienda, objetos consumibles de mejora temporal, a la customización de tu sala de juegos, donde podrás cambiar hasta la mesa de rol y convertir al narrador en Yoda. Una pasada.

Aunque la verdad es que el juego resulta sencillo incluso en las batallas finales, al menos si has seguido con continuidad la soberbia historia a partir de las misiones y has farmeado a un ritmo decente, adquiere una gran rejugabilidad con la versión New Game +, que añade un plus de dificultad. Pero la gran pega de este juego es sin duda la duración. Y no es que sea precisamente corto, pues puedes gastar hasta 25 horas para completarlo, lo cual es una duración decentísima para el tipo de juego que es, sino porque en los preámbulos del final del juego un personaje de la historia te deja caer que tu aventura no ha hecho más que empezar, y que queda todo un mapa mucho más extenso por explorar. Pero esto no llega a cumplirse, y el juego finaliza en las misiones próximas, dejándote un sabor de boca agridulce. 
Jamás te lo perdonaremos, mago de la costa este.

Pros:

-	Épica historia
-	Humor negro, blanco y del que haga falta
-	Estética 8bits y música retro: ambientación perfecta
-	Calidad del contenido: bestiario, paisajes, personajes
-	Libertad de personalización

Contra:

-	Dificultad facilista
-	Cruel engaño con la duración
-	DLC no aprovechado

Nota: 8.5

review:
8.5/10 - An RPG focused on battles

This is an interesting twist to the RPG genre: Battles similar to an RPG maker, but with a little more freedom. There is no exploration, just a map view, battles and quests. You can dictate the number of enemies you face and build a team up to (5) players.You can choose from 12 different classes which I found Rogue to be the most helpful(out of the starting classes)

The game is ultra-focused on the combat but I still found it enjoyable but after about 4 hours of playing none stop you can get bored beware XD . I personally wouldn't pay full price for this game because its a bit short  but on sale it's worth the pick-up.Oh yeah almost forgot get the deluxe edition because it will be cheaper than buying the dlc separetly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999753191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1493535209}
review:
It's like Dungeons & Dragons, minus the need for friends. One time I was playing this and 5 hours ended up passing before I realized it when I thought I had only been playing for 2 hours. 15/18

But seriously though, it's like DnD, except you control everything that happens, from how many enemies you fight in each encounter (most of the time) to which quests you do to how many characters you have in your party at one time.

It's a pretty meta game, calling upon/calling out various things you'd normally find in a DnD campaign and other tropes relative to table top RPGs, but at the same time it's pretty genre savvy in and of itself, so if you're familiar with these kinds of games, you'll probably get a kick outta the dialogue.

There's also a sequel available too if you like this then be sure to check that one out as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154912826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1419936246}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper is a blast. I love turn-based RPGs and this game is an excellent one that has a solid mixture of gameplay, humor and replay value that took me by surprise. To start off with, if you enjoy turn-based RPGs then this is worth buying. Read on for a more in-depth review.

In Knights of Pen and Paper you play as some friends sitting around a table and playing a Dungeons and Dragons-like game. You pick out your party and set up their class before the game begins which I thought was pretty cool. Typically new characters are introduced throughout the game, so it's interesting that we get to create our own dream team to play with. That's not all. You'll still find more characters throughout your time in the game. They'll offer new classes to use which you can switch out whenever you're not in combat. I found the cast of Knight of Pen and Paper to be nothing less than diverse and clever.

The gameplay is pretty basic at far as turn-based RPGs go. Each party member and enemy will get a turn, and you're given a bar showing who's turn is when so you can plan out your turns accordingly. Leveling is a lot of fun as you get to unlock new abilities and see how each of these characters evolve. 

For me, the true appeal of Knights of Pen and Paper is its presentation. The story isn't groundbreaking--it's about as generic as any quest in Dungeons and Dragons could be. However, the characters themselves are entertaining as the story plays out. The developers did a great job of portraying all the party members as human beings who with personalities. Sometimes someone will question the logic of something absurd happening and is quickly told to shut up by the game master. I also remember one character being jubilant in defeating a boss and the text-based dialogue was perfect. Whenever I saw the speech bubbles appear I got a little excited.

Knights of Pen and Paper is a solid game. It's got a classic feel to the gameplay, it has amazing presentation and it doesn't take itself seriously in the least. Even if you've never played a turn-based RPG, this is a game that would be the perfect entry to the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085577000', 'num_games_owned': 800, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 4051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2634, 'last_played': 1707245574}
review:
Com excessão de uma raiva tremenda que passei com a Paradox que lançou uma atualização que me fez perder todo meu save antigo, não consigo enxergar pontos negativos que me façam NÃO recomendar esse excelente game!!! <3

Pen and Paper é um game que simula uma partida de RPG de tabuleiro (quem aqui já jogou?) feito por nerds para nerds e isto é provado pelo amor aos trocadilhos e as referências que você encontrará no jogo, algo que dá um charme muito especial a KOPP. Sonystas gostarão de visitar a Vila Journey em meio a um grande deserto “onde só tem areia”, assim como fãs de um certo seriado britânico poderão comprar uma TARDIS para a sua sala de jogo (ou encontrá-la em uma tempestade de areia, com um Stargate). Entre as outras opções de compra, estão o Confuser, um tapete colorido do Twister, a coroa do Burger King e alguns mestres, que são inspirados claramente no Mestre Splinter, no Mestre Yoda, no Mestre dos Magos e no Doc Brown (De Volta para o Futuro). O jogo é um show em referências e o poder delas chegam a mais de 8000 (huehuehaueah). =P

Tenho ele no Google Play, tenho ele na Steam e terei ele em todos os dispositivos em que for lançado!!! Louco pra poder comprar logo o KoPP 2... \o/

NOTA: 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198038126793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1450895585}
review: The game supposedly is a take on table top rpg, but takes all the fun out of it and fills the void with souless grinding. The mechanics are extremely simplistic and imbalanced (very little choice in levelling your characters, and the rogue will do most of the team damage while the paladin will show epic useleness). I don't think there is a scenario to criticize. And the humour "look, we put a reference to a game you know!" is not quite enough for me. Overall, prepare to be bored to death.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060897401', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1288, 'last_played': 1392751796}

Do you enjoy pixel styled graphics? Well the good news is this game has got you covered on most of those points. Go adventure and save some people and the world! All without leaving your house, or inviting people to your house to eat all your food, leave your toliet seat up, digust/impress you with their hygine or lack thereof, or interact with any people at all!

author: {'steamid': '76561198058506358', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1289, 'last_played': 1419197927}
review: Knights of Pen and Paper jest ciekawym tworem RPG o mocym zabarwieniu humorystycznym. Produkcja nawiązuje, czerpie garściami i co ciekawe symuluje papierowe gry fabularne, co wskazuje nawet sam tytuł. Do dyspozycji mamy szereg klas i postaci, z których każda oferuje nam inne umiejętności i sposób wykorzystania. Jednocześnie możemy posiadać pięć członków drużyny i to zależy od nas na kogo zdecydujemy się, więc warto chwilę pogłówkować i stworzyć coś unikalnego, co będzie się dopełniać i świetnie sprawdzać w walce. Możliwości jest sporo, a gra jest turowa. Przy okazji warto dodać, że ten nietypowy indyk oferuje nam odrobinę losowości, a tła, które zmieniają się podczas opowieści mistrza gry są staranne i klimatyczne. Polecam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046277238', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 3574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3574, 'last_played': 1593660324}
review:
[h3] 장점 [/h3]
@ 유쾌한 분위기. 패러디와 농담, 메타픽션으로 가득 찬 유쾌함. 
@ 알찬 컨텐츠. 단순하고 반복적이지만, 실속은 충실하다. 
@ 부담 없는 가벼움. 복잡하고 기교를 요구하는 게임이 넘쳐나는 요즘, 적당히 쉽고 누구나 즐길 수 있는 게임은 반갑게 느껴진다. 

TRPG 플레이어들을 조작하여 게임 마스터와 게임을 진행하는 컨셉.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055979291', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1541825500}
review:
Fun and unique. Very meta.

Now for the nitty-gritty: Some of the achievements are a touch buggy at times, as is the game. There also isn't much linear leveling sense to the quests. In example, the second town is the first major town you encounter. You are perhaps level 7-11 when you visit it, yet the first main quest it gives you immediately sends you to a level 17+ point on the map. That's one heck of a learning curve. 

Even though this game is rough around the edges in certain senses, it's still incredibly enjoyable. I look forward to playing the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084364869', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1273, 'last_played': 1453105351}
review:
İ enjoy the game but at the end of game its kindda i just want to end it. The game itself is funny but end game is just kinda boring i just want to end it quick and over with it. 
+ funny characters
+ nice atmosphere
- game itself is too simple
- travelling is suck at the end of game
- escord quests are suck its not depend on ur xp its depend on where u are escording so u always encounter lvl1-10 when u are lvl 30+
- combat is so simple not much of a tactic needed. ( its not mean u can win with anybody its just basic party mentality is more than enough ( tank- healer - dps) 
- item drop is kinda suck at lvl 45 monsters still drop lvl 1 useless items.

Well even though i criticized alot still love the game and idea so i m gonna buy KOPaP 2 and play it :) so buy it its really not a bad game and i laughed alot when playing the game. it s return me to back old memories when the collage time we played D&D alot:)

(sorry for bad english its not my main lang.)

review:
Eu vi vários canais no youtube dizendo que era um jogo brasileiro que era legal valia a pena...
comprei e joguei dinheiro fora! É injuntivo,curto, repetitivo,e diálogos infantis e piadas genéricas sobre coisas nerds e geeks, as referencias são boas mais isso não salva o jogo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198078701746', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 988, 'last_played': 1486504703}
review:
Se trata de un RPG de batalla con la curiosidad y la gracia de la simulación de unos chicos que juegan en una habitación a dichos juegos de Rol. Tiene sus toques cómicos como los comentarios de los personajes y los nombres de algunos lugares.

Además te otorga mucha diversión para lo poco que cuesta, y quieras o no tiene su dificultad.

Tiene gráficos penosos, pero más que suficientes para que puedas jugar y divertirte con este juegazo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046020011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1552029913}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037589643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1452975297}
review:
TRPG를 위주로 풀어 나가는 게임.

턴제게임에 대해 별로 좋아하지 않지만 하다보니 나도 모르게 계속 하고 있어서 놀랐다.

단점이 하나 있다면 오로지 마우스로만 진행해야 했다는 점이 아닐까 싶다... 단축키라도 있으면...

그러나 내용도 재밌고 조합에 따른 데미지와 스킬도 재밌는 것 같다.

노가다를 단점으로 볼 수 도있는 데 그러한 노가다 조차 저는 재밌다고 느꼈습니다.

시간때우기에는 충분한 게임!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010427390', 'num_games_owned': 720, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1490840892}
review:
Now here's a charming tidbit of experimental gaming. A player pretending to be players role playing a game. It could have gone so wrong, but the developers understand that brevity is the better part of expression, and choice representations of tranditional pen and paper role playing cement this as a must play for anyone curious enough to give this a second look.

It may take you that long to realize just what's happening, but once you do you'll probably be hooked ensuring your Grandma has her 17th level Paladin wearing fully upgraded equipment. The biggest drawback is the titles in game currency, which on iOS translates to real world microtransactions. Fortunately you can quest your way through earning all of the gold you'll need to pay for all of your upgrades.

This is an addictive game, and the pixel art style has its appeal, through does not appear to scale well to all resolutions. A minor gripe, as the gameplay is the most compelling aspect. You'll want to grind away so your players can have the leveling high. There's no doubt this is a niche experience, but one you'll no doubt remember. A little pricey solo, I'd suggest buying the bundle of both Knights of Pen and Paper I and its sequel in one package (available via either of the games Steam pages).

author: {'steamid': '76561198016365353', 'num_games_owned': 1032, 'num_reviews': 300, 'playtime_forever': 1019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1019, 'last_played': 1452223396}
review:
Una semplice idea, un titolo brillante che, secondo la mia opinione, non può mancare nella vostra libreria, in particolare se siete fan accaniti dei giochi di ruolo cartacei, D&D in primis. Cinque sedie, un Master, un d20: la sostanza di KOPAP è tutta qui, ossia nelle sedie in cui poter far sedere i 5 personaggi del vostro party, il Master fautore della storia che vi terrà impegnati per una decina di ore abbondanti, un dado simbolo di una generazione, nonostante nel gioco venga utilizzato automaticamente in sporadiche situazioni.
Siamo di fronte ad un RPG a turni, mascherato da sessione di D&D, ma senza la complessità di quest'ultimo, poiché non ci saranno schede da aggiornare e talenti da scegliere, bensì soltanto 4 abilità per classe in cui poter investire il punticino che ogni Level Up porterà in dote: ne consegue che anche il combattimento risulta essere veloce ed immediato, senza particolari tatticismi da applicare; ciononostante, bisognerà affrontare le sfide con coscienza o si rischierà di essere sopraffatti con estrema facilità.

Oltre alla sua immediatezza, e ai suoi rimandi nostalgici, KOPAP è irresistibile anche per un altro motivo: le citazioni. Sono ovunque, sono geniali e sono tantissime. Spaziano da classici della storia dei videogiochi, come Castlevania, a capisaldi della cultura Nerd, come Il Signore degli Anelli o Guerre Stellari. Senza dubbio sono un contorno, ma che si incastra talmente bene, nello spirito goliardico del gioco, da risultare fondamentali ai fini del godimento generale.

Cheers...fammi un Tiro Salvezza su Tempra, CD 25, per resistere sobrio all'ennesimo brindisi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027987915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1605839601}

author: {'steamid': '76561198102807918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1553146265}
review: A ratos se puede notar algo repetetivo porque llega el momento en que tienes que farmear para ser lo suficiente poderoso y completar un objetivo. Aun así, es un juego que vale mucho la pena y es bastante entretenido eintuitivo. Algo bueno o malo según como se le vea es que las misiones pueden ser interrumpidas en cualquier momento y si no te preparas lo suficiente, puede que termines con varios personajes muertos en un viaje solamente porque tuviste mala suerte y no pudiste evitar esas peleas ni escapar de las mismas. Para mi todo se resume en saber que subir de lv lo es todo y si algo es muy difícil es resultado de que posiblemente tu lv no es suficiente (así coincida con el lv sugerido por el juego).

author: {'steamid': '76561198086887033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1453147870}
review: I have a lot of great love for this game and everything it tries to accomplish.  The game replicates your table top D&D group coming together for a whacky game of quick references, and general jappery.  The game is very solid, and gave me some good laughs.  There aren't any negatives to this game.  Honestly, if the devs kept making the same type of game I would be perfectly happy with it.  It's a great game deserves a lot of love.  For a small price it's well worth trying if your looking for some casual fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001895300', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 847, 'last_played': 1451166405}
review:
A very well done little game where you take control of players (and to a lesser extend the GM) to go through a campaign slaying monsters, random villagers, and saving the world(s)!

A Bit grindy at times but I think that was just how I ended up playing. I believe it is possible to go through the game without doing a lot of grinding for levels.

The only downside to this game is you don't quite have has much control of the character stats as I'd like, and there aren't many skills to utilize. But this didn't detract from the experience in any way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082281127', 'num_games_owned': 625, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1678840764}

review: 一个问题是，为什么自从版本更新到云存档之后，就会莫名其妙删档？原本这就是个需要时间刷刷刷的游戏，这样删档让我很难过。然而这确实是一个好游戏，策略性十足，就是略显简单。

author: {'steamid': '76561198025393429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1457135314}
review:
I love this game so much! It is super cute, the story is fun and it really does remind me of my D&D days. You can do the storyline quests, create your own spars of varying difficulty based on the available mob pool from that area and do a lot of customization of skills and your play area for buffs and other perks. The only downside is that it does feel a little repetitive after a while. 

Don't make the same mistake I did and only venture out with 2 characters to start, you will need all 5 and leveling them up later is difficult. 
Overall this is a 10/10 game; so good I purchased the sequel! You won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063576425', 'num_games_owned': 994, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 2295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2155, 'last_played': 1443907800}
review:
[b]Knights of Pen and Paper[/b] une a essência do RPG de mesa com elementos clássicos de jogos desse gênero dos anos 90.

[h1]Pontos Positivos[/h1]
+ Seu gameplay é extremamente intuitivo e de fácil aprendizado, assim, facilitando a introdução de qualquer pessoa ao gênero.
+ História simples mas muito divertida.
+ Seu time é composto de 5 hérois, sendo possível escolher dentre diversas classes e personagens, o que permite uma grande variedade de estratégias.
+ Design das fases, inimigos e personagens excelentes dentro da sua proposta.
+ Knights of Pen and Paper por si só possui um enorme carisma da sua parte. São muitas as referências a cultura pop e a esteriótipos relacionados a ela, além de diálogos lotados de forte teor humorístico enriquecem potencialmente a experiência com o jogo.
+ Como trata-se de um empreendimento brasileiro, o jogo conta com uma tradução PT-BR de excelente qualidade.

[h1]Pontos Nevgativos[/h1]
- Pode se tornar um pouco repetitivo após um certo tempo de jogo, já que basicamente a única diferença de um local para outro são o cenário, os inimigos e a dificuldade.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997801929', 'num_games_owned': 2899, 'num_reviews': 405, 'playtime_forever': 1815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1815, 'last_played': 1450307022}
review:
[h1]Fun game, Pen And Paper is![/h1]

[b]Knights Of Pen And Paper +1[/b] is one of those games I wish I bought for my phone rather than my PC, because it has simplistic visuals and a touch-friendly interface.  That said, after playing it for so long on here, I really enjoyed it enough to consider getting the phone version as well.  It has a lot of replay value due to its insanely [i]grindy[/i] RPG features and its humor.

The game's content is often based on external references, including Half-Life and Steam, but the base concept of the game's plot and visuals is that you are a party of Dungeons And Dragons - or a similar table top RPG - players trying to enjoy a night of role-playing.  [spoiler]The plot starts to unravel into a quest to save both the pen and paper universe and the real world when a mage starts to cross into their dimension from the game.[/spoiler]  The overall plot is very humorous and filled with nice cameo appearances by both the game development team and a variety of real world influences.  My personal favorite cameo was [spoiler]Nabe Gewell (Gabe Newell) on Steam Island.[/spoiler]

Overall, the gameplay is like something out of RPG Maker but ultimately more streamlined and customized than that.  The battles are turn-based and involve up to five player characters and up to seven enemy characters.  The battle system also involves status effects, including stun, sleep, poison, bleed, weaken, strengthen, and other boosts.  Each character/class acts differently in battle, allowing for a lot of strategizing during tough battles.  Battles are fun but also sometimes tedious.  There is a major grind to this game that some people may not appreciate, but I enjoy having long-term content, even if it's just a grind of stats and a bunch of high-powered enemies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004423189', 'num_games_owned': 4447, 'num_reviews': 422, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1382392237}
review:
Игра с флеш-графикой и качеством Фейсбучной/телефонной фритуплейки (во-он там на скриншоте Tap to kill не зря написано!) Механика тоже фритуплейная: ждите триста лет до апгрейда... или заплатите немного реальных денег, ага.

Сама игра на редкость уныла: ты выбираешь трёх приключенцев (можно апгрейдить количество! Только заплати!), выбираешь энконтер (фиксированный из списка, но можно поднять сложность для лучшего лута и более крутых противников), затем походово вырубаешь их в JRPGшном стиле. Возвращаешься, экипируешь найденное крутое оборудование/продаёшь лишнее, закупаешься в магазине, апгрейдишься - и опять всё по-новой. Шесть параметров: сила атаки, процент критикалов, очерёдность хода, шанс атаки со стороны монстра, жизнь и мана - как бы намекают, что особого разнообразия ждать не стоит. Ну да, есть ещё заклинания. Три-четыре разных на мага, из стандартного джентльменского набора "убить/вылечить". И зелья с той же функциональностью. Крайне разнообразно.

Ах, ну да, ещё можно "мета-элементы" апгрейдить. Типа "цветы для гейммастера" или там "улучшенное сукно", которые слегка улучшают твои шансы в бою.

Это, в общем, всё. Платить за _это_ реальные деньги я сильно не рекомендую. (Мне-то самому она в инди-паке досталась). В конце концов, есть Card Hunter, где забесплатно есть и тактика, и разнообразный геймплей, а не этот однообразный симулятор JRPG-боя с паршивой графикой.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059719354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1206, 'last_played': 1572047093}
review: Primeiramente, mostro-lhes um fato: Nos dias de hoje, as pessoas que jogam RPG de mesa geralmente não conseguem marcar sessões com muita frequência (Isso acontece comigo também). Esse jogo passa a sensação de estar numa sessão de RPG de mesa e, mesmo que não haja liberdade do jogador para escolher os diálogos ou até mesmo as ações dos personagens em certos momentos do jogo (em várias quests isso acontece), a sensação é a de que você está com um grupo de amigos a desbravar um mundo medieval bem estilo Terra-média (do Senhor dos Anéis): há orcs, esqueletos malvados, serpentes malignas, magos brancos, magos malvados e etc.). Com isso, aparentemente o jogo é perfeito, mas não há AQUELA LIBERDADE de ação que existe no RPG DE MESA, mas o jogo consegue quase substituí-la. Minha nota para esse jogo é 9,99/10 pelo motivo de não ter a opção de jogar multiplayer. Obs: as quests secundárias são tão legais que as da campanha principal...

author: {'steamid': '76561198074219725', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1100, 'last_played': 1448748548}
review:
If you like turn-based RPG's and have fond memories of pen and paper roleplaying sessions with your friends: you're going to love this game. I'm not a big fan of the recent trend for retro pixel aesthetics, but this game suits that genre.

If this game had been released in the late 80's, it would have been one of those legendary classics. I think it's better than the original Final Fantasy games because it doesn't take itself seriously (it doesn't flood you with a convoluted story) and the difficulty curve is fair (it doesn't destroy you within minutes of starting).

author: {'steamid': '76561198009671381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 1112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1112, 'last_played': 1420780647}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023246857', 'num_games_owned': 1266, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1547, 'last_played': 1448313937}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper +1 wasn't really the game I was expecting to go through. I thought it was actually worse than it is, and I'm glad I ended up buying this title and playing through it's 9 hour-ish campaign. The basic premise is, you are a group of friends that are playing the much known fantasy tabletop role-playing game, and your adventures are depicted both through pixelated landscapes/characters and from what the D&D players are actually saying, or actually the dungeon master. Much like in the main idea from the movie Inception, you are playing a game in which the characters are playing a game. So, gameception?

KoP&P (Knights of Pen and Paper) is an RPG, and most features you expect from one are available in this title. Leveling up your characters, giving them new items, armor and weapons, upgrading your character's abilities, questing your way through until the very end, or until New Game +, in which your able to replay the whole game, with the same characters, but everything is harder. It didn't really attract me, since the main campaign features a bit of grinding and I didn't want to go through the same. It's useful for completing the achievements, though.

Soundtrack fits the theme of KoP&P, but can actually become boring after a few hours of gameplay. Another interesting feature is the abundance of references to tv shows, movies, etc. [spoiler]You eventually find a character named Nabe Gewell, which lives in Steam Island, which I found amusing.[/spoiler] The 4th wall is also broken lots of times.

[h1]In conclusion, do yourself a favor, and purchase KoP&P. It entertained me for a couple hours and I'm sure it will do the same for you. Alas, if you actually don't enjoy D&D's concept, steer in the way of another game.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198014406350', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1448184204}
review:
I played this game mostly in offline mode (I am over 1000 days)

Fun game until the end when all of a sudden you have to grind 30 levels for the final boss. I beat every quest up until the boss, my characters are level 40 with maxed equipment. The boss one shots 3/5 of my party and then kills the other 2 on the next turn. The game was a decent rpg up until this point and sadly this ruined the whole experience for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037926699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1447992978}

author: {'steamid': '76561198169169842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1443481312}
review:
It's a charming concept that loses its charm fairly quickly. The humor gets old, and the combat system gets boring and repetitive. The story is pretty bland and its execution is poor, drowned in the midst of required jobber battles that the game throws at you in a mockery of typical poor DMing style. It's got the American Nightmare problem in which it acknowledges why what it's parodying is lame, but doesn't actually do anything to fix it. Something that's ironically bad is still, unfortunately, bad.

In all, it feels like a quirky, above-average quickie mobile game that sells itself as an engaging RPG.

If you like that sort of thing, then get it when it's on sale. It's not worth $10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054134004', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1447206928}
review:
[h1] O que falar desse pequeno ( porém imenso) jogo?![/h1]

De início devo falar que fiquei deveras surpreso com a qualidade do mesmo logo de cara, não pertenço ao grupo de gamers que são fanáticos por games Retro Style, mas, esse jogo feito por uma [b] EMPRESA 100% brasileira	[/b] merece destaque no dispositivo do Steam.
O jogo tem suas pequenas falhas, não que você vá ficar "P" da vida ao percebe-las, mas algumas não tem como passar despercebidas, a exemplo da trilha sonora; a mesma é excelente, porém, savo engano, o jogo tem no maximo 5 músicas que irão se repetir até o fina do mesmo, fazendo assim com que a experiencia chege a ser massante a ponto de você precisar dar um intervalo de 10 a 40 minutos para dar continuidade à partida.

No mais, não tenho nada mais a recamar de um game que me permite encontrar o [spoiler] Gaben GOD e ajuda-o a savar o mundo [/spoiler], entre outras coisas e  claro, com muitas piadas pontuais que somente Nerds de carteirinha que jogaram RPG e afins  irão entender e se deliciar rindo sozinhos ao jogar.

Comprei o jogo no Google play e comprei novamente aqui, é um MUST HAVE se você curte RPG padrão D&D

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198071845922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1477157989}

author: {'steamid': '76561198036851146', 'num_games_owned': 1734, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1089, 'last_played': 1523287828}
review:
[b]Good game to kill some time with a funny simple game.[/b]

This is no generic roleplay game or just some retold Pen & Paper story. You gather a group of every-mans around a table to slip into characters that contest in the weird world your gamemaster has set for them.

You'll meet a lot of interesting characters with amazing dialogues to it, travel strange lands and do quests, while your party gives direct feedback to their gamemaster if the do like it or think it's just some everyday shit anyone could come up with and he should think about some more impressive shit like DRAGONS or such.

Well, the dragons killed the game for me. I was on level 37 grinding some dungeons to train for the last stage of of the main quest which was labelled to be for characters of at least level 40. Out of a sudden a dragon appeared in the middle of a mid level dungeon, wiped my party and I dropped the game for some days. After a PC re-setup I unfortunately lost my save stat due to no steam cloud support and completely dropped this amazing game.

[i]If you like some weird-ass story in a beautiful 8bit RPG world, get this game and don't stop where I failed.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198135840511', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1542091748}
review:
Sério?! Cadê meus saves?! Eu não posso recomendar um game que tem um BUG tão F***** quanto esse jogo tem. A jogabilidade é ótima, o jogo é prazeroso.
Mas só foi passar uns dias sem jogar, ele atualiza, ai eu abro ele pra jogar esses dias e... PQP, SUMIU TUDO!
Eu tinha dois jogos salvos, não tinha razão pra isso sumir, ninguém deletou pasta nem nada. Fiquei put0 com isso!
Não da clima falar bem do jogo, só que no primeiros dias de jogatina estava entre os meus favoritos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977597227', 'num_games_owned': 1416, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 2018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2018, 'last_played': 1416511454}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020487283', 'num_games_owned': 5944, 'num_reviews': 1142, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1458617448}
review:
骑士经理
[spoiler]一个安卓手机上移植的手机游戏【[/spoiler]多谢好友指正，貌似是PC首发，因为最早接触的版本是手机版，有些混淆，现改正下
这游戏你需要大量的时间，大量的点击，而游戏的进度却比较缓慢
所以在点点点中可能会有些乏味
游戏中的战斗可以选择敌人的数量，休闲玩家一个怪点点点基本无伤过，喜欢挑战的话多设置几个敌人，收益会高很多，而且比较有挑战性，但是注意自己的技能使用就好了
另外游戏暂时没有正版可用的汉化
剧情有些恶搞成分，跟随任务刷刷刷
地牢，物品种类繁多，喜欢刷刷刷可以体验一下这个游戏

顺便吐槽一句：游戏的背景音乐简直让我删游戏

author: {'steamid': '76561198007233194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 1801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1615402784}
review:
Fresh, intuitive, well designed and greatly inspired.
Unlockable classes, towns, plenty of quests to do.

Some slow or repetitive gameplay make the game feeling a bit "long", or rather too simple.
Still a good game for children or adults looking for some casual styled party adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027999803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 2215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2215, 'last_played': 1446680921}
review:
More of a mixed review here. They really should put a middle option between Thumbs up/down.

I really enjoyed the game. I really easy to feel like in a real AD&D session. Very nice humor too.
Lots of party possiblities and choices of bonuses using the table customization option (after you bought them with gold, off course. It may take a while to grind but it is permanent across games).

I have to say though that the UI doe not make sense (esc quit to menu and the real options screen including save and quit is instead acessible by a button in the location area actions). If you happen to try to bring this menu on a dungeon by pressing esc... surprise! You will be restarting it.
There are also minor bugs as NPCs sometimes taking the wrong amount of items from inventory after a quest handover or when backtracking a dungeon to previous floors, getting stuck on specific locations (having to restart) or a few already visited location turn unvisited by magic.

Oh, no steam cloud either.

[b] [u] Also, for those who got the game before the expansion and bought the expansion when it came out, the is no option to acquire the bonus content of the deluxier edition other than buying the whole thing again. Unaceptable. [/u] [/b]

So, despite being on thumbs up/down borderline, last reason puts the weight to down untill they solve it, as rendering the player unable to get additional content (unless buying the whole package again) is simply too lame.

review:
Point positif:
+L'humour présent dans le jeu me fais rire
+Gameplay très amusant et facile d'utilisation
Point négatif:
-Jeu répétitif
-''L'histoire'' n'est pas ultra intéressant comme le ferais d'autre RPG ou JRPG
-Durée de jeu court pour la quête principale.
-le prix est un peu cher payer...
note:6/10
Knights of pen and paper +1 reste un jeu amusant mais attendez vous pas a un grand jeu ou a jouer plusieur fois.
Je recommande toute même ce jeu pour les personnes voulant débuter ou voir comment un JRPG se déroule de manière très basique.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077408019', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 2730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2033, 'last_played': 1451333022}
review:
É definitivamente um dos melhores jogos que tenho.

Uma surpresa atrás da outra. Cada uma delas mais engraçada que a anterior.

Acerca da jogabilidade é um jrpg à moda antiga, isto é: pixels e menus. Mas o melhor dele é a comédia pela qual o enredo vai se inveredando.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037003719', 'num_games_owned': 4039, 'num_reviews': 385, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1446289494}
review:
《Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition》是款玩法模仿經典桌上遊戲《龍與地下城》的回合制戰鬥角色扮演遊戲，對此作品的第一印象就是畫面整體表現有濃厚的像素復古風，跟《龍與地下城》桌遊最大的不同之處就是本作的戰鬥方式較近似於JRPG，將人物數值的行動力作為基準計算出敵我雙方的行動順序，而非全靠投擲二十面骰來決定回合的順序。不過本作仍然保留部分《龍與地下城》桌遊設定，當玩家帶領隊伍進行旅行時，系統會投擲二十面骰決定旅途中是否會遭遇怪物，除此之外玩家也會在強化裝備、睡眠休息、探索地城時，遭受到同樣狀況，舉例來說，假如一件裝備必須擲出十點以上數值才能順利強化，當你擲出十點以下數值就會導致裝備強化失敗，強化失敗後手續費並不會歸還。


玩家可以在遊戲初期創建三名角色遊玩（可以透過在商店購買道具來解鎖五名角色），我們必須選擇角色與其相對應的職業，從六種預設職業（戰士、聖騎士、巫師、盜賊、牧師、德魯伊）中選出適合的人選扮演它們，特別要注意的是不同的人物有不同的天賦技能，例如某一名角色可以在回合開始時自動回復血量，這種生存能力強的角色最適合扮演戰士或聖騎士這類吸收傷害的坦克，特定人物和特定職業搭配會在遊戲前中期玩起來較為輕鬆。不過到了後期所有人物等級相當時，不能透過技能點數升級的天賦技能就顯得十分雞肋，就像是筆者隊伍中的聖騎士，其角色天賦是額外取得百分之十經驗值，雖然在平時衝等速度是全隊最快，但是到了遊戲後期這項無法提升戰力的天賦根本毫無用處。


創建角色完成後遊戲就正式開始，玩家可以隨心所欲選擇要農怪衝等或是完成任務，一般來說用星號標註的任務都是屬於主線任務，沒有特別標註的任務則是支線任務，同一時間只能接受一項任務，如果途中放棄或是失敗，都要將流程從頭來過一次。完成任務系統會給予經驗值獎勵與金幣獎勵，其中經驗值最主要的功能就是用來提升職業等級，每種職業都支援四招技能，筆者建議最好是看過技能敘述了解效果再進行升級，不然有些技能的成效不彰（戰士的劈斬打怪跟抓癢一樣），反而會造成戰力不足的副作用。


金幣可以用來強化裝備（將磨刀石給予城鎮的鐵匠鋪能夠提升成功機率）、購買道具（道具可以分為補給品和飾品）、復活同伴（死去的同伴會依照等級多寡而有不同的金幣需求）以及解鎖家具，其中最具特色的就是家具裝潢系統，除了能夠放在桌上給予玩家限時輔助效果的零食飲料以外，可供更換的家具還有桌子、關主、門、地毯、寵物、牆、櫥櫃，每種家具物品都有各自不同的增益能力，擺放在場上就會讓玩家獲得額外數值加成，不過這些家具的售價都不便宜，沒有準備大把鈔票可是無法買到效果優良的高級家具喔！


整體來說《Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition》是款設計精良、玩法簡單、極富創意與中毒性強的角色扮演遊戲，本作玩法自由度高，系統不會強迫玩家透過固定流程完成遊戲，你可以無視所有支線任務，單靠戰鬥或是買賣物品來賺取經驗值與金錢，你也可以旅行到各地區接洽任務完成委託，然後繼續前往新的地區完成其他任務。少少幾百MB容量的作品有著二十小時以上的遊玩總時數，再一次證明了短小精幹、小巧精美、五臟俱全的獨立小品還是有3A大作無法觸及的優點，就是能使玩家抱持輕鬆心情享受周末假期。


優點：
+再一回合就好，再完成一個任務就好，歡迎來到精神時光屋。
+除非是進入困難模式，不然照著任務走通常不會卡關。
+如果喜愛復古像素風，那麼你一定也會愛上這款遊戲。


缺點：
-有些時候需要刷怪衝等農錢，重複不斷刷怪的作業感頗重。
-可能是因為手機版支援小額付費功能，導致電腦版的金幣資源嚴重缺乏。


結論：玩起來輕鬆逗趣的角色扮演遊戲，適合用來打發周末假期的閒暇時光。


網誌圖文好讀版：
http://mgrim214.blogspot.tw/2015/10/knights-of-pen-and-paper-1-edition.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198025088925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2255, 'last_played': 1448489749}
review:
I quite liked Knights of Pen and Paper+1. I liked the classes, the gameplay. However In the latest patch the developers accidentally deleted all the saved games. Accidents can happen, and they promised us a "Master Save" that "should appeal to all users that had their save deleted"

The Master Save however is somewhat of a joke. No XP potions, Character/class choices that are dubious at best, a rediculously low amount of gold and not nerely enough unlocks. What they really should have given us was a lot of Gold, XP potions and grindstones so we could remake our party as we had before.

The first was an honest mistake, the latter was simply insulting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028330193', 'num_games_owned': 766, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1445162525}
review:
Maybe this game works well on a cellphone but to sit down and deliberately play it on a PC is laughable. The gameplay is so incredibly shallow you can win practically every encounter by closing your eyes and clicking your mouse unless you try to stack the odds against yourself (which you will since every fight is so simple) and even then your rampant clicking will only be broken up to cast a healing spell now and then. There just isn't anything to it. You can pick multiple classes for your heroes but besides the 4 different abilities they all feel like they play the same. 

I couldn't even explain what was going on with the gold system. Everything at the store costs 1-5 coins and monsters drop a few coins here and there...but I started with like 5000 gold for some reason. I’m not entirely sure but I feel like the game tried to balance out the absence of micro-transactions of its mobile game counterpart by dumping all the gold in the world in my pocket and calling it square.

If this game has anything going for it, it’s the sprite work which is very pretty and the music is pleasant but everything is massively let down by how unstimulating the game feels. It's not a BAD game but its a pretty BLAH game

author: {'steamid': '76561198061585016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1117, 'last_played': 1445677162}
review:
Soul-crushingly repetitive.

It started out well and for some time, I actually enjoyed the game. I eagerly awaited the final battle, hoping to get the "finish campaign within 365 days" achievement. So, there I was, facing the final boss battle and (at the second attempt) gloriously winning it -- only to find out, that, ooops, that was not the [i]final[/i] battle yet because that cowardly bastard of a final boss (name redacted to avoid spoilers) had the guts (or lack thereof) to rather run away than die. Oh well, guess it's just a few more quests until I find that fool again and finish him for good.

Three hours later: Here I am, weapons sharpened and ready to let him meet his fate. Which he does. Except, the campaign is not over, because he was not the real [i]final[/i] boss. Alright, a few more quests -- we are having day 500 by now -- and [b]then[/b] the campaign must be over any time soon, because there's that achievement that says it is doable in 365 days and I haven't done any side quests.

Another five hours later: I fought my way through hordes of enemies who somehow start looking all the same to me. It's the same old drill, every single fight: Power up the paladin's shield, let the druid send a few to sleep, let the cleric and warrior weaken the rest, and let the mage finish them off with meteroids. ("Rocks fall, everyone dies!") I'm starting to consider writing a bot for clicking these same old buttons over and over again. I start detesting the painfully slow animation of travelling between locations which I am sure is only so slow because in an earlier version of the game there must have been an in-game-payment option to make it faster. But oh well, here we go: That's the [i]ultimate[/i] final [i]final[/i] battle, and then the campaign is finished.

Alas, it isn't. Because there's just this one more final enemy, who is level 70 and I'm level 50, and I've done all side quests by now, so now all that's left to do is grinding by fighting even more of the same repetitive battles over and over again and again and again and again until I'm ready to face that final(?) boss.

That's the point at which I decided to give up and go to sleep, so I don't know if [i]that[/i] at least would have been the final battle.

Three weeks later I returned to the game to continue -- only to find my save game deleted by a malfunctioning patch (see [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/231740/discussions/0/483367798517064514/]forum[/url]). That's the final straw for me -- I'm uninstalling this and will not come back.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985546819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1445606031}
review:
Le concept de départ est excellent : on incarne un petit groupe de joueurs qui se retrouvent autour d'une table pour se lancer dans un jeu de rôle papier.

La partie commence bien, les références geeks sont légions, l'univers du jeu et son humour paraissent sympathiques. Les graphismes pixel art peuvent paraître grossiers mais on saura rester indulgent quand on sait qu'il s'agit ici d'un portage mobile > pc.

Alors pourquoi un avis négatif ? Tout simplement parce que ce jeu n'est pas fait pour moi et je vais vous expliquer pourquoi. 

Le système de combat qui nous est présenté dès le départ est plutôt basique. J'aurais pu m'en contenter si les ennemis et les différents challenges évoluaient un peu. Le problème c'est qu'à la 2ème heure de jeu vous avez déjà vu tout ce que  KoPP a à vous proposer. Vous continuez donc le jeu en le sachant fermement puis vous commencez à noter de gros déséquilibres entre les classes dès l'apparition de la forge. Pourquoi l'assassin qui est la classe qui possède les plus gros dégâts possède également le plus gros sort utilitaire (commotion) ? Rajoutez à ça qu'il draine le mana en %, et vous avez une machine à stun/DPS qu'aucune classe de départ ne peut égaler et qui est tout le temps full mana... Du coup, passées les deux premières phases de forge (5h de jeu à peu près), TOUS vos combats ressembleront à ça : votre assassin, qui attaque 90% du temps en premier, perma stun une cible (il n'y a aucun jet de résistance de la part de votre ennemi, il sera assomé avec certitude), votre tank lance son taunt, votre healer débuff les ennemis et soigne 1 tour sur 2, et les autres font office de décoration. Oui car si vous avez pris un guerrier par exemple, il collera max des 80 de dégat en se défoncant la barre de mana quand votre assassin lachera des 250, en assomant et en récupérant 3-4 fois le coût du sort lancé. Répétez ça ad nauseam...

Alors au début du jeu, les combats bien que simples, peuvent présenter un aspect stratégique (léger hein) : vous devez quand même gérer votre mana, car plus vous vous reposez pour le récupérer, plus les chances de tomber sur des ennemis durant cette phase de repos augmente. Ok. Sauf que cet aspect disparait totalement par la suite, puisqu'à la fin de chaque combat non seulement tous vos personnages seront full vie mais ils seront également full mana. La faute à un système de compétence/coût mana/régénération mana foireux.

Ajoutez à tout ça la fin 10 fois plus répétitive que tout ce que je viens de dire. Vous affrontez des ennemis lvl 45 alors que vous êtes lvl 32 sans aucune difficulté en répétant encore et toujours la même stratégie débile. Le seul problème, c'est qu'ils ont 4 milliards de points de vie et que les devs se sont dits qu'il serait plus sympathique, pour nous remercier de notre patience, de toujours nous foutre les même ennemis (référence à monty python d'ailleurs). Puis là, comme dernier "fuck you for buying", on nous fout soudainement un donjon lvl 65. J'y suis allé pour tester. Mon équipe s'est fait oneshoter dès le premier combat. Première et dernière fois que je perdais un combat dans ce jeu. Aucune envie d'aller grinder de lvl 32 à 60 pour pouvoir terminer ce petit jeu qui m'a déjà bien saoulé.

Bref, cet avis n'engage que moi puisqu'il semble adulé par une vaste majorité. Mais, sérieusement, l'équilibrage est foireux et la fin totalement bâclée. D'ailleurs pour les francophones, sachez que si vous avez choisi la langue française dans les options (traduction très moyenne, fautes de frappe et d'orthographe nombreuses), toute la dernière partie du jeu sera en italien. Marrant non ? Allez, un dernier petit détail rigolo pour finir : si votre inventaire est plein et que vous dropez un item, ce dernier est supprimé. Miam miam ! Eh oui, portage mobile donc le minimum syndical en matière d'interface ! Oubliez également les clics droits pour avoir des infos sur les ennemis ou autres : y en a pas !

Un petit jeu qui ne vaut clairement pas les 10 euros demandés si vous n'êtes pas tenté par du grind soporifique. A essayer en solde à -75% à la rigueur.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031354605', 'num_games_owned': 819, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1471, 'last_played': 1445591838}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper is a turn based RPG game that's pretty simple. Each character has four skills, you unlock more characters as you go, and you can pick a party of five and buy upgrades and stuff.

The humor in it is pretty cheesey, so can be enjoyable if you like that sort of thing.

Achievements are all very obtainable, although they will take you two playthroughs to get them all.

First playthrough took me about 14 hours to beat everything, will probably take 8-10 if you dont. Overall spent 24 hours total to 100% the game and get every achievement. Was fun doing so. Expect to get 10 hours from this game without 100%, 20 hours with 100%

{'steamid': '76561198114887124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 999, 'last_played': 1445314478}
review:
FIRST OF ALL: the last update deleted my savegame file, so I would recommend to everyone: make backups of your saves, because the updates can reset them. Or turn off the updates for this game only.

This game is fun, has a nice gameplay, unlockable cool characters, lot of achievements, and you need work with your team and use the most useful tables, decorations for you. I was on the end of the game almost, but the update just deleted my save files, so I've got one from the forum, which almost the same like mine was. There are a lot of main and sidequests, you need to upgrade the blacksmith to increase your armor and weapon stats, you can use accessories to get bonuses on your characters and you can switch to another ones and create new ones anytime within the game.

About the serial number, you'll get: You can redeem it on the official Paradox forum, and CAN'T use it in-game as a promo code.

The only wrong thing about this game is the update system, but the game itself is really fun and enjoyable. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198010748161', 'num_games_owned': 290, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1044, 'last_played': 1443879006}
review:
This game is just absolutely fantastic! 20/D20

I've been wanting to get involved in D&D for AGES but I just can't seem to a) Find any friends who want too b) Find any groups in my area that run a weekly or something.. A little sad.. But oh well I'll keep looking. In the meantime - This game fills that space perfectly! It's got quick wit, great humor, reflections on a vast array of older games; most of which I had a really nice time remembering thanks to this beauty!

The gameplay is fairly quick and gets you into it without boring you in any way. A nice range of different classes, each one seperating it from the last meaning you can mix and match your 5-man squad quite a bit to your preferences!

Difficulty can be .. Sort off.. Scaled. By choosing more enemies it makes it more difficult. I personally don't class this as 'difficulty' as such, and you can cheat the system by setting the enemies closer or further apart to suit your teams attack.. Though, even with 7 enemies sometimes it can be 'easy'.. This is a slight downside, but still isn't much of one and you won't be choosing 7 enemies to fight until you become stronger anyway, as it is generally too much (when matched against similar levels that is).

But generally speaking this is a great game with tons of great moments!! If you're a fan of RPG's and D&D in general, you'll love this (I think..)!! :D

Plus the new ones out soon!! Can't wait!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011571564', 'num_games_owned': 597, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1485864871}

author: {'steamid': '76561198019465760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1621, 'last_played': 1508377963}
review:
This is a fun and funny rpg that is loaded with parodies and references. I have only played the game for a couple of days, but loss of save files seems to be a persistent problem. An update definitely cause a loss of save, but my save file was again lost several hours later. The story and progress of the game are consequential enough that a save loss is significant. This game is not worth playing with a broken save system.

EDIT: After making an account with Paradox Interactive, cloud saving does work. If you do not want to have to make an account, don't buy it. It is a game worth playing, but without a local save or even a Steam cloud save, I would say that the save system is poorly implemented.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111811696', 'num_games_owned': 1567, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1485071450}
review:
Я бы вполне мола порекомендовать эту игру, но - на мобильной платформе. Во всяком случае если она на мобильной платформе такая же, то это должно хорошо подходить ситуациям игры на планшете.

Интерфейс явно заточен под тач: приходится постоянно тыкать мышкой в одни и те же, но находящиеся далеко друг от друга места экрана; горячих клавиш нет; подсказок при наведении курсора на элементы экрана тоже нет даже тогда, когда они пригодились бы - например, когда нужно выбрать навык из списка иконок, детали которых помнишь нестрого. Кроме того, игра неаккуратно обращается с пикселями. Она должна имитировать графику старых приставок, что не так-то просто, когда требуется масштабировать пиксели на произвольные разрешения экрана - но у этой игры между "виртуальными пикселями" встречаются заметные тонкие промежутки шириной в обычный экранный пиксель. Разнобой масштабирования заметен и в тексте, и в движениях монстров. Эта непропорциональность здорово мешает наслаждаться графикой игры. Чтобы предотвратить это, следует играть только на разрешениях, кратных "исходному" разрешению игры.

Но главный недостаток - это монотонность. Квесты делятся на простые формулы в духе "убить", "довести", "собрать", что в конечном счёте сводится к сражениям. С одной стороны, в обычных РПГ для выполнения квестов обычно нужно убить гораздо больше монстров, но в них это происходит при изучении подземелья, движении по местности или с сюжетными вставками. Здесь же - это просто совершить Х одинаковых битв подряд, и это Х может быть 10-15. Битвы могут быть и не одинакоывми, но состав определяет игрок, так что спасение утопающих - дело рук самих утопающих. Интереснее всего квесты, где на тебя нападают неожиданно, особенно если между нападениями даётся сюжетная вставка. Но соотношение монотонности и кривой обучения, на мой взгляд, неблагоприятное для компьютерной игры и гораздо больше подходит для убивания времени в транспорте, очередях и так далее.

Хотя если вы играете в стимовские игры на планшете с Win8, то игра достойная.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971500794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1273, 'last_played': 1445259409}
review:
I enjoyed it, the humor might not be for everyone but its a classic rpg fantasy dungeonish adventure game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055836208', 'num_games_owned': 1301, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1444516408}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition hat sehr viel Spaß für zwischendurch gebracht . Mein einzigstes k.o. Kriterium bei diesem Spiel ist :
KEINE Steam Cloud-Spielzeitspeicherung.
dies ist mir erst aufgefallen als ich mein Pc neu aufgesetzt habe und das Spiel installiert habe und nicht mehr weiter spielen konnte . Da ich relativ Weit war hat mich dies schon sehr geärgert und seit dem nicht mehr weiter gespielt.
Alles andere hat durch das minimalistisch aufgebaute Spiel ( in allen bemerkbaren Elementen [Sound, Kampf, Charaktereinstellungen]) mir sehr gut gefallen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044568272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 803, 'last_played': 1504538309}
review:
Ótimo jogo, recomendadíssimo!

-Visualmente, o jogo traz o apelo da década de 90, não apenas pelo gráfico pixelado, mas também pela disposição de menus e animações.
-O som chiptune também auxilia nesse quesito, tanto pela música quanto pelos efeitos sonoros, lembrando a época em que jogos de 8 e 16 bits dominavam o mercado.
-As referências são o grande plus do jogo. Não apenas referências inerentes à cultura "nerd" (porém não exclusivas à ela) mas também referências folclóricas brasileiras (Behold Studios é um empresa brasileira).
-O Gameplay, fluente, torna o jogo mais leve, e mesmo a brincadeira sobre uma metagame traz algo novo ao gênero. O apelo aos jogadores de RPG de mesa se vê mais como uma referência de um hábito não tão comum hoje em dia, e isso somado ao saudosismo do jogo da década de 90 deixa claro que ele é uma Ode à cultura da época, não apenas a gamer, mas também da infância da época (com a referência do desenho Caverna do Dragão, por exemplo).

-O jogo é recomendado, mesmo pras novas gerações, mas é claro que ele foi feito por desenvolvedores que vivenciaram aquela época para pessoas que compartilham as mesmas experiências e lembranças, sem que isso seja um ponto negativo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997305428', 'num_games_owned': 1778, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1445007167}
review:
Хороший порт хорошей игры с мобильников :)
Веселые диалоги, довольно интересные классы :) в общем для порта с мобильника не хватает разве что управления клавиатурой, а так - все замечательно :)
В общем - с удовольствием прошел на телефоне года 2-3 назад, с таким же удовольствием прошел на компе :)
PS любителям набить 100% ачивок - хоть тут это и делается довольно легко, но некоторые ачивки багованные - например на достижение одним персонажем 30 лвла (я получил, когда вся команда уже была где-то 36). Ачивки на "поиграть всеми персами и классами" - пришлось получать на чужом компе, где они не глючили

author: {'steamid': '76561198219988685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1497216811}
review: I enjoy this game partly because of its simplicity; there's not a whole lot of skill involved and you can unwind for 15-20 minutes. While I enjoy it, I dislike that you can only have one of each class without deleting one of your characters or starting a new save, but that doesn't cheapen the game any for me. It's got humour, there are nods to various cult favourites within television and gaming, and it's an overall satisfying time while playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020366002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 3087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3004, 'last_played': 1446052087}
review:
This is a GREAT game! But thats only my opinion and because it was what I was looking for at this time in a game. Its funny. Its simpull. You can put it down and come back to it and not worry about forgetting anything or what to do. Its not graphics hungry so it can play on any michine. Its retro and brings back alot of memories for me of actually playing the game of pen and paper D&D. The humor is funny. And its cheap. Worth every cent.
  Like my positive review all the negitive ones are only opinions of people who didn't look into what this game really was. Read them. there is nothing wrong with this game. Its got a great developer. And is already making a second game.
  The only thing I would ask of the developer would be more dlc. That and a way to create your own caractor and even give the origianl caractors new names.

EDIT! 

As of this time I can not recommed this game. After playing 30 hrs and rasing my characters to lvl 35+ an automatic update was applied and my saved game was wiped out! So far there has been no response from the company. I'm not sure I want to sink that kind of time back into this game. I guess it will all depend on how the company handles it and all of the upset players.  If they do well I will once again change my review back to positive.

EDIT 2 !

Company tried to fix problem with a Master Save. It was a very poor fix. As of right now I will not be playing this game any more or buying the new game. I will keep an eye on the forms to see if they lisen and try again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009079522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1439521169}
review:
With a name light "Knights of Pen and Paper" and with a UI designed around the table top, I expected to have fun with this game. 
That was not the case.

One of the big problems with this game right off the bat is that each character has only 5 things they can do. Each of them can attack and then each class has 4 upgradable abilities, but some of them are passive. The problem here is that with a small margin of exception, there's no strategy to the fights. You either hit attack or you use abilities until you run out of mana.
The problem with the skills themselves is that the level scaling is frankly horrendous, so if you don't focus on one of the 4 skills, you'll quickly reach a point where you can't play the game anymore because you'll just get trounced during every encounter. This means that you really need 4 characters for each class by the end of the game because if you have a level 20 fire mage and you're up against fire resistant creatures, then you're probably going to get your party killed. 

Another problem I have is the grinding. For a game that's supposed to be just a short cute DnD knockoff, there is an obscene amount of grinding. Example: "Collect 20 green apples". Well, green apples only drop from venus fly traps that take off half your health per attack and killing one isn't a guarantee that they will drop. So to get 20 green apples, you'll probably end up playing 12 encoutners against 3 venus fly traps. And that's just the beggining. 
The upgrade system is also based on grinding. You need to visit special areas where upgrades can be found (usually caves) then you need to roll a 20 sided dice and hope you get lucky just for the chance of getting an upgrade item. Once you have about 5-10 upgrade items (for your first upgrade) you then take it to a blacksmith who gives you a %chance that your item will be upgraded or he'll just waste your upgrade items. You can upgrade the blacksmith himself so that you're more likely to succeed, but that requires double or even triple the number of upgrade items you already needed, so now you need go to back to grinding in the caves. Plus, each character has 2 items (clothes and weapon) and when you remember that you need multiples of each class, you understand that you'll need hundreds and hundreds of grindstones just for a chance of upgrading your party. You'd think you could just ignore the upgrading, but because the level scaling is so unbalanced, you have to upgrade to proceed. 

Its just an awful time waster with no sense of progression and I'm glad I bought it on sale because this is literally a ported mobile game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069008452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 4663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4629, 'last_played': 1698239749}
review:
Афигенная игра с афигенской атмосферой старых ролевых игр, где все решается броском кубика. Смотрели сериал "Теория большоого взрыва"? Помните, как те нерды играли в нее? Вот тут все тоже самое, только еще с красивой пиксельной графикой и не плохой музыкой. Сам я такое время (увы) не застал, а сейчас мало кто в такое хочет играть, потому нахожу себя в этой игре. Куча юмора, вещей, классов, перков, квестов, открытый мир и т.д. Первая игра, в которую я играл со словарем, ибо было очень интересно. Сейчас же в руководствах нашел перевод от команды ZOG. 

Со скидкой стоит всего 39р - рекомендую брать! К тому же через 6 дней выйдет ее вторая часть, которую я с нетерпением жду уже как почти полгода. 
Всем ролевикам и любителям этого жанра - маст хэв!
Оценка 10 из 10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198220311863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1524611749}
review:
This game easily could have been a free-to-play-game, but once you start playing, you realize that it IS a game you can play without restrictions. The idea of a table in the middle of the screen sounded weird, but you actually don't notice it in mid-battle. This is an awesome game.
    It's simple enough to just pick up and play, but you can still work out a winning strategy. Think of it like Pokemon. You can kinda ignore the stats and get through the game, but you can also maximize your team's potential by equiping certain items. So if you don't want to think about it, you can make it through, but if you do the math, you can do better. It's. Just. Awesome. You can go pretty much anywhere right from the start, but you'll probably die if you do. But that's still an option.
    I recommend reading a guide before playing, as there is some terms you probably won't understand, but it's smooth sailing from there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057664952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1381470401}
review: The idea of playing as a team of frp players sound good at first,but this game fails to satisfy your expectations.You can arrange a team by choosing from a good number of classes,but each class only has 2 (might even be 1,can't remember well) skills which is a really low number I think. Also,these skills are plain boring skills like heal this much hp,deal this much damage etc. If you ever played frp,you know there are so many stats,skills and mechanics that effect the gameplay in some way. In this game you are supposedly playing as a frp team who is playing frp,but none of the frp stuff is in there. You can change the table you are playing frp on,order some food to the room you are playing frp in,but it's not frp you are playing. It's just a shallow,boring,repetative grind fest without any real story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995225947', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 2993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2813, 'last_played': 1450052279}
review:
Pretty brilliant. It's a turn based RPG, but it's not hard for noobies.
You can balance it yourself by starting with more or less characters. I would strongly recommend starting with 5 players because the endgame is very hard otherwise.

Other then that you really need to play it for an hour or two to find out if it's for you. I like the dry humor and pop culture references. And how it doesn't take itself too seriously. But some people call this 'lacking in depth' and I guess they're right too. They do re-use certain backgrounds and let you grind from level 32-37 and 1 mission later 37-45 at the end of the game, so they definitely rushed through the end trying to add some 'gameplay' without putting in work sadly. That level 50 mission is optional btw. Throughout the rest of the game there is rarely a need to grind though. Do note that the game has some large bugs. Some achievements are broken, some missions are broken, DLC doesn't work for some and there's graphical glitches. This seems like a hasty port honestly. And then there's the fact that if you want the Deluxier Edition you have to buy it at once. You can't upgrade. If you already have Normal edition or Deluxe edition (extra's, but no DLC) you're screwed. Also they just wiped everybody's saves trying to emplement the (not fully working) cloud save. Then wiped all saves again when reverting to the old build.

So the game is very fun, but beware that this game is published by Paradox. As long as you're lucky enough to be in the 90% for whom most things don't break you're good. But if something goes wrong there's no support and dealing with Paradox is like talking to a 3 year old and when they realize you're right they just ignore you.

I only recommend this game because it's unique. It's very money-grabby, too expensive and the publisher is unethical and clearly doesn't care about it's customers, but the game is so much  fun and most people don't care about what happens behind the scenes. And if I'd downvote it the fanboys would downvote this review and you wouldn't be reading about the downsides of this game right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088642130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1446250523}
review:
[h1]시바, 게임하는데 이유가 어딨어! 그냥 하는거지![/h1]
...라는 원사운드의 명언과 매우 잘 어울리는 게임이 있는데, 클리커 히어로즈 같은 Idle 게임, 팩맨 같은 게임이 여기에 해당됩니다. 그리고 베홀드 스튜디오 개발, 패러독스 유통의 인디 게임인 연필과 펜의 기사 역시 이 사례에 당당히 올려놓아도 좋습니다.

컨셉은 굉장히 독특합니다. TRPG를 하는 주인공들이라는 컨셉을 가지고 있으며, TPRG를 하는 주인공을 조종하는 RPG죠. 조작은 굉장히 직관적이고 쉽습니다. 이동-퀘스트-몬스터를 적당한 스킬을 선택해서 클릭하고 때려잡기-미션 클리어-렙업-스킬 올리기! 이 여섯가지만 알아두면 게임의 80%를 정복하는셈입니다.

컨트롤은 편하고 직관적이며, 스토리는 그냥 전형적인 용사가 되어가는 RPG속 주인공들입니다. 별것 아닌것 같지만 그 덕분에 할 거 없을때 하기에 정말 좋은 게임이며, '나는 아무 생각이 없다. 왜냐면 아무 생각이 없기 때문이다.' 상태일때 플레이해도 좋습니다.

배경음악도 뭐 특별하진 않은데 중독성 있고, 대사들의 유머도 병맛이 묻어 나옵니다. 그리고 의외로 지역들이 많아서 팔 거리도 많습니다. 유일한 단점은 모든게 반복, 반복, 반복, 반복, 또 반복이란겁니다. 하지만, 심심하고 간단한걸로 시간 때우고 싶을때 정말 적절한 게임입니다. 할인이나 번들때 구매하시면 후회하지 않을만한 게임입니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057504816', 'num_games_owned': 1420, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1040, 'last_played': 1445272650}
review:
D'abord je tiens à dire que si je le recommande je ne l'ai pas fini et ne compte pas le finir, pour la simple et bonne raison que l'obligation de farm vers la fin du jeu est bien trop abusée...
Et comme le scénario (parodique) ne me tient du coup pas en haleine, je ne suis pas dérangé à l'idée de louper la fin.

Sinon parlons du jeu!
C'est un RPG à la sauce old-school qui surfe sur les clichés du genre, mettant en scène 5 personnes (maximum) jouant à un jeu de rôle sur table, vous pouvez donc contrôler 5 personnages et aussi le maître du jeu (ce qui vous permet d'ajuster parfois le nombre ou le type de monstres que vous combattez ainsi que comment se passent les quêtes).
J'espère que vous aimez les dés car vous allez en voir tout le temps, car presque tout se joue au dé. Dé à 20 faces que je trouve un peu injuste (qui a tendance malgré une amélioration à tomber en dessous de 10 assez souvent).
Ce qui fait que quand vous voulez vous reposer pour regagner de la vie et du mana, un jet de dé se fait, si il tombe en dessous de 10 en général vous avez de grandes chances de tomber sur un combat de monstres ce qui du coup vous empêche de vous soigner (et pour ma part 75% du temps je ne peux me soigner à cause de ça).
Bon heureusement il y a des auberges mais c'est quand même assez pénible. Un jet de dé se fait aussi lors des déplacements sur la map mais heureusement là on rencontre rarement des problèmes sur la route.

Sinon pour les gros points positifs, le design pixel à l'ancienne est charmeur, la musique est délicieuse (même en 17 heures et malgré sa faible diversité je ne m'en lasse pas ou presque). Il y a une tonne de trucs à faire, la quête principale est très longue et relativement drôle, attention à certains passages vers la fin non traduits en français et apparaissant en italien (même en parlant couramment l'espagnol j'ai pas tout compris ><). Bon après ce n'est pas une grande perte, le jeu se veut parodique, le scénario est à peine plus développé que celui du premier Final Fantasy, références en plus.

Les seuls défauts restants sont le système de level up, trop long pour upper, et chaque perso ne gagne que très peu de mana en uppant, et pas de vie du tout si je ne me trompe pas. Il gagne un point à répartir dans une de ses 4 capacités (actives ou passives), ce qui est ma foi peu... On finit vite par ne plus avoir assez de mana pour certains persos ce qui nous amène à aller réinitialiser leurs points de compétence à l'auberge la plus proche pour trouver le bon ajustement de mana.

En bref, le jeu est bon, mignon, intéressant, long avec un bon design et une bonne musique, mais assez injuste sur certains points qui risquent de vous enlever l'envie de continuer ou de le finir.

Je reviendrais sûrement sur cette évaluation pour l'améliorer (je l'ai écrite en vitesse et n'ai pas vraiment eu le temps de bien organiser mes phrases^^).

author: {'steamid': '76561198117846315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1518891473}
review:
[h1] Overview: [/h1]

After playing this game for quite a while now, I'm ready to give it the thumbs up. It's fun, and it goes to great lengths to show itself as a self-deprecating parody of Tabletop RPGS like Dungeons and Dragons.  But if you haven't ever played D&D before, then probably most of this game's humor and sarcasm will slip by past you. 

[h1] Pros: [/h1]
[list]
[*]Great Humor
[*]A lot of replayability value.
[*]More depth than you would probably think at first glance. 
[*]Interesting system and tactics.
[/list]
[h1] Cons: [/h1]
[list]
[*] Heavily oriented towards grinding.
[*] Repetitive music. 
[*] Pixel-based graphics are not for everyone
[*] Once you grasp the stength of some of the powers (stun-locking non-elites and bleeding or burning elites), it quickly becomes far too easy. 
[/list]
