author: {'steamid': '76561198062446764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 886, 'last_played': 1442193850}
review:
This game is a cute tribute to D&D, and it's a nice novel game. But there are some glaring issues with it that I plan to dissect.

Pros:
-The game has a bunch of cute references to D&D/RPG game mechanics.
-The art style is nice. They pull off the pixel style very well.
-Even though the story is somewhat mundane, it still kept me interested because of the nice art and clever jokes.

Cons:
-Within 20 minutes of starting the game, you can unlock every ability. So that means the combat from then on is exactly the same. You battle strategy is set extremely early, which will make you frustrated because...
-The game requires an insane amount of grinding. Plus, the difficulty curve is artificial, since the only difference between high level and low level enemies is how long it takes t kill them.
-My final problem was that my copy of the game randomly erased my save file. After 14 hours of grinding, it was gone. So I gave up.

Final verdict?
If it's on sale, it could be a nice way to spend your afternoon, but don't spend more than $1 on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041636869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 2249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2215, 'last_played': 1441859493}
review: This game starts out really fun with rather unique premiss and some fun humor. However, the game never really changes in play style and gets very, very grindy in places. In the end, the story wasn't strong enough and the grind wore me down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142106999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1533949676}
review:
Quite enjoyable.  Perhaps the jokes are obvious as some reviews have said, but they're still fun.
The game is better if your computer is a touch-screen as this is a mobile port.  Mouse clicking is kind of a drag primarily because of this reason (click the Skills button, now move the mouse up to click the thing you want to attack, now move back down to click the Skills button of the next hero, now back up to click the enemy, now back down...).  It would have been better to add some keyboard/controller support.
But, speaking of the whole "mobile port" thing, it IS nice that I can transfer my save file from my Android device and play my current game on my PC and Mac.  I've gone between all three platforms without too much trouble--just save it to my choice of cloud storage and then download it into the game file folders to play from where I left off.  The fact that there isn't Steam Cloud is a bummer, but since Steam doesn't have a client on Android, it doesn't matter too much for me.
Overall, very nice little game.  Grab it on sale and have some old-school fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059776224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1441669084}
review:
Between Steam and the Android version, I've surely logged 40 or 50 hours on this game. It's great fun, and the game-within-a-game structure makes for some funny moments in the main quest. While the gameplay can get a little stale after you've maxed everyone out (not hard to do), it's still a fun diversion from time to time. I can wholeheartedly recommend KoP&P, but at the same time ... it's game that's also a tremendous missed opportunity for something greater.

My big complaint about the game is the lack of additional content. The one DLC, "Haunted Fall," is a mere sliver of addtional content, and hardly worth the price. This is the kind of game that SCREAMS for a rich set of adds ons and expansions, particularly for high-level gameplay. After two years, however, we have one lackluster, overpriced expansion that would have been a free upgrade from most other publishers.

If it had Steam Workshop support, it could easily become one of the best pick-up-and-play RPG games out there. But, again, we have nothing like that. Just a great core game and some tantatlizingly untapped potential.

That said, at $10 it's a touch on the pricey side. I picked my copy up on sale for perhaps $5, and when the DLC was maybe $3. It's a great deal at $8, but I'm not sure I'd feel the same way at $20 for the Deluxier version. If you can get it on steep sale, you won't regret it. Otherwise, stick to the much cheaper mobile version,

author: {'steamid': '76561198124648739', 'num_games_owned': 1579, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 20365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15108, 'last_played': 1452426067}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048834816', 'num_games_owned': 2648, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 1663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1663, 'last_played': 1441232774}
review:
RPG de batalla por turnos donde nos sumergiremos de lleno en una partida de rol de mesa, nosotros encarnaremos a un grupo de aventureros que deberán avanzar en un mundo ficticio (creado por el todopoderoso master) donde la aventura y el humor no censarán en ningún momento.

La mecánica del juego se basa en avanzar a través de la trama mientras realizamos misiones, subimos los parámetros de nuestros personajes, los equipamos y mejoramos, añadimos o cambiamos sus habilidades y oficios y derrotamos hordas de monstruos,  todo enmarcado dentro de una jugabilidad basada en el point and click muy intuitiva y sencilla. Estéticamente enmarcado dentro de gráficos de 16 bits el titulo ofrece unos diseños sencillos pero coloridos, escenarios bien hechos y gran cantidad de detalle. La banda sonora nos acompaña enmarcada dentro de la misma estética del título con sonidos y melodías que nos brindarán más de un momento de nostalgia.

Como pegas cabe destacar la alta monotoneidad del juego, las misiones no van más lejos de matar monstruos todo el rato y esto junto con los desplazamientos y los ataques aleatorios hacen la experiencia algunas veces bastante repetitiva y pesada.

Por contra hay que destacar el enorme sentido del humor y las innumerables referencias a la cultura pop que el titulo nos muestra, esto junto con experimentar la diversión de una partida de rol de mesa nos garantizará una buena dosis de carcajadas y de enrevesadas historias que nos mantendrán siempre al tanto de querer ver con que nuevas ocurrencias nos sorprenderá esta apasionante trama. Por otra parte cuenta con un precio quizá algo elevado para lo que este ofrece, aunque con una durabilidad decente recomendaría comprarlo con descuento. Recomendable para todo aficionado al rol de mesa y a la cultura pop.

[h1] Análisis relacionados de interés: [/h1]
[u][url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/taizo_hori/recommended/324250/] Knights of Pen and Paper - Haunted Fall (DLC)[/url][/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561198052300260', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1440700537}
review:
I wish there was a 'mixed' review option. Or a 'meh' one. Overall the game is pretty alright (albeit a bit repetitive), but considering that and the fact that a number of achievements are bugged, I'm definitely leaning more towards negative. For example, I didn't get the one for having a party member reach level 15, and the one for getting all masters shows no progress despite having quite a few. And then there's the level 30 one that so many people have problems with.  

I can't honestly recommend this game. It's been out for 2 years and I feel like those problems would be resolved by now. Maybe if the developers fixed all of that I might change my mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089433701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1825, 'last_played': 1442144533}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003523138', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1377, 'last_played': 1418446909}
review:
This game pulls off imitating the tabletop experience well for good and for ill.

THINGS THS IS GAME DOES LIKE TABLETOP GAMING:
~Travel is quick because travel is boring.
~Travel is still something that you have to do too much.
~The NPCs that stand out remain well in your memory
~The NPCs that don't are all exactly the same re-skinned NPC, other than MAYBE half a dozen they are all boring
~The jokes remind me of the same type of self-referencial humor as expereinced with your first highschool GM
~The jokes still suck.
~The early game is a desperate struggle against keeping the squishies alive long enough for them to unleash the hurt on the enemies.
~The late game every fight is waiting on the wizard or equivilant to denign to cast the right spell after the rest of the party spend the whole combat setting it up.
~Enemies actually have some flavor to them that is easily apparent.
~Enemies are universially made tougher by merit of adding hitpoints and raw damage rather than tricks or tactics.

I wish the game had more elements of randomness, like miss chances based ona rolled die in combat rather than it only being effected on the map.

I'm marking this as a RECOMMEND, but only buy it if you really like old school RPGs and/or tabletop gaming

author: {'steamid': '76561198089251945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1647319006}

author: {'steamid': '76561198144593917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 1331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1331, 'last_played': 1435157157}
review:
Overall, this game is both technically solid and enjoyable to play. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who likes RPGs and Tabletop games, especially older gamers.

Pros:
+ Classic mechanics that will appeal to any veteran RPG fan. The game is mechanically solid.
+ The story gets surprisingly good as the game goes on
+ The game has a very good sense of humor. It is filled with inside jokes about RPGs, tabletop games, sci-fi, and all sorts of things that will appeal to nerdy people, especially ones old enough to get more of the references.

Cons:
- Gets a little repetitive and grindy after a while. For example, there are very few enemy types, locations, quest types, etc. This might be an intentional parody of other games, but still.
- Sometimes in an effort to give a Classic RPG or Tabletop feel, the game gets a bit overly simplistic, which can make it a little boring to play at times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063324141', 'num_games_owned': 1131, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1445277359}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012704990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1439600311}
review:
The game would have been really fun if it was half as long. Unfortunately it is padded with a ton of boring grind.

In retrospect I wish I wouldn't have dragged myself through so much of the game. It was fun for a few hours but at some point I was just hoping it would finally come to a conclusion. However, it just kept going, copy-pasting fights over and over, adding loop after loop to a story that had you running around in circles, never getting anywhere. The biggest punch in the face was when I finally got to the boss and it wiped my characters in one strike. Trying again would have meant hours of more grinding.

Very unsatisfying and a waste of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044153289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1439077954}
review:
I enjoy the premise of this game, the core idea that it tries to emulate with a twist, a DnD session where you can customize and control the players and the room that the game takes place in, even the dungeon master. 

I will say that the game does have charm and has a good art direction, though I would say that there should have been more effort in the pixel art. However, it has both condensed and distilled the core elements of pen and paper gaming to a level which is far too simplistic for me to enjoy. The combat is shallow, the quests are repetitive, and the stats and perks are shallow and hardly feel like they matter. The UI is also highly simplistic and does not even provide important information efficiently or at all. 

I am sure that this is a fun bathroom game on a mobile device or something on the go, but the flaws of this game impeded my enjoyment of this game and cannot recommend this game to people who want an enthralling experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053817234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1558, 'last_played': 1438978368}
review:
Przyjemne, krótkie i momentami całkiem zabawne cRPG, w którym wcielamy się w grupę dzieciaków odgrywających sesję papierowej gry fabularnej. Standardowa misja ratowania świata przed złym czarnoksiężnikiem zmusi nas do wędrówki po fantastycznej krainie, w której aż roi się od potworów. Na swojej drodze spotkamy jednak także kosmitów, Gabe'a Newella i... czekającą na nas w kuchni matkę ;)

Cieszy spora ilość klas i kombinacji umiejętności, które udało się twórcom opracować. Za pomocą dostępnych buildów można stworzyć wiele bardzo różnych od siebie, a wciąż skutecznych drużyn, które z większością wrogów rozprawią się szybko i bezboleśnie. Wymaga to jednak od graczy odrobiny cierpliwości, właściwego inwestowania w poszczególne umiejętności w czasie awansów i właściwych zakupów w sklepie.

Zadania nie wykraczają poza schemat wyrusz do jakiejś lokacji -> pokonaj potwora/zdobądź przedmiot - wróć po wykonaniu zadania, co sprawia, że po jakimś czasie przestajemy przesadnie uważnie śledzić wydarzenia na ekranie. W takich mementach na ratunek przychodzi  nam dowcip twórców - choć nie jest przesadnie błyskotliwy, to jednak czasami udaje się wywołać u gracza uśmiech, szczególnie, jeżeli samemu miało się okazję uczestniczyć w sesji papierowego erpega.

Gdyby nie przesadna chwilami potrzeba grindowania, by pokonać kolejne etapy i coraz silniejszych przeciwników KoPaP nadawałby się idealnie do krótkich posiedzeń, kiedy na grę możemy poświęcić maksymalnie pół godziny lub godzinę, a mimo to chcielibyśmy dostrzec jakiś znaczący postęp w rozwoju fabuły i postaci. Nawet mimo tego gra się jednak przyjemnie, a dzięki temu, że zdobyte ulepszenia i złoto dzielone są na wszystkie nasze zapisane rozgrywki, możemy w każdej chwili rozpocząć grę od nowa, od początku używając interesujących nas klas i postaci oraz wcześniej wykupując potężny ekwipunek, który na dalszych etapach znacznie ułatwia szybką eksterminację przeciwników.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978608285', 'num_games_owned': 2462, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 1698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1431, 'last_played': 1561713690}
review:
I love this game, it's witty, can be fun if you enjoy the grind, is fun once you've bought enough boosting items. This game has a lot of 80's kid focused humor.

It's loaded with great nostalgia/references and beautifully done pixel art, the sound is great though you will likely turn the music off after 3-5 hours of playing.

You can have several parties going at once and share earned gold across parties which can make for interesting progression styles. There are permenant upgrades to your table and the room you're playing from that really change the way the game is played and I felt that was a very nice touch.

The DEV team was bought out so there's no real support for the game anymore, it has some odd bugs in it still and can occasionally break if you do some things too quickly.

Overall 100%ing this game was fun and a steady challenge it took me just under 30 hours.

I have a difficult time recommending this game though since it's not really something that just anyone can pick up and play. This game can be frustratingly difficult at times. Especially if your party composition is unable to overcome an obstacle, you may have to start a new game to support your main party.

But I've decided to recommend it due to the 8bit charm it has throughout the game which is really entertaining.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053860492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1438526466}
review:
<Mistrz Gry> Przez cały dzień podążacie śladem nekromanty. Zmierzcha już, gdy docieracie na bagna. Trop się urywa. Co robicie?
<Wolf Zabójca> Idziemy tam.
<MG> Ale gdzie? Przed wami trzęsawiska, jak okiem sięgnąć.
<Wolf> (triumfalnie) Idziemy TAM. Tam, gdzie powinniśmy iść.
<MG> Doigrasz się, Olo. Jeszcze jeden taki dowcip, to odejmę ci za wczucie.
<Ernst Halfing> (studiuje swoją kartę postaci) Ja mam Bystry Wzrok, Czuły Słuch i Widzenie w Ciemnościach do 30 metrów.
<MG> No dobrze.. Trop się urywa, ale... (rzuca kostkami) gdzieś w oddali, we mgle spowijającej trzęsawiska, dostrzegasz migotliwe, słabe światełko.
<Wolf> Ha! A nie mówiłem? Idziemy tam.
<Sirrah Krasnolud> Czas komuś wpierdolić.
<MG> Nagle przed wami w wodzie coś się kotłuje i wystrzeliwuje z niej ogromna macka. To ośmiornica bagienna. Macka chwyta Ernsta i unosi wysoko w powietrze.
<Ernst> Jak to?
<MG> Nie wyszło ci na Inicjatywę.
<Ernst> Nawet nie rzuciłeś kostką! Nie bawię się tak. Popełniam samobójstwo.
<MG> Jak chcesz to zrobić?
<Ernst> Skaczę na główkę.
<MG> Ośmiornica trzyma cię w stalowym uchwycie.
<Sirrah> 33, 42 i 11. Trafiam wszystkimi trzema atakami!
<MG> Zaczekaj, najpierw opiszę wam potwora. To wielka, bagienna ośmiornica. Ma K8 macek, a ta, którą widzicie, ma dokładnie... (rzuca kostką) jedną. Ośmiornica ma jedną mackę.
<Wolf> Haha. Ośmiornica z jedną macką? Toż to wielki plemnik!
<Ernst> Każdy wie, że ośmiornica ma osiem macek.
<MG> (obrażony) Dobra, sami tego chcieliście. Osiem macek! To wy będziecie mieli trudniej. *

"Knights of Pen and Paper" pozostaje wierny właśnie temu duchowi nastoletnich sesji RPG, przypominając o zarwanych nocach, kiedy napędzani kanapkami i pomarańczową Grappą, toczyliśmy epickie boje, kombinując jak tu zagarnąć najwięcej skarbów dla siebie. Co ciekawe, w grze sterujemy nie tylko postaciami, grającymi w RPG (jest więc babcia, młodszy brat itd.), ale i Mistrzem Gry, ponieważ sami wybieramy questy i decydujemy o stopniu trudności starć (wybierając rodzaj lub ilość przeciwników). Rzecz jasna levelujemy, rozwijając postacie i zdobywamy coraz lepsze wyposażenie, co pozwala zmierzyć się z coraz trudniejszymi adwersarzami. I tak w kółko, bo gra polega wyłącznie na walce. No, przemieszczamy się jeszcze po mapie, gdyż tego wymagają niektóre zadania, jest drobny crafting (chyba żadna gra nie może pozwolić sobie na jego brak).

Podsumowując - gra prosta, urocza i grywalna, chociaż nieuchronnie zmierza w kierunku lekkiego grindu. Ale to część uroku podobnych produkcji, nieprawdaż? "Knights of Pen and Paper" nie jest poważną produkcją - to typowy casualowy przerywnik, którego zalety (i humor) doceni każdy, kto grał w "papierowe" RPG. Żeby dopełnić wrażenia nostalgii, mamy tu kolorową, pixel-artową grafikę.

Jeżeli zdecydujecie się spróbować, mam małą podpowiedź: nie należy wydawać całej kasy w grze - najlepiej zostawić sobie w rezerwie trochę złota (ok. 200 sztuk przy 5 osobowej drużynie) na wskrzeszenie drużyny. Nigdy nie wiadomo, która konfrontacja może okazać się zabójcza.

Polecam tytuł, jeżeli możecie wyrwać go za kilka złociszy. Przynajmniej jeden wieczór dobrej zabawy gwarantowany.

+ klimat nastoletnich sesji RPG
+ prosta i przystępna mechanika
+ kolorowa, pixel-artowa grafika

- zbyt prosta, aby być czymś więcej niż li tylko przerywnikiem między "poważniejszymi" produkcjami
- jak we wszystkich tego typu grach, po jakimś czasie doskiera powtarzalność
- niektóre questy zmuszają do grindu

* autentyk z sesji RPG; zamierzchłe lata 90-te ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198107180370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1438449574}
review:
这个游戏就是根据人物特性和技能搭建一个5人团队，肉盾+输出+治疗，前期注意一下回魔，搭配好后就可以几乎无伤挑战比自己高10多级的对手了。建议人物到16级时再到铁匠铺升级装备，[spoiler]通过物品最高可以节省90%的升级装备费用。[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198059890752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1155, 'last_played': 1438465079}
review:
As a 25+ year veteran of pen and paper gaming in real life it was hard not to instantly fall in love with this game when I was put on to it for my tablet, when I saw it was on Steam I just had to have it here as well, the Deluxer content is somewhat useful but by no means essential but I'm happy to put the money towards the company in the hopes of continuing the title.
The game captured the feel of a well run gaming group with a very tongue in cheek look at the genre and while it is easy to offend such minority interests it is hard to endear, and this game certainly doesn't offend :)
The pop culture references date from my childhood to modern day and any nerd/geek will find something in there they relate to from their childhood, very well written and humorous throughout.
Game play is easy and as I like to call it, drunk friendly, easy enough to play while intoxicated, engrossing enough not to get dull.
In my opinion this is the best game I've played after Skyrim and Fallout 3 and if you know me that is a high recommendation indeed.
Behold studios are my 8 bit Bethesda 
All in all you will not regret buying this game and once you play it you'll be recommending it too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063185839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 6611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1153, 'last_played': 1472444906}
review: love it :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198041437449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1435899749}
review:
[b]Fiz um texto mais completo e com uma historinha narrativa bem massa lá no meu tumblr, se vocês quiserem e puderem dar uma lida e me dizer o que acharam, ficaria feliz. :)[/b]
http://mindskingdom.tumblr.com/post/125313382606/cavaleiros-da-inf%C3%A2ncia-e-do-papel

[i]"Eis que surge então, lá nas vastas terras do mundo indie, onde apenas um desbravador apaixonado e corajoso vasculharia, um pequeno baú. trancado, reluzindo, quase gritando na consciência daquele moço:
-Abra-me... abra-me... abra-me.
Ele se aproxima, resolve investigar, olha bem, vê que parece ser algo muito pequeno, talvez não valha a pena arriscar, já que havia vislumbrado coisas maiores e por ele definidas, melhores, para quem já tinha viajado à Skyrim... mas havia algo diferente naquele pequeno baú, que o fazia querer abrir... e quando assim fez, eis que surge algo surpreendente, brilhava intensamente, e o moço, ao visualizar, trouxe-o uma sensação de aquele pequeno tesouro fora criado com grande esmero, ao ponto de beirar a perfeição, guardou-o para si, da maneira mais segura possível, tornando-o assim uma das melhores coisas que ele já havia conseguido em sua jornada de exploração entre as terras de Indieland."[/i]

_____________________________________________________________

[i]Haha, essa foi um pequena narrativa/conto, espero que tenha ao menos saído divertido, não sou lá um escritor muito bom. rs[/i]

Agora, voltando ao excelentíssimo Knights of Pen and Paper +1.

-KoPaP é um simulador de RPG de mesa, baseado em turnos de modo clássico.
-Seu gameplay é extremamente intuitivo e de fácil aprendizado, assim, facilitando a introdução de qualquer pessoa ao gênero, abrangendo tanto em questão de idade quanto em questão de experiência.
-Seu roteiro, apesar de ser scripitado, te dá uma sensação incrível de liberdade, de que é você que está guiando todo enredo detalhe por detalhe, a Behold Studios conseguiu fazer um excelente trabalho, pois, apesar de scriptado, não é de maneira alguma linear. A história não é nada complexa, mas é de grande carisma, fazendo com que você se importe por ler tintin por tintin, é divertida sem ser boba e profunda dentro do necessário.
- Os personagens? São outros carismas à parte, começa desde a ficha de personagem, seus nomes e descrições descontraídas, ao criar seu grupo e ver a interação dos personagens, você percebe o quanto cada um tem de personalidade apenas por texto, isso me impressionou.
- O game, por mais simples que pareça, possui muitas features e add-ons interessantíssimos, como: leveis, aprimoramento de skills, aprimoramento de builds de armaduras, de cenário, itens, poções... enfim, é um rpg, mesmo que não complexo; completo.
- Toda a parte de design está de parabéns, o jogo é lindo dentro da sua proposta e as referências a cultura pop e a esteriótipos relacionados a ela ficaram demais, só tenho o que aplaudir.

-Raramente há um game em que eu consiga gostar de tudo sem apontar ao menos uma coisa que eu não gostei. A Behold Studios provou sua grande competência e seu grande carinho pelas coisas que fazem, tenho grande orgulho de ser fã dessa produtora e orgulho maior ainda por ela ser daqui, de nossa terra Tupiniquim!

Vida longa e próspera a eles!

author: {'steamid': '76561198123537815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1693, 'last_played': 1436382679}
review:
Gra RPG w której gramy... tak właściwie to graczami, któży grają w papierowe rpg. Pod naszą kontrolą również znajduje się sam mistrz i rozgrywka którą proponuje swoim bohaterom. Jest to dość oryginalny koncept, ale zrealizowany w całkiem przyjemny sposób. Możemy określać ilość i rodzaj potworów jakie gracze napotykają na swojej drodze, a zatem określać poziom trudności walki.
Grafika to ładnie wykonany pixel art, natomiast udźwiękowienie jest dobre, ale trochę monotonne. Rozgrywka nie jest trudna, opiera się na bardzo prostych zasadach. Całość jest wykonana jako parodia. Może gra nie jest rewelacyjna, ale na pewno warto w nią zagrać, jako ciekawostkę. A nuż się spodoba, i zgubisz gdzieś parę godzin? :P

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198091014298', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 4951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3922, 'last_played': 1648634782}
review:
I don't know where and when I got this game...
But... This game...
This game is awesome!

I liked the overall parody feel about it while it has a strong and solid work about delivering action and plot in moderation, getting some loud laughs from me here and there. The battle is unforgiving, so you always have to be focused, despite it being turn-based. The difficulty is adjustable in a manner "How frisky you are today?", taking on anything between 1 and 7 rats or elite monsters. The open-ended way the characters are presented lets you use your imagination. I do feel like playing a table top sheets'n'pens while playing this. Yes, the feel of every character is an illusion, but it's a very-VERY well made illusion.

Another point is the building difficulty: Items give you stats that you barely see. Levels give you damage that you barely see. Hp and Mana regen is earned by tears and sweat dripping down your inner thigh. All this while enemy shamelessly uses lifesteal and applies crazy bleeding stacks. Some battles will be so tight that you will stain your undergarments a bit and still lose because of the enemy randomly preferring your rouge to your fully buffed granny paladin. You will put a sleep on a DoT'ed enemy and lose your healer because of that, and you will spend 4 times the money you earned in that battle to revive your team. You will even spend 2k on upgrading your sword and still get nothing in return because you are a looser and you will have no money to leave the god forsaken town.
But... You know... That's what's good about this game... That's what's your adventure is. And you should not just accept it, but have tons of fun while at it!

I would like to say thank you to the developers. I've seen a lot of attempts to do what they achieved in this game and i think they did it better than anyone else I've seen so far, including UnEpic and Magicka, the first being too far away and the second being a bit too silly. But this game, oh, this game grabs the bull by his modesty and makes him enjoy it so much that he's ashamed afterwards, but he begs for more.

Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090350939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1198, 'last_played': 1466610588}

author: {'steamid': '76561198080781507', 'num_games_owned': 525, 'num_reviews': 260, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1436714609}
review: A fun and simple game, witty dialogue and, in some cases, reminded me of my tabletop gaming group. What I didn't like is the excessive need of grinding, more so, in the end levels, the fact that you could screw up the game if you didn't choose the correct skills each level and the music, in the end, it was the same soundtrack again and again. If you can work with that, it is easy to recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986618829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 7905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3742, 'last_played': 1542973920}
review:
Se presenta como un intento de llevar al mundo de los videojuegos la esencia de los juegos de rol tradicional, esto es, las partidas que se hacían entre amigos, con dado, con papel, lápiz... y mucha imaginación. Seré breve, no hay forma de lograr esa sensación en un videojuego, no al menos con la I.A. actual y sin amigos reales, pero el juego logra su objetivo de ser diferente y divertir, que al fin y al cabo es lo que importa, nunca nos lo vendieron como algo pretencioso así que no seré yo quien lo critique por ello.

Nos encontramos con un mundo creado por pixel art, con una variedad de localizaciones bastante buena, habilidades de los personajes y otros tantos aspectos que ayudan al progreso en el juego, un sistema de combate tan simple como divertido, diferente estrategia de ataque según si el enemigo ataca solo o en grupo y nuestra selección de personajes para el combate, diálogos divertidos y en muchas ocasiones irónicos y cargados de referencias a terceros, música pegadiza en formato midi, control con el ratón y muchas horas por delante para terminarlo aparte del modo +newgame que reinicia el mundo pero no los personajes (aunque los enemigos comienzan con bastante nivel).

Voy a decir algo con lo que últimamente me repito mucho... no es perfecto, pero en este caso si tras media hora no ves interés en continuarlo no lo hagas, el juego no mejora apenas y no presenta ningún aliciente, simplemente si te atrapa la mecánica y te gusta el universo le darás hasta acabar, pero el juego es lo que es y se muestra tal cual en pocos minutos. Por suerte o desgracia a mí me ha gustado mucho y para colmo lo he descubierto también para el móvil y ha sido complicado desengancharme xD pero todo se supera jajaj

PD: El DLC está muy bien aunque es más de lo mismo y como añade algunas partes justo al final del juego, cuando nuestros personajes son muy fuertes y los enemigos nos duran un suspiro, pues nos sabrá a poco, pero objetivamente es un buen añadido.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967267578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1549566735}
review:
A game that obliterates your grasp of time.  This game should not be initiated late in the evening as you will almost always find yourself still playing by one in the morning.  New players begin with five seats, but can only afford to fill two of them at first.  Choose carefully which skills your heroes will specialize in, don't make jack-of-all-trades; because even though you can 'usually' controll the strength of the mob parties you will fight, you can't afford to be unspecialized.   I'm loving this game so much I can barely elequate.

Humor:  Casual, but usually satisfactory, 8-bit cliches and DM wit, 7/10
Music: Fits the game, it's 8-bit rpg themes, what is there to say?  6/10

Controls: Smoothe as giant moth fur.  In combat, whoevers turn it is, no need to click 'attack' and then select which enemy to attack, just click the enemy and, wham, a virtual 'rush' mechanic for mopping up weaker mobs.  The world map could've been given a bit more compensation room at the fringes because you click and drag the map to move it around and some locations ARE right at the edges, just a minor irritation there, could've been fixed with the ability to zoom out, but they didn't include that.  There were other things, but overall, deserves a 9/10

Visuals: In an 8-bit tabletop rpg sim, all you can ask for is a great color pallete, and it's in there.  8/10

This game is virtually always in Ironman mode, constantly autosaving, so even if you hit esc enough times to terminate the game, no need to freak for your progress' sake :)

That's enough from me, enjoy, my comerade gamers, *drops the mic*

review:
Esse jogo me rendeu boooas horas de gameplay. À primeira vista, o visual do gameplay me fez achar que não me faria me sentir imerso naquele mundo, justamente por ter uma mesa e um cara narrando, mas me enganei.
É uma pena que o jogo fica repetitivo depois de um tempo, pois além de ter quests bem parecidas, é você quem controla a quantidade de inimigos na tela, o que faz o jogo não ter desafio por si só.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031582331', 'num_games_owned': 6779, 'num_reviews': 767, 'playtime_forever': 3344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3344, 'last_played': 1444956810}
review:
here is some gameplay. "hidden classes

author: {'steamid': '76561198016911242', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 754, 'last_played': 1436428000}
review:
O meşhur dungeon dedikleri yere gelemedim. Uğraştım ama bir yerden sonra hakikaten baydı. İndie oyunlara bayılırım zaten.

Şu dakika oyunu bırakmış bulunuyorum çarlar level 26 satılıktır. Şaka, yok öyle bir şey tabii. Tamam çok seveni vardır, doğrudur ama kimi oyunlar var kanınız ısınmaz aylarca bekler de bitirmezsiniz döner dönr uğraşırsınız ya bu da benim için öyleydi. Başta hevesle başladım sonra 3-4 ay sonra kaldığım yerden devam ettim falan ama yok gitmedi.

Ben yine size tavsiye ediyorum ya öyle kötü bir oyun değil ama indie tarzı için gayet güzel. Oyunun mantığı sona yazılmaz fakat ben yazıyorum. Türlü şehirlerde çeşitli görevler var ve siz zar atarak şehirlerde geziyorsunuz. Yaratıkları öldürüp üstü başı dizip devam ediyorsunuz. Tabii bu olay kağıt üzerinde oluyor. Hadi kolay gelsin.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970887820', 'num_games_owned': 4506, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1436274253}
review:
This is a game you will love or hate depending on your tolerance for RPG tropes. The best parts are when it succesfully makes fun of the cliches of CRPG's while bringing a sense of humour about what makes the pen and paper versions so much fun. At its worst it IS those cliches. One of the things I really disliked was that to upgrade your characters standard weapons and armour costs a fortune at the blacksmith and requires extensive upgrades to get above a less than %50 chance of the upgrade being successful (Your money, which is in short suppy, is spent regardless). You can upgrade the chance by getting grindstones, but GRIND is the opperative word. Grindstones are only available in caves and there is only a precentage of getting one for each ore pile you click on. You will need to go back to these places again and again and again to try to get enough grindstones to raise the chance of an upgrade succeeding more than %50 of the time. I do like it, but with caveats. If you can tolerate the random grinding required, go for it.

Pros: 
        Good sense of humour
        Graphics have a lot of charm
        Chirpy retro music

Cons:
         Grinding
         Repetition
         Rinse/repeat
         Tear enducing upgrade system

author: {'steamid': '76561198056449335', 'num_games_owned': 1397, 'num_reviews': 280, 'playtime_forever': 2049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2049, 'last_played': 1435620422}
review:
Довольно забавная инди игра сделанная в стиле старых настольных рпг с кубиками.
Плюсы:
+Разнообразие классов
+Красивая пиксельная графика
+Забавная основная сюжетная линия с кучей отсылок
+Куча итемов
+Прикольно сделанные данжи
+Можно получить монтировку из халф лайф :D
Минусы:
-Слабое звуковое сопровождение, и музыка и звуки сделаны на очень низком уровне
-Геймплей не блещет разнообразием
-Тотальная затянутость игры 

Knights of Pen and Paper приятно играть пару часов в день на протяжении нескольких недель, но если пытаться пройти её залпом то становятся заметными куча очевидных проблем игр такого типа. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198082882640', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1541917364}
review: Wer Nerd der ersten Stunde ist, also großgeworden mit Das Schwarze Auge, Shadowrun, Ad&d und das alles noch mit Stift und Papier ist hier gut aufgehoben. Macht schon Spaß und erinnert an die guten alten Zeiten, als man noch mit den Jungs zusammen seine Charaktere durch Fantasywelten geschleust hat, weil man sich noch keine Freundin leisten konnte, oder zu Schüchtern war sich eine "klar zu machen". Einzig komisch ist wieso so viele Frauen an dem Tisch platz nehmen können, frag mich welche Pen & Paper Spielgruppe Frauen bei sich hatte. Habe zwar Gerüchte gehört das es sowas gegeben haben sollte, irgendwie, irgendwo, irgendwann, aber das gleiche wird auch von Riesen, Feen, Elfen und Zwergen behauptet. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197980625500', 'num_games_owned': 5910, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1546, 'last_played': 1438175287}
review: Прошёл в своё время на андройде, отличная РПГ, для любителей настолок вдвойне хороша. Тематический юмор присутствует сполна, увы оф. русификации нет, но в руководствах можно найти перевод от ZOG. Рекомендую!

author: {'steamid': '76561198094310379', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1103, 'last_played': 1466367471}
review:
Bon alors, par où commencer ?
 -Les Graphismes : certes c'est du pixel art, mais c'est le style qu'il fallait pour un jeu imitant un jeu de rôle sur table...pis on s'en fout des graphismes pour les RPG, merde !!! (En plus, ce bougre peut tourner sur la GRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAANDE majorité des ordinateurs encores utilisables de nos jours....(ouai, même les téléphones ont plus que 512 MO de RAM :D)

 -Le Gameplay : un RPG sur table au tour par tour...mais sans la table....parfait si vous n'avez pas assez d'amis/de temps/d'envie/decekevouvoulé pour faire un vrai JDRST (Jeu De Rôle Sur Table, faut suivre un peu !)
On peut acheter des objets qui vont de simples carottes ou potions pour les HP et MP jusqu'a des fioles d'experiences si vous avez des sous...et la flemme de monter votre perso de niveau "manuellement"
On peut égallement acheter du stuff qui améliorrera les caractéristiques de vos persos (autrement dit, la "feuille de personnage" si on était sur un vrai JDRST)

 -La Durée de vie : Si vous vous concentrez uniquement, UNIQUEMENT sur la mission principale, je dirais que vous en avez pour 10 heures (il est obligatoire de "upper" vos persos pour aller dans certaines zones, notamment les dernieres, logic)
Si vous faites en plus de l'histoire les quetes secondaires, vous en aurez pour une bonne 15aine d'heures, voir legerrement plus
Si, par contre, vous faites TOUT (missions (secondaires et principales), succes, forgeages, toutes les classes, tous les persos tout ça tout ça), il vous faudra au moins 22h si vous abusez des fioles d'exp :D, arrondissons a une bonne 25aine (ça se dit pas ça, si ?) d'heures si vous jouez "legit"
Rajoutez 5 heures pour le DLC

 -Le prix : malheuresement, je le trouve trop excessif, il aurait été dans les 5-6 euros, oké, mais 10 euros (+ 5 euros pour son dlc), je trouve que c'est assez cher, mais il en vaut quand même le coup (si vous le choppez en solde, c'est génial)
Mea Culpa, je ne peux pas faire le dlc, faute de non avoir d'argent pour l'acheter, qui à l'air pourtant excellent (1 nouvelle classe, 31 nouvelles missions, d'autres zones et pleins d'ennemis)

 -Le scénario/histoire : le seul soucis de ce jeu, c'est que l'histoire n'est pas narrée, il faut donc lire TOOOOOOUUUUTES les cases de dialogue pour comprendre toutes la subtilité de ce jeu (rajoutez une bonne heure de lécture)
A part ça, elle est trés interessante...je vous laisse la découvrir ;)

*-*                                  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~NOTES GLOBALES~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                                       *-*

 -Graphismes : 16.5/20 (pas tres joli, mais c'est mignon et c'est dans l'ambiance)

 -Gameplay : 18/20 (RPG au tour par tour sur table sans table, what else ?)

 -Durée de vie : 16/20 (ça vous remplit une journée entiere quoi :D)

 -Prix : 15.5/20 (je vous conseille d'attendre les soldes, mais vous vous amserez largement plus sur un petit jeu indé comme ça à 10 euros que sur certains AAA à 40 euros)

 -Scénario/Histoire : 18.5/20 (j'ai dis que je vous laissais la découvrir !!!! non mais oh !)


      MOYENNE : 16.9 ~ 17/20

author: {'steamid': '76561198038538764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 2872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2752, 'last_played': 1435356849}
review:
Ein Spielchen für Rollenspieler und für Zwischendurch, für mehr aber auch nicht.

Dieses Spielchen aus Brasilien (!!!) ist erstmal nett gemacht. Der Pixel-Style ist gelungen und es gibt viele 
Verweise auf andere Rollenspiele oder das Leben von Rollenspielern. Man kann es mal ne Runde zocken
und dann ist wieder gut. Dieser niedliche und liebenswürdige Style lässt auch einiges Verzeihen.

Jetzt kommt allerdings das grosse Aber: Es verfehlt meiner Meinung nach die Zielgruppe.

Hardcore Gamer, die die Verweise verstehen, fühlen sich schnell vom immer wiederholenden Gameplay
unterfordert. Das Spiel besteht nur aus Kämpfen (geh dahin und kämpfe, hol etwas und kämpfe, blabla und kämpfe)
und selbst diese sind simpel ohne Ende. Im Prinzip wird ein Gegner schlafen geschickt, der Rest verflucht
und dann auf jeden Gegner nacheinander konzentriert draufgeschlagen. Also nix für Hardcore-Gamer, max.
eben für Zwischendurch. Ein Hardcore Gamer ärgert sich sicher auch über unsaubere Beschreibungen.
Beim Level-Aufstieg steht in der Beschreibung "... plus 2%", bekommen tut man aber nur 1%. Bei so nem kleinen
Game geht das besser!

Für Gelegenheitsspieler ist es durchaus was, wenn das zweite Aber nicht wäre: das Balancing.

Man kann sich in 80% der Kämpfe den Schwierigkeitsgrad selbst einstellen, indem man die Zahl der Gegner
im Kampf selbst bestimmt. Die restlichen 20 % sind fast das ganze Spiel über viel zu leicht. Das ist durchaus 
was für nen Gelegenheitsspieler. Ganz zum Ende geht der Schwierigkeitsgrad aber dermassen in die Höhe, das 
eben jeder Casual-Gamer die Finger schnell vom Spiel lässt. Für den Endgegner hab ich mit ner bestens
ausgerüsteten Party mehrere Anläufe gebraucht (und ich bin kein Casual-Gamer). Hier ist Frust vorprogrammiert!

Ausserdem gibt es Möglichkeiten (siehe Tip), ziemlich schnell seinen gesamten Spielfortschritt zu verlieren, da kein Cloud-Saving Support besteht.
Ist mir nach 18 Stunden Spielzeit passiert. Ganz schlecht (!!!), aber erklärbar durch das unerfahrene Team.

Der Wert des Spiels liegt für mich um die 3 Euro, das DLC ist seine 5 Euro mit den paar Inhalten aber nicht Wert.
Hier muss wohl mal ein Steam Sale her...

Fazit: Keine Empfehlung, da zwar nett, aber nicht Zielgruppengerecht. Ich hoffe, Teil 2 bügelt einiges aus...

Tip: Finger ganz weit weg von der "Escape-Taste" im Spiel!!! Man kommt damit ohne Sicherheitsabfrage sofort
zurück ins Hauptmenü. Geht man jetzt schnell noch aus dem Spiel (warum auch immer) raus,
ist der gesamte Spielfortschritt dahin. Deshlb nur mit dem Zahnrad (neben Reisekarte, Shop und ähnlichem zu finden) in den jeweiligen Gebieten speichern.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055842377', 'num_games_owned': 1134, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 855, 'last_played': 1451578868}

review:
This game has sucked waaay too many hours of my life.  It's cute and fun!  BUT be sure to have a system running that reduces frame rates or else this will burn up your system.  On my craptop it ran at 550-600 FPS.  No joke.

EDIT: Still love it.  Don't get 2, just stick with this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111101393', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1435185791}
review: adamlar demiş ki, "ben bir easter egg paketi yapayım ama oyuna benzesin.", gerçekten her yerden alıntı var. nabe gawell ne lan? ahahah, missingno falan var, adamlar samimiyeti korumuş ama net, steam'e yavşamışlar elbet ama hakkını vermişler. ama bir yerde tıkanıyor oyun, hile yapmamak için kendinizi zor tutuyorsunuz bazen "cheat's won't help" deyince hele, "NAH" diyesiniz geliyor. ama şükür bitti oyun, achievement'lar neden bitmedi çünkü DLC'si de var ve nabe gawell 10 TL ver yoksa avucunu yalarsın diyor, şu an avucumu yalayarak yazıyorum. OYNAYIN, GÜZEL.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077934520', 'num_games_owned': 1092, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1438721671}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198065828289', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1436712820}
review:
If you're looking for a quirky, fun RPG that simulates the basics of a game of Dungeons and Dragons, then this game is worth trying out. You are given a selection of players with different passive abilities, and are able to invite them to your game as the class of your choice. New players and classes can be rotated in, and you have control over everyone's skills, equipment upgrades and accessories, but not their base stats. You are able to switch Dungeon Masters, furniture, and table items that add bonuses to your game, as well as purchase perishable food items which give temporary bonuses to players.

Fully upgrading your equipment and game room does require grinding for experience and gold, and the game is plagued by seemingly random difficulty jumps as the recommended levels for quests start to outpace your characters' growth even if you complete the optional quest lines. Despite this, the game is still quite enjoyable and charming, as long as you have a soft spot for old school RPGs. However those looking for a compelling narrative are going to be disappointed, as the game's dialogue is riddled with generic stereotypes and frequent grammar mistakes.

So if you're looking for a traditional turn-based RPG with some D&D flair to spend hours slaughtering monsters and levelling up your characters, then this is your game. If that sounds boring and repetitive to you, or if you require an epic story and interesting characters, then you may want to pass on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196388915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1464135183}
review:
The initial reason for purchasing this game was because it looked like it would likely run on my computer.  Which, hey, it does a swimming job of it.

I also thought it would be the kind of game I might actually enjoy.  Damn it, I was actually right there, and this is a game that while hugely "simple" in design and all that, totally draws me in.  No idea why.  But as a "not a gamer" the having played over 13 hours of the game, and being actively avoiding it, in about a month is really a huge plus for the game.  

So, yep, go for this if this kind of game (classic (sort of) RPG) interests you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997631907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 929, 'last_played': 1381376184}
review:
The game has charm, but it also has flaws.

It's very heavy on grinding, but that's a problem when your game's strength is its personality and it's weakness is its combat.

I come narrowly down on the no side.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007471259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 2379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2379, 'last_played': 1434743193}
review: Nice old school RPG. 8/10. Has a nice variety of quests, you unlock various classes, nice achievements (some are bugged), I needed 35h+ to see the end dungeon... which is way to hard and would require an insane amount of grinding, which was not really necessary until my lv41 party. Still, for a cheap Indie game, worth the money and time spent!

author: {'steamid': '76561198081709395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1433703564}
review: AD&D Simulator +1.0. Every tabletop gaming session is like this, even the ones that aren't.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994480308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1434954292}
review:
Cute concept for a game. Unfortunately, the novelty wears off fairly quickly, and the actual gameplay just doesn't hold up. Traditional jRPGs are carried by their characters and story, because the combat and mechanics thereof are so one-dimensional and stale.

So Knights of Pen and Paper has the same boring combat as any Dragon Warrior/Dragon Quest/Final Fantasy/etc game, but all the writing, charm, and polish has been replaced by easy jokes about RPG tropes.

If RPGs are played for the story, where's the story? I guess the gag is that there is no story, that this is the RPG stripped down and laid bare. I can buy that. But since there's no gameplay worth noting, does that joke really carry a game for 5+ hours? 

I don't think it does. The premise is done a hundred times better by Half Minute Hero - which has all the same lazy RPG "observational humor", but uses it as a fluffy coat to the solid framework of fun, interesting gameplay. I recommend you pick that up, instead. Knights of Pen and Paper isn't worth the time it takes to finish it, much less the asking price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036951609', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1676134729}
review:
Rarely do I find myself purchasing a game, begin playing it and find myself looking at the (FAR TOO MANY) hours I've played according to Steam. I've been playing this for six hours? Impressive.

For anyone who ever wanted to play P&P and didn't have anyone to play with, here's the chance to do so on your lonesome. It's worth your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045428265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 2561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1389, 'last_played': 1620599427}
review:
On the whole this is a fun little RPG that hearkens back to tabletop DnD. But it's not without a few significant flaws in my opinion.

Pros:
1) Good concept and basic game design
2) Combat involves some strategy - while combat has some RNG components, by and large strategy will win/lose most matches
3) "Bonus" purchases are creative and allow for nice customization


Cons:
1) "Crafting" system is almost entirely RNG. A bad streak of rolls and you can come away with nothing.  Equipment upgrades are relatively expensive without significant off-quest grinding, and even levelling up the Blacksmith and maxing out luck bonuses, the chance of failure is still relatively high for items of that expense.  
2) This problem is exacerbated by 'mining' being the primary means to upgrade said blacksmith. Relatively few nodes vs. a steep cost-scaling, and a needlessly long dialogue (which can't be interrupted best I can tell) each time you attempt to mine a node makes it like pulling teeth after level 3-4.  At BS level 7, even with bonuses my risk of failure is about 20-25%.  And perhaps due to bad luck, I think my actual failure rate is closer to 40%.  
3) The design feature that has certain quest types trigger combat as you hit each zone is reasonable in the early game, and incredibly annoying in the late game. As a lvl 35 party, what's the point of slowing the game for me to have repeated battles against lvl 5 enemies?

On the whole it's a good game, and it's probably going to take the average player 12-20 hours to play through the main campaign. While side quests are technically optional, end-game battles are much higher level than you'd likely manage if you just skipped through. Regular mobs can be cc'ed regardless of your level (so at worst you can slog through a long fight even if overmatched), but elites/bosses cannot.

It will be interesting to see what improvements they make for the 2nd game due out this fall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171275434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1325, 'last_played': 1435076512}
review:
Danke für dieses Spiel!
Derzeit spiele ich kaum etwas anderes :D Absolut süchtigmachend und ein MUST HAVE für alle P&P Zocker ;)

+ Schöne Pixelgrafik, toll für Nostalgiker
+ Schönes Hintergrundgedudel ;)
+ Lustige Anspielungen auf Filme, Spiele, etc
+ Viel Entscheidungsfreiheit, mach den Hauptquest weiter, oder prügel dich erstmal so durch die Gegend
+ Cooler DLC, der gerade im Sale war <3

- Nix :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198081960053', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1455447136}
review:
Qu'est-ce que Knight of Pen and Paper ? Un jeu de rôle sur table...Sans table...Et sans feuilles de personnages ! On peut dire que ce jeu est un jeu de rôle sur table dans un jeu vidéo, c'est pour le moins osé mais ça porte ses fruits quand on regarde ce que le jeu donne.

Si vous voulez un petit aperçu du scénario, j'ai bien peur de ne pas pouvoir combler vos attentes. En effet le scénario n'est pas un élément très important dans ce RPG, et selon moi ce n'est pas forcèment une mauvaise chose. Il faut déjà dire que le jeu est bourré d'humour et je pense qu'un scénario travaillé ne serait pas bénéfique à la qualité du jeu. Je vous conseille donc de lire les dialogues qui appréciable de part leur coté humoristique.

Ce jeu vous offrira donc de bons moments avec une durée de vie appréciable (à noter que le jeu dispose d'un DLC pouvant ralonger celle-ci). Vous aurez à votre disposition 13 classes, dont 5 à débloquer et une présente dans le DLC. Une multitude de quêtes se présentera à vous, certaines seront complètement anodines tandis que d'autres se révèleront être des quêtes obligatoires pour avancer dans la trame principale du jeu, ou encore pour débloquer de nouvelles classes.

Les graphismes du jeu sauront vous rappeller aux plus nostalgiques d'entre vous l'époque 16bits tandis que la bande son, quant à elle vous rappellera plutôt l'époque 8bits. Il faut noter au passage que la bande son peut s'avérer répétitive au bout d'un moment.

Je vous recommande donc biensûr ce jeu, qui saura vous offrir du bon contenu par rapport à son prix qui je pense, est entièrement justifié.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052989462', 'num_games_owned': 4659, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1048, 'last_played': 1434722127}
review:
A blast from my past, all the little pop culture references and reminders of Saturday D & D sessions from my childhood played the nostalgia card nicely.  Add to that the humor(ie  little quips between players and the DM, parody of movies, cameos, etc), the broadrange of customable settings and characters and the general light hearted fun factor and it makes for an enjoyable title.  
Though as the game continues it does get rather grindy and repetitive; my suggestion would be to play this one in short bursts with breaks inbetween to keep it fresh.  7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198063465895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 461, 'playtime_forever': 1744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1709, 'last_played': 1434684185}
review: A delightful, interesting, and fourth-wall breaking take on  the classic pen-and-paper RPG. Aside from a couple of achievements being a little grindy, i dont have a single problem with this game. the combat is balanced, the enemies are varied and interesting, there's plenty of classes and class combinations, and a lot of humour and particually excellently designed moments. I'm very glad i bought and played this game, and if you've ever liked RPG's or turn-based combat, i suggest you check this little gem out

author: {'steamid': '76561198096524393', 'num_games_owned': 827, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1519162169}
review:
Grasz graczami, którzy grają w grę RPG, jednocześnie kontrolując Mistrza Gry.
Jednym z głównych zadań jest pokonanie twórców KoPaP'a.
Gra pozwala samemu sobie rzucić grupę potworów nie do pokonania.
Poznałem Nabe'a Gewella na Parowej Wyspie (Steam Island).

!WARNING!
Nie występuje "syndrom jeszcze jednej tury".
To się liczy w godzinach, nie turach :P

Polecam, szczególnie, jak internet wysiądzie, do grania w offline. Bo nałupałem tyle godzin, że NIE CHCIAŁBYM, żeby ludzie widzieli, jak ostro w to no-lifie. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198054463377', 'num_games_owned': 3811, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1553, 'last_played': 1437328491}
review:
[table][tr][td][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/MentorPixel]Mentor Píxel[/url] - [i]Bajo el lente crítico de un monóculo objetivo[/i][/td][/tr][/table]

[i]Knights of Pen and Paper +1[/i] es una referencia directa a los clásicos juegos de rol de mesa jugados mediante lápiz y papel. En un intento de matrimonio entre temática y jugabilidad, todas las mecánicas del juego giran en torno al núcleo narrativo y al concepto de rol en vivo.

[h1]Presentación[/h1]
[i]Knights of Pen and Paper +1[/i] está presentado en un formato de 8 bits. Quienes llegamos a vivir en la época de las consolas de la viejas generaciones podemos hacer constar mediante nostalgia la calidad de los gráficos fieles a este estilo. Con esto, digno del estilo del juego, la esencia del sonido y la música son correspondientes al espíritu retro. La música está bien presentada, haciendo sus cambios de pista en los momentos requeridos según la ambientación.

[h1]Controles/Interfaz[/h1]
El juego es operado enteramente mediante el ratón y la interfaz, el jugador no hará uso del teclado. Esta interfaz está diseñada de manera sencilla y simple de manejar; sin embargo, debido al concepto meta-gaming del juego, se nos presenta de una manera en la cual quizás no estemos familiarizados: en [i]Knights of Pen and Paper +1[/i] debemos hablar con el Director del Juego haciendo clic sobre él para que nos muestre las acciones y opciones. Una vez nos habituemos a hacer clic sobre este personaje —que siempre estará frente a nosotros—, ya nos habremos asido de esta mecánica, la cual se se termina tornándose en una bastante amigable e intuitiva para el jugador.

A pesar de que las configuración nos presenta la opción de "Guardar y salir del juego", el juego se guarda automáticamente así el jugador no lo haya hecho a voluntad, lo cual podría convertirse en una causa de contrariedad para el disfrute del usuario.

[h1]Argumento[/h1]
La historia comienza cuando un grupo de amigos decide jugar un juego de rol: Pen and Paper, todos parecen pasarla bien hasta que, a medida que avanzan en la trama principal de su juego, se dan cuenta que no todo es tan inocente como se piensa. A pesar de que la narrativa está delimitada por u un script bastante lineal, la historia cuenta con muchos giros argumentales que nos harán dar cuenta de lo inteligentemente escrito del guión.

La premisa es innovadora e interesante: un jugador de rol (el jugador [i]per sé[/i]) asumiendo el rol de jugadores de rol (los personajes). A lo largo de la historia, nos encontraremos con diálogos entre el Director del Juego y los jugadores, cuyo humor picoso y fuera de rol nos sacará una carcajada de vez en cuando. Sin embargo, uno de los puntos débiles del juego fue la decisión de los desarrolladores de implementar diálogos aislados durante la jugabilidad que no corresponden a ningún tipo de mecánica, pudiendo incluso resultar tediosos. Por ejemplo, podremos ver como un personaje dice “haré una llamada”, mientras esta se queda en su sitio, sin realizar alguna acción; por otro lado, veremos una y otra vez cómo los personajes se quejan cuando nos toca visitar algún pueblo ya visitado, llegando a resultar irritante para el jugador real. Pronto, nos daremos cuenta que el humor que una vez nos pareció jocoso, rápidamente se volverá insulso y poco risible, y este factor se tornará en un elemento con el que jugador tendrá que lidiar con frecuencia.

[h1]Jugabilidad[/h1]
Lo primero que se puede notar en el juego es la diversidad de personas y clases con el que se pueden crear los personajes. Las personas tienen una habilidad pasiva única, mientras que la clase determina el progreso del personaje, sus habilidades activas, y en definitiva, su función en la mesa.

El progreso del juego es determinado por el uso de oro, con él podremos subir el nivel de las habilidades de los personajes, comprar objetos, mejorar el equipamiento y, además, comprar accesorios fuera de Pen and Paper, es decir, fuera de la partida de los personajes jugables del juego. Estos accesorios permanentes se añaden a la mesa y otorgan habilidades pasivas para todos los jugadores, incluso para partidas nuevas.

En el pueblo podremos visitar el herrero, el cual mejora el equipamiento de los personajes. La tasa de éxito depende de su nivel, el cual se puede aumentar al darle piedras de afilar que encuentras en las cuevas. También tenemos acceso a la taberna, en la cual podemos, no solo reestructurar la mesa, sino crear nuevos personajes con los jugadores y clases que aún no tengamos.

Las misiones se dividen en Caza, Recolecta, Rescate, Escolta y Viaje. Las primarias son identificadas por una estrella y el resto son alternas, las cuales no alteran de ningún modo el curso de la historia. En algunas misiones se le pedirá al jugador colectar ciertos objetos de determinados monstruos, y aunque esto parezca fácil de lograr, solo contará los objetos colectados desde el comienzo de la misión, forzando al jugador a matar necesariamente a los monstruos para poder  soltar los objetos, y por si esto no fuera poco, la taza de [i]dropeo[/i] es aleatoria.

El sistema de combate es por turnos. Antes del inicio de cada batalla, podremos escoger con cuáles y cuántos monstruos pelear a la vez. En estas batallas las opciones serán atacar, usar habilidades, consumir objetos, posicionar un personaje en defensa o huir.

Varias de las acciones en el juego (viajar, dormir, forjar, picar una piedra de afilar y huir de las batallas) requieren del lance de dado de 20 caras, si el resultado es negativo, la acción tendrá consecuencias desfavorables. Lo cual hace que el elemento azar termine siendo un factor indispensable para el desarrollo de la partida.

Un elemento frustrante del diseño del juego es el muy limitado espacio de inventario con el que se dispone, el cual fuerza al jugador a constantemente tomar decisiones difíciles, ya que, una vez se llene el saco de objetos, los ítems entrantes no podrán ser obtenidos, y terminan dados por perdidos permanentemente.

[h1]Rejugabilidad[/h1]
Si existe un elemento que añada rejugabilidad y alargue la duración del título en [i]Knights of Pen and Paper +1[/i], este viene en forma de cazas de mazmorras, a las cuales se pueden acceder  en cualquier momento durante la campaña. En ellas, el tipo de encuentro en cada zona de la mazmorra es determinado por un lance de dados, las cuatro posibilidades son: caer en una trampa, encontrarnos con monstruos, curarnos, o, en el mejor de los casos, encontraros un tesoro. La finalidad será llegar al último cuarto para recibir nuestra recompensa mayor.

El juego tambiéb anima a la creación de distintos personajes para probar nuevas combinaciones. Además, el contador de días en la interfaz es una indirecta para desafiar al jugador a terminar la campaña en el menor tiempo posible.

[h1]Conclusión[/h1]
A pesar de sus fallas, [i]Knights of Pen and Paper +1[/i] invita a los jugadores de rol de lápiz y papel de la vieja escuela a sentir la nostalgia que el título brinda. Es un juego exclusivo para quienes desean tomar unos paso atrás en el tiempo con su estética retro y disfrutar de un juego con creativas mecánicas meta-gaming y una temática para una audiencia nicha.

[table][tr][td][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/9059978][u]Seguir a Mentor Píxel para más análisis y reseñas[/u][/url][/td][/tr][/table]

author: {'steamid': '76561198035239240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1488, 'last_played': 1572002557}
review:
First Off, This is one of the games I never thought I would enjoy, then 20 hours in, I'm still enjoying it!

Pros : 
Very User friendly, easy to learn the mechanics
Good Leveling System, if you follow the storyline and do quests, you will level up without too much grinding.
Multiple Upgrades and perks, Mixing the old with the new with multiple upgrades with equipment, items, and char perks

Cons: 
Small Map, though the gameplay is pretty good with the map, for the price you pay, i expected more than 32 locations
More upgrades is possible, I believe there can be more upgrades avaliable to help with later gameplay.

Overall:
If you like 90's games with simplistic designs and gameplay fitted for modern times, this game is made for you.  I wouldn't say it is made for the modern taste of how RPGS are like but it's still amazing. 

Recommendation to Creators:
I know that there is a second game that is out, But i really wish for this game to have editor edition for players who wish to create their own rpg, storyline, and quests. I am willing to pay for something like that !

author: {'steamid': '76561198032622588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1425240258}
review: a great game for any D&D player or fan of the tabletop games. i had a lot of fun with this game and how accurate the game is to playing D&D it really captures the struggle, combat and hilariousness of playing D&D with ninja turtles, mario mushrooms and giant bosses not to mention the customizable options to the game such as being able to customize your fellow players at the table and swtich them out or changing the dungeon master this game has it all along with it having a 8 bit style of art and an RPG element and turn based style to the gameplay this game was really enjoyable and super fun to play i would highly recommened giving this gem of a game a chance :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198141957545', 'num_games_owned': 851, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1439259341}
review:
This is one of my favorite games tbh. I beat it on my phone twice, then saw it was on steam and immediately scooped it up and I'm well into my third playthrough. My only wish is that the PC version took advantage of the platform and added some improvements. 

The main one I'd like would be seeing the numerical life totals of the enemies. If I know a spell deals 30 damage...that doesn't really help me a lot when I have to guesstimate how much HP the enemies actually have, and guessing becomes even more difficult when you realize that the damage of attacks is randomized slightly (or in some cases, a lot). 

Another I'd like is very minor, I'd like it if windows such as your character screens were closeable by just clicking outside the window, instead of needing to click the x. Or at least move the x to the top right instead of bottom left, it only makes sense down there on a phone game for ease of clicking, on PC it's just needlessly different.

The last thing I can think of is at least a couple keyboard shortcuts. If the bottom row of buttons were assigned to 1-5, combat would be at least 2 or 3 times as fast and way less tedious, instead of clicking 3 different things for each attack, I can just type 1 2 and then click, for example.

All in all though, despite these minor PC-specific annoyances, I highly recommend the game to anyone on any platform. It's super fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076291038', 'num_games_owned': 1300, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1432073036}
review: Nice game with lots of in-jokes for whoever has ever played D&D in their life (plus a good amount of geeky references in general). The game is mostly combat though, and the combat is as classic a turn based RPG combat as it can get - any SNES Final Fantasy had a similar system with more depth. This, combined with the fact that the game is pretty grind-y, makes the gameplay rather repetitive. Buy it only in offer and only if you like the idea of the "meta" RPG jokes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052740381', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1353, 'last_played': 1483793740}
review:
Первый час я не понимал где я и что делать, поэтому дубасил крыс. Следующие 20 часов я не понимал как уйти спать, не говоря уже об учёбе и работе (благо выходные). 

Сюжет: основная линейка достаточно большая, и интересная, в частности порадовала концовка ибо играть в игру в игре, играя в игру это играбельно :D Квесты не сказать, что разнообразные, но построены достаточно интересно, местами дикий хардкор, такой как побить "мамуличку" на 30м лвле, это анриал полный :D А в других местах этого хардкора как раз не хватает, как на пример в финальном данже, ибо была пати магов и 1 маленький рога, которым пришлось почти соло весь данж вырезать, что не составило труда, хоть и уровень пати был на пару десятков ниже рекомендуемого. 

В плане геймплея, управление удобное - одной кнопкой мыши, так что изучил все позы кам..задрoта за последние сутки. Графика не кусается (графoдрoчеры мимо), хоть и пиксельная, контрастная, но глаза не выедает. Радует полное отсутствие ограничения времени, т.е. посреди боя встал, пошёл за пряником и никто не помрёт =) 

Ну и как итог 10 бобров с телевизором из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198028724797', 'num_games_owned': 1479, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1433506779}

author: {'steamid': '76561198061167460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1432623228}
review:
Really bad port. You can't use the keyboard. It is all just clicking. Nothing is different from the mobile version. It is the same exact game. You are not getting anything more in the PC version. Even the quests are the same. I'd really recommend the mobile version to play on the go, the PC version has nothing more to offer. 

It's like bringing Angry Birds to PC, it's just the same game, it's not worth more.

Now if they expanded on the game and made it more PC friendly, able to use a keyboard, and made the UI fit better on the screen, it would have been a great game. But it's not. The only difference is that you click instead of touch.

Now I like the game on mobile, but this is just a bad PC port. It's still a good RPG overall though, I really like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995448225', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 4120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1646419283}
review:
Пожалуй начну с небольшого предисловия: где-то год назд мне почему-то захотелось сыграть в какое-нибудь РПГ "старой закалки", т.к действие разворачивалось на даче, под рукой был лишь мобильник. Тогда-то мне и попалась эта замечательная игра. Стоит ещё заметить, что я прошёл её 4 раза на мобильнике.

Смысл
Итак, добро пожаловать в мир Пера и Бумаги. Герои этой ролевой игры играют в ролевую игру. Мы снаряжаем отряд искателей приключений, в количестве до 5 лиц. Каждому приключенцу выбираем "расу" и класс. Расы здесь очень интересные: хипстер, рокер, учительница, инопланетянин, чубака и т.п. Изначально классов доступно 6(7 с ДЛС), но по мере прохождения мы будем открывать новые. (Правда по мне так есть один полезный, но очень унылый класс: Паладин. Единственная его толковая функция это быть мальчиком для битья. Хотя в этом он достиг мастерства).



Геймплэй
Всё очень просто: перемещаемся по глобальной карте и дерёмся в пошаговых боях с монстрами в разный локациях.
Это всё, поэтому в игре есть квесты.

Сюжет или что-то вроде того
В игре очень много юмора и отсылок. Квесты почти на 100% состоят из них. Присутствует интересный  сюжет (естественно не без штампов). Для комнаты, в которой происходит игра наших героев, можно покупать улучшения, иногда существено влияющих на игру(согласитесь +1 ко всем навыкам это существенный бонус). Так как игра пародирует реальные ролеые игры, то перемещаться из локации в локацию наши герои будут вместесо столом. Сами локации долго осматриваешь в поисках отсылок (король лев, Голлум, Слендермэн и т.п.).

Графон
Для людей с отсутствием фантазии игра не рекомендуется, ибо они увидят лишь какие-то кучки пиксилей. 

Недостатки:
- Нельзя самому выбрать оружие и броню для героев, куётся только только одно определённое оружие и броня для каждого класса.
- На высоких уровнях улучшение навыков часто абсолютно бесполезно. + 0,5 к урону это так нужно, при уроне >150.

Официального перевода нету, но есть любительский среднего качества. 
Итог: Хорошая игра с неплохим юмором(хоть и немного спецефическим) 

P.s. Не знаю может это троллинг, но Великий Гэйб посылает героев отвоевать священную монтировку у рыцаря около Ледяного трона...
P.S.S Готовится к выходу вторая часть, где: 1)улучшили графику(а надо было ли?) 2)Исправили все указаные мною недостатки. 3) Углубили систему

author: {'steamid': '76561198051894463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1433252597}
review:
Pros:
- D&D Style RPG gameplay
- Easy to understand mechanics and controls
- Well defined classes, each with different set of abilities
- Plenty of customization options
- Fine pixel art aesthetic

Cons:
- Repetitive quests
- Repetitive soundtracks
- Require LOTS of grinding at later stages

Summary:
Overall a fun to play game to spend your extra time on.

Score:
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198050460617', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1437626557}
review: gorgeous "little" game about Pen&Paper RPGs with a surprisingly deep story and looooots of stuff to see, do and kill. The writing of this game is glorious, full of pop and nerd culture references and despite an easy to pick up gameplay, it's really challenging at times and hard to beat "on the side". Even with only a couple of hours of play time, I really quite like the game and am waaaaays away of actually beating it. Still, I quite enjoy it and for that price, it's totally worth every cent

author: {'steamid': '76561198042249962', 'num_games_owned': 2580, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1433589884}
review:
I don't know where and when I got this game...
But... This game...
This game is awesome!

I liked the overall parody feel about it while it has a strong and solid work about delivering action and plot in moderation, getting some loud laughs from me here and there. The battle is unforgiving, so you always have to be focused, despite it being turn-based. The difficulty is adjustable in a manner "How frisky you are today?", taking on anything between 1 and 7 rats or elite monsters. The open-ended way the characters are presented lets you use your imagination. I do feel like playing a table top sheets'n'pens while playing this. Yes, the feel of every character is an illusion, but it's a very-VERY well made illusion.

Another point is the building difficulty: Items give you stats that you barely see. Levels give you damage that you barely see. Hp and Mana regen is earned by tears and sweat dripping down your inner thigh. All this while enemy shamelessly uses lifesteal and applies crazy bleeding stacks. Some battles will be so tight that you will stain your undergarments a bit and still lose because of the enemy randomly preferring your rouge to your fully buffed granny paladin. You will put a sleep on a DoT'ed enemy and lose your healer because of that, and you will spend 4 times the money you earned in that battle to revive your team. You will even spend 2k on upgrading your sword and still get nothing in return because you are a looser and you will have no money to leave the god forsaken town.
But... You know... That's what's good about this game... That's what's your adventure is. And you should not just accept it, but have tons of fun while at it!

I would like to say thank you to the developers. I've seen a lot of attempts to do what they achieved in this game and i think they did it better than anyone else I've seen so far, including UnEpic and Magicka, the first being too far away and the second being a bit too silly. But this game, oh, this game grabs the bull by his modesty and makes him enjoy it so much that he's ashamed afterwards, but he begs for more.

Highly recommend.
