author: {'steamid': '76561198122493217', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1608409263}
review:
Очень хорошая игра,мне чем-то напомнившая "Подземелья и Драконы".
Сначала вы выбераете 2 персонажа, позже можно выбрать 5, или даже больше, но часть будет сидеть в таверне.
Вы начинаете свой путь из деревни, в которой для вас будут предоставлены мелкие квесты, такие как: Убить 5 крыс,убить 5 летучих мышей и тд. Но позже вам предстоит ездить из точки в точку,из деревни в деревню, из замка в замок...
Так-же в игре есть магазин, в нём вы сможете купить предметы востанавливающие HP (яблоко,моркова и тд), одежду,обои для дома, стол, мебель, и многое другое.
Ну а теперь я напишу плюсы и минусы этой игры:
+Приятная пиксельная графика
+Множество квестов
+Юмор
+Множество персонажей
+Множество классов
+Множество городов,деревень,замков и тд.
Ну а минусов я пока не нашел :)
P.S. В руководствах можно найти как русифицировать игру, если вы хотите детально узнать о чём говорят персонажи.
P.S.S Моя оценка этой замечательной игре 10/10 :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198154517000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1433355415}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040952498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5896, 'last_played': 1433033685}
review:
Overall, this game is a great time killer for mindlessly clicking things. You may as well play a mobile phone app. Looks deep, then you dive in and get overwhelmed with disappointment.

Battle System
---------------
P&P has a fun little take on the D&D system but taking advantage of the two worlds that you would see this in. The fantasy realm and the player realm. Which would have been absolutely amazing if executed better.

The battle system is pretty basic. You've got your skills both active and passive, plus whatever bonuses that your player has. Real easy. What's nice is that you can for the most part control the curve of difficulty. You want grindy? You can have it. You want to breeze through? You can have that too. I like that.

If you're looking for something that isn't too terribly distracting to play, this battle system is it.

Story
---------------
The story for this game is abysmal. It's not engaging and the NPCs are boring. There's no sense of urgency or plight. King and kingdom is in trouble because some stereotypical mage is doing suspicious things and cursing people. Oh boy. How quaint. Let's go murder all the things to fix it. Whoo.

With a mindless battle system, you HAVE to have the story element to draw you in. It's definitely not there and I gave it quite a chance.


Characters
---------------
This is where I had the highest hopes. At first glance, you'd think each player would act out their character differently and there would be lots of fun banter between characters. Nope. All dialogue is cut paste across all characters. This broke my heart. Basically all the player characters are just one personality with different skins. The bully could have been a jerk who begrudgingly helped the party, ET could have misunderstood things and made things hilarious, but nope. Gotta have the one character to rule them all.

tl;dr Mindless click game with generic story. So disappointing I had to write about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017932227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1433016989}
review:
As a disclaimer, I got this game with the humble bundle.
At first I thought this game looked interesting. Jokes baout tabletop RPGs? Yes! Good pixelart? Oh my yes! Turn based combat? Eh, not my favourite, but there's worse.

When I started playing the game was allright. The story wasn't nearly as good as I thought it was going to be, but the gameplay wasn't as bad as I thought, so that kept me going. The difficulty of the game kept going upwards, which is understandable. I did enjoy it.
For a while.
Then I hit a pay wall. Yes, this game has in-app-purchases for gold, which the whole game revolves around; with enough gold you could pretty much beat the whole game while using a first level character. The whole game is constructed around selling this gold, at least seemingly; although the grind times were long at some points, I didn't mind since games like these always have long grind times. However when I spent a very long time grinding for a single fight, I realized that the game is geared toward trying to get you to buy gold.

Good game. Bad business model. Not worth 10 dollar. I'd say buy it for one or two if the concept interests you, and as always, veer as far away from making in-app-purchases in a game you already paid for as possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992817286', 'num_games_owned': 1165, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1435107688}
review:
Me a sorprendido gratamente este juego...

Knights of Pen and Paper (Desde ahora KPP) es un juego que me a recordado mucho a aquellos libros de rol de los años 80-90 donde al final de la pagina te daban X opciones y debias ir a X pagina segun la opcion que elegias. 

El juego trata de un grupo de personas (Un ejecutivo, un repartidor, una profesora...por citar algunos ejemplos) que se reunen con un narrador el cual te va contando una historia...TU HISTORIA. 
La historia es divertida dado que tiene muchisimos toques de humor y hace referencias a muchas cosas como peliculas, series, comics, juegos etc. 

El sistema de combate es super sencillo, al mas puro estilo juego RPG clasico. 
Debes matar a X numero de enemigos (Dado que puedes elegirlos tu, si añadir mas o añadir menos enemigos segun quieras elegir la dificultad en el combate, algo que esta muy bien) dando click sobre el enemigo. Para ello puedes hacerlo con ataques basicos (click normal) o con una gama de hechizos, para ello deberas seleccionar el libro de skills. 

Tenemos un inventario, con items. Pociones, armas, proteciones...lo tipico. 
Hay varios roles dentro del juego y dependiendo del personaje que elijamos , el rol le vendra mejor o peor. Por ejemplo el rockero creo recordar que tenia +5 puntos de salud de pasiva, por lo cual pegaria mejor en la clase Paladin o Guerrero que en la clase Rogue, aprovechariamos mejor su pasiva. 



En fin, el juego me a venido en el Humble Bundle de Paradox junto con muchos mas productos, en total apgue 5 euros por 9 juegos o asi muy buenos... asi que en realidad este juego me a salido por un par de centimos, ahora bien...pienso que vale los 10 euros que cuesta en Steam? Definitivamente si, es un juego que te va sacar muchas sonrisas, es muy simple pero cuidado, muy adictivo. No necesitas dedicarle 1000 horas para progresar, puedes dedicarle esos 30 min muertos que tienes de vez en cuando y aun asi lo disfrutas mucho. 

100% recomendado tanto si lo ves en oferta por steam como si no. Yo desde luego pienso comprar el KPP 2 cuando salga, que ya me he enterado que Paradox lo sacara pronto. 

Mi nota 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198059083664', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1474184040}
review:
What a little gem! 

I found this beauty in the Paradox Humble Bundle (still available at the time of writing so go grab it if you haven't already) and fell in love with it. Not the style of RPG that I've really had much experience with so for me this was a bit of an experiment. I digress, a simple and smooth game that's easy to get into. I found it a little odd that my rogue has an attack almost double that of my warrior but that's pretty much the only issue I've had. Of course there's grinding... and then some more grinding 

Oh I'm sorry did you think you were done? Guess what!?

MORE GRINDING

But that's what you sign up for with these games, you have to be prepared for it and I have to say, it pays off. The parody of the traditional D&D scenario is wonderful and the humor is very self aware. The references are tasteful and abundant but not overly so that they obscure the story.

I would recommend this to anyone lacking the means, friends or who's simply as antisocial as myself to actually play D&D (not a bad thing) to give this a go if you are interested in that sort of thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987388969', 'num_games_owned': 1728, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1432519548}
review: Imagine playing table top D&D, and getting sucked into the world of Nintendo, where you are still playing Table top D&D, only you are playing it as an NES video game. That pretty much sums up this game in a nutshell, only you play it on the PC. It looks like an old school NES game, but incorporates the table top D&D feel, Very interesting concept. Much different than the early video game D&D adventures, this game tries to stay true to old school D&D. I thought it was a fun little game and would recommend it, because it can be picked up for next to nothing or even free and if you enjoy anything D&D related, you should at least give it a try. Get ready for a Nostalgia rush.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085564783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1446345046}
review:
(This is a copy-paste of my Google Play review, since I apparently don't "own" a license to the app and my review was automatically deleted right after posting it) - I purchased it via the Humble Bundle.
This game is a great game! In fact, I got hooked into it to the point I play it instead of Clash of Clans (if I'm not already playing Geometry Dash).

It's so satisfying to be able to have a Dungeons-and-Dragons-like game in my pocket that I can bring anywhere and play at anytime.
The mechanics aren't groundbreaking, but it's included everything that I've forgotten to consider as a Dungeon Master.

The story's full of references to our gaming culture, but towards the end of the game, I felt that the story died after the "you have to save the world" bit... And the grind to the higher levels seemed impossible.
(I mean come on... I've finished all the quests elsewhere and all my characters are only Level 37, despite having to beat Level 50-60 bosses which naturally one-shot them all, and getting gold becomes impossible without having to repeat near-death dungeons as farming lower down becomes more and more redundant as you level up since the bosses are the only thing that actually yields descent (more than 40) gold.)

The only other problem with this game is (only applies to the Android version)... I can't buy the DLC or add gold.

review:
Bom, o jogo é incrível, Soundtrack agradável, jogabilidade... Simples, Graficos simples, Historia MAGNÍFICA.
Basicamente é um jogo que simula aquelas mesas de RPG que duram uma eternidade.

BTW... O jogo é divertido, anti-depressivo (Pois jogava muito quando estava sem net), relaxante, estressante, inspirador e como todo bom RPG, não poderia faltar muita diversão e bla bla bla... o jogo é bom bla bla bla... ENFIM COPREM E DEIXEM A BEHOLDER RICA HAUAHUAHUAHUHAAHAHU.

Obrigado pela atenção...

author: {'steamid': '76561198035186307', 'num_games_owned': 723, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1416, 'last_played': 1445289720}
review:
Un excelente y entretenido juego, lleno de referencias y chistes al mas puro humor parodia, hay muchas cosas de las que puedo decir sobre este juego y la mayoria son buenas, pero mejor dejo una lista de pros y contras:

PROS:
-Tiene un humor hilarante.
-Persononajes comicos y epicos.
-La posibilidad de mejorar las habilidades de tu personaje.
-La posibilidad de mejorar armaduras y armas.
-Que el juego no sea lineal a la historia.
-Que cuando viajes dependiendo de lo que toque en el dado decidirá si los monstruos atacaran.
-Nabe Gewell

CONTRAS:
-No me gusto mucho que solo puedas mejorar las habilidades, me hubiera gustado que tambien puedas mejorar el atk, def, magia, etc, del personaje asi poder volver fuertes sus puntos debiles.
-Que algunos monstruos no tengan debilidades, por ejemplo te enfrentas a un mosntruo de hielo y aun asi el ataque de glaciar del mago le quita mas HP que el de fuego, pero creo que eso ya es cosa mia.
-La banda sonora es parte importante de un juego, pero en este solo se repite la misma una y otra vez, espero que en el 2 la banda sea igual de epica que el juego.

Bueno eso fue toda mi review, el juego es muy bueno si tienes algo de dinero de sobra compralo, no te arrepentiras, yo que no soy mucho de jugar juegos que son estrategia por turnos, por que simplemente me parecen que a cierto punto se vuelven monotonos y aburridos, bueno pues este juego es uno de los pocos que me han gustado de verdad.

Sin mas que decir los dejo con una frase que dijeron acerca de Nabe Gewell "Parece que va a ayudarnos, pero algún día se quedará con todo nuestro dinero".

author: {'steamid': '76561198169486891', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1432956162}
review:
The main knock against this game is the grind that ruins the entire experience. The whole game seems like it's built to try to get you to buy gold for real money with micro-transactions. Everything from the meager drops from enemies to the fact that you have to pay gold to upgrade the blacksmith to the fact that upgrading weapons and armor always has a failure chance requiring you to spend even more gold. Even the in-game methods of boosting your gold gain almost always come at the expense of experience which in turn prevents you from mitigating the one thing that you're most likely trying to escape from: the grind. The whole time I was playing this I could feel it reaching for my wallet... in spite of the fact that this feature has apparently been removed from the game.

And this is really a shame because it's not a bad game in any other aspect. The combat is the core of the game and, while basic, it's pretty solid. I never found myself feeling overpowered or like there was no aspect of challenge to it; nor did I ever feel like the game had pushed me into a corner where I was helpless. Even though you have very few abilities to choose from, there is depth and strategy in how they're use. The pixel-art backgrounds are good and contain a lot of cool references. It's kinda cool and chilling when you go to an area to level-grind and notice after an hour that slenderman has been standing there the whole time. I personally found the humor a bit flat and irreverent... though also occasionally spot-on speaking as someone who's played the tabletop RPGs this game is supposedly an homage to.

Bottom line: If you like level grinding or have a high enough tolerance for it to see the rest of the experience though then this is the game for you. For me, I've found the game too tedious to play at length and it's not worth spending hours farming gold for the meager amounts of story and the occasional chuckle. Maybe it gets better later on, but it doesn't feel worth it to me to spend the time slogging through it.

And for anyone who says "This is SOOOoo much like D&D"... no, it's not. At least, not if you have a good DM it isn't. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198062489928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 1483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1483, 'last_played': 1431821860}
review:
This game is pretty cool. It's like if Final Fantasy and Jdr (Rpg) encountered each other. 

Ff-Like : Quest, Fight, Lore, Magic and Cqc Class, Bad boy, Sub Bad Boy, Crtystal or Artefact...

Paper Rpg : Dice's roll, player playing a character, character sheet, Lore said by the master.

Things in the market are fun to use to help you in this long quest, some are very usefull when some others... No. xD

This game is cool, pretty long, but Repetitive at death and the Dlc is not eally worth it if you paid the game full price. (If you show me the budget sheet for the making of this dlc i ll accept the price for sure.)


There a New Game + Feature so let's go if you like some strange game mixing things. =p

author: {'steamid': '76561198046052619', 'num_games_owned': 1006, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1067, 'last_played': 1431602162}
review:
テーブルトークRPGの世界をゲーム画面に出したら
こんな感じですよー的なRPG。
というか真ん中でTRPGしちゃってるし。
各所でサイコロをふってる感じなのがなかなかいい。
とはいえ、クエストを受けてこなすのを繰り返すのみ。
そのクエストも３～４種類ぐらいしかないので代わり映えはしない。
職業も進めるとアンロックされるが、ある程度メンバーがきまったころに出てくる職業も多いので、
使うとしたら２週目になってしまうのが残念なところ。
スキルも各自４種類で、キャラのLVアップ時に１ポイントを割り振っていくのだが、
あまり使えないスキルもあるので注意。
そのためこの職業ならこのスキルといった感じで個性がちょっと出しにくいかも。
個人的にはスキルツリー的なものがあったほうが良かったなという印象。

と、マイナスなところが結構あるが、TRPG自体を知っていてそういったものが好きなら
セール時などなら買っても損はしないと思います。
TRPG風というだけで個人的には結構ハマりました。
アンロックされた職業とかでもう１週しようかな？と思えるくらいには。

author: {'steamid': '76561197991055084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1436123442}
review: Si eres jugador de rol de toda la vida, acostumbrado a los libros, las fichas de personajes, las bromas graciosas de tus amigos cada vez que pasa algo en la sesión, este es tu juego, tengo que decir que me ha sorprendido gratamente, es un juego que tiene ese toque que engancha con sus graficos simples, su tematica facil, pero que realmente esta llena de vida. Tiene una gran variedad de guiños al mundo frikie y la verdad debido a temas personales, hace muchisimo que no jugaba a una sesion de rol con amigos y este juego me ha hecho sentir otra vez en una y le estoy muy agradecido, mi nota un 8,5 de 10 y se lo recomiendo a todo el mundo

author: {'steamid': '76561198067716744', 'num_games_owned': 1281, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1615, 'last_played': 1431693299}
review:
結局英語が全然わからないまま裏ボスとDLC全部やりきったよ！
英語がわからなくても雰囲気で遊べるからお勧め！
なんか色々面白いこといってる雰囲気だけで面白いよほんとだよ

どんな話だったか？なんとなく神殿っぽいところまわって
そのうち悪い奴があんなところやこんなところにいってそれをやっつけた
RPGなんてそんだけわければいいんだよ…


TRPGを遊んでる人たちを操作してTRPGを進めてくため
ゲーム外でスナック菓子を買ったりできたりするのは面白い
TRPGを遊んでる体ならではのメタネタをいっぱい使ったりしていて
システム自体はTRPGっぽくシンプルで硬派であっても
堅苦しくならずに気持ちよく遊べる

絶妙な戦闘難易度とアイテムやクラスの
選択肢の広さと自由度は遊んでいて非常にやり応えがあった
レスポンスがよくサクサク進められるため中毒性も高い

お使いクエストが多くあちこち往復するだけで
結構な時間をとられてしまうのは若干気にはなった
しかしそれを補ってあまりあるシステム面の良さや
軽快な展開は一度遊んでみる価値はあるかと思います

TRPGで遊んでみたい方や
シンプルでやりごたえのあるRPGで遊びたい人にはお勧めします

author: {'steamid': '76561198086704372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1453863186}

Un RPG estilo clásico 8 bit (incluida la música)  que me recuerda mucho a la saga Dragon Quest por su jugabilidad, ataque por turnos donde lucharemos con toda clase de criaturas, montones de referencias a otros juegos, series y películas....

author: {'steamid': '76561198016440432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1686659076}
review:
Не знаю, кому там надоест, но игра хорошая, затягивает, требует усидчивости. Это не какой-нибудь финал фэнтэзи, скорее это пиксельная настольная игра, где ты проходишь сюжетку, бьешь мобов, прокачиваешь героев.
Лично мне понравилась система рандома кубика. Она заключается в том, что при переходе на другую локацию, при крафте шмота, при отдыхе и сне есть шанс, что на тебя нападут/ шмот не скрафтится и ты потеряешь деньги. Это некий челендж, на который вы идете на свой страх и риск.
Также я приметил апгрейд стола, за котором сидит ведущий и игроки. Очень напоминает донат в играх фри ту плей, но поверьте, тут апгрейд интересный, под каждого игрока, и в общем нужный.
Советую любителям пошаговых и неторопливых игр.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044337564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1431576166}
review:
Ever play tabletop D&D? This game will definitely feel like that at times.
It has some subtle references (and some not so subtle) to classic movies, tv shows, characters and more.
The concept of playing characters playing a dungeon crawl style game may not seem appealing but it is oddly addictive.

The gameplay is simple to pick up but also offers some challenge to keep the game from being boring though like most rpg style games some grinding may be required (for various reasons).
The characters are not the every day people, from a wolverine, to an alien, to your grandma, your team is made by you and customized to your needs.

I picked this game up on sale for 75% off but knowing now how much fun this game is, I would purchase it for full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964641301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 312, 'playtime_forever': 835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 813, 'last_played': 1395453416}
review: This is a very nice casual game, as it manages to keep you entertained for quite a decent amount of time. You start with a certain party and then while you're advancing in the campaign, you get to unlock other classes or upgrades that improve the gameplay experience. It's worth to mention that the graphics are simple and the soundtrack is also very limited, but you might as well just turn off the music and listen to a radio station (something that I usually do). There're also the trading cards and achievements available, which is something that might add for the replay value factor. Overall, this is the kind of game to play bit by bit, I really don't recommend to experience for straight hours because it might start to wear down on you quite easily.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976751793', 'num_games_owned': 2759, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1431264524}
review: In this game, you play a player, who is in turn playing a character in a tabletop DnD style RPG game. Its a fresh, nearly original idea, and it is pulled off rather nicely. So far it has been very fun. Well worth picking up for any rpg fan out there looming for something new and fresh to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000097769', 'num_games_owned': 1116, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1283, 'last_played': 1430378400}
review: It's good. It really is. Nearly every screen has a reference to something in the pop culture sphere, and the humor is pretty on point. That being said, it's a real grindfest, even with enhancing items that cost lots of gold that you can only realistically get at the tail end of the campaign. The combat is simplistic, which only makes sense since this game is also on mobile phones, but that being said I had lots of fun mixing and matching my team of characters to complement their skills and otherwise challenge myself during boss fights. I'd pick it up again, given the option.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075795351', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1474678382}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066972721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1724, 'last_played': 1431320325}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper is not a standard RPG.  But it is.

If you ever spent time at a kitchen table hashing out battles between your elf ranger and heaps of orcs, you'll recognize 99% of what's going on in this game.  If not, the jokes may wear faster than Holy Grail references at your girlfriend's house.

Fun, interesting mechanics keep the battles at varying levels of difficulty, and the party dynamics are interesting as well.  A great, fun rimp for RPG fans, and a special treat for tabletop role-players.  

TL;DR: 10/10, would die during character creation again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005378126', 'num_games_owned': 700, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1418116373}
review: This game gets old very fast. The forulma is a very narrow one and is very repititious. It's also very much on rails. There's no investment on any level other than monetarily on the part of the player. It's a bit insulting in that way. It's funny for a laugh, because it's about a group of role-players off on an adventure and it makes fun of the culture, but I don't think I can recommend spending your money on it unless you already have all the games in it's price range. Even then i'd say wait for it to go on a super sale before diving in. You're better off taking a pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061221617', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 7627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5993, 'last_played': 1557327774}
review: Do you love Adventure? Excitement? Cheesyness? Then this is your game. I can't say enough good things about this game, except that they need to make a sequel. Even with the graphics being as simple as they are they are stunning none the less. Each character has their own unique traits, pro's and con's and for me that is a big draw. This is the most basic of RPG's, but it's also the most enjoyable as well. If you love RPG's like myself, then this game is for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040996114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1466532340}
review:
I can't remember why exactly i bought this, nor do i care. This is a great game. I bought the five dollar expansion almost immediatly after playing a few missions because i didn't want to miss a thing. 
The game takes after DnD in that your players are a group of nerds at a table, being guided through an adventure by a GM. This opens up possibilities for excellent 4th wall breaks and humorous diolalogue, something the devs took full adventege of. The retro styles is pleasing to the eye and, just when i though i had beaten the game, a ton more suddenly opened up. 
The open endedness of the game was a huge selling point for me. There are clear idicators letting you know which way the plot lies, but you are free to explore wherever the heck you please. Suggestions are given for how strong you ought ot be before you go to different locations so you aren't unduely surprised when your two level ten boys are jumped by a level 25 wraith. 
There are cons of course. Items and items drops in general are poor, but gold is very easy to get ahold of while still making you work for it, so you can purchase the good items with moderate hassle. There is a fair amount of grinding, but it doesn't have to be samey if you don't let it. Honestly, this is a very good game and extremely well worth the price. 9.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045144284', 'num_games_owned': 1965, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 4219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4096, 'last_played': 1429532221}
review:
This is a simple game, but with a different and innovative approach, making it a must-have item in every RPG fan player's collection.

It represents the genre very well, with many classes to develop, many enemies to face, many items to collect and many quests to complete.

While not as fun as a real tabletop RPG where we play alongside our friends, this single player adventure, where you lead a party of five young adventurers, serves well to remember the golden days of D&D.

Four skills for each class, upgrades for weapons and armor, items to farm and dungeons to conquer.

Speaking of conquering, we have here well-elaborated achievements, although some are problematic, as many have witnessed (lol).

And, to top it off, it takes the signature of the brazilians from Behold Studios. In other words, it's a troll game (lol), with a lot of fuss and jokes about the universe of RPGs, satirizing big titles with lots of references and good humor.

For every RPG fan, I recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055311780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 2377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2105, 'last_played': 1531667145}
review:
[i]Boring.[/i]
Knights of Pen & Paper is long, dull, grindy and most of all it is boring.
It starts out novel enough. You are playing a game about a bunch of gamers playing D&D
A few obvious jokes and references and things start out pretty well.
The sound, music, graphics, they all lend themselves pretty well. 
But the grind, jeez! This is a single player game! Who thought that...
Converted mobile app with a cash shop in the mobile version? Ooooooooooooooooh

I don't need to say much more really. As far as converted mobile games go its actually really well ported. But the play time is so artifically padded that you probably will not complete the game. 
A sequel has been announced and I hope and pray it addresses the flaws this game has or even just does away with the excessive grinding for the inevitable PC port.

I know some smartass will reply that this is an RPG and you are supposed to grind but this isn't 1997 anymore. Games like Bravely Default, like Magic Fantasy Battle 4, have come along and said 'listen, there is grinding but we streamlined it or we made it [i]fun[/i].'

I stopped caring about the storyline the 8th time I was told to backtrack for excuse reasons. I especially stopped caring when my Lv32 Barbarian, with maxed equipment, wearing 4 +9attack items, still can't one shot a friggen spider! 
I especially was agitated that a newer version of this game was released that I can't simply upgrade too, or even buy apprently since steam says 'you already own that game' when clearly I don't. 

Flaws aside the game is enjoyable in short bursts which is fitting given its mobile phone roots. It was ported to the PC and no real effort was made to make it a more PC friendly game. Instead its dull, repetitive and boring.
Also the achievement, beat in 365 (game)days, is unachievable it seems. That's always nice for the achievement hunters.

Join Grumpy reviews for all your gaming needs
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/grumpyreviews

author: {'steamid': '76561198028884388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1377754426}
review: nice d and d style fun with an amazing sense of humor

author: {'steamid': '76561198034096055', 'num_games_owned': 697, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1428948778}
review:
Let me start off by saying that I actually liked this game. However, there's A LOT of small problems with the game that make it not very fun or enjoyable. I was really excited to play this and was pretty disappointed halfway through and was completely over it by the end.

- The class and character system
This had the potential to be really cool and in-depth but classes are limited to 4 abilities and never change. There aren't any skill trees or advancing skills, you get the same 4 skills from the beginning to the end, the only thing changing are the numbers tied to each skill. This got boring really fast. The unique character system is kind of pointless, characters range from useful, to slightly useful, to pointless. Who would you rather have, the guy with +3 attack or the guy who only has +1 attack? The guy with +5 health who's more likely to live or the guy who costs -50% gold to revive after he dies because he sucks? Most of them are just pointless, especially after you unlock the game devs and restart your game.

-Lack of plot
I know that this is supposed to be more of a comedy/parody type thing, and I appreciated the humor, but the whole lack of an actual plot just made the game feel even more boring when you tie in the tedious and boring gameplay.

-Boring gameplay
Just keep clicking on the same skills over and over. Fight mobs without any sort of auto-battle or anything to streamline grinding (and trust me, there's a lot of grinding). On a PC this is the worst thing. Obviously if you have a touch screen computer (like I do) or play this game on a mobile platform (which obviously isn't the Steam version) then it's not so bad but still. Sitting there and clicking the same shit over and over gets boring really fast. The beginning of the game is fun because you're still new to everything and your skills and levels are rising fast, but everything plateaus equally as fast, especially the fun.

-Gold system
Everything in this game costs gold except for leveling up. Consumables cost gold, accessories cost an obscene amount of gold, TRAVELING costs gold (this is one of the stupidest things ever), reviving your dead characters cost gold and most quests cost gold as a result of traveling (despite them usually refunding the gold, if you don't have the initial gold you will have to grind). Now, this doesn't SOUND like that big a deal, but grinding gold is unbelievably slow. You can spend about half an hour to grind about 1000 or so gold through the early to mid game. To upgrade all of your characters' armor from lvl1 to lvl2 would cost roughly 1000+ and that's assuming you succeed because upgrading equips usually has a 50% and below chance to upgrade unless you invest either MORE GOLD or grind mines to upgrade your blacksmith. There's upgrades that increase your gold income rate but they don't do very much. The whole thing is just terrible.

There's not much the game does right, but what they actually DO right is pretty good.

+Balance
This is one of the few indie/joke/whatever RPGs that has actual balance. Most of them either don't try to have any semblance of balance and are too easy just so they can spout more shitty memes. This actually feels like a really well done game and the battle mechanics were well thought out. It doesn't feel like there are any OP classes. Yeah, the rogue and hunter are really strong, but they're not overpowered. The game is decently challenging from beginning to end and never feels too easy or bullshit hard. This is pretty hard to do so I have to commend the creators.

+Humor
This is a pretty funny game, lots of humor and lightheartedness, but it's an actual game. There are way too many shitty indie games that just try to shove unfunny jokes everywhere and lack actual content. This game has both and once again, the creators did a good job.

Overall thoughts: I actually liked this game and had a good time playing it, it just has a lot of flaws. However, I also only paid about $4 for this and the DLC. If I had paid the full $15 for both I would have been extremely upset as this game does not provide for more than a couple of dollars worth of entertainment. As far as replay value goes, I don't want to ever play this again. It'll just remind me of how disappointed I was the first time playing it. If you can grab it for a couple of dollars (preferably the mobile version, avoid the steam version) go for it, but don't bother paying full price for this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087400039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1428767546}
review: The game reminds me that old school days when kids played boardgames at school and hoped the dice would alter the enemy's plan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017751317', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1077, 'last_played': 1429496916}
review:
Allow me to preface this review by saying that I do like it and that this is an increbily fun game. That being said, there are big flaws that are constantly nagging at me, slowly becoming worse as I continue to play. I DO recommend this game, and also kinda not. I'll try to explain below.

Let's start with the positives:
- Each job feels unique. 
The jobs are varied significantly, each having their own abilities and "hat" that goes onto the player's. The players themselves each have a skill that they bring to the table and it's fun to min/max or switch out players with different jobs to see what they would work best as.

- The art direction is classic and very colourful. 
The art direction reminds me a lot of the older FF games, and a few other sprite-based games that were brought out in the 90s and early 2000s. It's simple, colourful, and nice to look at. Nothing is too washed out and the colour choice isn't offensive to the eye.

- Cute references to Sci-Fi and Fantasy stories.
There are TONS of references to various shows, books, movies, ect littered throughout the game world. It's cute seeing the Tardis in the desert or fighting a Ninja Turtle in the sewers. I won't spoil any more for anyone reading this review, but I will say that if you don't mind referential humour then you will certainly enjoy many bits of this game.

- The music can be pretty enjoyable.
The music is simple, but not in a bad way. It feels a bit like the old Mario games in places. I'm afraid I can't really elaborate on exactly what I mean, sufficed to say that the music fits the areas that it's in.

So what about the negatives? Well, I'm afraid that this is where a majority of my review is going to be focused. There are quite a lot of issues littered throughout the game that bug me and I'll try to elaborate on why that is.

- The referential humor.
Okay, I know what you're all thinking, "Hey, didn't you just list that as a positive?" Well, yes, and it is... However, I also feel it's a bit of a negative. This game is a little too busy referencing so many things that it's a bit hard to tell where the references end and the original content begins. For instance, most of the player characters are references to either real life people or fictional people. Which this doesn't bother me too much, I do feel like it wasn't really needed. Is it really so hard to come up with original player characters? Well, apparently not, I mean, there are some. So why did we need a Paris Hilton or Ramona Flowers allusion? Also, the "Game Dev Gang" joke was cute at first but it got old way too fast. I may be the only one that's really bothered by this but this is a bias review so... Yeah.

- Job abilities.
Simply put? There aren't enough/ They're too easily unlocked. The jobs -are- still distinct from one another, I can't take that away. However, there's something to be said about being limited to four abilities. That, of course, being "why?" I'm not ignorant, I know you can only realistically fit in so many on a game that was originally a mobile game- but, this isn't a mobile platform I'm playing it on, this is the PC edition. Why are jobs so limited? Some jobs have 2 passive abilities and 2 abilities you need to activate. That doesn't seem right to me. For example: The Cleric job has a focus heal, a group heal, a divine attack that restores HP, and a Attack down debuff that spreads to 3 enemies. Those are all fine and dandy, but why doesn't it have a manner of Dispel? How about a passive ability to not be harmed by Divine attacks or something along those lines? This may be a nit-pick, but this is what was nagging me as I use certain characters. Now, that being said, I also feel that being able to unlock any of a job's abilities at any level is... Questionable. Again, might just be a nit-pick, maybe it only bothers me.

- Enemy Encounters.
I'll keep this one short: Add a 'random' option to the 'enemy choice' screen. I get what they're going for, allowing the player to pick the enemies your group encounters so as to best simulate both the DM and Player experience, but I don't feel like you should -always- have your cake and eat it like that. Dungeons are good for random encounters.

- Missing Dialogue/ Lack of Personality for the Players
There are moments in the various quests or on the world map when your players are either talking to an NPC or casually interacting with the "DM" of the group that, honestly, feel like they have dialogue missing from them. For instance, sometimes I'll have completed a quest and the NPC will say something along the lines of, "Oh, thank you! You're so helpful." I'll click to go to the next bit of dialogue, presumebly what the player would say to the NPC, but there's... Nothing. A blank screen that I click through to go to my quest rewards. What? It's even worse when there are times where an entire half of a conversation is missing- or the players don't react to what was said in any realistic manner. The grammar has mistakes on occasion, as well. So, the dialogue seems missing. That's a pretty big problem in-and-of itself, but then you couple that with none of the players, DMs, NPCs, even the enemies, having -any- kind of distinct personality? Well, that just rubs me the wrong way. In this age of having defined characters, enemies, and even monsters in our stories, this feels lazy. Hopelessly lazy.

- A lack of any kind of multiplayer support.
This game would be a MUCH better experience if I could get a group of five other friends to play with me, with someone to DM and actually create custom quests or something. Alas, that is not available here.

So, before I continue on for a few hours, what am I saying with all of this? This game, in all honesty, is just decent. It's a decent game and I enjoy it, but it is weighed down by some pretty substantial flaws. I enjoy it for what it is and would play it again, even if a grain of salt has to be taken with it. If they fix these problems, then fantastic. This would be an excellent game. As it stands right now, I recommend it- but only if you think you can handle the flaws.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078148095', 'num_games_owned': 1403, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2544, 'last_played': 1431982249}
review:
A great casual game. A bit too prone to grinding (if you want to unlock all achievements...) but beware, achievements are unstable. For example, there is an achievement that just doesn't work for most people.
In my case, it didnt work either, but I got the DLC, and all my achievement JUST DISAPPEARED (I was at 99% completion)! To later have them all back (plus the one not working) when I installed the game on another pc.
So... the DLC got me a 100% completion of the game. Which is somehow nice, but beware, it might not work for everyone.
Nevertheless, a great game for pc. An awesome game for tablet/android.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055682145', 'num_games_owned': 561, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1429884672}
review:
Juego divertido, aunque al final de la partida se puede llegar a hacer repetitivo.
Esta bastante bien ya que el juego trata como de una partida de rol, en la que existe un "Lider" el cual va contando la historia y relatando los acontecimiento y tu tienes que ir tomando las decisiones de que hacer (ir a misiones principales, secundarias y cosas asi) e ir avanzando en la aventura.
El sistema de funcionamiento del juego cuesta entenderlo al principio, pero tampoco es muy complejo.
Los logros estan algo bugs, y hay algunos que no funcionan bien.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964410359', 'num_games_owned': 5229, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1426559381}
review:
Encore un jeu mobile qui débarque sur Steam, celui-ci se présente comme une simulation pixellesque de jeu de rôle "de table", le maitre du jeu et la table sont en permanent présents et c'est à vous de construire votre aventure en vous déplaçant sur une carte, en créant une nouvelle quête pour tuer 5 vampires, ou en décidant de suivre un peu la trame "officielle" symbolisée par un symbole sur la carte. Le premier contact est plutôt agréable, les graphismes sont assez classiques, les personnages jouables assez variés, les combats sont basés sur le système final fantasy. 
On distingue bien ici et là le lourd héritage des jeux mobiles, un shop est accessible in-game pour acheter des modifications pour votre table de jeu qui ajoutent divers bonus, ou des boissons et autres snacks qui multiplient votre gain en xp ou en gold, le tout uniquement achetable avec de l'or dans la version PC étant donné que les achats in-app ont été enlevés. Le gameplay, lui, n'a pas été adapté, et passé la fraicheur du début on se rend compte très rapidement qu'on assiste ici à un grindfest intégral, les combats sont longs et répétitifs, le système d'upgrade punitif à souhait implique de farmer de l'or pendant des heures pour un gain de stats ridicule, ou de faire des aller-retours entre deux caves pour miner les mêmes bonus pendant des heures... 
Un exemple typique du jeu répétitif beaucoup trop long, finir la campagne demandera des heures à tuer les mêmes monstres avec les mêmes attaques, les barres de vie dans ce jeu vont en s'allongeant sans être calquées sur les dégats, et l'ensemble s'éternise trop pour en rester agréable. Le gameplay ne reçoit aucune surprise passée la première heure de jeu et rien ne viendra renouveler l'interet jusqu'à la fin de la campagne. 
Un port mobile qui aurait mérité plus d'attentions pour être vraiment débarassé de son lourd héritage freemium donc, dont le contenu est beaucoup plus vaste qu'il n'est intéressant, on passera aisément son chemin sur ce titre pour PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043409014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1252, 'last_played': 1481168929}
review:
I feel awful giving this game a thumbs down, like I'm kicking a puppy.

It's pleasent, it's a neat concept, and it has some really cute jokes in it. I love the developers!

But I really tried to get into it, I really did. I put 20 hours into this game and still didn't really enjoy it. The game's major weak points are as follows:
-The combat is very very repetitive.
-The quests are repetitive, the only goal of any quest is to kill monsters to obtain their items, to kill monsters to clear a path, or to kill monsters to protect an npc. All quests are to kill monsters.
-Grinding is slow and is not stimulating at all.

Combat is this game's only real game mechanic and it is boring!

While this game gave me nostalgia and a warm feeling in my heart, I lost interest fairly quickly. I feel like it's hard to recreate the pen and paper feel of D&D without other human beings, and this game simply doesn't do it for me.

Summary: Maybe if it goes on sale it would be worth some nostalgia induced smiles, but this game is not engaging enough to keep me occupied for hours on end like real D&D with friends is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055806898', 'num_games_owned': 748, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2857, 'last_played': 1426721078}

review:

As referências que a equipe fez a lugares comuns dos jogos foram fantásticas, principalmente a do Gabe.
Os cenários e inimigos são um pouco repetitivos, mas nada que a diversão e diálogos não compensem.
Recomendo a compra, ainda mais sabendo que há uma competente equipe por trás deste bom jogo.
Busque fazer todas as proezas, vale o esforço e não é tão complicado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074743792', 'num_games_owned': 871, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1426416030}
review:
TRPGをしている体でストーリーが進んでいくが、いつしかゲームと現実とが交錯する面白い展開に。
メインキャンペーンは思っていたよりずっとボリュームがあり、クリア後にはsteam配信ならではのクエストとキャラクターも登場。
steamer、ゲーマーならニヤリとする台詞がいっぱいでした。

パーティーキャラクターが多数用意されており、ピザの配達に来た兄ちゃんをそのままゲームに参加させたりとツッコミどころ満載。
彼らはそれぞれ特有のtraitを持っており、traitが活きるクラスを組み合わせるのが面白い。
例えばthreat(敵からの狙われやすさ)の高いキャラクターを盾役クラスのパラディンにする、などなど。
ちなみにパーティーの入れ替えやスキルポイントのリセットは、町の酒場でいつでも可能。

難点はやはり、スマホゲーとしての部分。
無課金プレイのごとく慢性的にコイン不足に悩まされるので、そこはｺﾞﾆｮｺﾞﾆｮしちゃったりして好きに楽しみましょう。(オンライン要素無し)
逆に言えば、それだけで格段に快適で楽しいゲームになります。勿体無いことです。

author: {'steamid': '76561197991369092', 'num_games_owned': 2901, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1260, 'last_played': 1426086516}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper is what I'd call a sufficiently flawed dungeon-crawler.  While the game does allow for a lot of "customization", the upgrade system feels wholly dissapointing.  

Upgrades/level-ups are barely even noticable, being slight precentage upgrades that almost always mean next to nothing; The variation of the classes is really where the enjoyment of the customization is.  In addition to the lackluster upgrade system, the entire game is grind-ey as all hell.  Want to upgrade your armor? be prepared to either walk back-and-forth between town and cave for a couple hours; that or pay through the nose with your hard-earned gold.  

The humor/references are cute at times, but get old very fast... with neither making up for the repetitive gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984819909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1425934659}
review: Dissapointing in many ways. The game is very adamant about breaking the 4th wall. This started being somewhat endearing but after an hour or so the overly obvious refrences in the lazily made backgrounds, really hurt the game. You're left not really caring about your characters or the world, as the game constantly states that it is just made up. Town have names like default, desert, forest... The game lacks inspiration and drive to be worth your time. Dont get this game unless its on sale or you want to see how which direction not to go with your retro game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060039172', 'num_games_owned': 1292, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1424287323}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper is quirky, it's enjoyable, and charming, but what's really down there is a game that's downright infuriating. The actual concept of a fun D&D like experience of Knights of Pen and Paper sounds fun and gives it a nice charm to it, but it's simply put down by extremely simple and boring battle mechanics, proceding to follow by annoying dice rolls that become much more of an annoyance then an actual Tabletop game, extreme grinding to the point of just annoyance, and the fact that this game isn't simply something to play a long session on just doesn't give it a justifiable pricetag that's way too expensive for it's own good. It works as a fun mobile game, and I really love the charm and such, but it's still isn't enough to warrant such a purchase of 10 dollars.

I don't know, maybe I am judging it a bit too much, after all, it's roots were from a mobile game. I wouldn't recommend playing this game to many people (Particularly those who don't like mobile games and their microtransaction-like models), but if you like something that can be played in short bursts, is quirky, and simple, this game is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985668557', 'num_games_owned': 1514, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 897, 'last_played': 1425862760}
review:
Pros:
The game is kind of humorous.
The backgrounds look nice.
They removed microtransactions

Cons:
The gameplay lacks any depth.
The game is super grindy.
The game is REALLY resource intensive for what it is. (It uses 14% to 17% of my CPU just idling at the title screen.)
Text is recycled far too often.
The music isn't bad, but it is way too short. So in a given fight it probably loops 5 or 6 times.
Alternate save files don't have independant gold, room items, characters, or classes; however, the blacksmith doesn't carry over. (The whole idea of all that being persistent is just stupid as it was physically impossible to get the game over achievement unless I deleted my save file.)
More of a nitpick, but the developers made themselves the best characters in the game. (That's a bit too narassistic, in my opinion, and since they have shitty one-liners it ruins most of the fun of the game.)


Overall:
I got the game in a sale because it looked like it would fun to play. Little did I know I would just make a party full of physical attackers, leave the twister floor mat on, and just run this in the background while I played other games. The game got a bit of a chuckle from me when I first played it, but as the game dragged on it just got more monotonous due to there being no real growth in the game. Everything in the game scales linearly, including mana costs, so it's more about playing keep up with how much health the enemies in later areas have as opposed to actually feeling strong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024204703', 'num_games_owned': 810, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 2298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2220, 'last_played': 1426098784}
review:
A simple game that carefully balances some of the best and irreplacable facets of gaming both modern and retro. This game offers a really nice blend of modern humour and references in the form of turn-based Retro Pixel-art, all of which is set in a world set inside a game of dungeons and dragons-or-some-similar-RPG. If you have played DnD you'll get a couple of references that might tickle you greatly but its not a pre-requisite to have fun with this little gem. 

Great bang for your buck, good looking, nice sounding and entertaining. But I wont tell you anymore incase I ruin the magical adventure :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198047462796', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1535900508}

author: {'steamid': '76561198093421380', 'num_games_owned': 2808, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1425268646}
review:
As a person who understands the basics of Dungeons And Dragons, this game makes me feel as if I actually know a lot about D&D. This game takes itself lightly by breaking the fourth wall to the players of the game as well as the fourth wall to the person playing the game. The short time I've played this game makes me want to keep playing to see how the story fully pans out. The quality of the story so far (up to level 25) is quite good and is filled with humor and stereotypical quest missions. The missions can get repetitive if you don't customize the wave difficulty, I found that mechanic to be especially usefull in making the game more challenging. The upgrade mechanics are well rounded and I have found no problem with them. If you aren't a fan of the Turn Based games then this game is DEFINITELY NOT FOR YOU. But the fans of TBS and people who can appreciate the gamestyle, my favorite gamestyle is Wavedefense/Towerdefense, then this game offers alot to you. I have not been disapointed by this game at all.

Cost to Gameplay Ratio (.8 is an Okay ratio) : $10 - 6(+6 hours of completing the game fully)
Replay Value: 9/10
Story Quality: 6/10 (the story itself isn't so great but the small sidemissions and other things are great)
Humor Value: 8/10
Technical Quality: 10/10
Graphics Quality: 8/10 (it is in the pixel artstyle (did not subtract b/c of the pixel artsyle))

OVERALL RATING: 8/10

I purchased this game in a bundlestars bundle and I'm glad this game was in it, I didn't buy the bundle for this game at the time, but after playing it I would have been mad if I didn't purchase the bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039518325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1432757659}

author: {'steamid': '76561198168533916', 'num_games_owned': 684, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2357, 'last_played': 1445832191}
review:
"Knights of Pen and Paper" é um jogo incrívelmente viciante que, sem você esperar, pode acabar tomando lhe horas e horas de jogatina de um jeito muito agradável. O jogo é uma enorme homenagem ao tradicional rpg de mesa (pen and paper) e apresenta um enorme bom humor sobre tudo relacionado a isso, desde clichês de aventuras fantásticas, comentários dos jogadores na mesa que toda hora quebram a quarta parede, sem contar com a absurda quatidade de referências ao universo pop, geek, nerd, gamer (chame como quiser). São tantas referências muito legais a quase todo instante que o jogo é quase um easter egg gigante (!) e isso é muito divertido.

O gameplay em si é o que pode acabar desencorajando algumas pessoas depois de um tempo já que é basicamente lutar, lutar e lutar, escolher algum canto do mapa para ir, rolar o dado e... lutar. Se você é uma pessoa que está acostumada a "grindar" em outros rpg's, ou seja, passar bastante tempo só lutando afim de ganhar level, algum gold e talvez uns itens, você vai tirar isso de letra, até porque o sistema de batalha é bem simples, intuitivo e rápido. Particularmente, isso não só não foi um problema como foi o que ajudou a me viciar no jogo.

Se você já gosta de rpg e procura por algo leve, bem humorado, despretencioso e bem feito, dê uma chance a "Knights of Pen and Paper" que ele pode acabar te surpeendendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018031715', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1421167567}

author: {'steamid': '76561198098013678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 965, 'last_played': 1660258204}
review:
So, understand right off the bat that this is a mobile phone port -- nothing more, nothing less.  As such, it's overpriced (twice as much as the mobile app), but I would still recommend it.  I've played it on the phone and on the laptop, so I've played much more than the 13 hours it shows.  

Imagine a D&D mod for a Final Fantasy game, and that's largely how Knights of Pen and Paper plays -- D&D feel, FF-type mechanics.  

It has a great variety of traditional D&D classes (though simplified and somewhat reimagined for the FF-type mechanics), and each class really does play differently from the others.  Sure, you have your traditional D&D roles that each one fits, but they're not just strikers, glass cannons, rogues, etc with different skins.  For example, even though they are all traditionally tanks/strikers, a paladin is not a warrior is not a barbarian in this game.  

You also have classes that excel verseus single targers, excel versus groups, and some that can do both fairly well.  The true variety between classes is probably the game's greatest selling point, in my opinion.  No two parties will feel the same, giving the game great replay value.  

You also RP as the DM, as well as the players.  This lets you do things like decide exactly how hard most battles will be (with more xp for more/harder enemies).  It's a nice little touch.

Overall, buy it on sale without even thinking about it! Seriously! Pounce on any sale at all!

For full price, you probably need to have some D&D nostalgia to make it worth the $10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006437089', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1424819305}
review:
Análise em 24/02/2015 - 1,5 horas in-game

Achei o sistema do jogo bem divertido, pois é possível personalizar quais "pessoas" vão jogar com você na mesa (cada uma tem um efeito passivo específico) e qual a classe de cada um.

Não achei ruim a opção de personalizar quais encontros a party vai ter que batalhar e quais as quests vão ser feitas, mas acho que podiam ter mais encontros randômicos como quando você vai descansar e falha nos dados.

É possível evoluir as habilidades que quiser, entre as 4 disponíveis por classe.
Como ainda não joguei muito, não sei se elas mudam conforme aumenta os níveis, mas pelo formato de jogo acho que isso não vai mudar.

Outra coisa legal é personalizar a mesa de jogo, o mestre, e outros objetos que ficam sobre a mesa e rendem bônus adicionais. Você pode comprar tudo isso no SHOP desde que consiga juntar uma quantidade bem considerável de moedas.

Quel curte RPG de mesa e jogos tipo Old School eu recomendo bastante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014766672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 398, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1424728621}
review:
This is a very simple looking RPG on the cover but once you get into it, there is plenty of min/maxing to be done. A turn based gameplay makes fits this much more than a normal action type. I love how you can swap in "team members" to the table once you purchase more seats at the table.

Another thing which is probably overlooked in Knights of Pen & Paper, is the dialog of the dungeon master and the players, some really humours lines came out during my playthrough and I would really recommend anyone read through them for a giggle. 

The soundtracks can get fairly repetitve but what do you expect for an 8bit style game. I'm up to about twelve hours gameplay and I am still finding new things to try out. 

I would 100% recommend this to any RPG/Turn based fan

author: {'steamid': '76561198049406158', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1, 'last_played': 1421330400}
review:
30% of this game is doing quests. You go to one place, learn what the quest is about, go to another place, kill a bunch of monsters on your way, go back, collect reward.

70% is grinding. The main difference is that now you can choose by yourself what monsters you want to fight.

The fights, which are the core element of the game, use simple old-school JRPG mechanics. It gets tedious and repetitive.

Item management and skill upgrades are simple. There isn't much room for creativity.

The main gimmick (the player controlling not an adventurer, but a DM with his players who in turn control their adventurers) is OK, but it's not utilised to its fullest. In-game 4th wall breaking is a storytelling device and not a game mechanic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974038206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 1325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1325, 'last_played': 1386367096}
review:
Verdict: Ok game, for what it tries to be. 

KoPnP is all about character-building and fantasy combat. Char-build is quite simplistic, but in a good way. The combat becomes repetitive after a while, but it's ok until it gets booring. 

KoPnP does not deliver an enganging story or personalities, but rather a parody on pnpRPG. It does that well enough to make me laugh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098629028', 'num_games_owned': 797, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1486072107}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper é um jogo para os fãs de RPG de mesa. Uma homenagem a esse universo até mesmo no título.
O jogo tem uma história decente, personagens diferentes (você pode jogar até como o entregador de pizzas da mesa de RPG do jogo, ou a professora da escola local, ou um alien que é fã da Terra!), e cheio de referencias engraçadas ao RPG de mesa.
Apesar disso tudo Knights of Pen and Paper padece de um mal: a repetitividade. Apesar da história ter um bom desenvolvimento, as missões que a acompanham, por sua vez, são sempre as mesmas: lute com x mosntros, lute com um boss, recolha quantidade x de um item, resgate tal pessoa, escolte outra, vá a outra cidade e repita tudo de novo. 
Isso pode irritar um jogo mais longo, coisa que irá ocorrer caso queira zerar o jogo a 100%. Fora que para um jogo com uma história que é relativamente extensa e de desenvolvimento lento, as missões são repetitivas.
Um jogo que vale a pena jogar, mas que de certo, não há de agradar a todos.
Recomendo principalmente aos fãs de RPG de mesa. E aos de Phantasy Star, cujo combate parece muito com o de Knights of Pen and Paper.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006543535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1356, 'last_played': 1413317489}
review:
Charming, unique RPG. The controls are obviously made for tablets, so on a PC they can get tedious at times.
Gameplay is fun, but becomes repetitive quickly. After a single playthrough I'm quite sure that I'll never touch it again.
That said, the price is usually pretty low and on sale it can be recommended. It's more style over substance though, so make sure to love the charme of the game, otherwise it's just a repetitive shallow game.
Slight recommendation.
6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197971411597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1604241805}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper is an RPG within an RPG : as a dungeon master, you gather a team of friends to be "the characters you'll play with", and each of your characters play another character inside the grand adventure of roleplaying, Inception style. Cool, uh ?

The "fictional adventure" is decent, but not very original or engaging unless you're a stat junkie or easily fall for nostalgia. The "game night advenure" is a complete static one and takes place around a table. 

From this point, your options to level things up are limited to your vicinity. And that's kinda boring even depressive the envision your progression as providing junk food or changing furniture. I thought the real joy of a gaming night was the emotions shared by the players.

Maybe the game should have been more accurately named Gaming Buddies of Ikea and Superstores. Didn't worked for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049035558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 2608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2484, 'last_played': 1431472392}
review:
At it's core, it's a game of numbers. Press a few buttons, watch the numbers get bigger. With a thin veil of strategy layered over top.  

That said, that thin veil of strategy is what makes the game enjoyable even with the skinner box design methodology. It's a game everyone should play at least once for the experience and it's a good game to keep in the backgrund of something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061993763', 'num_games_owned': 1152, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 859, 'last_played': 1423215289}
review:
Awesome game, funny idea of D&D simulator...
Dozens of easter eggs a lot of them very funny.
But with time the game gets repetitive as hell. Go there, bring this, kill a lot of those, and so on...
Not sure if want to play again.
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198133280884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1260, 'last_played': 1430764308}
review: Ele te prende, esse jogo tem um elemento que te segura e te envia pra dentro do jogo, é como se fosse um híbrido de RPG de turnos, RPG de mesa e RPG Eletrônico, agora, tudo isso, em maravilhosos 8bits juntos com uma trilha sonora que formam uma combinação alucinante e psicodélica. Você gasta várias horas. A melhor parte são as referências, desde Caça Fantasmas até Gremlins. Agora, se tivesse um modo cooperativo seria perfeito, sem sombra de dúvidas. 9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198050478086', 'num_games_owned': 1671, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1481757170}
review:
Knights of pen and paper is a turn based rpg with a lot of fourth breaking wall jokes and D&D style.
When the game starts the game master tells you to choose at least 2 heroes out of 6 initial classes, and 12 different "Races" having each a unique bonus, then as you win battles win gold to get more party members, upgrade the game master room, like having a pet for more attack, change the game master for yoda for more health and etc.
The combat system is okay but not great, maybe because this is a port from mobile devices so we have no hotkeys having to click a lot.
You can upgrade your blacksmith by giving him ore you either buy or mine at caverns in order to be able to purchase better weapons and armors, all having to roll a D20 dice in order to craft.
Any rpg fan should get this game and it's just 10$ for hours of fun (and tedious grinding, but what's a rpg without tedious grinding?)

author: {'steamid': '76561198107888561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 1825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1616794794}
review:
Lo cierto es que es un juego muy divertido y entrenido con el que te ries mucho no solo por los comentarios o personajes, sino tambien con los que te vas encontrando que hacen alusión al cine, la tv o los viedojuegos.
Las horas de juego estan muy bien, he tenido ocasión de pasarmelo en Android. Aunque si que si rebusco iré encontrando alguna que otra misión más.

Aunque al principio no tienes muchas clases de personajes los vas desbloqueando a medida que vas avanzando. Algo muy interesante es que esos nuevas clases las puedes ir añadiendo a nuevos jugadores que tendran que ir subiendo de nivel. Solo puedes tener 5 jugadores en la mesa, así que puedes dejar los personajes que menos te interesen en la cantina. 
Un aspecto muy positivo es que cuando te pasas el juego por primera vez todas las cosas que has ido comprando y desbloqueando las puedes usar en la partida siguiente.

Ahora queda probar la expansión. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198028386037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1421871302}
review:

The fighting is round based combat, final fantasy stile. You do not actualy wander around tho, instead your dungeon master reads the stuff you are apparently doing. Offers a lot of replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079822770', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1843, 'last_played': 1487034875}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040783171', 'num_games_owned': 884, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1397872244}
review:
Um RPG de mesa transportado para um RPG de computador, com seu guia podendo ser o mestre dos magos e ter personagens baseados até na Paris Hilton.
Knights of Pen and Paper traz uma lista enorme de qualidades, difícil dizer o que é ruim no jogo. O jogo preza pela comédia e faz referência a jogos, pessoas, histórias...
O combate do jogo é simples, em turnos e você define os ataques de seu personagem. Há uma gama enorme de profissões e magias que podem ser aprendidas. O jogo não traz um desafio muito grande (até você chegar nos dragões) e se você gosta de side quests não vai se arrepender em fazer todas elas (até para evoluir as classes e conseguir melhores armas).
Um ponto negativo fica para o sistema de moedas do jogo, no qual voc6e depende para tudo, desde reviver personagens até comprar e evoluir os personagens. É um sistema feito para compras dentro do jogo, mas que acaba atrapalhando porque uma hora acaba as side quests e você fica refém dessas moedas e não consegue evoluir.
Recomendado para quem gosta de um RPG com uma história rasa, mas que consegue ser divertido em todos os momentos!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028152357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1422009105}
review: The mobile version is far better. The controlls on the pc suck, and takes a lot of clicking around. Wish they had put in some short cut keys or controller support.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169733375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1995, 'last_played': 1421976985}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper has its charm, albeit it is not well-maintained throughout the game. The dialogues are funny, the characters and classes available for selection are varied, and its simple UI design makes it easy to get into. There are many features you can play around with, like the ability to decorate your room with items that grant bonuses to stats, and trying out different party setups after you've unlocked new classes and players. You also get to pick and choose which quests to do. The experience you receive from completing quests is also scaled according to your levels, so doing the lower level ones that you missed won't be a complete waste of your time when you're level grinding.

On the minus side, the quests are fairly uninspired and they get repetitive. The battles eventually suffer from the same flaw as well. I only did the storyline quests and the ones that unlocked new classes. The story itself is also quite weak. There's nothing compelling or awe-inspiring to it. Having a great story is certainly not one of this game's selling points. Despite all the shortfalls, Knights of Pen and Paper can still keep you entertained for hours until the repetitiveness catches up and playing the game becomes more like a chore, where you're still playing because you haven't unlocked the other achievements yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104538734', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1426179703}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996636565', 'num_games_owned': 950, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1421704045}
review:
My first impression was really good. Nice style, humor, cool idea overall. Not only you choose your classes, but also the "people" who play them.

Sadly, after an hour or so of gameplay, it gets too grindy. It turns into a lot of very similar encounters without enough depth to them. Also the music gets really repetitive... The mobile roots can be noticed...

I'd like to recommend this game, because the idea seems to have a great potential. However, it's just not fun for me after a couple hours, and still a long time before the end. I'd love to see a sequel with less grindy fights and more gameplay apart from combat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162883951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 914, 'last_played': 1418992359}
review: Decent old style RPG, but a bit repetitive. Still worth a shot if you get it on sale  8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198045703002', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1382, 'last_played': 1422485838}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition is a turn based RPG game set in a scenario that is a, well, table top pen and paper game, the game starts out with you choosing two starting party members from a specific selection of characters and classes, for example, a jock and a warrior, each character having their own little passive buffs, such as the Jock having a +1 to attack.
Whilst the concept is nice, the gameplay tried and true, and characters, classes, and enemies all nicely diverse, and the quests a bit repetetive, you might begin to become a bit tired of doing the typical selection of escort, kill set number of enemies, or rescue quests, that is, only if you're not a fan of games such as this.
Overall, the game is a fun one, with a humorous setting and story, I highly reccomend it if you're a fan of turn based RPGs, or RPGs in general, and even more so if you enjoy humorous games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050165022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1439115775}
review:
It is very good game for its price, cannot ask more!

This game took traditional methods of classic table top Dungeon and Dragon (DnD) RPG with modern turn based approach. Just imagine playing Pokemon with DnD approach. The storyline is pretty much linear in my opinion, but I really like the writtings. Jokes and some references are pretty on point in this game (although not in Borderlands level). The sounds are mediocre, neither good or bad, it just suit the game. The pixel arts are pretty and fit with the game theme. Overall, is not a big RPG game like Earthbound or classic Final Fantasy, however this game offers compact gameplay and without hassle. I play this game in the mean time everytime I get bored with studying or programming for ~30 minutes. Definitely a worth game to play!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969372390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 2310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1264, 'last_played': 1516067114}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper is a throwback to old school table top rpg's.  At least it presents it self that way.  You have a dungeon master that sits at a table along with your party.  He tells a story and provides quests for you to do.  It's a pretty easy game and fun too.  You can determine how the game is played.  You want to just solo it, bring 5 different classes along, fight just 1 monster or 7.. it's your call.

All in all if you dig the graphics and of course like rpg's this game is a definite play through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053933638', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1425677130}
review: Who'd have expected this total streamlining of RPG mechanics to be so addictive?

author: {'steamid': '76561198048887844', 'num_games_owned': 1966, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2715, 'last_played': 1421712090}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper +1 is a ported mobile game (with a swath of improvements).  You control a DM and players as you embark on a traditional adventure for glory (and xp and gold and loot).

There are plenty of sidequests to give you a break from the main quest if you desire and you can even just sit and farm monsters if you prefer.

The writing is funny and drops plenty of references.  It can be a little rough at times, as though it was translated or written by a non-native speaker.

However, if you have a tabletop itch to scratch, this will surely satisfy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073495745', 'num_games_owned': 35, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1469464152}
