author: {'steamid': '76561198067263809', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 942, 'last_played': 1494911252}
review:
[u]The Good[/u]: Fun premise, mixing the tropes of D&D-style tabletop gaming and [i]Final Fantasy[/i]-esque RPG combat, with the usual nods to post-Tolkien high fantasy worlds. There's a solid dose of fun pop culture references (from Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles and Super Mario Brothers in the sewer dungeon, to Pirates of the Caribbean and the Creature from the Black Lagoon in the seaside areas). And it's not just gratuitious name-checking either -- all of it is properly statted out and integrated into the gameplay.

[u]The Bad[/u]: Admittedly, it's hardly ground-breaking stuff, especially if you're partial to comedy/parody RPGs. It's not quite as witty or clever as its web-based counterparts like [i][url=http://kingdomofloathing.com]Kingdom of Loathing[/url][/i] or [i][url=http://game.cardhunter.com]Card Hunter[/url][/i]. But even as someone who liked both those games, I wasn't disappointed -- I'm now at 10 hours play time and counting.

[u]The Ugly[/u]: Less-than-ideal game balance. It definitely appears to favor particular player/class combos over others, to the point that it's damn near impossible to last the higher levels with certain oddball party compositions, which kinda takes out some of the fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146331835', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1421584738}
review: This game is probably the best RPG that I have played for a LONG time. I love the humour and the detail that has gone into this game. Would recommend it to anyone!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047656545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2804, 'last_played': 1421500276}
review:
The first thing that really impressed me about KoPaP+1, is that it recognised my eyefinity multi-monitor setup without skipping a beat and started in native resolution on my central (designated no. 1) monitor. The second is the pixel art, which is sumptious and extremely well done.

This is a light and amusing game, paying homage to tabletop RPGs and early 90s cRPGs. If you have reservations in respect of the gold buying facility which is apparently a feature of the tablet versions, it is disabled in the PC version. At first I found the concept a little too meta and self-referential, but the humour grew on me to the point where I found myself laughing and recalling real pen and paper sessions where the GM and players said almost exactly the same things the characters in game were saying.

If you are trying for full completion of achievements, keep in mind that your gold is common between all your saved games, so you can accumulate a good amount of reserves to equip the uber party you create for the 365/465 day completion achieve. This is probably the most elusive while the similarly rare 50 dungeon complete achieve requires no particular strategy except an appetite for doing the same thing over and over again. I've found resetting or upgrading a party which has completed the game and replaying the content at a higher level to be the best way of accumulating gold for such an attempt.

Wait for a decent sale price and you will get at least 25hrs of entertainment for a reasonable sum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084000741', 'num_games_owned': 606, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1456957485}
review:
I have played and finished this game and it's lovely. If you have played some dungeon&dragons-like games in the past, it will bring fond memories. Some of the phrases and quips of the characters are spot on, and it all brings you back to that D&D atmosphere very well.

The game principles are quite simple, there is a number of characters, each character has 4 skills, you can loot or buy wearable items and consumables, you can upgrade your weapons. Battles are turn-based, one action per turn. Simple, but also enjoyable and sufficient to help you enjoy yet another D&D adventure.

The questing is well done, there is a main story line, but in any place you have a set of pre-created generic side quests that you can activate at any moment in order to gain more experience or items. You can also set up a custom fight any time. When setting up a fight, you choose how many and which creatures you're going to fight with, and the reward reflects that. I very much like this approach.

There are a few dungeons in the game, which force you to stock up some healing items in the inventory if you want to explore it all, survive, and kill the boss. Again, similar to the D&D theme.

There is good humor in the game, I liked it. After some hours it gets a bit repetitive, but it doesn't hold you up. The music is a bit more of a problem, there are just a few songs in the game, so it gets old quickly. A few more songs would be nice.

Please note I've played this game on an Android tablet, not a PC, so I'm seeing this in a bit different perspective. The greatest benefit of this game for me was that it is an enjoyable game that can easily be played in a public transport during commuting, therefore offline and turn-based. This is an ideal game for your phone or tablet. If you intend to play this on PC, you might expect a bit more complex game mechanics, because you're fully concentrated on the game and you have a big screen. In that case, my opinion might not apply that well.

Highly recommended, especially if you plan to play this on a mobile device (not the Steam version, though, of course).

author: {'steamid': '76561198074881838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1194, 'last_played': 1530217260}
review:
[h1]Картате вар'ятство[/h1]

Чого-чого, а таких веселощів я від ціє забавки не очікував. Ця клята "кнопкотиснява" втягнула мене у вир пригод на добрячих таки декілька днів. І як вона мене дибнула, так і не попускає. Ідеальний сюжет, який я так і не встиг уловити (певно, що тут його нема!), інтригуючі завдання, скажені почвари, цікаві локації. Це збірний образ усіх моїх вимог до рольової гри. Я вражений і знімаю капелюха перед розробниками.

[b]Best game ever, long live the developers![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198000002438', 'num_games_owned': 577, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1689, 'last_played': 1615513205}

author: {'steamid': '76561198115461516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 2022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1112, 'last_played': 1478218501}
review:
I really, really, really want to recommend this game. It's a cool little game and a bit addictive to boot. Had I written this review after just an hour then it would have been an enthusiastic yes! However, it has a serious flaw; it is so repetitive in nature that eventually you'll find yourself playing for the sake of it. I skip dialogs. I auto-click through tedious battles. I just want the game to be completed. My desire to achieve that has, well, almost been depleted. I made a few errors on my first go at the game. The thought of restarting fills me full of dread. There's no way I could grind my way through the game again and have any fun doing so.

The game seems to lack keyboard controls, and all the mouse movement is RSI inducing. I'm sure its better on a touchscreen, but this is a review of the PC version. The developers really should look into enabling some keyboard controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997906414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1428599348}
review: Awesome! I love RPG games and this one is like taking it back to the retro days. If you're a huge fan of the Pokemon series you would love this! I've never played Dungeons and Dragons, but I believe this is exactly how that game is played. It's so fun, so much to do in it, and endless really! Join the wagon!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970630958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1420737532}
review:
This game was included in one of the bundles I bought so i really didn't know what to expect jumping into it, but I must say after 8 hours of playing this game it's really fun.  The humor in this game is pretty good, the gameplay is spot on to any older style turn based RPG and they have enough classes to constantly change up your party.   I will definitely be keeping an eye out for future game releases from the devs.

Great Game!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061710488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1675704642}
review:
Paradox Interactive and Behold Studios have created a labor of love with this little game.  This retro style RPG does an amazing job at bringing both the experience of a DnD session and a 90's style JRPG to you with plenty of toungue-in-cheek, modern humor to liven things up.  The classes are all very interesting and provide you with many unique ways to play their skills off of each other.  Battles are quickly paced and fairly designed; if you lose it's your fault.  If I had any critisism at it would be that the game is easier than it should be.  Granted, I grew up in the 90's so I'm a grizzled, RPG veteren at this point but I would still say a small difficulty spike would have raised this game to even greater heights.  

If you have even a smidge of love for Pen and Paper style role play this game is a must purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072202664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1397594316}
review:
Interesting in the beginning and it does offer a lot of variation, but personally I would not play it again - the fights get boring very soon. Story seems OK. I like the transition between D&D fantasy world and real world of players behind the table. Some parts are hilarious and add flavour to the game. The crafting system IS HARD AS HELL and can make you ragequit.

Although as a game for mobile phones this is very neat and reminds me of old Pokemon Gold I used to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054126859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1419360353}
review: As far as turn based adventures go, this one is one of the most creative I've played. Simple battle style, but plenty of mobs and heroes to choose from and lots to explore. I'm a big fan of anything with upgrades, and this one has many, as well as little easter eggs to unlock. It's not meant to be taken seriously like a lot of fantasy turn-based strategy, which is what makes it so spectacular.

review: Very enjoyable game, mixes Dungeons and Dragons with real life.  Whimsical game with lots of fun stereotypes.  Some of the item finding quests can be tedious though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027279354', 'num_games_owned': 1808, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1457905949}
review:
Really impressive and addictive game. A good mix of cRPG, tabletop RPG and Pixel Art. One one hand, you just play it like an old, gameboy RPG game. On the other hand you are leading a group of players with a Game Master buying a new powerups.

Although there's a moment (somewhere around 20th-25th level), when you have not anough levels to go on with a main quests and need to gain some with random encounters. There should be a little bit more side quests to keep up with needs of new monsters. That's why I didn't finish the game. It's too boring to walk around and just have fight after fight.

Also I recommend to you the mobile version o the game. It's same as the Steam one, but can be played during the travel. And that's where I have spent tons of hours playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052267322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1593663670}
review:
Fiquei surpreso com a fidelidade desse joguinho com o sentimento do autentico RPG de mesa. Embora seja um RPG bastante simples, não deixa de reunir diversos elementos que o tornam um bom jogo. 

O jogo começa apenas com o Mestre e uma dupla de jogadores. A história vai se desenrolando e a medida que vamos descobrindo e completando as mais diferentes missões, somos recompensados com gold, que será usado das mais diversas maneiras, não apenas dentro do mundo de fantasia, mas no quarto onde os jogadores e o mestre estão. Ao acumular gold, podemos chamar mais jogadores e criar os mais diversos grupos com as mais variadas personalidades, como um hippie clérigo ou uma professora berserker, ou mesmo a vovozinha ladrão ou mesmo o roqueiro guerreiro.

In game, o gold também é usado para comprar e forjar melhoramentos de arma e armadura para cada personagem criado, podendo ser usado apenas cinco jogadores (pois na mesa só cabem cinco!), na qual, caso sejam chamados mais jogadores, estes ficam em aguardo em qualquer taverna do reino.

Mas aqui vai um destaque do jogo e que faz o diferencial. Durante todo o tempo, uma cena peculiar sempre estará presente, independente do que estiver acontecendo: haverá uma grande mesa (com alguns objetos compráveis que darão os mais diversos bônus para o grupo), um mestre de frente para os jogadores, e estes até o máximo de cinco. Ao longo da narrativa, todo o cenário do quarto irá mudar, de acordo com o que está sendo narrado, mas a cena descrita estará sempre lá, com direito a comentários, trocadilhos, conversas e todo tipo de piadinha relacionada ao RPG.

A sensação de RPG de mesa é muito forte. Porém, o começo pode ser um pouco monótono (como quase todo RPG), visto que não há uma história palpável e personagens fracos até, mais ou menos, o nivel 10~15. Evoluir é rápido, mas pode ser repetitivo no começo, exigindo um pouco de paciência para quem quiser tirar o melhor desse joguinho.

Eu fortemente recomendo este jogo para qualquer amante de RPG, possuindo um preço bastante acessível em épocas de promoção. E é em Português. Bônus para KPP+1. =)

author: {'steamid': '76561198032075179', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1401628920}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072492823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1518671046}
review: Fun game to play with lots of references. If you enjoy pen and paper in general this is for you, although it is not nearly as complex as TDE or DnD. Very beginner friendly, but the lack of options makes combat kind of repetitive after a few hours. The fact that you have to fight the same enemy 7 times before you can progress in the story does not help neither.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076285282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1154, 'last_played': 1505370284}
review: This game is great for a light hearted RPG. I started playing on my mobile while commuting on the train, then upgraded to my laptop for a transatlantic flight. The game can be beat leisurely in a few days, and is never frustratingly difficult. There is a certain quantity of grinding required as in most RPGs, but the true "need" to grind is pretty low. Money and XP are attainable, unlockable classes are fun, and the story is lightheartedly entertaining. I certainly recommend giving the game a chance if you want a light spin on the simulated DnD tabletop style RPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110520529', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1415602198}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969333093', 'num_games_owned': 590, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1418301149}
review:
I love this game.  Everything about it has an old-school feel that blends tabletop RPGs with NES graphics.  There is a lot of grinding in this game, but that's what RPGs are about.  You choose your initial characters from an assortment of people who each have their own unique bonuses, then pick a class for them based on those bonuses and what you want in your party.  

If you make challenging enough fights, they require a bit of strategy.  My paladin typically casts a shield to reduce damage by 50%, then increases his threat to draw attention, while my rogue stuns people for 3 turns (thanks to items I have that extend the time by 2 turns).  My mage will either AoE the entire group or fireball for a burning DoT.  My cleric has a powerful single heal, decent group heal, an offensive move called smite, and a debuff on 3 enemy's attack strength.  My newest addition, the berserker, goes berserk (I can't choose his targets but he gains extra damage and regen) and has passives/equipment that boost his crit rate above 30% while also allowing him to heal for 63% of his total damage.  And those are just my 5 classes, there's quite a few more to unlock as you play.

The grinding part comes in two forms.  You'll find yourself moving back and forth to caves often to get grindstones to upgrade your blacksmith.  You'll also want to fight a lot, and grind quests to earn gold.  Gold can be spent buying yourself some equipment at the blacksmith, or on a whole bunch of upgrades to the room you play in, the table you play on, etc.  Purchases made will give your party bonuses, such as higher RNG die rolls, more gold/exp, boosted stats, regen, etc.

There's always something to do in this game.  It can be tedious at times, but the humor of the game, including comments from the game master and party members help to ease this.  Overall, I think it would be a worthy addition to anyone's library who is a fan of old school RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989827790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1412531863}
review: Lengthy RPG with no relationship to anything that makes tabletop gaming good (freedom of choice, drama, reactivity) which tries to sell itself by blandly satirising outdated stereotypes of PnP RPG hobby with all the scathing wit of a Half-Orc Barbarian. Tedious to play and seldom funny.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994586734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 14685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10855, 'last_played': 1407635283}
review: Retro graphic style, classic RPG.  Actually kinda fun to the point where I was intent on finishing it.  Too bad the story got goofy near the end and the final boss was ridiculously difficult.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041307414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1445290144}
review:
If you like classic Tabletop/RPGs then this brings the best of both worlds together (Tabletop and Video Games).
Controls are so simplistic and the game runs on very little resources that a lower end mini tablet can run this game without any problems, while still offering that classic RPG challenge.

The references and Easter Eggs that pay homage to older RPG style games are just the + in "+1 Edition"
If you find yourself looking for some time to kill I recommend playing this game (at full price, but you can never beat a good deal).

author: {'steamid': '76561198099295469', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1434302591}
review:
I'm not the biggest fan of RPG, for some reason I just can't play this genre for much long, but this game it's one of the rare exceptions that sometimes i have the pleasure to discover. I bought this game on a brazilian version of humble bundle, i installed and gave a chance to the independent brazilian games and god, the best decision ever. I spent hours and hours in this game without getting tired, it has all the "must have's" of a classic RPG with soft humor that makes all the difference, a beautiful pixel art, great dialogues.

 TL;DR 9/10  You're wasting playable time reading this analysis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044915116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1417865431}
review:
Cute game, but needlessly difficult.  

My game functionally ended when enough of my party died that I couldn't reliably fight and didn't have enough cash to resurrect anyone.  Could I have farmed for the money in low level fights?  Yes.  Was that prospect enjoyable?  Not in the least.

I do enjoy that while the game has some pretty standard stereotypes of gamers, it also embraces women, jocks, and businessmen, amongst others, at the table.  

All the geek culture shout-outs were amusing.

Still, any game I can't finish isn't a game I'm going to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030902621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1521252439}
review:
Knights of pen and paper is a decent game for passing the time. For a ten dollar game, you get a cute little game full of references of both dnd and pop cultural stuff.

Gameplay's can get tedious, the music getting rather grating after a while since it has a one 30 second music loop for a fight. It's definitly not a game for extended play.

You're better off having a small party, around 3 people or so. Having 4-5 people in your party really punishes your leveling leading to a lot more grinding to keep up with the game's quick level pace.

The game has microtransactions, though it's really bizarre why they decided to. You can buy gold for real money but I never really found myself short on money in the game for what I wanted to do.

6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198033999305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1413486415}
review:
I liked this game. The gameplay mechanics were simple and fun. There was lots of customisation (in some sense), though i would say that the game was really straight forward. 

Some parts would get repetitive, if you like grinding and stuff, i guess you won't mind, else it would get rather bothersome.

Ultimately, this game is fun to play and would kill a few hours of your time. I would recommend this game, it is good value for money if on discount (I'd usually do not buy games when they are not XD).

author: {'steamid': '76561198045768026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1696521034}
review:
Für Rollenspielfreunde; Als alter DSA-Fan habe ich einige Nettigkeiten, die für Spielrunden typisch sind, mit einem Schmunzeln wiedererkannt. Nicht den Fehler machen und durch die Dialoge klicken, dann entgeht einem einiges vom Spaß und das Spiel wird zu einem Hack and Slay.

Ich empfehle, die Spracheinstellung auf Englisch zu belassen, da die deutschen Begriffe über die Buttons hinausragen. Das Spiel ist imho auch mit geringen Englsichkenntnissen gut spielbar und der Retro-Look recht hübsch anzusehen.

10/10 would buy again

author: {'steamid': '76561198027488651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2176, 'last_played': 1440270159}
review:
For those of you who want to upgrade to the deluxier version even if you purchased the original, one way you can try is to use the purchase for self link on the web browser version of steam:
https://store.steampowered.com/checkout/?purchasetype=self
You then keep on spamming the purchase button to try and get into paypal. Most of the time it will say "you already have the game" but if you keep switching payment methods and keep trying to click on purchase, it will eventually take you to the paypal confirmation page.
The other way is to buy it through another game sales website (it has starts with gamer and ends with gate), if you still can't upgrade it through here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013056652', 'num_games_owned': 663, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1477917274}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067326071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 6799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3394, 'last_played': 1572284759}
review:
SOOO MUUUUCH FUUUUN!!! I totally recommend this game to ANYBODY who has played D&D ever! It’s just a fun romp of the whole table top genre. It’s got so many background references that I started looking harder in areas to revisit anything that I might have missed. This game is totally worth getting. 

As for gameplay, it’s really easy to figure out what is what. I figured everything out in the first 5 minutes. Unfortunately for those who haven't played D&D, it may be a little hard to understand what is what. (Considering this is steam, and its PC gamers we are talking about here: I’m pretty sure that it would be a safe bet to say that many, if not all, have done some version of D&D if not something similar. Dragon Age, D&D on PC, Etc.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198067646487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1416766841}
review: It's worth playing, but worth a lot less than the asking price.  It's a cute game and it' s funny, but the gameplay really suffers.  The escort missions are really awful and greatly detract from the overall experience with forced encounters that pose no challenge or threat and simply waste your time.  Another bad mission is the "gather the 5 desert flowers... 8 furs... 5 glitches..." It's quite contrived, which doesn't help when the story is very minimalistic.  The overworld map is the absolute enemy to this game.  That map really ruins the pacing of the game, if moving from one location to another wasn't so boring and time-comsuming the game would feel a lot better.  The combat is good, but could be improved.  If the enemies could have more interesting abilities then the grindy nature of game could be helped a lot.  It would be great if there were more D&D-like mechanics included, because that would be appropriate with the theme and would be fun.  It's art and style were fun enough for me to recommend, but if you were looking for an good RPG then look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021059768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1424880102}
review: La sintesi di una vita passata tra gdr e D&d, risate e momenti di vita vissuta reale...molto semplice comunque, e niente di eccezionale ma le espressioni dei giocatori valgono il prezzo del biglietto! Fruibile e divertente!

author: {'steamid': '76561198116204694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1121, 'last_played': 1443788596}
review:
¿Alguna vez has jugado [b]juegos de rol analógicos	 [/b]? (con lápiz y papel)

Antiguamente, antes que se hayan masificado los RPG digitales en computadores, consolas y otros, los jugadores se juntaban en alguna casa, encargaban comida y preparaban la partida de rol sobre una mesa central. Luego, todos se sentaban alrededor de la mesa y escuchaban atentamente lo que el [i]Game Master[/i] tenía que decir. Elegías una raza y una profesión, y salías a cumplir misiones con la esperanza de encontrar algún tesoro y [i]levelear[/i] a tu personaje. 

El Maestro relataba la historia, describía los lugares, y decidía los enemigos que se interponían en el camino de los héroes; mientras que los jugadores tomaban las decisiones y administraban los puntos de habilidad de sus personajes. 

El maestro decía "Al atravesar la colina, encuentran un castillo de aspecto derruido y tenebroso; si quieren obtener el tesoro, deberán entrar al castillo, al cual pueden acceder por la puerta central, o intentar infiltrarse por las alcantarillas subterráneas". Los jugadores debían ponerse de acuerdo con el resto del grupo, y decidir si ir por la puerta central, o bien internarse por las cloacas: "Decido ir por las alcantarillas". "Muy bien" -respondía el Maestro- "Sin embargo la corriente es fuerte y te arrastra peligrosamente, si quieres sobrevivir deberás sacar 5 o más en los dados".

[b]Knights of Pen and Paper	 [/b] es un juego que se basa en ese mismo concepto. En este juego, tú no eres el paladín enano o el arquero elfo, tú eres un jugador común y corriente que decide juntarse en la casa de un amigo a jugar como se hacía según la vieja escuela: con un librillo, un lápiz y un dado. 

Por lo demás, es exactamente igual a la mayoría de los juegos de rol de combates por turno: eliges un grupo de guerreros, cumples misiones, combates a los enemigos, compras tu equipo y pociones, salvas princesas, exploras diferentes tierras, distribuyes puntos de experiencia entre tus personajes, y compras ciertos artefactos que mejoran tus habilidades. 

Todo ello a través de una estética [i]pixeleada[/i] y una nostálgica música estilo 8 bits que recuerdan Pokemon de gameboy advance, y una muy entretenida historia llena de humor, y fantásticos combates por turno.

[b]Puntos positivos:	 [/b]
(1) Estilo esencialmente original
(2) Mucha libertad
(3) Jugabilidad satisfactoria pero sencilla 
(4) Gran potencial de rejugabilidad  
(5) Traducido al español

[b]Puntos negativos:	 [/b]
(1) Baja dificultad en cuanto a la infinita e ilimitada posibilidad de [i]levelear [/i]a tus personajes
(2) Falta de instructivos

[b]Recomendación:	 [/b] Knights of Pen and Paper es de esos juegos enviciantes y tremendamente absorbentes. Si lo disfrutas como yo, probablemente olvidarás comer y ducharte. ¡Recomendado!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995932271', 'num_games_owned': 548, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1145, 'last_played': 1422640157}

author: {'steamid': '76561198120132735', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1122, 'last_played': 1635420165}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition uzun soluklu ve güzel bir oyun.RPG,PixelArt tarzı oyunları seviyorsanız kesinlikle almanızı öneririm,pişman olmayacaksınız.

Oyunun Artı Yanları:
+Oynanışı çok zor değil
+Görevleri anlamak kolay
+Bazı özellikler oldukça gerçekçi(yolda düşman saldırısına uğramak gibi)
+Demirci,Meyhane ve Simyacı gibi kısımlar
+Kullanımı kolay harita
+Karakter sayısı fazla ve karakterlerin hepsi özgün
+Görev sayısı oldukça fazla

Oyunun Eksi Yanları:
-Bazı görevlerin zorluğu orantısız.
-Yolculuk yapmak için oyun parası olan altından harcamanız gerekiyor.

Genel Puan:90

author: {'steamid': '76561198043887343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1771, 'last_played': 1417668620}
review:
You can probably tell at a glance whether you will like this game. If you are a fan of the Pixel Art style and enjoy RPGs, then you will love Knights of Pen and Paper. Otherwise, move along. This game is quirky, entertaining, and more robust than a lot of people give it credit for. 

The last game I bought on Steam before Knights of Pen and Paper was Final Fantasy III, and I have to say, I actually think KoPaP has a better class system than FFIII. I certainly enjoyed it a lot more. There are six classes available at first, with another six that you can unlock for future playthroughs by completing side quests throughout the game. Each class has four abilities which you can upgrade over time as the character levels up. These abilities can either be passive (increasing attack power, critical chance, physical resistance, etc.) or active (dealing extra damage, buffing friendly units, etc.), and the variety of different classes and different abilities means that you can come up with different strategies and play styles on each and every playthrough.

This game has a ton of replay value. Setting up a unique and balanced party is half the fun--the other half is learning how to make the most out of the combinations you choose. And since each of the twelve (or seventeen) playable characters has unique traits as well (such as extra experience, extra luck, or skill bonuses), this game provides way more variety between one playthrough and the next than you might think from the "casual" label the game has earned from a lot of people. 

Furthermore, KoPaP's gameplay successfully solves some of the problems inherent in turn-based RPGs--including Final Fantasy III. Turn order is determined at random at the start of every battle (bases on each character and enemy's Initiative stat), but it stays the same throughout the entire battle. Thus, the game allows you to strategize, knowing exactly which characters get to move when, but still introduces an element of randomness that makes every battle feel unique. Consecutive fights against the exact same enemies will play out differently and require slightly different strategies.

Visually, KoPaP makes clever and effective use of the faux-8-bit style that's currently so popular in indie games. When characters from other Behold Studios games appear as part of certain quests, the humorously obvious contrast between the blocky KoPaP characters and the much higher-resolution guest characters serves to remind you that this game looks the way it does as a matter of choice--not of hardware or software limitations. 

The backgrounds in nearly every area you visit are loaded with minimalistically rendered pop culture references, from Lord of the Rings to Captain America. But these references get annoying quickly once they start working their way into the game's main plotlines. What is amusing as a background easter egg comes across as cheesy, clunky, and unfitting as a major foreground element. The game tries to spin these pop culture interpositions as an inside joke about how real-world RPG dungeon masters come up with their material, but the joke, in my opinion, falls flat. 

Therein lies one potential pitfall of the game: KoPaP derives most of its humor from stereotypes and inside jokes about real-world RPG players. Sometimes, the game strikes on some genuinely amusing and accessible ideas. All of the original twelve playable characters are pretty funny--from Hynx (the hardcore guy who came up with his own lame fantasy name) to Mr. John (the totally normal business man who plays in his scanty spare time) to Grandma (who doesn't know what's going on and wants everyone else to speak up). But after a few hours, you'll probably be pretty bored with characters complaining about stupid quests. Or asking for the hundredth time whether someone can order a pizza. Or worse, laughing at the game's own jokes. Self-congratulation is never funny or desirable in a video game.

The game has other flaws as well. KoPaP was made by a Brazilian company, which is really cool. But the localization is really spotty, and--especially as you get closer to the end of the game--a lot of the dialogue is totally garbled and difficult to make out. Given how much of the humor and plot of this game depends on dialogue for delivery, that's a pretty serious problem. Also, outside of a single box of flavor text when you first create a character, none of the playable characters has any unique dialogue. Each character simply gets assigned different lines of text that are the exact same on every playthrough. And while it can be amusing to hear Grandma complain about why there aren't more hot girls in the game's quests, the canned dialogue gets old once you've already seen it once or twice. 

For the most part, the game does a good job "scaling" enemies so that you are always at an appropriate level to tackle  the main storyline quests. But towards the end of the game, more enemies gain powerful abilities that can make them much harder than their level suggests. You will face some frustrations from enemies that are pushovers in one battle and obliterate you in the next. The game also helpfully tells you approximately what level of enemies you will face in any specific quest. But there are a lot of mistakes--particularly on quests that have you going to multiple locations or that show up as a set--which can lead to you stumbling into difficult areas before you're ready (or abandoning a quest halfway through). 

Really, I can only see two truly "casual" elements to this game. First, you can save and quit at any point when you aren't fighting enemies. It's a nice touch, since it means you can play this game for five minutes or two hours. But, second, this game shows its "casual" nature in that you will probably start to get bored if you play for much more than an hour or an hour-and-a-half at once. For one thing, the game's story is pretty goofy and trivial--more entertaining than engrossing. And there are only so many variations on the "go to X, battle Y" formula that the game can throw you before it gets a little tiresome. Seriously. The gameplay in this game consists entirely of traveling to different areas and fighting different enemies. Of course, combat is fun and engaging, but the game is still better in small doses.

If all that sounds appealing to you, then buy this game. I bought it on sale, and I have really enjoyed it. It's just fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042721907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1372091313}
review:
I don't really enjoy it that much I mean you'd probably love it if you thought the ios version was crap.
I got nothin else to say so have a cookie recipe
INGREDIENTS:
1 cup butter, softened
1 cup white sugar
1 cup packed brown sugar
2 eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
3 cups all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
2 teaspoons hot water
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 cups semisweet chocolate chips
1 cup chopped walnuts
DIRECTIONS:
1.	Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
2.	Cream together the butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla. Dissolve baking soda in hot water. Add to batter along with salt. Stir in flour, chocolate chips, and nuts. Drop by large spoonfuls onto ungreased pans.
3.	Bake for about 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until edges are nicely browned.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011703826', 'num_games_owned': 1733, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1415569666}
review:
SCORE: 7.8/10

It is a pretty enjoyable game with a lot of nice touches and quirks, as well as homages to many things from pop culture and your childhood as a steadfast nerd. I would recommend this game on sale, but probably not at full price (but this goes for almost every game, so that is not much of a slight on this game). It does get a bit repetitive and personally, I don't think it has much replay value. It is unique and probably worth a play at the right price for the right gamer, which is spot on for a "good" game with a 7ish rating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064279115', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1420035161}
review:
Se você já jogou games estilo pokemon ou se é fã de RPG de mesa, Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition é a fórmula certa para você. O jogo é realmente excelente: primor, fineza estrutural e gráficos agradáveis em um só pacote. É absoluta e impreterivelmente viciante.

Além disso, os criadores são de Brasília! Virei fã da Behold Studios. Pode comprar que nao se arrependerá.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077637717', 'num_games_owned': 16, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1418687096}
review:
Sinceramente,por ser um jogo BR,eu fiquei cabreiro,mas ao tentar arriscar,jogando pela primeira vez,fiquei admirado pelo incrivel trabalho realizado pela equipe de nosso país.Custando apenas R$ 16,99 , ele proporciona a experiencia de uma real 
partida de rpg de mesa.Com várias situações de humor,e gameplay fácil e acessível a todos ,tem a história simples,mas viciante.Contendo vários e vários elementos de um verdadeiro rpg de mesa,pode ser um ótimo título para que gosta disso que citei.
   Os gráficos são pixelizados ,parecidos com jogos de 8-bits.A dificuldade,para mim , foi uma das melhores sacadas dele :
TU ESCOLHES SUA DIFICULDADE DURANTE CADA LUTA !!! ASSIM É POSSÍVEL PÔR 1 ATÉ 5 INIMIGOS,DE DIFICULDADE FÁCIL À HARDCORE !!!!!!!!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997370410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1472142162}
review:
A great casual game. It really only has the one game mechanic, as if you're in a battle in a final fantasy game, or any turn-based RPG - Each turn you choose to battle / magic / item, and your party defeats monsters. An interesting aspect of this game is that you control the number and difficulty of most of the encounters. But graphically, there is not much beyond what you see in the trailer. Besides the world map, and the table where your party sits, you don't move around.

It could get boring for some, if you're not looking for an endless battle; but the game is as difficult or as easy as you choose to make it. I definitely think it's worth it. It's very easy to pick up and play a few minutes at a time, as there's no learning curve. There are enough random encounters, and it's well polished, this game will keep me entertained for hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991103051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 252, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1415488250}
review:
If you've ever played an mmo like WoW and during the quests you would often get to get x amount of y thing or kill x amount of z monsters and you thought, "Holy crap that sounds, and is, like the most fun I have ever had!" then this game is for you!

It starts off grabing your interest with a prision escape and a cute art style and 'dnd' type set up, but quickly wears down into a slogging grind fest. There isn't any decisions to be made (As one would expect from a dnd game) or strategy, and there isn't even any dice rolling aside from travel or sleeping. 

The classes are un balanced like crazy. The mage and the cleric are easily the best classes in the game. The rogue is in 3rd at average and the warrior and paladin are just complete garbage. The characters dont do anything story wise and there is no banter or personality to them.

The character sheets are pretty boring. Each character gets 3 active skills and 1 passive that you can level up. However the skills are just about asa basic and uninteresting as you can get. The mage has a fireball, Frostbolt, meteor, and mana increase skill. The Cleric has smite, heal all, heal one, and a damage debuff skill. The rogue has a stealth, double strike, disable, and posion skill. The warrior has a healing, damage debuff, cleave, and one more skill I forgot. And the paladin has a shield, heal, aggro strike, and defense increase skill. B-O-R-I-N-G!!!

You do have a nice selection of buyable items to give buffs thought. Various items/props/food and even the dm can be changed. I do think that is nice and adds some charm to the game. The equipable items however, are again boring +to stat upgrades. Nothing cool or interesting.

I hate not recommending this game as it is a solid concept that I hope to see expanded and improved in the future, but in its current state it just isn't worth your time or money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970573281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1231, 'last_played': 1383596134}
review:
テーブルトークのノリを再現し、戦闘と買い物にコンテンツを集中したRPGです。
途中メタ的な展開もあり、なかなかストーリーは楽しませてくれます。
反面ゲーム内容は主軸の戦闘が敵味方ともスキルや要素に乏しく、同じ敵のレベル違いとひたすら戦う場面も多いため、かなり早い段階で飽きます。
一応アイテムドロップはありますが、基本的にひたすらお金を集めて強化するという展開も、感覚の飽和に拍車をかけます。
もうひとつでもコンテンツがあれば、なにか戦闘にトレードオフな選択を迫る要素があれば。
素材というかコンセプトは良いのですが、最後まで続かないというタイトルです。惜しい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198096667372', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1448524161}
review:
这游戏居然出了DLC......我只能说果然是大P社......
虽然我现在不会入DLC，还是提醒大家衫果卖15RMB......

优点：游戏是好游戏，与其说是黑老式RPG做出的游戏不如说就是老式RPG。
特色是可以控制一次打怪的个数，不过也就是让刷刷刷更方便而已。
难度不大，只要好好利用技能点就可以了。后期主要是在刷钱做装备，但其实没有好装备也差不多能打。

缺点：我感觉最大的槽点是BGM，虽然我知道是要做出8Bit风格，可也太难听了吧！严重影响游戏体验，不关掉的话，玩20分钟就头疼。

还有我当年年轻入了豪华版，现在想想当时我就是傻逼。

review:
Классная игрушка! И стилем, и игровой механикой, и музыкальным оформлением, и сюжетом... Может излишне простая - здесь нет огромного ветвистого дерева прокачки, но разнообразия в игре более чем достаточно. И юмор, в игре отличный юмор. Правда, оценить без знания английского его не получится - игра не переведена на великий и могучий.

Так что за смешные 200 рублей (а если по скидке - и того меньше) игра развлекает на все 200%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134794307', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1002, 'last_played': 1487890827}
review:
this is a turnbased rpg with the works  potions, monsters, classes, evil sorcerers, but yet no slimes. Also instead of races you get types of dnd players: sister, grandma, friend, pizza guy, etc. Most of the stuff is luck based on a 20 sided die thou you can easily get +1 perks which are good. and they have a stat that determines how likely it will be when a party member will be chosen as a target. Griding can be a pain but when you're in an area you can choose which monster and how many local monsters youd like to fight and even tells you how hard it would be. so it helps alot, There are also great differences between monsters, no reskins what so ever (but there are cliche monsters and missingno.)
Overall if you're expecting something spectacular like earthbound or final fantasy you aint getting it. the game knows this so you can just shrink the window and watch youtube while you play.

This is just a nice little rpg, I like it, but you should get it at discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991213805', 'num_games_owned': 430, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 933, 'last_played': 1659293752}

author: {'steamid': '76561198082724926', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1451326451}
review:
Определенно рекомендую! Отличная время убивалка. Любителям D&D и RPG должно понравиться. Графика приятна глазу, очень красиво и стильно, музыка тоже очень хороша напоминает мелодии из старых приставок, Геймплей тоже очень хорош. Разумеется не думаю что она стоит свои 300 рублей, но на скидках берите не ошибётесь. В игре присутствуют много классов, не которые открываются только после прохождения определенных квестов, состав команды можно всегда изменить, каждому игроку в команде можно улучшить экипировку. Можно сказать это почти D&D, но с не которыми отличиями, так сказать подстроение под аркаду. Игра долго будет казаться вам интересной, разумееться пока не наиграете 100+ часов, ну и это не у всех случаеться.
10\10

author: {'steamid': '76561198003306082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1699379167}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper allows me to do something that I've always wanted to do in a fantasy setting.  I am able to control a few characters on one table with clear cut differences between them.  It is simple enough for almost anyone to understand, and it is a pretty good game to play if you like indie, small time games.  It has a lot of exploration that I haven't done.  Even though you repeat quests a lot, the quests are different every time with different people.

The basis of the game is that you are playing against whatever the DM throws at you.  You are at your table, with your players and your classes they each encapsulate.  The classes are basic (Mage, Druid, Rogue, Warrior, Cleric, etc.) and the players themselves each have a special characteristic about them (the Jock has +? HP, the Alien regenrates +1 MP every turn, etc.).  It  Buying objects for the DM room, table, general location allows the players to get better points, experience, health, etc.  So instead of buffing singular characters, you are buffing all characters.  It's a fun game ultimately, and one that I will play frequently.

If you don't like pixelated gfxs, or table top scenarios at all, this might not be your cup of tea.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977385392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1415345165}
review: A fun turn based RPG with good humor.  Would not reccomend trying to sit down and play for hours straight as it will get too tedious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080449611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1413887429}
review:
Let me first say that Its cute. Its user friendly. It has some funny moments.

Having said that, I feel this game is empty. I can handle slow paced and repetitive games but Knights of Pen and Paper is so slow, so repetitive, and so monotonous that I can't appreciate it even as a background distraction while multitasking. Any game so simple needs to compensate with good story depth, complexity, style, or pacing. This game delivers none of these.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038176213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1478879997}
review:
This game is somewhat casual and is, perhaps, a bit better suited for moble devices. I've played it on my tablet much more than on this format. But, it's the same game (as far as i can tell), so it doesn't really matter - whatever suits you.

In any case, it's a simple, well thought out, and fun game that was obviously made with care and love. That's not to say that there isn't some depth, but certainly anyone can play it and like it - on some level.

Whatever the level of interest, it would be utterly unfair to slam a game like this. Any fair minded person would have to admit that it's quite good at what it's trying to do - excellent, in fact.

I would also mention that the humor and inside jokes are amusing and add favorably to the experience.

Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086183753', 'num_games_owned': 849, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1413889152}
review:
Alright, I love the game and all. I still can't seem to get enough after a year.

That being said, though, if you bought the normal version of it, and not Digital Deluxe, there's just no way to upgrade to Digital Deluxe. At all. All of that bonus content? You can't even get it on an alternate OS since it's Steam exclusive, so you're eternally screwed unless you use an alternate account and buy the full game all over again.

It's a ridiculous thing that should seriously be fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032777622', 'num_games_owned': 865, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 1030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1030, 'last_played': 1414982475}
review:
One minute I'm having fun and feeling charmed by the unique character creation and meta commentary and playful *wink, wink* moments of this game. 

And then the next I'm ready to throw my +2 Keyboard Of Nerd References through my monitor over the sheer padded grindiness of this thing.

I don't know--give this game a play, but make sure you buy it cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000604423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1381705261}
review: "Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition" enthält klar zu verachtende Pay-to-win-Elemente, weshalb es von vorneherein schonmal keinen Daumen nach oben erwarten kann. Bevor ich in Überlegungen versinken kann, ob ein Spiel tatsächlich über ein Bewusstsein verfügt, das ihm gestattet irgendetwas abseits der Programmierung zu erwarten, hier die Restbegründung: Screenshots von "Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition" versprechen eine wunderschöne Welt des metaleptischen Scherzes, in der sich die Fantasie des P&P in pixeliger Weise offenbart. Von den Entwicklern hat wohl leider niemand wirklich einmal ein P&P-RPG gespielt, denn gerade diese sollten sich ja eigentlich vom stupiden Dungeon-Crawling und dem Kampf um bessere und bessere Gegenstände unterscheiden, sollten storylastiger und interaktiver sein, weshalb sie sich ja auch immernoch großer Beliebtheit erfreuen. Ich habe nicht erwartet, dass mir dieses Spiel das Gefühl gibt, ein P&P-RPG zu spielen, doch kann man wohl dennoch von einem Spiel, das "Pen and Paper" im Namen trägt, einen gewissen Standard erwarten. In diesem Spiel werden sehr gekonnt die Umstände um narrative Standardelemente des Rollenspiels entlarvt, indem sie auf ihre Grundsrukturen heruntergebrochen werden. Eigentlich ein sehr interessanter Gedanke - hätte man nur darauf aufgebaut! Stattdessen wird der bissig-ironische Humor dazu genutzt, über die eigentliche Inhaltslosigkeit des Spiel hinwegzutäuschen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000222040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2148, 'last_played': 1414518796}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper is an awesome game. It was so much more than I expected it to be. It gives you a totally unique gaming experience.

Pros:

- Play time (especially compared to price)
- Customisability of the Experience (tactic, characters, path you take)
- Lots of Humor
- Story
- Balanced Gameplay
- Cute Graphics

Cons:

- Some grinding is included

I would give it a total score of 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985258780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1412713384}
review:
The premise of the game might be funny at first, but dulls down to pure boredom as you progress through this repetetive grind fest of an RPG...The Leveling as well as the Fight mechanics are, well boring, as well as the whole presentation of the game, you just see your group of people sitting at the table doing next to nothing as you read text boxes...
I know this is all intended but still, the narration just lacks the humour or tension or just anything to make up for all the downsides... 
I played for 10h, I had fun for 1 at most...the other 9 were just hope it could get better, but ah well, it did not...

I would not recommend this game to anyone. Seriously, do not buy it, its repetetive poorly presentated garbage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004104607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1414180836}
review: Lots of fun, easy to sit down and play during a coffee break. An interesting take on the turn based RPG with some good humor sprinkled throughout.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016179939', 'num_games_owned': 2435, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1413900361}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper is a tongue-in-cheek look at table top RPGs. The characters are silly, the "microtransactions" even sillier, and the references to other video games and people in the industry is, quite frankly, horrible (but in a silly way). 

The entire game has your characters sitting at a table in various places such as a village, a cave, an arcade, and so on, while a DM (Dungeon Master, for those of you who are unfamiliar with pen and paper RPG terminology) guides them through their quests. 

The graphics are simple, but fit well with the game. The music is repetitive, but catchy. And there's loads of replay value. 

I definitely recommend getting this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032220357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1413846649}
review: Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition is a decently entertaining turn-based RPG, which likely fares much better on it's original mobile Platform. As it is, the repetetive nature of combat and grinding make the game somewhat tedious during longer sittings on PC, thus making it all too easy to lose interest in the game sooner than it likely deserves.

review: Super cool little boardgame style roleplaying video game. The artwork is super cool with the pixels and little animations with the characters that sometimes move. It gets to be pretty challenging around level 40 or whenever you get to "Steam" island. Its like, everything is a reference and some I don't recognize but the ones that I do give me a chuckle. I'd reccomend this game to anyone who wants it for their phone. Yes, this is a game for your phone, and the touch screen controls are actually pretty good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128788858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1436418706}
review: If you've ever played SNES or spent a night playing tabletop D&D with your buddies, you should give this simple, 16bit gem a whirl. It's got all the makings of one of those games you spent way too many hours playing. Definitely recommend to old school gamers, tabletop nerds, or indie game fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073294749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1663, 'last_played': 1413194009}
review: This game was designed for mobile and is more of a casual game, but it is great if you want to play something while multitasking. The game relies on basic RPG elements and humor to make the gameplay fun. There isn't really much replay value apart from doing a second or third play-through to gather all the achievements for the game, but on a sale it's worth getting if you're looking for a casual game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119790792', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1425828712}
review:
This game is soooooooooooo amazing, it ruined my life.
"Can Someone order a pizza?" - Comic Story Guy

author: {'steamid': '76561198037720383', 'num_games_owned': 970, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1435540496}
review:
Knights of Pen. And Paper! I tried to be witty there.

Now, I'm not one to do really large reviews, but I can tell you this: Buy this game.

A ton of people will go on and on about how it sucks, how it's stupid, but it's a really fun RPG game for those that are into the genre. And a lot of people have gone on to say that it's just a time waster, but no, it's more than that. Like an RPG game, it'll take you into the story the best it can. It's up to you, if you let it do it's job or not.

And as such, this took me to believe that not many people gave it that starting chance. The chance to change their lives forever.

Now, you might be thinking I'm biased, and yeah, I am. I never got the chance to grow up with great games that were released on older gen consoles. Like the NES, the SNES, and even the Sega Mega Drive. I got to miss the truly astonishing ups and lows of gaming history. All because I'm a kid. So, when a game like this comes along, a game that does so well at giving the player a feel of the old world, I take it like it's a van full of candy.

But, TL;DR: Buy this game if you're into the genre, you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998434564', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1412910490}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992335042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1684, 'last_played': 1415762088}
review:
Had a blast going through this gem for the last few days.  The classes are fairly 'niche' with the usual tropes, a warrior, a priest, a mage, ext.  More classes can be unlocked from differing quest chains.  It feels like a way to waste the week away 20 years ago on a summer vacation.  Not a care in the world and just getting absorbed into an old 8-bit recreation.

Solid mix of quests/content, silly dialogues, available classes, and itemization/customization is in it.  After finishing it, I'm now looking forward to A DLC or a +2 edition.  More classes with more growth/interactivity, larger map world / feel, I'd love to be able to quest further or in another story to see have the characters will have to adapt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971024725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1418416196}
review:
First game I've ever bought on Steam where I've not actually gotten what I paid for. Sure sometimes a game will have bugs, and sometimes there may be un-noticed system requirements/limitations which are my fault for missing. But here, it's not even the right product. Advertised as win/mac/linux, but buying the deluxe version, none of that extra content shows up for linux. No response from the publisher/devs on their own steam forum linux-specific discussion. First time I've ever felt truly cheated on Steam.


Edit: Dec 12th, 2014
WIth the latest update, it seems that at long last 2 1/2 months later, the Deluxe Version finally works under linux. Of course they've still been selling for Linux this whole time instead of taking that off until it was fixed. What miniscule communication there has been in that time was all of poor quality and incorrect. Moreover this actual fix wasn't even described or announced. Still cannot recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085324347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1321, 'last_played': 1413715928}
review:
Skuriles und Lustiges RPG für zwischendurch 
7/10 Punkten 

Knights of Pen & Paper wirft einen in eine Fantasywelt wie bei klassischen Dungeon und Dragons. Es gibt einen Spielmaster und man muss eine Gruppe zusammenstellen, die dann Aufgaben erledigt und Abenteuer erlebt. 
Dabei verarscht sich das Spiel selbst und andere RPGS gleich mit und bietet einige witzige Dialoge.
Helden kann man sich selber zusammenstellen, aus einem alten Ego aus der 'realen Welt' , der meist ein sterotyp ist, wie ein Hipster, ein Nerd oder zum Beispiel der kleiner Bruder und dem Charakter, den die Leute spielen wie Krieger Magier oder Priester. 

Alles in allem ist das Spiel sehr lustig, wird aber mit der Zeit doch monoton, weshalb es sicherlich nicht für jeden was ist, dennoch für Leute , die für zwischendurch Lust auf ein RPG haben und einfach mal auf ein paar Abenteuer gehen wollen sehr unterhaltsam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049305971', 'num_games_owned': 1347, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 745, 'last_played': 1683569294}
review:
[h1][b]Knights of Pen and Paper[/b][/h1]

Es un JRPGs? Creo que si, con lo de generalizar etiquetas ando un poco mareado con las caracteristicas de cada una. Lo etiqueto de JRPG porque se basa en los clasicos combates por turnos estaticos. Digamos que es como un Final Fantasy solo que muy, muy, muy recortado. 

Si me preguntais cual es la primera palabra que se me biene a la cabeza al pensar en el juego es "simple", la segunda seria comico.

El juego se ambienta en las tipicas partidas de Dungeon & Dragons donde un grupo de amigos siguen la narracion del maestro de mazmorras. Empiezas creando el grupo y siguiendo las diversas misiones que ofrece el juego. No hay nada resaltable salvo el humor de los dialogos y la bestial cantidad de parodias que aparecen a lo largo del juego en forma de misiones/personajes.

La totalidad de la jugabilidad se basa en combates por turnos bastante simples, que unido al excaso repertorio de habilidades de las clases (4 habilidades y algunas pueden ser pasivas) dan como resultado combates muy repetitivos y pobres. Las misiones se reducen a 2, ir del punto A al punto B y lucha contra monstruos y ambas suelen ser cortas y rapidas (basicamente es matar y pasearse). 
No hay puzzles, ni profundidad de misiones o opciones de dialogo, el equipamiento esta restringuido y el inventario tiene poco uso. El movimiento se reduce pasearse por los punto de un mapa y llegado a un punto elegir entre las mismas opciones. El juego no tiene nada mas.

El apartado grafico es pixelado y colorido, siendo simple como el resto del juego aunque sumado a su BSO de maquina recreativa le da bastante personalidad y carisma al titulo.

[b]Pros:[/b][list]
[*]Gran cantidad de parodias y mucho humor[/list]

[b]Contras:[/b][list]
[*]Juego muy simple, no apto para partidas largas[/list]

[b]Conclusion[/b]
Un juego perfecto de dispositivos moviles para matar el tiempo pero que salvo por cierto aire carismatico no tiene nada y abusa de la nostalgia con las parodias.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989896566', 'num_games_owned': 1391, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1432519674}
review:
This game is charming as hell.  I bought it, and before I knew it, my Steam account said I had put 75 minutes into it.  I hope to put a lot more time into it.

It's got an addictive quality to it, but it's not brazen about it.  It has enough humor to keep you interested.  Obviously lots of people have played it longer than me, so this is just my interpretation after 1 hour and 15 minutes.

For $2.49 (on sale) it's an absolute steal.  I'll be playing the heck out of this game down the road, and I look forward to the irreverant 90s RPG game humor for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064916091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1777, 'last_played': 1567011675}
review:
Esse jogo é fantastico. Para quem gosta de RPG de Mesa, esse jogo é no minimo, OBRIGATÓRIO. Quando peguei esse game, não dava nada por ele, ficou largado entre meus jogos por um bom tempo até eu ter a coragem de joga-lo, mas após isso comecei uma jogatina que não dá nenhuma vontade de parar.

O Jogo faz muitas referencias ao mundo Geek (Até o Gabe aparece no game).

Uma das melhores coisas do game é a Tradução, se eu não me engano a empresa que desenvolveu esse game é Brasileira, então o nosso "Amado" português está em sua raiz, com trocadilhos perfeitamente encaixados e coesos.

A Jogabilidade é muito simples, porém muito divertida e não se torna enjoativa.

Joguei tanto a versão PC quanto a Versão Mobile e zerei o game em amabas, você só utiliza o mouse para fazer tudo.

Inicialmente pensei que o jogo fosse curto, porém me enganei totalmente, levei umas 25 horas para finaliza-lo a primeira vez, depois de finaliza-lo ele te oferece o New Game +1 ... Mas não finalizei o +1 pois não curto replay (mas cada um decide o que fazer com seu tempo =D).

Única coisa que não gostei, mas isso faz parte do MEU GOSTO PESSOAL, foram os graficos, mas isso não atrapalha em nada na jogabilidade divertida e simples que o jogo proporciona.

Se vale a pena compra-lo?
-- COM TODA CERTEZA !!!

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198060616666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1477519749}
review:
I do have the game but i never actually bothered myself on playin it for some reason.
But from what i´ve seen from alot of gameplays, the game is really good, despite the hate comments i see below.
This game was made for people who used to play board games such as Dungeons and Dragons among others (that i seem to have forgotten) back wen there was no computers.
Of course people from this generation will hate it, they got no taste in videogames anymore, for them its all about graphics, guns, sex and drugs.
I am from this generation though, although somehow i like these retro/indie games (dont ask why).
So, i do recommend this game to anyone (especially to old gamers) , and if you grew playing Turn Based Fantasy RPG games such as Final Fantasy, Chrono Cross. Phantasy Star etc etc and i know there are alot here on steam, then buy it, it will be worth it and money well spent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063573191', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1471, 'last_played': 1541496685}
review: dobry RPG turowy, mnóstwo odniesień do innych gier i twórców

author: {'steamid': '76561198025267880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 2231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2202, 'last_played': 1431892601}
review:
Fun game.  Had WAY more of a story than I expected from this kind of game.  The classes are cooky, and it's a diverting enough game.  Definitely worth $5...might not be worth $10 or more, though...

Update for Haunted Fall DLC: The DLC has three new areas, all connected with each other with another plotline, plus a new class and a bunch of new items. The new items aren't really worth the price tag, because they're all just variations on what was already available (health, mana, etc) but the witch class is interesting and the new content is fun. It looks like the DLC isn't installed because it's integrated into the story, so it only opens up at a certain level, but it's there. Don't pay full price for the DLC because it's probably not worth it, but if you can get it in a bundle, it's good. Adds an hour or two to the game length if you do everything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042709543', 'num_games_owned': 891, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1428233769}
review:
This game is a wonderful mini-masterpiece that makes you feel as if you're playing a table-top game without the actual table or friends. You can experience D&D-style gameplay without having to break out dice, charts, pencils, and painted figures, and it really makes it much easier to immerse yourself into the game. With the deluxe edition, you get SO many awesome new items and references to play with, including furniture such as THE TARDIS from Doctor Who, 800 gold coins and starting buff items, and even a new player character that makes a powerful magic user! I'd honestly buy the game just for that.

So many different players-class combinations to choose from that could either make the game difficult or easy, and it's so much fun to try different combos!
I highly recommend this game to anyone who likes RPG games, humor, and gaming/television references!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037097820', 'num_games_owned': 511, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1411669949}
review: Un exelente juego de rol clásico en pixelart, que de cierta forma me recuerda libros como los de elige tu propia aventura, el juego es bastante entretenido, la historia es envolvente y el juego definitivamente es adictivo y todo esto con bastantes toques de buen humor y parodiando el género con un estilo único.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960451002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1425442215}
review: Mediocre. While superficially fun, the gameplay is stale and awkward. Transitions from one area to the next is very strange and the game itself feels oddly incomplete or very strange. Buy if on sale or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988968266', 'num_games_owned': 3923, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1411053044}
review:
¿Habeis jugado alguna vez a rol de mesa? ¿Si? Bien, entonces este juego te resultará una agradable parodia. ¿No? No importa, vas a reirte muchisimo teniendo una "abuela" paladin preparada para tanquear a los goblins porque ella habla alto ya que esta medio sorda. 

Si si, como oyes, este juego-parodia te permite tener cosas de ese estilo, un alien mago, una sabelotodo guerrera, etc. Muy muy agradable de jugar, bastante rapido y rejugable, muchas opciones de personalizacion (si, puedes cambiar la mesa, el master, las puertas, y todo eso da efectos diferentes).

Desde luego, es un must have del genero indie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026776653', 'num_games_owned': 879, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1631695936}
review: OMG!! Warning this game is extremely addicting!! I love the artwork and the music kept me hooked the game. The story is playful but still manages to keep you hooked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048005431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1413699266}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper is like a online board game/dungeons and dragons game.
The game isn't exactly like a dungeons and dragons game but is a RPG/Adventure and action filled game. With different characters to chose from the adventure is different.
I found that this game is very fun, has some old school memories involved and has comedy and cool missions to go on.
Each character has different abilities and weaponry, but also each character has a special characteristic which makes then unique.
Such as the Cleric which is the healer can also be built as a damage person as well as healing.
The amazing use of customizing the background of the game has some different passive abilities which change how the game is played.
The layout equipment has cool abilities such as small xp boosts in battle and also a higher pickup chance.
The battles are cool as well, the customizing of how many enemies you face is a great way to lower the difficulty if a new character is introduced to the party. This makes the game much harder or easier for the player, for a smooth ride or for a hardcore bombardment of Giant Rats or Bats.
Kinghts of Pen and Paper is simple, enjoyable, addictive and has a unique feel to it.
The game is worth the buy and has many enjoyable features which i may not have discovered yet. Deffs buy the game and try it out
9/10 Good Game. GG.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980519871', 'num_games_owned': 2662, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 1964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1487517114}
review: Game starts nice and easy, but after a few hours quests get repetitive and boring. You have to run around the same lactations over and over again, and are forced to fight the same enemies while game master gives you quests like "get to this location, then get back, then back to previous location and now back again". Maybe it has something to with game being port from mobile. Still, prepare to be bored few hours in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024950356', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 953, 'last_played': 1390766361}
review: Despite being sprites rather than 3D, this game threatened to overheat my laptop, which I count the first strike against it. It's no good sacrificing graphics quality if you're still going to demand huge amounts of GPU investment. The second strike is that the massive amounts of heat are going to waste doing nothing at high speeds - the game is irritatingly slow at times, and I used CheatEngine to double KPP+1's speed to get it to a tolerable level. In-app purchases are the third strike leading me to conclude: KPP+1 is a bad game. Cute characters, witty humor, and a whole lot of hack'n'slash against evil monsters doesn't make up for poor underlying design.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024473091', 'num_games_owned': 1243, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 982, 'last_played': 1410484146}
review:
Eu não dava muito do jogo, só algo legalzinho e curto, porém ele é muito engraçado e tem diversas classes... o sistema de evolução e batalha são bem simples, mas ainda assim tem uma variação legal de ambientes pra ir, muitas referências do mundo dos jogos, desenhos e etc, não só visuais, mas em relação a história e citações

Ao invés de ficar correndo pra tentar uma luta aleatória, ele permite criar suas batalhas com quantos inimigos quiser, dependendo do quanto de XP e grana precisa, ou a dificuldade que ta disposto a enfrentar... e ele é todo baseado em sorte de dados, o que pode render boas recompensas ou gastar o precioso dinheiro a toa num ferreiro, pra dar o azar de não dar certo

No geral é engraçado ver os personagens simulando uma aventura de RPG de mesa e poder alterar tudo em volta, desde objetos da sala, até quem está na mesa ou os objetos sobre a mesma

Recomendo com certeza, e vou ficar de olho no Chroma Squad que promete muito!
