author: {'steamid': '76561197971948490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 950, 'last_played': 1392357897}
review:
I wish there was a "meh" button between yes and no, but Knights of Pen and Paper is... well, a basic, bare-bones turn-based grindy RPG.  Don't interpret the no vote to mean I think it's a bad game, it's just not that inspiring.  You set up a party, choose which fights you want so as to make sure you don't bite off more than you can chew, and then grind, grind, and grind some more.  Then you curb-stomp a quest boss when you can be bothered.  

You have four skills per character, and basically pick one or two to min-max, and use basically exclusively for the entire length of the game.  Since your potential actions are so limited in combat, the differences between one fight and the next are negligible... if you're even fighting different enemies at all, since uneven challenge and reward schedules tend to reward players heavily for fighting the same pack of creatures in droves until you're ready to leapfrog half a dozen levels to the next cash cow.  A special "rug" for auto-battling basically means this game becomes something to press "start" on, then come back to later to reset another battle.  The only real thing to do outside of battles is to buy things, so there isn't much to break the monotony.

Kinghts of Pen and Paper is a decent concept, but it just doesn't engage the player enough for me to give this a good recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050854979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1390537748}
review: Sadly, Knights of Pen and Paper has all of my least favorite elements of RPG's (meaningless random battles) and none of my favorite ones (role-playing).  I was hoping for something that was more akin to a random story simulator with some combat that played into the narrative, but from the get-go I was just deciding how many bats I wanted to kill before I completed the "quest".

author: {'steamid': '76561198092275308', 'num_games_owned': 869, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1408136793}
review:
It was cute and clever and all. Fun for the first ten levels.

And then everything gets grindy. Like, really grindy.

There are, maybe 6, 7 classes all with 4 skills each (some are randomly passive, too). So it turns into a lot of grinding and not enough variety. Which might be good for them because they used to have microtransactions for gold. They might still have that option on the mobile version, too.

There was also confusion because Steam will give you an acess code and tell you that the program will possibly need it. On the main menu of the game you will also see an option for inputting such a code. However, no matter how many times you try, the code Steam gives you is not the code needed to unlock the game, the game is activated upon perchase. What you are supposed to use with the code Steam gives you is registering for the game dev/publishers' website forms...ops. And the option to input a key is extra content that was given out during an event. So...yeah...thanks for the absence of an explaination, guys.

So all in all, Good on the art, good on the humor, not so good on the gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023420032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1250, 'last_played': 1436808794}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper is a really good method of killing a lot of time without getting bored.
Of course you have to like the 8 bit style and the battlesystem relying on initiative.
A lot of nicely built in jokes and even more references to Star Wars, Monty Python and other must knows.

At some points it's a bit repetitive, that aside recommendable without hesitation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105680429', 'num_games_owned': 5132, 'num_reviews': 572, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1409725756}
review: 不错的一款小游戏，多职业多装备多道具，剧情蛮有意思的，培养你的兵来闯关到新的地点，不过金币确实少刷起来有点苦逼费时间，还有这游戏名字后面+1让人印象深刻，估计作者明白大家的用意了，如果大家有空余的时间不妨玩玩这款游戏~

author: {'steamid': '76561198084508145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1394585962}
review: Rogues are easily broken in tabletop games..... And Knights of Pen and Paper remind us of this. Love the references throughout

author: {'steamid': '76561198030609446', 'num_games_owned': 4334, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 913, 'last_played': 1402528449}
review:
Knights of Pen andd Paper was originally designed for the portable player - on smartphone and tablet.
What this means is that the graphics are simplistic, and the gameplay is designed to be experienced in short bursts.
However, this is a good game for any medium. It has been ported well to the PC, and the gameplay, again, although simplistic, has that "one-more-go" aura around it.
It does have in-game purchases, but you can play the game without paying any more than the initial money you bought the game for. You just need to do a bit of grinding. The good news is that you can earn quite a lot of money from completing the quests.
The design of the game is that of gamers sat around a table and gaming their little RPG hearts out. It's endearing, nostalgic and very retro at the same time.
If you have more than a passing aquaintance with rolling dice and role playing, get this game. It's quite frequently on sale and has been in Humble bundles before. Catch it then, and get sucked into it's time sink.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045018073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1403213258}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020959541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1412104859}
review:
I really enjoyed playing this game. I got kind of hooked on it while I was playing from my laptop (which has the gpu that can just about handle rendering a webpage) and I ended up playing for 4h straight. It's got a lot of classic RPG elements in it, which I like very much. There is talk of a lot of humor, but I did not see too much of that (yet?). 
The functionality is nice, and it's great that you can switch between characters during a game. Only thing I find lacking is pokémon style upgrading abilities for the spells.
Also, it would have been nice to have the game full screen and a little more animation on the player characters. 
All in all a very good choice to waste a couple of hours on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087403502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1528665345}
review: Wonderful little rpg. I was looking for something to spend some time with simple tasks and leveling up. If you like rpgs and the physical world where they came from you'll enjoy this smooth yet nostalgic game. No need to get to dedicated but don't be surprised if you get lose a few hours playing and wonder where the time went.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997424004', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1409107200}
review:
Loved it, played tons of hours for such a little game. Got the the end boss, and it's at least 300% harder than anything up to that point, forcing you to grind for another several hours to even have a chance at hearing the boss fart through a walkie-talkie.

Obviously, final bosses are supposed to be hard, and maybe I'm missing the point, but this is just poor design.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986973931', 'num_games_owned': 1669, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 1154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1069, 'last_played': 1396154347}
review: This game seems like a cross between an app game and a classic jrpg. Which is not a bad thing. Not a ton of skills, but combat is relatively satisfying. Graphics are weak but if you like classic console games you'll feel at home. As you play you unlock additional classes, though unfortunately those classes start at level 1, which makes playing with them frustrating. Grinding is a requirement unfortunately. Sometimes random quests unlock more meaningful quests, and everything has interesting dialog, so that's cool. The story is pretty good, the idea of playing a game about playing a game is well done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033618053', 'num_games_owned': 691, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1575064087}
review:
Disregard the play time, I started playing this on my computer but then decided it was better played on a tablet.

Although this game is a phone/mobile/tablet game it is still a good game to play. I didn't honestly mind playing it on the PC.
I spent at least 40 hours into this game, this game has the refferences, it has the jokes, it has the pokes, the jabs, the dice, the everything you need to make you want to play a game like this.

It starts you off in a room where you are playing a game of well... dnd. sort of. so you play it like you normally would play dnd except... it's silly. which I love. It would be like having that cool uncle who actually has no life guiding you through an adventure he made that is filled with everything that cool uncle wanted to do. As an example (SPOILER) [spoiler] The is a place called steam island, obviously there are monsters there etc, but you have to go retrieve the crowbar for gabe. [/spoiler] You know what, games with those kind of nudges are just my thing. GG
10/10 a game to play offline, on a mobile device. OR on a computer.

(I am an achievement whore so I got a lot of the achievements for this game on PC too.)
Also Flower is OP, that extra dice roll is too strong, she is a must have on the team.

Story: 10/10 (Solid.)
Gameplay: 8/10 (Fairly Basic, Contains the holy trinity of dullness. (Tank Healer DAMAGE DAMAGE DAMAGE)
Presentation: 10/10 (cute)
Soundtrack: X *I don't really remember
Replayability: 7/10 (Completionists, yes, others not so much.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198080882896', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1469746026}
review:
Comecei a jogar esse joguinho no celular e não parei mais. 

Simplesmente é um jogo que qualquer um que diz gostar de RPG DEVE jogar. O jogo possui uma mecanica muito simples e divertida, você facilmente vai passar horas jogando e nem vai perceber, fazendo as quests para upar seus personagens e até mesmo para upar o seu equipamento e para quem não tem muito conhecimento do inglês o jogo também tem em pt-br.

Eu consegui o jogo gratuitamente mas com certeza vale o preço. :]

author: {'steamid': '76561198107769415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1455891967}
review: 22 МБ счастья! Радует не только, то что игра сделана в старом стиле и не напрягает переизбытком ненужных эффектов, но и сама концепция игры. Игра сделана по типу настольной игры "Подземелье и драконы". Большое разннообразие персонажей и билдов команды, достаточно тактичные бои и неслабая система апгрейдов. Но есть и небольшой минус. Все квесты завязаны на убиении вставших на пути недругов. Все-таки было бы неплохо добавить в игру загадки и пазлы, тогда было бы вдвое больше "острых" ощущений :D Очень рекомендую. Даже меня, ярого противника пошаговых игр ито затянуло.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003167548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 13029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8966, 'last_played': 1405994097}
review: Surprisingly entertaining retro game. The battles scaled up a bit more quickly than the characters did towards the end and it made the battles more annoying than fun. The replay value is pretty low, but it's a great game to pick up when it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982371705', 'num_games_owned': 2762, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 2757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1600, 'last_played': 1572164126}
review:
This game has a lot of charm and I enjoyed my two play-throughs. However it boils down to very shallow RPG that's comparable to some of the original GameBoy's launch titles. 

You select a premade character, there's no way to customize their look but you do get to distribute points to their character sheets. Each of the 10 classes only has 4 abilities, and that is counting their passives. Damage is either magical or physical, no breakdowns within such as fire, slashing, holy, etc.  You'll quickly find others to join your party and unlock new classes to choose from.

An interesting feature is that when a battle starts you choose what type of enemies appear and how many there are, you're the dungeon master as well as the player. You'll probably want to have a tank in your party to taunt, and at least one area of effect damage dealer, along with a healer, and maybe a single target damager to mop up the rough edges and elites. Extremely basic tactics here.

The unlockables were nice (they were previously microtransactions but changed in this mobile to Steam port to be bought only with in game gold), but they make the game far too easy. Even with the cheats off don't expect a challege here. But you'll probably get some laughs and have fun, especially if you've ever put hours into any RPG. This one won't try to keep you for long and it's cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985091220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 968, 'last_played': 1407327858}
review:
Un buen juego. RPG clásico mezclado con los juegos de rol de papel y lápiz, al que quizás le falta acercarse un poquito más a estos últimos para ser una gran propuesta. A pesar de ello, ofrece bastante diversión y entretenimiento bajo una interfaz sencilla.

Como punto a mejorar, los diferentes fallos en los logros (y, como ya dije antes, le faltaba tener más de juego de rol de mesa que de RPG). Y quizás controlar la curva de dificultad, que al final se convierte en algo demasiado endiablado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003970062', 'num_games_owned': 2015, 'num_reviews': 355, 'playtime_forever': 1204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1204, 'last_played': 1407059456}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper +1 is a “roleplaying game”, but in truth it has very little roleplaying in it; while this is common to many “RPGs,” this game takes it to an all-new level. The conceit behind the game is that you are sitting at a table with your game master with a group of friends, and that you are going through a campaign. The players are indeed all seated around a table, with the game master on the far side of the table dictating what is going on. It is a very clever idea, but unfortunately the game fails to execute on it at all; instead, the game is a pure hack-and-slash fest which tries to spice things up with humor and gaming references but falls flat because, quite frankly, everyone sitting around a table has already not only made all of these references, but done it better. The plot is every bad game of D&D you've ever played, every unoriginal campaign rolled into one, and it is played straight - sure, one could argue that it is almost comically bad, but it is painfully bad, like Batman and Robin, rather than camp.

	As the gameplay itself is thoroughly hack and slash, purely about cutting your way through an extremely large number of monsters using extremely simplistic turn-based combat reminiscent of many JRPGs, with no real coherent or interesting story to speak of, there is little to recommend this game as anything but a time waster, and even there, you can do far better. There's nothing that this game doesn't show you in the first hour, and there's nothing in that first hour worth taking. While the basic underlying idea of having a bunch of players playing a roleplaying game is an interesting one, this game is a total failure at it. Maybe someday, someone will take this idea and do something good with it, but this is not that game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018585197', 'num_games_owned': 2394, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1406992864}
review:
For quite a few hours I really liked this game. Then I ended up with all my party dead and not enough gold to revive more than one. And not enough gold then to take that one to an area in which to earn more gold. Sooo.... heading to the internet I read up on what happened and I saw a lot of confused information about other save systems, a blacksmith that wasn't mentioned in the game from what I could see, and microtransations that may or may not be in the pc version of the game as they were in the ios version for the mobile.

Really such a shame as up until then I was loving the game, but seriously not enough to try and start it all over again. It's simple enough in premise, very more-ish when you're playing but unless you know what you are doing before you start, I wouldn't bother. If you do want to play it, definitely read up on it all before you start as you'll  have zero help in game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092971357', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1463886555}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper parece ser uma certa paródia sobre RPGs de tabuleiro. 
Você controla tanto o mestre quanto os jogadores na mesa, que são personagens bastante engraçados, sendo desde uma velhinha ao seu irmãozinho chato ou um entregador de pizza. A história é pré-pronta, mas você toma decisões como partir em missões, caçar tesouros e etc. Além da forma como você "builda" os personagens, como em qualquer RPG, é claro.
É um jogo visualmente bonito em pixel art e bastante comédia, e divertido...Casual.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144195703', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1590559771}
review:
A great game, old 16-bit style with tabletop style RPG
Pros:
-Quite a variation of class and character
-Quite a good story
-Some fights can be rigged at the start of the battle

Cons:
-Fetch quest and grinding
-One quest at a time is bad

Worth: I bought the special edition so I'd say it's worth 20 out of your 15 dollar

author: {'steamid': '76561197994271416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1425313922}
review:
I recommend this game to everyone who loves a good game and appreciates hard work put into it, intelligent puns to both old and contemporary games and ofc pen and paper as well as modern rpgs.
So many times have I read lines that just elevate this game into an own sphere of "conciousness" that say "Hey, I'm a game let's have fun with me." 

Yes the are multiple grinding parts in between the story and I wish we could choose more than just how many enemies to fight, but this here is an honest work thought through and through and deserves to be played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041631636', 'num_games_owned': 12818, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 8491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4072, 'last_played': 1453973219}
review:
This is one of those games you might give a quick look and pass on, but you'd be making a grave mistake!

If you're into oldschool style turn-based RPGs, pick up KoPP+1.  It's a ton of fun and completely playable in both short doses and long sessions, with a decent story that pokes a lot of fun at the entire table-top RPG genre and many other pop icons.  I purchased it on a whim and quickly fell in love with the quaint graphics, the quirky story, and the RPG style character/equipment progression. 

With the amount of time I've sunk into the game (replaying and achievement hunting), I'm forced to give the game a 9/10 rating and highly recommend it!  I wish there were more games like it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960546255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 773, 'last_played': 1439398367}
review:
The game is really nice. 

It's a classical RPG with classes and different perks (different player characters with different passives) you can choose from.
It's a funny homage to all Pen & Paper playing people out there. You can boost your stats ingame with Fastfood, Coke, Beer, Candy and Pizza ordering it directly via the ingame shop, where you pay with gold found in the game. 

The game is hard, but fair. 

There are a lot of eastereggs in it. Everywhere you find little hints or textparts that will remind you of other great games or movies. 

Only negative thing was the fact that there are only 2 dungeons. But perhaps more will be added to a later point. There will be a few DLC's I heard. 

So if you like great classical RPG's this game is a must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076389904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1429, 'last_played': 1472665240}

Fiz um review pra quem quiser conferir: http://qgmaster.blogspot.com.br/2014/07/review-knights-of-pen-paper-pc.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198142030607', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1470936155}
review:
Годная инди РПГ. Сюжета, как такового, не предусмотрено - стилизация '80-ых. 
Игра хоршо показывает будни зaдрoтoв D&S (рассказчик (среди которых есть Йода и Мастер Сплинтер), который по сути в игре является генератором квестов, и участники "шабаша" (разносчик пиццы, офисный планктон, хипстер и пр. (даже разработчики этой игры), исполняющие роли клирика, мага, воина и пр. классы, которые открываются по ходу игры.
Тексты лаконичны, с юмором - комментарии персонажей тому подтверждение. Приятные диологи.
Сеттинг, как и сказано выше, является реинкарнацией настольных игр '80-ых (пошаговая система (дни-ходы), типы данжей и пр.), т.е. "в одном царстве-государстве существует куча проблем, которые решают такая же куча героев (сидящих всё время за столом, который можно прокачать нямкой и прочими кунштюками)".
Игра для ностальгирующих и "прото"-хипстеров.
9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198071544889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 812, 'last_played': 1633655087}
review:
Everything good about retro RPG video games as well as classic pen and paper like Dungeons & Dragons is mixed into one wonderful experience in the form of Knights of Pen and Paper. In the game, you play as a group of friends, getting together to play Dungeons & Dragons. You're not just picking classes, but picking which "real life" person is playing the characters in game. Want grandma to be the paladin on your team? No problem! Think your little brother would be best suited as a stealthy rogue? You can do that too. Although the character creation is as simple as matching an archetype to a class (like Hipster Mage or Pizza Guy Druid), it's pretty fun and gives the game replayability as you want to experiment with different combinations.

The storyline is light, but definitely will bring back memories to anyone who has played Dungeons & Dragons in their lives. You travel through towns like "Journey Village" and battle monsters to save missing kings in a world full of pop culture references. It might be a bit silly if you're looking for a serious RPG, but if you love the classic turn-based battle style of the early Final Fantasy games, you'll at least appreciate the simple awesomeness of the gameplay. It's also hugely accessible and easy to learn for those who've never played that kinda game before.

You'll get the most out of this if you're just a huge RPG fan, because Knights of Pen and Paper relies a lot on nostalgia. Still, it's a really fun RPG that can eat up many hours of your life in a very satisfying way. It's a really good example of what indie game companies are capable of. Oh, and if you complain about the graphics, I have a fist to shake at you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049316790', 'num_games_owned': 2248, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 2186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2060, 'last_played': 1437667359}
review:
Механика и графический стиль игры могут показаться слегка примитивными, но это компенсируется неплохим юмором и целым рядом забавных отсылок. Впрочем, большая часть интересных нюансов может ускользнуть от тех, кто не увлекается настольными ролевыми играми. Заключительная часть игры и расширенное издание несколько контрастируют по сложности с основной кампанией и могут потребовать продолжительного убийства монстров ради золота и опыта.
7,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197998958795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1522836580}
review:
혹시 TRPG 를 좋아하십니까? 아니면 ORPG 경험이 있으십니까?
솔직히 TRPG 경험이 필요하지도 좋아하지도 않으셔도 됩니다.
RPG 만 좋아하신다면 만사 OK! 

TRPG를 하는 사람들을 보는 기묘한 시점의 게임이지만, RPG 를 좋아하신다면 강력 추천 해드립니다.
게다가 마우스 클릭으로 간편하고 빠른 게임을 원하시는 분들께도 추천 드려요.
사람들 말하고 농담하는 것들은 모두 영어이지만 굳이 영어를 알지 못해도 게임을 즐기시는데는 상관없을 정도로 직관적인 게임입니다.
하지만 영어를 알아들으신다면 게임 곳곳에 도사린 유머에 즐겁게 하실 수 있습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079303142', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1248, 'last_played': 1408459865}
review: Jogatinas de RPG de mesa quem nunca teve? Acho que esse jogo é para lembrar de todos que jogaram com os amigos na casa de alguem enfrentando os mais complicados desafios e passando por situações comicas. Sendo um jogo parado onde apenas o mouse faz toda função é um jogo lindo com musicas adequadas de escutar e sendo algumas delas boas de escutar repetidamente. Tendo os personagens  com suas vantagens basta o jogador ver com qual classe ele ira se encaixar melhor e criar sua estrategia. Admito não sei qual o lvl max mais meu time que eu joguei foi até o 52 (mais forte do time) mais acredito que seja até o lvl 99 (assim espero). Podendo desbloquear classes adicionais para o seu jogo fazendo side-quests que se tornam engraçadas pelas falas dos personagens e missões que até os jogadores do jogo ficam se perguntando "como é possivel aquilo?". Recomendo o jogo para quem jogava (ou joga ainda) RPG com amigos, pois vai lembrar que é igual mais sempre veja algum video do jogo para ver se realmente gostou e se é o estilo que você quer jogar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041543513', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1403225698}
review:
Heh.

-_-

Okay, so: do you A.) Like Dungeons and Dragons-style adventuring games?
B.) Like playing actual D&D style games, on pen and paper?
C.) Would like to try a simulator of the two?

This is that game. 

Will you like it? That's debatable.

I bought this game when it was a daily deal because I like pen and paper D&D-style games. Note that I had received all of the boosts from the digital deluxe version.

The retro-style graphics are a nice aesthetic, and there is quite a bit of variety with the creatures you will encounter in the game.

So the game plays with you as the DM (dungeon master) overseeing a game of D20 Knights of Pen and Paper. You have seats that can sit how ever many characters you would like to use, but the last few seats require you to pay the in-game currency. You can keep grinding to afford the seats in the future.

For each seat, you can sit a type of character (ex: hipster, grandma) and assign them a specific class (ex: barbarian, bard). This offers a seemingly wide range of party configurations.

The difficulty is completely self-driven, as you are both the DM and the players. That being said, you may have an "objective" to kill 5 orcs - you can choose to fight them 1-at-a-time, or all at once, or whatever configuration you prefer. The entirety of the game involves A LOT of grinding, and this is even considering the boosts you may have gotten from the deluxe edition. 

I love D20 games, but this game can become repetitive extremely quickly. If there was a multiplayer cooperative functionality, it might have saved it a bit, however, there isn't one.

There is A LOT of variety for you to upgrade - you can change everything from the type of table you're playing on (each type provides different bonuses) to the type of door in the room to the DM. All of this can help shape your overall party into a specfic area, like tanky high HP characters, or high MP, magic-relying casters.

I paid ~$5 US for the deluxe edition, and I think even then you may want to hold off and wait for it to be cheaper, if you are interested in trying the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008873790', 'num_games_owned': 718, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2820, 'last_played': 1404714358}

author: {'steamid': '76561198084629926', 'num_games_owned': 868, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1422624617}
review:
這是一個模擬最早RPG（還是該說DnD？）以紙和筆代替冒險歷程時的手機遊戲
雖說如此，該遊戲在實際遊玩上還是屬於傳統RPG遊戲的風格：打怪升等點技能
但因為扮演者的各種不同天賦配上多樣遊戲內職業的特性，使得這遊戲的過程充滿了選擇的樂趣
隨著冒險的腳步還會逐一解鎖獨特職業，更讓你期待往後的未知旅程

由DnD發展出來的後續遊戲分枝當中，我也只玩過WOW而已
但僅此我就能在此《筆與紙騎士》遊戲當中找到許多的樂趣與不少的回憶
很快的，我就深深地已經沉陷在遊戲裡！
「許久」也並非是什麼誇大詞，從練功到買裝，從試職業到煩惱技能點法，從買裝備到附魔武器...真的能玩上許久！

啊，對了
這遊戲比較建議去Humble Bundle網站購買，一次擁有手機版本 + Steam版本的遊戲
因為就整體內容來講，我覺得恐怕還是比較適合破碎型的閒暇時間遊玩。Steam版本的就拿來單純減緩你的+1病症

author: {'steamid': '76561198141638439', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1174, 'last_played': 1530392276}
review:
I found that Knights of Pen and Paper was a nice take on the Rpg/Turn-base genre, though it does keep the generic combat classicaly found in the genre it posseses an interesting narrative that can keep a player interested throughout the whole game. The generic aspects aside the game does have a nice twist allowing the player to keep certain bonuses and gold on all save files  
which adds greatly to the replay value of the game. ( The game does have a + mode which allows you to restart your adventure  keeping all your characters but making the enemies allot harder )

A game I definitely recommend playing for new and veterans to the genre.

review: Docela prijemna oddechovka, ve ktere vam autori prinesou na vase monitory hru na hrdinu ve stylu Draci Doupe ci Dungeons & Dragons. Na misto dechberouci grafiky tak budete sledovat slovni popisy situace vaseho dobrodrizstvi doplnenou o vcelku vkusnou pixel art grafiku. A samozrejme nebudete ochuzeni o klasickou 20to stennou kostku. Ktera v mnoha pripradech rozhodne o vasi blizke budocnosti. Hra se sice po nejake dobe muze stat stereotypni, predevsim co se souboju tyce, ale na nekolik dni jiste zabavi. Navic obsahuje pomerne hodne achievementu, coz muze herni dobu taktez prodlouzit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019396241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1198, 'last_played': 1472239138}
review: Great game with a classic 8-bit look. Many different character and player combinations make for great replayability. Sometimes it can feel like a bit of a grind, but overall this is a real gem of a game. Give it a shot if you like old school games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024995878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1397436568}
review:
This game is one of those games that is hella fun until you realize that the first couple hours which were so awesome are what you're going to be doing for the next X hours until you're done. I wanted to love this game, I really did. I've been fascinated with it ever since I first heard about the idea of playing an RPG about an RPG and I did manage to avoid paying full price (Steam sale or Humble Bundle, can't remember which anymore), but after about 6 hours with this game, I just gave up. The story was bad, the writing was bad, the gameplay was cool at first but devolved into being bad by way of mindlessly repetitive (as soon as I had 4 worthwhile party members [balance is another issue with the game, honestly] I found myself unconsciously falling into a pattern of using the same attacks every time because it was pretty much a guaranteed win), the humour (read: pop-culture references) is outdated and forced... The graphics are very nice, though. There's something to be said for well-done 8-bit pixel art. I'd say something about the soundtrack here, but after a while I just turned it off and played my own music. I felt that it added more to the "game about a game" experience than generic chiptunes, honestly. I mean, if I were running a game of D&D, I'd probably be playing power metal, not NES soundtracks.

Bottom Line: If you're midly curious, skip it. If you absolutely HAVE to play this game, at least wait until a sale or something. The game deserves some attention for its unique premise, but it's just not worth the full price. At all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064373241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1299, 'last_played': 1445917022}

author: {'steamid': '76561198051345697', 'num_games_owned': 1309, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5734, 'last_played': 1403823212}
review:
Хорошая turn-based RPG.
Тебе предлагают играть за персонажей из реального мира которые играют персонажей в виртуальном. С этим фактом связана часть шуток. Много отсылок к другим играм, персонажам и т. п. Вобщем, в игре присутствует хороший юмор.
Сюжет не плох, но и ничего особенного(тут главное не сам сюжет, а юмор).
Сама игра не даст вам челленджа, но и легкой ее не назовешь.
Единственный минус, лично для меня, в музыке(играл без звука).

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198082134101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1408, 'last_played': 1423259336}
review: This game is perfect for when I want something fun to distract me from real-life without having to put too much effort into it.  Basically you're controlling a tabletop group of people - DM included.  It's relaxing and turn-based - no button mashing required.  I love the dialog among the different characters you can play.  There are a lot of pop culture references and just enough crude humor to make it entertaining.  There are all sorts of upgrades you can buy with gold to decorate the room the group is playing in (rugs, doors, items for the table like loaded dice and books)  that give bonuses to your characters.  There's a lot of customization for the characters as well.  I got this on sale for $2, but I'd say it's worth the full price.  I can see myself playing this game for a long time.

review: Um jogo muito divertido, recomendadíssimo para fãs de RPG's de mesa. review: I really have been enjoying the quality of this game. The gameplay is pretty straightforward like a normal RPG, but being able to add so many new classes and switching it up was appreciated. I also really enjoy the humor of this game and its locations. It seems like a silly idea, being in control of your people and their classes, but its pretty simple and enjoyable. Plus theres so many extra things to collect to enhance your game, I'm nowhere near done and I'm still excited to keep going.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995865992', 'num_games_owned': 1198, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1402555450}
review:
[h1][b] This isn't a terribly bad game, but it's fun is very fleeting and you'll forget about it the minute you exit out of it. [/b][/h1]

The premise was cool and was the main reason I bought it but they really didn't do anything with it - the characters are all interchangable (literally) and the dialog seems to be aimed at kids - the humor is mostly refrencing things and changing one word or changing it slightly (Wizards of the [i]East[/i] Coast, HAHAHAHA). You set your own pace on everything, like choosing which enemies you want to fight and how many, so the game never really suprises or challenges you. The quests are boring and all feel like sidequests (kill this many things, go here, collect this many things, blahblahblah). They've taken microtransactions out of the game but you can tell a lot of the mechanics were set up with those in mind.

They do have some neat things like the ability to buy upgrades and powerups for the 'real life' players, and these upgrades carry over different saves, but there isn't enough of this and you'll have most the things you want rather early on. The graphics are pretty nice as well, if you like the 8bit style. 

This game is probably better played on a phone or mobile device, this isn't a terrible port but it shows it was made for a touch screen in mind - for example you have to select the enemy to attack every time. I'd recommend buying this on a mobile touch screen device, it'll prob cost less - also it'd be easier to play it in short bursts like it is prob meant to be played.

In short, they botched it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048880581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1513191326}
review:
This is a clever cross platform RPG that plays like a tabletop without the roleplay. 

The Good
  - This is a really fun game with a lot of backstory.
  - There is a lot of freedom to do what you want/need to do. 
  - There is a ton of replayability because of the large amount of character options. 
  - Go anywhere you can afford. Grinding isn't the main thrust of the game.

The Bad
  - It's an RPG you will be grinding in some cases. 
  - Once you get a rhythm down it can get repetetive. 
  
Overall this was a surprisingly fun game. I was expecting something cute and shallow, but the sheer amount of stuff there is to do makes this a truly fun game with a nice story.

review:
Jogo bastante simples e divertido. É extremamente fácil de perder diversas horas o jogando. O maior pecado dele, como em todos rpgs eletrônicos, é a perda de liberdade que um RPG de mesa possibilita, e como a proposta do jogo é simular um rpg de mesa, isso fica ainda mais gritante.

Porém o jogo é bem feito, divertido e ainda barato, o fazendo ser uma escolha bastante divertida.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030783359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1597, 'last_played': 1415796067}
review:
After seeing a gameplay video on this game i had to give it a try and it delivers. If your into RPGs and tabletop gaming youll enjoy the combat ,options and story this game has to offer.Although some ppl have complained that it is to much of a grind i found that pushing though the story made the game reasonable difficult and well paced.
 Although the replay value is weak there is the option of using the different and new classes and items to get some replay value but dont expect to be playing through half a dozen times.
 The story is amusing and quirky with alot of pop and nerd culture references littered through out spicing it up and providing alot of humour to keep you going.
 I think it was well worth the money i paid and was one of the funnest games ive played this year.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998079161', 'num_games_owned': 1369, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1408501286}
review:
Ideia excelente trazer o ambiente das jogatinas de RPG de mesa num formato digital. Em meio ao falatório e a bagunça tradicional, explorada da forma mais cômica possível, aventuras bem boladas se desenrolam. Um jogo que merece a atenção dos saudosistas! Mais que recomendado! Nota: 8.5/10!

Prós:
• Gráficos indies.
• Áudio agradável.
• Jogabilidade aponte e clique.
• Dificuldade razoável.
• Diversão sem limites.

Contras:
• Nada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034358843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2096, 'last_played': 1503732163}
review:
Knight of Pen and Paper is basically a fun bad-pun-filled D&D night with your friends, but in 8-bit form. Very easy to pick up, intuitive UI and battle system, and loads of fun. It's definitely very entertaining and worth the purchase.

The wide range of character/class set-ups offer replayability (though that's really the only reason to replay the adventure). The game is free from unecessary bloat or complications. Solid design.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995158485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 3284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2574, 'last_played': 1422121218}
review:
I had a ton of fun with this classic arcade style turn-based RPG. There's plenty to love in designing your own D&D room, then using all the bonuses in the game world when you start playing. I can see this used to be a "pay-to-win" sort of game, but thankfully that's been taken out so it's all good now.

As far as style and identity, this game has NONE of it's own. Every creature, every location, virtually every screen and character and bit of dialogue is pulled from somewhere else. The temples are marked with nintendo controllers. Gonzo and Rizzo (muppets) are aliens. There are Chozo (metriod) statues and dancing skeletons and everything in between. This game is a giant cluster-(blank) of references, both of the pop-culture and video game history variety. While this IS charming, it does get old after a while. There's a difference between a cute little nod towards another game, and just building your ENTIRE GAME around references.

[b]TDLR:[/b]
+It's very, very fun and cute for a quick laugh. (excellent price)
+It's a solid turn-based RPG that'll tickle your nostalgia bone.
+20-25hr campaign with tons of unlockables.
+/-The ENTIRE GAME is nothing but references to other games and geek culture.
+/- Low difficulty, okay replay value.
-Some achievements are needlessly grindy. (Complete 50 dungeons, wee!)
-Some achievements are [i]badly[/i] bugged. 1-3 of them simply don't work or don't work as intended.


Is it worth getting? If you're ingrained in nerd culture and can grasp all the nintendo, Doctor Who and other references-- its more than worth it's price tag. Check it out. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197992926831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1402931489}
review:
Ce jeu est tout simplement une pépite.
Il n'a pas l'aura et la renommée d'une grosse franchise mais il fait tout simplement l'effet qu'il devrait. Pour tout les joueurs de JDR sur table qui n'ont pas la possibilité de trouver un groupe IRL pour jouer, ce jeu est parfait.
Même si certains éléments sont vraiment trop fantaisistes, le fun est là et on s'amuse beaucoup.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040853714', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 938, 'last_played': 1429382575}
review: This game is very addicting, but the fun kind of addicting. It was so fun, that i got really sad when i thought that i was approaching the end of the game, but then i realized that it wasn't really the end of the game, so i became happy again. I don't know how far I am into the game now, but I have mostly level 30-40 characters, which i think is about half way to max level, (not sure exactly what max level is though) and this game is still very fun. Over 10 hours and this game still isn't old. I highly recommend this classic RPG styled game

author: {'steamid': '76561198083815374', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1408671073}
review:
Made in Brazil!! oh yes!

Gráficos: Pixel arte cara eu preciso falar algo mais? Sim eu preciso! PERFEIÇÂO!
Jogabilidade: Como se trata de um "simulador de RPG de mesa" então o sistema de turnos caiu muito bem!
Sons: Simples e nostálgicos ^^

Nota: Paladino Lvl. 10!

Mas então, se eu não me engano esse game foi feito com o foco nas plataformas mobiles, sabendo disso você logo percebe que o jogo é um verdadeiro TOP em seu reinado, afinal se algo já está bom em plataformas de games robustos e sofisticados imagina nos mobiles? (Se bem que por lá isso tá ficado bem requisitado também)

author: {'steamid': '76561198053716831', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 1190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1415344542}
review:
As frequently as this goes on sale, the game itself remains as disappointing as ever. Each character has four skills, which become repetitive instantly. Combat, levelling, and crafting are excessively grindy. The story is essentially non-existant and the attempts at satire are forced. Not to mention some of the achievements are broken and the developers have done nothing to fix this for years, despite being entirely aware of it.

A game lackluster in all respects.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025561413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3, 'last_played': 1557622358}
review:
If you have EVER played a tabletop RPG (Dungeons and Dragons, GURPS, anything by White Wolf; or for that matter, anything where dice, paper and your imagination are required) you will be familiar with how this game operates.  Folks are around the table, One leads them in thier adventure and (sort of) asks them what they feel like doing.  The crazy part about this RPG, is that the DM and Characters are sitting around thier table as they go about thier adventure.

Then, introduce EVERY NERD TROPE YOU CAN THINK OF.  Seriously, ALL OF THEM.  I saw a Tardis, Stargate and a Pyramid all in the same background.  Nothing is sacred and nothing is safe, and for that reason the game is a BLAST.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031978305', 'num_games_owned': 1917, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1415901821}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015927355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1413481703}
review: Grab this game on sale while you can. Absolutely great bang for the buck at 3.39 for normal and 5.09 for the deluxe. It's very simple, yet very addicting. It has such basic things that I love about the older RPG games: No preset characters whos backstory is always the same or the same class. You simply pick what classes you want and jump right into it - think final fantasy 1. It's got a goofy spin on it that I like: You are always playing from the game table even when fighting and can buy furniture, snacks, etc. for bonuses. You won't regret buying this game. ESPECIALLY on sale. GET IT NOW!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052450529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1407312994}

author: {'steamid': '76561198033981978', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1501307568}
review: This game is a lot of fun. I also have it on my phone from Humble Bundle. I play it on the bus and on my PC when i get home. It's a fun little game to pass the time. I like the fact you can create your own team of players and customize the room you play in. The fun little quotes they have are pretty cool. The only thing i would like to change is that the Dungeon Master should pick which creatures you face, instead of the player choosing which and how many creatures to face. But overall I really do enjoy playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013253627', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1687499171}
review: I wasn't exspecting much from this game. I watched the video and I thought that the graphics looked really cool and so I bought it, plus it was on sale. Now this game has my full attention and has completely blown me away. I wasn't expecting to open the game and sit and play it for hours on end without looking away from the screen. I have only one regret about buy this game though. It is that I didn't buy the deluxe edition when I had the chance cause there is no upgrade as of right now so I'm missing out on a few extra levels and a new character. So buy this game, and buy the deluxe edition cause you will regret it!

review: Honestly I genuinely enjoy this game. If you don't like grinding then you won't like it, but if you're like me and don't mind it, then I think you'll like it as a casual, good-but-don't-want-to-tell-the-entire-world, non-life-changing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037793209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1459720505}
review: Junte suas incríveis histórias mestradas em uma mesa de D&D com a nostalgia dos 8-bits e uma pitada de humor. Tudo isso você vai encontrar em Knights of Pen and Paper. Toda a essência que havia em sua versão Android foi muito bem transmitida para o computador: somente com o mouse você domina o jogo inteiro. Apesar de sua jogabilidade ser um pouco travada e enjoar em certos pontos, como todo bom RPG, ele conta com suporte a várias línguas (inclusive ao Português Brasileiro, graças aos desenvolvedores serem Brasileiros), um enredo simples, porém cativante, e uma boa trilha sonora. Você com certeza vai perder horas do seu dia preso nesse jogo. Vale lembrar também que extinção das Microtransações só tornaram esse jogo ainda melhor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026154042', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1475262781}

author: {'steamid': '76561198138636487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1405171299}
review: Un soplo de aire fresco entre tanto juego masivo. Un rpg diferente, aunque clásico; por turnos, pixelart, tópicos y guiños de los típicos juegos y sagas... Pero eso de no menearte de la mesa, con el master delante, lanzando dados y con esa historia tan típica de noche de rol, con sus puntos cómicos y absurdos (sin falta de épica, claro). Lo recomiendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063726688', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1419773362}
review:
Comprei e joguei no mesmo dia, gostei muito. É muito legal a idéia do jogo de ser uma sessão de RPG de mesa, você mesmo escolhe a quantidade de inimigos do jogo e isso é bom pois você pode enfrentar qualquer monstro desde que você seja forte o suficiente.
Tambem gostei de poder jogar o jogo todo em Português do Brasil, sem contar que o jogo é produzido por brasileiros.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972516345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2294, 'last_played': 1400174659}
review: If you're a fan of turn based games with minimal graphics, this is the game for you. It takes very good aspects of DnD and packages it into a nice little table top game. Do recomend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008784747', 'num_games_owned': 1393, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1542505226}
review: A good game, reminds me of Ancients Death Watch from way back in the early 90's.  Lots of fun, great game play and the game mechanics are well thought out too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090766605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1816, 'last_played': 1402255081}
review: This is an excellent game that makes a lot of references to pencil-and-paper RPGs.  It has a fun retro style, and is full of geeky humor.  It's not very deep, but that works in its favor.  It's the kind of game you can play for a few minutes at a time, or you can go at it for hours to knock a bunch of quests out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040677656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 881, 'last_played': 1403312521}
review:
Love old school RPGing but don't have the time to invest in the latest RPG? Then this is the game for you! Even if you just need something to kill a few minutes every now and then, you can't go wrong with this game.

It's classic role-playing finely tuned for a casual gaming experience. You can play this game at your own leisure, choosing to challenge yourself as much as you desire. Choose your party, collect your quests, and pick your encounters. All with the click of a mouse!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007719464', 'num_games_owned': 521, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1402262372}
review: Increíble, la verdad un juego simple pero tan adictivo, ir mejorando habilidades, una historia que es simple pero engancha. Muy recomendable, lo instalé para sacarle los cromos nomás, pero la verdad que vale muchisimo la pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082808136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 676, 'last_played': 1448077361}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004416299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1392493237}
review:
Vtipne! Velice vtipne! A velice podarene!
Hra, ktera nadchne kazdeho starsiho geeka, jenz ve sve pubertalni fazi zivota travil vecery mimo beznou zabavu vrstevniku a v potemelych pokojich, nad ctvereckovanym papirem, s predimenzovanou fantazii, nabrousenym ostrovtipem a dvacetistenou kostkou, spokojene, s partou dalsich stredoveko-fantasknich hrdinu, leveloval a premlouval Pana jeskyne, ze toho trolla, co hlida vstup do Temne veze, se svou naboostenou kouzelnickou inteligenci s klidem ukeca...

A o cem ze to tedy je?
O tom jak particka dobrodruhu, ne nepodobna te vyse popsane, hraje hru na hrdiny.

System samotne hry je jednoduchy, funkcni a zabavny - vyberete postavu, nahodite roly, pozici u stolu a pak uz je na rade PJ, ktery pred vami doslova otevre ohrozeny svet plny nebezpeci a chudych rolniku, co potrebuji pomoc se ztracenym dobytkem nebo zakutalenymi jablky :) 
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198048418886', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 2826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1703617090}

author: {'steamid': '76561198081382083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1402003319}
review: I thought this was going to be a quick, fun and quirky adventure full of quips, puns and fun. Its hard to explain, this game had alot of potential and the idea behind it was solid, but it just dumbs everything down to the point where its hard to like. It does too much of the work for you, and takes away all your options. It feels like a pre-alpha build of what could have been a great game, with zero of the features included, like a proof of concept. I was seriously disappointed, because I was actually excited to play it after watching the preview for it.

review: I'm pretty happy with this game. I got it on a sale at a bargain, and it's well worth what i paid. I wouldnt pay full price for it though. This game can be pretty repeatative, even the music just loops. Fun little game if you want to just kind of veg out for a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043950825', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1519, 'last_played': 1402331034}
review:
[b]J U E G A Z O.[/b] Si te gustan los RPG por turnos, este te va a encantar. La historia es muy entretenida y constantemente hay guiños en las conversaciones o en los escenarios a otras famosisimas sagas. Muchisimos personajes y roles para combinar a tu gusto y personalizar la "partida" como quieras.

El único punto "negativo" por asi decirlo, es que se maneja integramente con el ratón, no tiene soporte para mando ni teclas de acceso rápido, además de que hay que comprar y vender de uno en uno los objetos, pero bueno.

En resumen, a jugarlo todos! Espero pillar el 2 pronto y poder ver si es aún mejor!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009093193', 'num_games_owned': 2404, 'num_reviews': 300, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1448083262}
review:
Microtransations in a paid for single-player game.  Avoid.  It can be fun if you get it on a large sale, but if you plan to seriously play it, rethink that thought right now.
Humor is good, gameplay is crap.  Come on Paradox, you're better than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104065928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1401144493}
review: I just bought this as part of a package deal for $5.09.  It came with a promo code, but it is impossible to enter it in game.  The game doesn't let you use lowercase letters even though the code has them.  Consequently, it won't accept the promo code.  Finding an error in programing within the first minute of playing the game and hearing the grinding, iritating, and monotonous music looping over and over again as frustration builds soured my opinion instantly.  Ever stop watching a movie within the first minute of playing it?  That can happen with video games too.  There are plenty of reviews about gameplay, but the community needs to know about flaws as well to get an accurate picture.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032830821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1424217459}
review: Loads of fun! Simple to play, clever toon customization, and easily worth 2-3x the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975392126', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1402262250}
review:
a solid rpg game, pretty much (s)nes sytle w/o the 'walking in an open world with random encounters'. instead you have routes.
a nice plus are the popculture references.
i finished it on android first, now i sometimes play it on pc.

some quests are repetative, indeed - kill x of those, collect x of these...
travel/escort person x to place y.

thing that could have done better: the game seemed easy - or maybe i had a good combo and didnt had to switch characters/classes.
just for 'mom' i had to swith in the cleric for the druid i had before.

overall: worth its money

author: {'steamid': '76561198041995002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1482098046}
review: Every time I try to play this game it crashes about 10/15 minutes in, I enjoy the game for those short bursts but this is the only game that does this, it's a shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967992446', 'num_games_owned': 1178, 'num_reviews': 543, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1401090590}
review:
When this game first came out on Steam, it was a port of a really grindy and repetitive mobile game that had microtransactions in it, namely to pay actual money for more in-game gold instead of having to grind it out from combat and the infinite amount of escort and item collection quests. People who bought it on release were fucking pissed off about the microtransactions.

Now that the microtransactions have been patched out, it plays like a game with too many fucking escort and item collection quests. Basically, a mobile game without the option to skip the grind. Don't fucking bother, read a book instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970941642', 'num_games_owned': 1639, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1442345519}
review:
La première fois que j'ai vu les images du jeu, je me suis dit encore un casual game, sans grand intérêt. 
Puis j'ai regardé les explications, le fonctionnement du jeu, et là j'ai trouvé l'idée magnifique. 
Vous êtes à la fois les joueurs et le Maitre de jeu d'une partie de jeu de rôle Papier. Vous écrivez votre histoire, en choisissant vos propres actions, vous faites jeter les dés au maitre de jeu pour chaques actions, Montez votre niveau, gagnez des pièces d'or, débloquez des bonus, dans une quête épique donc vous êtes à la fois un tout, et à la fois sur laquelle vous n'avez pas la main. Foncez, c'est un indé sûr !

author: {'steamid': '76561198002945013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 1393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1165, 'last_played': 1405835199}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027998028', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1391267539}
review: No he encontrado nada interesante en este juego salvo la referencias cómicas a la cultura del rol de mesa. Puede que en un dispositivo movil tenga sentido como entretenimiento casual.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976923611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1423770615}
review:
The game is good and has a nice variety. It's certainly simple, but it has a short-term, addictive charm.

The biggest problem by far is that it crashes far too often. I have two different PCs, both easily capable of playing a game like this, and the game has crashed well over a dozen times. The fact that the game doesn't have a save function unless you [save & quit] also makes it frustrating when you lose a lot of progress.

With this bug, as of 5/22/14, I can't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009843704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1400807634}
review:
This is not the best looking game, but it is a fun RPG to play.  I run it in a window while I do other things on my PC.

The game is a very simple, single player, turn-based, RPG game, where a bunch of friends sit at a table with a DM and play a D&D-type game by a rolling a die to decide everything (view trailer on Steam).  You can have anywhere from 2-5 people in your group.  The graphics are Pixel Art (i.e. very basic square pixels to create everything).  There is a simple map with locations that are level based.  You have a main quest line as well as additional quests per location.  Finishing some quests can open up new quests throughout the map.  There are also dungeons, that have their own maps, monsters, bosses, etc..

There are 12 player types and 17 character types, although not all of the player/character types are available initially.  Each player and character can only be used once in your group.  Each player type, gives your character a passive skill.  Each character type, has 4 skills that can be a mix of passive/active skills.  You get a skill point each time you level your character.  There are quests to find the additional player/character types and once they are found they are available to all save slots (see below).

The game has three save slots, so you can have three different groups playing the game.  The game only has one pool of gold that is shared between all three save slots.  You can purchase new tables, table items, room accouterments, doors, walls, and other items that will also be shared between all save slots.  So once they are purchased, they are available to all three player groups.  A couple of essential items are the BK Crown and the Holy Grail, which allow you to face 7 enemies at a time (default 5) and have 5 party members (default 3?).  You get bonus XP for larger groups of enemies.  

You earn gold at the end of each fight, quest, etc..  You use gold to purchase potions and items from a store/blacksmith/enchanter/etc..  You also need gold to travel.  You can fight at any location to generate some gold as needed.  You can rest after most fights to recoup your health/mana, although a dice will roll to see if you have any interruptions to your sleep.  If your player dies, you can revive them but paying gold.  Initially, your low level character can be resurrected for 0 gold.  I played the game without needing any potions by just using my group's healing and mana generators during a fight or resting after a fight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134023045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1456386884}
review: Simple, Classic, and really enjoyable RPG!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031348089', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1113, 'last_played': 1396133296}
review:
タイトルのとおりPen and PaperのRPG（TRPG）をモチーフにしたゲーム。
といっても自由度が高いTRPG風のRPGというわけではなく、むしろ
TRPGをしているプレイヤーを動かすゲーム、という感覚が近いだろうか。

パーティキャラクターは「プレイヤー」と「ゲームキャラクター（職業）」の組み合わせで作成。
卓を挟んだゲームマスターとプレイヤーの会話で話が進んでいく。
このプレイヤーやマスターはどこかで見たことのあるような人物が多く、
またストーリー進行中もTRPGをしたことのある人なら「あるある」と思ってしまうような台詞が
飛び出すなど、つまりはメタ構造を楽しむゲームなのである。

日本語化されてはいないものの、わりあい易しい英語ばかりなのでプレイに支障はないはず。
ただ、キャラクターたちの会話のやりとりがこのゲームの大きな魅力なので、
読み飛ばさずじっくり読んでみてほしい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198003306883', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1455, 'last_played': 1398899398}
review:
The first half of this game is awesome. Once you hit roughly level 15 the sidequests are absent. If your going to play this title it's not too bad, to make the experience better, spend some cash on the XP potions especially at lower levels.

Once you finish the level 15 main quest the next main quest level jumps to 21. I might finish this title one day, I really don't want to grind 6 levels especially when the xp requirements are so high at that point.

I'm going to have to give Knight of Pen and Paper a thumbs down. I'm certainly not saying this is a terrible game though and many people will probably love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000750565', 'num_games_owned': 1207, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1400075876}
review:
Es un juego de rol dentro de otro juego de rol, literalmente: controlas hasta a cinco estereotipos de la sociedad dentro de un amplio abanico (la abuela, el bruto, el crío, el hipster...) cada uno con diferentes ventajas para las clases que dieras darle y que se meten en una partida de rol de las de toda la vida, con sus dados, sus tiradas, su máster con sus chascarrillos y sus perrerías... 

Como propuesta es muy original, pero desgraciadamente, yo no he llegado a acabármelo por dos razones:

1.- Resulta muy, muy repetitivo: todas las misiones acaban resumiéndose a matar cuatro o cinco enemigos distintos sin apenas variar tu estrategia. El tener apenas 2 o 3 habilidades diferentes por clase no ayuda...
2.- Quizá sea un punto bastante subjetivo, pero a mí los combates se me antojan lentísimos; tardas un montón en cargarte cualquier enemigo si no le sacas bastantes niveles, y ya ni te digo si combates contra siete a la vez. Supongo que se puede compensar si usas equipos muy ofensivos (dos de mis miembros del equipo son un paladín y un clérigo, y eso implica daño casi nulo) pero no sé, la impresión que me da es esa...

En general lo recomiendo, porque como propuesta jugable resulta bastante original y es gracioso cuando te encuentras cualquier referencia friki (puedes hacer que el maestro de las tortugas ninja narre la partida, por ejemplo) pero sé consciente de las limitaciones que tiene.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047121191', 'num_games_owned': 2367, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1021, 'last_played': 1399348858}
review:
Excellent game, one of my favorites for the year, but certainly this type of game will not be everyone's cup of tea.

If you're around 20s or older you would perhaps miss those retro moments and this game will bring to the table exactly that if not better. I will not, however, classify this as a "Main" game though, as the game itself is pretty fast once you know your way around and perhaps light-bites of retro fun is a better summation for this title. Regardless, its a neat and great one at that and I suggest you get one right away if you love old-school RPGs.

8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198042023224', 'num_games_owned': 1587, 'num_reviews': 1027, 'playtime_forever': 1723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1723, 'last_played': 1399889055}
review:
간략화된 TRPG. 

그닥 좁지 않은 맵, 적절한 길이의 캠페인, 꽤나 방대한 양의 서브퀘스트(및 패러디들),
가장 참신한 건, 역시 적의 종류 및 숫자를 어느 정도 조절해 줄 수 있다는 것.
위자드리나 드래곤퀘스트 같은거 하면서 즐겼던 TRPG의 향취를 제법 느낄 수 있어 좋다.
여관시스템 등을 통해 멤버교체가 자유로운 것도 매력적.
TRPG 치곤 자유도가 꽤나 높으편.

다만 원래 모바일 게임이었던 걸 이식하느라 과금결제 개념을 고대로 가져온 게 크나큰 문제점.
(지금은 과금결제는 없어졌다.)
또한 어느정도 과금결제를 노리고 만든 게임이라 그런지 과금을 안 하면 느낄 불편점이 하나 있는데, 바로 골드. 게임하면서 요구되는 골드는 많은데 그걸 충당하려면 결국 노가다를 해야되고, 노가다 대비 버는 골드의 효율이 그닥 높질 않다.

게임의 퀄리티 자체가 뛰어나 일단 추천은 하겠으나,
전형적인 과금 요구하는 게임들이 싫다면 그냥 적절히 즐기고 게임 지우시면 되겠다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028066044', 'num_games_owned': 907, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1415184887}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper was a IOS and Android game that could rival Angry birds, Candy Crush saga and....Flappy bird??. But since Knights of pen and paper was released on PC it has become even bigger than its compedators, I have hundreds of hours clocked on the IOS version of this game and have loved every single moment of it. The PC Version has increased features, some added monsters, adventures and etc and will keep you playing for hours.

Knights of Pen and Paper is as the title suggests a pen and paper kind of game like Dungeons of dragons, where you roll a dice and depending on the number you can get good or bad results. For example, ingame you are camping in the woods and you have to get between 5 and 10 in order for your group to rest without being attacked, if you get lower than 5 and 20 your group will be attacked by an enemy equal to your Level. When you travel you roll the dice and same as before you will either get good or bad results. 

The characters in this game range from a Jock, A Rocker, Teen girl, Alien, Little brother, Grandma, and many more, each character has a different ability that will make you think if thats the right character for a class. Another example would be the Grandma who has extra Threat so if the gradma was a Warrior she would be the Tank of the group being that the monsters will attack her more than any of her group. The Story ingame is completely up to you, you make choices and the characters follow them. Each character type has their own funny quirks and quips like the little brother shouting "PICK ME PICK ME PICK ME" when going into battle or the Jock character just being an ass.

10/10 must Buy ;3

author: {'steamid': '76561197992070626', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1290, 'last_played': 1399073120}
review:
Knight of Pen & Paper is a simulator of RPG style combats. You can choose which monster to beat and how many of them. So you're totally free to put your own difficulty.
The game reminds me of those old roleplays used to be "played" in forums:
5 characters around a table with a master that is telling all the interactions you're doing with them. 
Plenty of environments, classes and monsters more or less tough are available during the quests.

The bad point is the repetitive actions in combat, from a place to another you can't change your character because it will take too long to level. A character has only 4 skills, you can easily choose which skill is the best though you will note that the effects of a single skill does the same for every monster: An ice monster should be weak against fire. The mage class uses "Fireball", no effect. "Deep Freeze", super effective, and that against most of the monsters.

Finally, the game should be fine for beginners, who never played any old RPG game before because Knights Of Pen & Paper is really easy to beat, hard with patience.
Otherwise, I think the game would fit better on phone and tablets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077186342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1431470000}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070964319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1438053018}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006653420', 'num_games_owned': 2271, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1426269657}
review:
A fun RPG styled after a group of people playing DnD.  There's a decent amount of customization with a good variety of characters and classes.  The writing is pretty good.  

My main complaint is the game really drags on towards the end.  The entire game is combat and dialogue, and the combat doesn't vary much, so after a while it gets extremely repetitive.  I ended up skipping half the sidequests because I just wanted to be done.

If you enjoy DnD I highly recommend this game.  Otherwise, it is a decent RPG worth paying a few dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107471020', 'num_games_owned': 2152, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1411526776}
review: Um jogo extremamente bonito, divertido e ao mesmo tempo muito criativo. Knights of Pen and Paper +1 é um jogo que mescla elementos de RPG de mesa com de clássicos RPGs eletronicos como Dragon Quest. O mestre fica numa parte da mesa e na outra ficam os jogadores, que são pessoas comuns como nós, interpretando os personagens (cada qual com suas respectivas classes, que são escolhidas pelos jogadores). Além da criatividade grandiosa, o jogo permite uma liberdade muito boa para treinar os personagens, aprimorar seus atributos e personalizar seus ambientes conforme suas necessidades. Simplesmente recomendado, além de ter uma história bacana, liberdade para ir aos locais e originalidade tem graficos que remetem bem ao estilo papel, lápis e caneta, além de agradar casuais e jogadores que buscam desafios simples porém divertidissimos.
