author: {'steamid': '76561198063336845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 999, 'last_played': 1429724292}
review: This is my goto rpg whenever I'm itching for an adventure to defeat stuff while sitting at my table (literally in the game). It combines a theme of table top gaming and a fantasy rpg that churns up a uniqe and delightful experience for anyone who gets this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970345808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1398615044}
review: The idea is BRILLIANT in my opinion! Here is a game clearly dedicated to pen and paper RP-ers, and the meta-feel of it all is excellent. The execution, however, is not up to par. The game begins well, with quips to geek culture all over the place. However, it quickly devolves into a "hit monsters, get XP" run of the mill game. The RP component is not there, they fail to pull jokes consistently and you get an old-school hack-and-slash RPG with a meta LOOK. The game caught my interest in the beginning, yet ended up being too boring to complete.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014296738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2348, 'last_played': 1702663206}
review: Great game, lots of fun, many party combinations, great time killer, check out the mobile version too

author: {'steamid': '76561197964150853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1396987880}
review:
I waited a long time to pick this up.

I haven't played it for very long, and in the time I have played the game feels very unguided and clunky.

It seems like it needs a tutorial to explain how the flow of the game works.

It feels like you just move from one background to another, and at each one you can pick your battles.

This makes the game feel really disjointed and like there's no story or explanation of what's going on.

I'm giving a thumbs down for now because I don't understand what you are supposed to do in the game. Right now it feels like a really simple sandbox for turn-based RPG style fights with nothing else.

I'll report back after playing more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998254543', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1398524539}
review: Ce jeu est une tuerie. En 1109 jours j'ai finis presque a 100% le jeu sur smartphone. Je me refais un plaisir de le torcher sur PC. Fun, adictif, juissif, bourré de référence, un must.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052698549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2637, 'last_played': 1540043091}
review:
Ich sags vorneweg: Ein geniales Spiel!
Immer wieder findet man Anspielungen auf andere Videospiele, Filme, etc., es gibt genug Witz
und mehr als genug Quests. Ich selbst habe noch nie eine Pen and Paper Partie gespielt (also, eine die nicht am Pc stattfindet), aber genauso stelle ich mir das vor. Das Spiel nimmt sich selbst nicht so ernst und das ist auch gut so. Andernfalls wäre es wohl schwer gewesen, den Spieler an den Bildschirm zu fesseln.

Zugegeben: Die Quests sind manchmal sehr nervig und die Level der neuen Gebiete steigern sich ein wenig zu schnell, aber solange man auf Normal spielt, klappts eigentlich ganz gut. Von meiner Warte aus kann ich sagen, dass Knights of Pen and Paper ein faires und spaßiges Spiel ist. Schön, dass man so etwas auch heute noch zu Gesicht bekommt. 
Meine Wertung: 81% - Sehr empfehlenswert!

[b]Anhang[/b]
Hat euch das Review gefallen oder ihr habt einfach Interesse am Schreiben von Reviews, dann unterstützt doch bitte unsere noch im Aufbau befindliche Gruppe [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/germanicusreviewius]GermanReviews[/url]

Wer an Lets Plays von mir interessiert ist, der kann gerne auf dem [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsmwY21QABw-LxG-6Uh4gZw/videos?view_as=subscriber]Order of Gamers[/url] vorbeischauen! Ich freu mich auf jeden von euch!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032378682', 'num_games_owned': 1454, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1066, 'last_played': 1397152441}
review:
So it took me 25 hours of gameplay before I realized this isn't a RPG - it's a simulator, simulating a tabletop role-playing session. Needless to say, it's an awesome game.

Although, on the con-side, the battles are quite repetitive - the grinding parts are just dreadful.

Still, I put in a good 30 hours on this. So, yeah. It's a good game.

7/10 - awesome idea, but awful grinding and repetitive battles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967419832', 'num_games_owned': 1360, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1398993153}
review:
A fun and very casual JRPG-like themed like a Tabletop D&D game. There's plenty of upgrades both for your individual characters and the party as a whole. These upgrades increase the quality of your characters gear, or even buy new accesories for your room which grant passive bonuses to your group. 

This is a light RPG game, great in small bursts, as this was once a mobile game. However it's also fun in longer bursts. 

I plan on updating this review later, so check in if ya want.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025287127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1305, 'last_played': 1398129307}
review:
At first, I thought this game was great!  However, then it just turned into a grind and the completionist in me forced me to play through and finish it.  Here are the main complaints:

-The game progresses pretty smoothly and you don't need to grind much until the last dungeon.  I could get to the last dungeon easily, but then had to do almost 5 levels of grinding with all my guys just to be able to complete the final dungeon.
-The blacksmith levels up far too slowly. The only way to level him is to get him grindstones, which you can find 1 to 4 of in certain locations.  However, at the final level you can give him 20-30 grindstones and barely move his xp bar.
-Any game that encourages micro-transactions has already failed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009655674', 'num_games_owned': 635, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 762, 'last_played': 1398230397}
review:
Cons:

-Monotonous
-The additonal content is lackluster
- The Story isn't that great/funny
-Very few songs

Pros:

-Decent enemy variety

author: {'steamid': '76561198116797541', 'num_games_owned': 1732, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 2770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2237, 'last_played': 1561711980}
review:
充滿復古風格的RPG遊戲，原本想說睡前玩玩結果一玩到天亮XD

設計很簡單卻不乏遊戲性，主線任務約10小時左右就能全破，個人覺得長度很剛好
雖然是簡單的PRG卻也需要角色、職業和技能分配的技巧，不然也可能會陷入卡任務的窘境(像我打龍試了十幾次...)。有很多地方有小技巧可以省錢、增加衝裝成功機率，一開始不知道花了很多冤枉錢，但一旦摸上手就會很有成就感；整體而言順暢度夠，配樂懷舊舒適，打怪衝裝解任務的過程樂趣十足。

Paradox出品還真的還沒讓我失望過，期待更多有趣的遊戲！
花了40多小時終於全程就啦！

Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition
[7.5/10]

author: {'steamid': '76561197997880213', 'num_games_owned': 616, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1389825169}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037976872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1431953401}
review:
Before I start, I must imply Ive played this game on my tablet so Ive no hours played on PC but its the same version.

The majority of this game is well executed with a strong plot, side missions and with the moderate fun level of killing the baddie mansies. BUT..... After playing the game for at least 30+ hours I have found that a lot of areas are VERY FARMY to level up and by the time you get to the end the "PLOT" seems to disintegrate to nothing. 

To this date I CANT complete the end boss as am 20 levels lower than it and theres NO PLOT to level me to it. 

VERY SAD dissapointment, especially the second half of the game!! 

PS Missions are very irresponsably levelled, and I was left several times with no missions to do as I wasnt high level enough and no low level ones to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025159964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1397938497}
review:
Hard to recommend, but recommending nonetheless. Why? It's just full of charm, funny little cultural references and has a pretty good amount of content. However combat gets very boring as each class has 4 abilities, one of which is just a passive for 80-90% of the classes. So you largely spam the same 1-2 abilities, with the rare use (sometimes once a fight later on) of a 3rd ability, and sometimes a basic attack.

Other gripe is upgrading items at the blacksmith. Farming grindstones takes forever after the 1st or 2nd upgrade for him. However if you want upgrades without spending ALL of your gold, you need to gather dozens of these at a time for a 5-10% increase in chance of succesfully forging an item. Don't even bother trying unless you're at about 60% success, because you can waste almost all your gold upgrading one or two items. It's a shame because this could have been a really fun and important mechanic, but feels really forced. The only way to get grindstones is travel to caves, and hopefully roll a high enough number for each ore vein present, or spend 25 G a piece. As I said though this can take ALOT of grindstones and buying that amount can really add up in early-midgame as gold generally isnt earned fast. Battles (depending on bonuses of items you have and what you are fighting) generally drop 1-20 gold.

The blacksmith, repetive fighting and slow accumlation of gold are painfully dull or even annoying. However, the concept, dialogue, references, simplicity and music keep it entertaining enough to play for 20 or so minutes at a time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042098921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1642460767}
review: Il est facile de résumer Knights of Pen and Paper : c'est un jeu qui ne cherche pas à être le jeu de l'année, mais qui cherche au moins à faire bien ce qu'il cherche à faire. Et c'est réussi : le jeu se joue simplement, on prend plaisir à y jouer, c'est clair et efficace. Un petit jeu sympathique recommandable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070783429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1458, 'last_played': 1391445273}
review:
Tudo o que um bom Nerd das antigas gosta reunido em um único jogo: RPG de mesa (com uma boa história), belos gráficos 16 bits e uma boa aventura pela frente.

A história do jogo pode se tornar bem extensa e divertida caso você tenha paciência para ler os diálogos do jogo mas se você conseguir fazer isso, ficará imerso no jogo por muito tempo esquecendo de muitas tarefas escolares e da vida lá fora kkk.

O jogo também apresenta um preço muito bacana na Steam/Google Play/App Store (caso queiram jogar em seus smartphones) fazendo com que sua aventura seja um dinheiro bem gasto.

Mas termino minha analise com apenas uma pequena critica que deveria haver mais variedades de itens para todas as classes do jogo.. Fora isto, ele é muito legal :)

Devo ter esquecido de comentar mais algumas coisas que notei em todo o jogo, mas caso eu lembre, irei voltar aqui para adiciona-las (ou não, vai depender do meu nível de alzheimer precoce).

author: {'steamid': '76561198065073372', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1399713194}
review:
Як і будь-який геймер, який поважає себе і вважає себе справжнім гравцем, має ознайомитися з усіма жанрами ігрової індустрії. І одним із таких жанрів, застарілих зараз, є покрокова текстова рольова гра. Я завжди мріяв побавитися в забавку такого жанру, а тому був дуже радий, коли виграв Knights of Pen and Paper +1. Надзвичайна гра, яка принесла навіть на даному етапі (всього 2.5 години) незабутні емоції. Виконана не в диковинку зараз - у піксельному оформленні, що ще раз говорить гравцеві, що це саме олдфажна гра. Вона базується на тому, що гравець, сідає за стіл, за яким сидить ГМ - гейм мастер, знайомий з розповідей "олдускеллерів" (які в свій час зависали за настольними іграми, такими як D'n'D, наприклад) і роблячи певні ходи розповідає все, що коїться в даний момент з гравцем. Цікавенька схема, чи не правда? Ось саме це і захоплює, адже відчуваєш дух минулого, згадуєш розповіді братів/сестер про настільні ігри, в пам"яті проминає серіал Теорія великого вибуху.
Ось така вона, Knights of Pena and Paper +1 - вносить щось нове у внутрішній світ ньюфага, та ще й примушує згадати минуле. А тут ще і до всього є багато відсилок (наприклад, до таких телесеріалів як "Декстер" та "Доктор Хто").
Рекомендую цю гру всім, хто вважає себе геймером.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046139420', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1787, 'last_played': 1401099877}
review:
TRPG風のクリックゲー。
TRPGといっても別に自由度が高いわけでもなく、戦闘もクラシカルなターン制。基本的にはお使いやモンスター退治のクエストをこなして最後は世界を救う、というとてもオーソドックスな内容。
しかし、TRPGならではのメタ発言や、テーブルの上にお菓子を用意するとゲーム内のステータスを強化できるなど、なんとなくわくわくしてしまう要素があります。（他にもステータスアップには部屋の内装や、ゲームマスターの交換まで）
また、アンロックしたクラスやお金はアカウント共通なので、2周目はより気軽にすすめられます。
日本語化はされてませんが、使われている英語は易しめで内容もベタなファンタジーRPGなので理解するのはそれほど難しくありません。

残念な点は前半では、後半だけで使うような要素もすべて最初から使えるため、どうしても常にお金が足りないように感じてしまうところ。
後半では、自由度に比べてストーリーが長めなので、作業になってしまうこと。もう少しストーリー自体短く、お金が経験値もはいりやすくてもよかったように思います。

繰り返しになりますがかなりクラシカルなRPGなので、TRPGの雰囲気が好きな人・手軽にできるゲームを探している人向け。

author: {'steamid': '76561197995951257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1959, 'last_played': 1398129685}
review:
Look... if you have this game, was most likely part of a bundle. But I wouldn't have bought it otherwise. The game was supposed to be retro and amusing but turned into a horrible grind. A really *grindy* grind. It was cute for a while but then quickly got annoying... and the pop-culture references have been done to death.

The quests often were "Kill 7 of X then come back" or "Collect 7-12 drops from Y then come back" and there were a few examples where you had do it that 4 times in a row. You have to pay gold to walk between locations, so it feels like you're questing on a Monopoly board; "Go south 2, kill 7, come back" or "Escort 5 spaces East, get attacked every step, come back" while you are paying each way. Dumb.

The little dungeon system... is annoying. You can't rest or run away from a fight or it boots you out and you have to do the whole dungeon again. You have to wander around to find the key for the boss fight, taking damage from fights or traps 75% of the time. Who does that? Who is going to spend time to do 10-50 of those for the achievement? Pass. Just pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127825728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1429934873}
review: This game is so addictive!!!  I've played it for hours and it's always fun to just load it up whenever you have some spare minutes! :)  It's turn based combat with different classes that you can choose to add to your team and the ingame store has plenty of cool things to buy with ingame cash that you earn from battles.  It's easy enough to keep wanting another go but difficult enough to keep you trying to "just get past that next load of monsters" :)  And at this price... a must buy for any fantasy turn based combat player.  P.S. don't get put off by the pixelised low res graphics... the amount of fun and humour more than makes up for any cosmetic looks and will keep you coming back to it again and again! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198071706064', 'num_games_owned': 1960, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2167, 'last_played': 1517886831}
review:
Tabletop rping gone meta. This game is chock full of little gags, from visual ones in the background to quotes and characters. The gameplay itself is solid and is a lot of fun. There are times where you do have to grind but that's standard issue for an rpg and if you dislike that then there are very few rpg's I would or could recommend.

I have no issues with this game... With one exception, the in game microtransactions. You can avoid them quite easily, but it irks me that it is still included in a game I had to pay for in the first place. Either be free and have microtransactions or paid and not have them not paid and have them, that's just underhanded. That being said it's actually really easy to get around. If your main team dies just create a new one and any coins they earn will be shared between the different playthroughs. 

There's also a new game + mode but it doesn't really add anything except the monsters being more difficult.

I would highly recommend this game but I would also wait for it to appear in a steam sale.

I love this game! I bought it after the "no more microtransactions" update, so I haven't had any issues with paying to win. Even though it is a very XP grinding game, for some reason I enjoy doing the monotonous quests and collecting items over and over. Very fun, lots of great classes and characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070107174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1086, 'last_played': 1398331333}
review:
This game is addicting, and amazingly fun. For those who have played D&D, and either do not anymore, or just love the party aspect (but hate organizing times to play), this IS the game for you! 

Do not let the D&D reference mislead you, it is not quite as in depth and does not have a million skills/feats/spells, but it has just enough to keep the interest, while not overplaying it all, and DEFINITELY does not have the time devotion and endless hours of character sheet organization... and best of all, it only takes one player, not a DM+5.

 The tables are customizable, the ornaments in the room, the door, the artifacts on the table, the DM itself, I mean, you can even buy soda and chips and such in the store, to place on the table for your characters to get bonuses for XX amount of time! If only some D&D games would follow suit with the style of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979958996', 'num_games_owned': 1760, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1411722296}
review:
I wasn't expecting to like this game as much as I have been. In all honesty, this is a fun little game! There's several different kinds of combinations you can make with your characters, and there's also new classes to unlock along the way, which just adds to the replayability to see all the different kinds of combinations. The gameplay is incredibly simple, but it's fun to kind of 'multitask' as you're doing something in the background while also playing this game in windowed mode.

The game also kind of lets you 'choose' how the game progresses, as you're essentially the Dungeon Master. You can choose what kind of enemy to fight, and also how many of them. This allows for you to play at your own pace!

You can also add on more characters as you go along (up to five in total), but you'd have to level them up all the way from level one, which can be kind of a pain, but, ya know, comes with the territory. The same applies for whenever you unlock a class and want to use them. You'd have to level them up from level one. Kind of sucks, but once again, this is supposed to be reminiscent of old-school RPG's. You want to play that new class you just unlocked? Gotta start 'em from the beginning.

Overall, even though I'm only a few hours into the game, I still want to play it and progress even further. This game could definitely keep you occupied for a while, especially if you're looking for a more traditional, old-school RPG. Check it out!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971035314', 'num_games_owned': 902, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 877, 'last_played': 1397237375}
review:
Eng: 7/10 : Quite fun if you like old style RPG with the spite art. But might get bore very quick if you not into this genre. 

เกมส์เล็กๆ (จากมือถือมาก่อน) ไสตล์ Classic RPG มาด้วยกลิ่นอายของ RPG แบบ Table Top (บ้านเราอาจจะไม่ค่อยรู้จัก แต่ก่อนหน้าเกมสื PC ฝรั่งเขาเล่น RPG กันโดยการตั้งโต๊ะที่บ้านมีคนคุมเกมส์ และเพื่อนๆมาเล่นโดยการเขียน Stat ลงกระดาษทอยเต๋าไปตามคนคุมเกมส์) ด้วยกราฟิคแบบ Spite Art ก็ต้องบอกว่า ถ้ามอง Screenshot เบื้องต้นแล้วไม่ติดตา เกมส์แนวนี้ไม่ใช่ ก็ควรผ่านไปครับ

แต่ถ้าเกมส์มันเตะตาคุณ แนวเกมส์ RPG แบบนี้รับได้ไหม เดินตามแม็ปรับเควส หรือสู้กับศัตรูเก็บเลเวลตามที่เราอยากให้เจอ มีตัวละครให้เลือกเล่นมาพร้อมกับ Stat พิเศษต่างๆกันมาก แล้วก็ Class ที่เลือกเล่นได้มากมาย (มีปลด lock เพิ่มจาก Q รวมทั้งหมด 7-8 Class) แต่ละ Class มี แค่ 4 skill มาตั้งแต่เริ่ม แล้วก็มีแค่นี้จนจบเกมส์ Lv up จะเป็นการเพิ่มความแรงของ skill ถ้าคนแสวงหาการพัฒนาขั้นลึกอาจจะเบื่อได้เร็ว  การเล่นนานมีแต่ทำเควสแล้วอัพเกรดของเพื่อสู้กับมอนระดับสูงขึ้นมากกว่า

ก็ถ้าชอบ RPG ไสตล์เก่าที่ไม่ลึกมาก ไว้เล่นฆ่าเวลาก็นับเป็นตัวเลือกที่น่าสนใจครับผม  เพราะเกมส์มีอะไรให้ปลดlock เยอะมาก
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198047985807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 1290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1518001383}
review:
Knight of Pen and Paper è veramente un ottimo gioco, in soli 91 MB.
Grafica pixelosa ma funzionale, un buon RPG in stile D&D che ci porterà di fronte a diverse sfide e situazioni. Abbastanza rigiocabile, e con numerosi oggetti da acquistare, collezionare, e da equipaggiare. La personalizzazione del personaggio è un po' limitata ma fa il suo dovere.

Se amate gli RPG (anche sempliciotti come profondità come questo) e non badate alla grafica, è un must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043484653', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 973, 'last_played': 1403706135}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper +1, is... Different.

Something you should know:
On the google play store, it is only £1.99.
On steam it is £7.99. For the SAME GAME.
Just for this, I wouldn't reccommend buying it from Steam on principle, as even though it is a brillian game, it is still only a mobile android app. On PC.
Now I got this game with a Humble Bundle, so assuming I paid the £1.99 for it, I can certainly say it was worth it.

I think my first runthrough took approx 12 hours, that wasn't rushed but it wasn't lazed either, so even if you where to pay £7.99, it still has more play time then most £40 hit title campaigns.

In the game you take control of 5 people role playing in a board RPG pretty much, and without going into to much detail, it's like playing a game of Dungeons & Dragons with amusing characters and dungeonmaster.
The missions are reasonably simple, and if you complete the entire campaign in a day, like me, then it does get somewhat repetitive by the end, though if you actually have a life and pace it out a bit more, you may not find this the same.

The game is FULL of references, there are pointers to Star Wars, Pokemon, Sponge Bob Square Pants, TMNT, Final Fantasy, Mario and much much more, almost every five minutes I would see something and be amazed at how many references they have fit in there.

That is everything, and if you are reading this and the Humble Bundle PC & Android Bundle 9 is still on (It is until 14/04/14) then go and get it, as it is worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972468905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1398564529}
review: This is a silly little RPG game. I initially liked it. However, the lack of story and continuity finally got to me. Also, it is an absolute grind to beat it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048917728', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1435097828}
review:
Bastante referências a outros títulos, séries de TV, filmes, cultura brasileira e principalmente as situações cotidianas do RPG de mesa.
Não espere muita coisa do sistema de de quests, que são do tipo mate 6 bichos para completar a missão, ou consiga 15 pelos que cai do bicho fulano. Os produtores estão cientes disso e fizeram de proprósito, até tiram graça a respeito em uma quest.
Simplificaram bastante o sistema de lvl up. Você não evolui atributos, apenas as abilidades, o que eu acho ótimo para um game casual.
O combate também é bem simples e por turnos: atacar, defender, usar item ou usar abilidade.
A posição dos personagens lembra os primeiros jogos da série final fantasy e ultima. 

Os devs conseguiram junto a publisher remover as microtransações, que eram acessíveis através de um icone bem discreto e não eram necessárias para terminar o game.

Recomendo o game devido estar em português-BR e as várias risadas devido as referências.

Ps.1 O humble bundle está com um bom desconto no jogo, recomendo comprar lá e ativar aqui no steam, dessa forma é possível jogar no android também.

Ps.2 Joguei e terminei a versão de android, que é praticamente a mesma de desktop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082489227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1445642412}
review:
Also ich habe jetzt 9 Stunden des Spieles  hinter mir ich weiß nicht wie weit es noch gehen mag, dennoch möchte ich die Zeit nutzen um ein vorzeitiges Fazit zu ziehen. 

Pro
- Nette Spielidee zwar nichts wirklich neues aber das macht nichts. 
- Viele nette Anspielungen auf andere Spiele aus der Vergangenheit. 
- die komplette Steuerung des Spieles läuft über die Maus was ich sehr angenehm finde, so kann man sich zwischendurch einfach mal hinlegen und so weiterspielen, falls man eine Liegefläche haben sollte. 
- Die Vielen Upgrade Funktionen die in dem Spiel eingebaut wurden so kann man zum Beispiel den Tisch upgraden und so Boni auf den Statuswert kriegen sowas habe ich mir schon bei anderen Spielen gewünscht und auch so gut umgesetzt wie in diesem Spiel - auch wenn es meiner Meinung nach etwas zu wenige sind. 
- die Klassenauswahl die mich sehr stark an Dragon Quest errinnert, so muss man sich manche Klassen erst freispielen damit man sie nutzen kann. 
- man kann nicht einfach 3 Stunden lang die selben Monster hauen um sich Geld zu erfarmen, den diese Monster geben nach einer gewissen Zeit immer weniger Geld. 

Contra

- Ganz klar das "Mobile Feeling" welches man (zumindest ich) bei dem Spiel bekommt, es fühlt sich so an als ob es eine Portierung von einem Handyspiel wäre. 
- Der Schwirigkeitsgrad ist ganz klar zu niedrig, wenn man so wie ich ein abgestimmtes Team hat ist es schon fast zu einfach. 
- Das Grinding, welches wirklich an den Nerven zehrt. mit Level 30, Level 7 Monster hauen für ein bestimmtes Item, zumindest ist die Dropchance ziemlich hoch und man kann sich durch Items weiter in die Höhe treiben.
- Die dauernde Gängelung, im laufe des Spieles bekommt man Aufgaben um eine bestimmte Sache von A nach B zu bringen, dies verläuft dann gerne über die gesamte Karte und überall lauern einem Monster auf die einen aufhalten.
- Für 70% Der Aufgaben muss man bestimmte Monster 7 mal besiegen, was in meinen Augen eine weitere Gängelung ist, da man in manchen Fällen (besonders am Anfang) nicht alle 7 auf einmal schafft und sie nach und nach besiegen muss. 



Fazit: Das Spiel ist nett und kommt mit guten Ideen daher die teils gut teils schlecht umgesetzt wurden, jedoch kommt in einem, je länger man es spielt das Gefühl der Gängelung hoch, überall wird man aufgehalten und das meistens sinnlos, es kommt also kein richtiger Spielfluss zu gange, und es ist sehr anstrengend es am Stück zu spielen, man sollte es daher eher als Gelegenheitsspiel ansehen. Die Klassen sind gut gemacht insgesamt besitzt Jede Klasse zwar nur 4 Skills + Rassenbonus jedoch reichen die locker aus. Den Schwirigkeitsgrad hätten sie ruhig höher legen können und dafür weniger Monstergefarme reinpacken sollen, da dies in meinen Augen ein absoluter Minuspunkt für das Spiel ist. Dennoch werde ich es weiterspielen nur vielleicht nicht mehr 9 Stunden am Stück da es wirklich schlaucht. :) 

6,5/10 reicht in dem Fall locker für das Spiel. empfehlen würde ich es an frustresistente Menschen die Lust an Grinding und Lust auf ein Spiel haben welches sich selbst nicht immer ganz so ernst nimmt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998261477', 'num_games_owned': 2271, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1396627813}
review:
[おすすめ度：★★★★☆]
ロールプレイのゲームをやっているという体のRPG

まずはじめに人物と職業の2種類を決めて最大5人パーティを作る
人物にはそれぞれ1つの特徴をもっており、例えば、初期HP・MP増加や毎ターン回復と言った特徴がある
職業はパラディンやメイジ、ハンターなどなどあり、職業ごとに4種類のスキルを使うことが出来る
どちらも最初は数種類しかないけれど、ストーリーを進めていくと人物は17種、職業は12種まで増えていく

ゲーム自体は普通のRPGだけれども、家に集まってロールプレイのゲームをするというゲームなので
真ん中に机があり、奥に語り手、手前にプレイヤーが座っているという景色が常にうつってる
ストーリーもありきたりRPGで途中で人助けをしながら悪いやつをやっつけていこうという流れ
クエストはある敵を一定数倒せ、あるアイテムを集めろ、ある場所に行け、といったものがほとんど
戦闘は敵をクリックすることで攻撃エフェクトがちょっと出るぐらいの超シンプル

難易度は高めだけど好きな時に戦闘をしたり、ほとんどの場所で休憩して回復することもできるので進みやすい
戦闘は敵の数を自分で指定することもできるので、難しい時は1体ずつと言った方法で簡単に進むことも出来る
お金はゲーム内の装備を整えたりアイテムを買ったりする他にマップ移動にも必要になる
さらに、リアルの部屋（ロールプレイをしている部屋）の壁やドア、机や部屋の家具などもお金を払うことで変更することが出来る
部屋の装飾を変えることで得られる経験値が増えたり、能力を上昇させたりすることが出来る
他にも食べ物や飲み物を買って一定時間だけ能力を上げてゲームを有利に進めていくようになる

途中でちょっとしたギャグやメタ発言など笑える点もちらほら
ロールプレイングゲームをするロールプレイングゲームだからなかなか画期的
シンプルでもRPGが好きっていう人にかなりおすすめ
本当にシンプルなRPGなのでグラフィックやら派手さを求めているような人には全くおすすめできない

review:
A genuinely cute and simple RPG with the added 'twist' of your group being actual paper RPGers (sorry if this doesn't make sense!). One of those 'just one more turn' games.
Couple of things though - it isn't very helpful about things like 'how do I buy items?' so you have to work that out for yourself or do like I did and hit buttons to see what they do. Additionally I find the music annoying and tinny but I can turn that off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036161654', 'num_games_owned': 4361, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1101, 'last_played': 1486695695}
review:
Juego de rol por turnos, donde controlaras a 5 amigos jugando un juego de rol a la antigua con máster(guía, árbitro o narrador) y todo, que no te engañen sus gráficos porque el juego es excelente.Al avanzar en el juego te iras encontrando con personajes muy conocidos de juegos, que te sacaran una sonrisa.
Pues la única cosa que necesitas es echar a volar tu imaginación como lo hacen los protagonistas del juego, para pasar un excelente rato.

Lo único malo es que algunas clases se desbloquean al ir pasando el juego.

Nota:jugarlo con algo de Botana hace que la experiencia sea mas memorable xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198010395257', 'num_games_owned': 3304, 'num_reviews': 463, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1381326571}
review:
This is one that I’d been playing on and off alongside Grand Theft Auto 5. You’ve gotta understand, GTA5 is addictive enough that pretty much everything else fell by the wayside, so that’s really saying something. Knights is a really fun game that’s about…well, gaming. Specifically, it parodies tabletop RPGs, dungeon masters, and so on.

You get to form a party of up to five people with varying classes such as fighter, paladin, and so on…but with real people such as little brother, jock, nerd, and so on. The combination of the two forces kind of creates a whole new class in most cases, fully capable of being stronger within their respective classes or at the very least more interesting.

In fact, you can change everything including the toys on the table, back pieces, dungeon master himself, and so on in order to modify various bonuses, buffs, and the like. I’ve never played that much into tabletop, but this game is nothing but addictive and it’s easy to see why. If you like RPGs or in general you’re looking for something easy to pick up and play, this one’s for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058596963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1394919625}
review:
[b]Prepare seu papel eletrônico[/b]

[i]Prós[/i]
 * Ideia de controlar jogadores de RPG de mesa é interessante
 * Você controla a dificuldade do jogo, aumentando ou diminuindo o número de inimigos nas batalhas
 * Diálogos divertidos e personagens cativantes

[i]Contras[/i]
 * Jogabilidade repetitiva e pouco variada
 * Mesmo após nove meses do lançamento alguns bugs ainda impedem que o jogador complete algumas conquistas
 * É preciso Grinding se quiser aproveitar as Profissões e Personagens desbloqueáveis na primeira vez que jogar

[b]NOTA:[/b] 7.0

author: {'steamid': '76561198117164958', 'num_games_owned': 5, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1590, 'last_played': 1395582173}
review:
Ich empfehle das Spiel Leuten die Pen & Paper oder D&D mögen.
Mit den vielen kleinen Easter Eggs wie MrKrabbs oder dem Ring and der Hand die in der Lava versingt.
Ich bin immernoch nicht am Ende des Spiels da es Lange dauert aber es wenig Speicher verbraucht.
Man entwickelt sein eigenes Team das zum Beispiel ein säufender Magier oder eine Oma als Schurkin,
levelt seine Crew und verbessert die Zauber.
Und der Schmied macht mich süchtig :3!
Der sinnlose Grund dass das Spiel gut ist:Der Schmied tanzt wenn er verbessert wird!

author: {'steamid': '76561198109604941', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1438828263}
review: As an avid fan of the D20 system and DnD series(I play Ver. 3.5 currently) created my the Great and Powerful Melevolence himself, Gary Gygax, I loved the pitch off the bat! It's in retro 8-bit animation style, leaving room for extra nostalgia for those who used to play the old DnD Game Boy games and NES games(amongst other titles too!). The story(campaign) is funny, edgy, tense and just an all around perfect adventure. The aspects that I enjoy most from this game is Armor and Weapons upgrading through the Blacksmith(which you can upgrade with donations of materials, etc.) and that you CHOOSE how big of a fight you get yourself and your party into. It's like having a voyeur POV of a very long DnD campaign, and YOU CONTROL IT! What's not to like?! :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198045241070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1431362805}
review: This game is half/decent game. I haven't played enough of it, only 3.5 hours of the game, from what I know, I got the original version and not the "digital deluxe" I reccomend you get this otherwise, you'll have to do about 1 hour of grinding in order to reach it. In 3.5 hours I've created two saves which include characters level 11/12. Its fairly challenging to level up and its meant to give a nostalgic feel to the game which is why the graphics are pixel art. Problem I find, people pay £8 or $15 to only spend more money to get your coins, you dont necessarily have to buy it, I would do it because grinding is repetitive and mind-blowingly boring. People should pay money for games to not have to spend more money. Thats what F2P games are for. Thats how they get their money not games you spend a fair bit on only to spend more. Thats my complaint, Peace. a weak six or a strong five is my score, I feel I wont exceed 25 hours of gameplay on this game. If I do then I'll surprise myself. - 09.03.2014

author: {'steamid': '76561198075187985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1406086020}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018593712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1393596277}
review:
It only took 30+ years for someone to make an RPG game about D&D, from the third person perspective.

I can't stress enough how much I love this game. It's just so unique and lovable. 

The dialogue is great and the amount of things you can do in the game are ridiculous. One thing I love is that the game rewards you for pushing yourself to the limit. The harder you make it on yourself, the more EXP and Gold you'll earn, making the game easier overall, later down the line. But give yourself an easy time and the game will become brutal at the later stages. 

There are multiple classes (Some are secret. Shhhh...) to choose from and multiple players for those characters. For example, the Hipster playing as a Druid or your Grandma playing as a Necromancer. Make your own party and formulate your own way to win. Anything is possible. Single target DOT team. An AoE team. 'Classic' 1 tank, 3 DPS and a healer. Whatever you want to do.

There are microtransactions apparent in the game, but they are about as pointless as a chocolate radiator. Best not to bother with them. In fact, just forget I said anything at all.

Like classic RPG's? Buy it. Have some fun. 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067731111', 'num_games_owned': 897, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1709, 'last_played': 1636208133}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060202528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 964, 'last_played': 1659723910}
review:
THE GOOD:
-Basically the only DnD simulator on the market, at least to my knowledge
-Tons of tongue in cheek humor and hilarious dialogue
-Game shatters the fourth wall by the endgame, and it's glorious
-Can choose which encounters you fight, which allows you to play at your own pace
-Tons of freedom to choose your RL avatars and their DnD selves and classes
-Ability to customize your room for all sorts of zany combinations
-Overall a very fun - if easy - RPG romp with a unique twist

THE BAD:
-Game's difficulty fluctuates often, and there are inconsistent difficulty spikes and ridiculously easy section
-Microtransactions. Thankfully, this can be countered with Cheat Engine and some patience*

* = More on this later, if you're serious about buying the game.

Here we have a short, but incredibly cute and fun game that's at least worth a shot to anybody who is a fan of DnD, JRPGs and tons of meta humor. To my knowledge, it's the only Dungeons and Dragons Simulator on Steam right now, at least to my knowledge, and the idea of being able to simulate a DnD game without the pain of finding people interested is EXTREMELY cool overall. As somebody who loves tabletop RPGs by seldom plays them due to the effort required to set them up on a regular basis, the very premise of this game was enough to sell me alone.

And overall? It's a very good game. The story, which cliched, revels in it's clichedness, making tons of wisecracks at numerous genres, other games and making enough pop culture references to almost drown it it - and given the nature of this game, instead of being aggravating and forced, the DnD Simulator idea actually helps it work, overall making a stupidly enjoyable game that knows how dumb it is yet manages to make the best out of said idiocy.

With solid gameplay, fine-tuned performance (then again, it's pretty damn hard to turn a retro RPG into an unplayable, buggy mess, but it happens) and a hilarious cast of zany characters, the game's only real major flaw is it's implication of microtransactions, in order to get more gold to buy more stuff. Normally this would seriously hurt the game since it demands some spending to be truly rich, but it backfires hilariously with Cheat Engine, as an increase from one penny to another means that you'll be able to use Cheat Engine to maintain a reasonably-fat wallet in-game.

Overall, this is a fun, zany and stupidly enjoyable RPG with good writing, though I recommend you use Cheat Engine to enjoy it at it's fullest. Otherwise, give this game a go if you get the chance.

For those too lazy to look up Cheat Engine: http://www.cheatengine.org/

author: {'steamid': '76561197985793015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1503800221}
review: Welcome to The Grind(TM). There is very little game here. The style is cute but there's no story to speak of. Repetitive, grindy battles. They do almost nothing with the "you're playing as the players" gimmick. It's just a generic JRPG with a cute retro style. It's pandering to people who play D&D becuase it's a novel idea. Fun stops there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012048104', 'num_games_owned': 1759, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1499440402}
review:
This game is awful. I got it in a bundle. It plays like Dragon Warrior (the ultimate example of why JRPGs are bad) but with microtransactions. The whole "real people playing a pnp RPG" concept is paper thin. It just gives you additional stats that directly update your combat abilities (e.g. buy a new gaming table and get +1 to attack) and stuff like that. The microtransaction angle is really heavily pushed on the player.
It's a pure progress quest. Choose to churn through monster type "A" until they drop enough coins to afford the sword that can kill monster type "B." These developers should be boycotted for all of eternity. I'm really disappointed in Paradox for publishing it too. This has to be the most shallow, unethically money grubbing game they've ever put their name on. I can't imagine their cut of the sales would compensate them for being associated with this trash.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980786340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1388286619}
review:
This is a fun game while it lasts, and I do mean while it lasts.  The combat gets very repetitive after awhile and there are only a few choices in character builds.  Once you have unlocked all the classes the can get old in a hurry.  There is just not enough diversity or depth for me. If you get it on sale it is worth the price. 

You might like this game if:
You enjoy stripped down RPGs with multiple classes, but limited development.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021114209', 'num_games_owned': 740, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1431967813}
review: 这款游戏我最先是在ios上玩的，超级上瘾，我是在忍不住就把PC的也买了。不过各个平台和设备间的数据不共享。这个游戏的风格有些奇葩。任务和旁白都很搞笑。有很多职业和人物（有些需要在游戏过程中解锁）。每个人物都有他自己的被动，（被动的名字挺搞笑的）每个职业都有四个技能。合理的控制仇恨，和技能才能提高战斗效率。里面的金币一开始超级不够用。不打算花钱，所以刷的有些辛苦。里面的铁匠制造和升级武器需要花费大量的金币，但最坑的是成功率一开始还很低。曾经一把135的武器，足足花费了我一千多才搞定T. T。这个游戏建议等减价再买。十多刀还是有些贵的。不过的确是一款好游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198023917323', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1400357138}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978773831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1491268893}
review: I host Dungeons & Dragons campaigns often, and this game is wonderfully similar to the kind of excitement and experience both on the end of the DM and on the end of the player. I love how the difficulty of the game scales, as you are both the game player and in a way the creator! If you think the quest is too hard, you can lower the monster count. If it's too easy, max out the  bar and fight 7 goblin warchiefs at once! Quite a fun game and hours of RPG content, worth every cent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002547996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 973, 'last_played': 1392327682}
review:
マウスでぽちぽち系RPG。
英語がわりと簡単なので流し読みでなんとなくストーリーは追える。
金は贅沢しなければ十分に手に入る。一見値段高めな鍛冶はちゃんと対策があったりする。
残念な点はクエスト解禁での追加職業が使いづらいこと。初プレイはほぼ最初の固定メンバーとなるだろう。
それと鍛冶屋のレベルを上げるのが作業なのも残念。あと後半ストーリーがダレ気味。
難易度も高くなく、見た目と違って謎解き要素もないので気軽に遊べる。

author: {'steamid': '76561198047525840', 'num_games_owned': 1384, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 999, 'last_played': 1394310230}
review:
If you're an old school fan of Dungeons & Dragons and don't have the time to play an epic RPG, this game is for you. You do NOT need to buy any microtransactions in this game as long as you manage you money ok (read the guides and use +gold bonus modifiers). I like the fact that you have the option to play in different screen resolutions as well as in a windowed mode where you can multitask.

This game takes turn-based RPG to its roots. Newer gamers may not appreciate it, but it is right for older gamers with busy lives. It is sprinkled with pop culture and various references throughout the game. It may get repetitive at times, but there are various classes to keep things fresh.

The game doesn't do a very good job in explaining that you can mine rocks in caves for grindstone, and then take the stones to a town to raise the XP of the blacksmith. I would not suggest attempting to level up weapons and armors until later in the game since the success rate is so low. Reading the tips and guides will make your experience more enjoyable and you won't be wasting your hard-earned gold (since gold is used for everything, including travel).

Даже донат не портит впечатления, ибо совершенно не нужен. Если вы хотите поиграть в настоящий D&D, но не с кем - это ваш выбор.

review:

The pixelart graphics add just that little more enthusiasm to the storyline. I completed this game within 8 hours, but that it by completing absolutly everything. I thoroughly enjoyed the game and might even jump back on it in the future, just to mess around. Overall the game is very pleasant and exciting.

9.2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197999357031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1405424105}
review:
So the video preview is what got me to try this game. I will say it's the most meta RPG I've ever played and, unfortunately, it's very much in the spirit of a freemium facebook game.

You need gold to buy a cup to buy more party members. Need gold for party members. Food, Travel, so on, you need gold for quite a lot. But no worries, you can buy more gold for USD, just click the everpresent gold buy button in the top right.

I can see playing this game at short stretches, but I have no interest in the freemium nature of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119851863', 'num_games_owned': 505, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1409659986}
review:
对于我来说，纯粹是浪费游戏时间，来享受这个枯燥的回合制游戏，但是毕竟年龄的问题，这个游戏对于我的弟弟来说，还是好玩的，因为这个游戏很简单，只需要鼠标点一点，就可以无需求通关，装备系统、技能系统、打怪系统太过简单，但是这款游戏让我想起了，原来小时候玩的小游戏。
       Is a waste of time to game, for me to enjoy the boring turn-based game, but after all the problems of the age, the game for my brother, or fun, because the game is very simple, only need the mouse, you can no need customs clearance, equipment systems, skills, and a strange system is too simple, but the game reminds me of, originally as a kid playing little games.
      Для меня, совершенно бесполезная трата времени, игры, чтобы насладиться заморить раунда кирпичного игра, но в конце концов проблемы с возрастом, эта игра для моего брата, в целом или смешно, потому что эта игра очень просто, нужно только мышь-немного, можно без спроса, оборудования очистки системы, навыки системы, бить винить система слишком простой, но это пункта, игра напомнило мне, оказывается, когда был маленьким играем в игру.

review:
Been playing Knights of Pen and Paper +1 for 12 hours striaght. It a great game. If you love D&D or any table top games. You"ll enjoy this. 

You pick from a a group of classes. you start with 2 classes of your choice for free and 3 more classes for gold. Equipe items to upgrade your char. As you play the game new classes open up.

I love this game. just shows you dont need a million dollar team to make a top knoch game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043176260', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1424883019}
review: Extremely fun game. Can't stop playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012111055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1417127537}
review:
Yo creo que los viejos jugadores de rol somos unas víctimas del tocomocho con juegos como éste. No puedes resistir la tentación de comprarlo porque tiene un punto de partida divertido, friki y que te trae recuerdos de otros tiempos... y luego te das cuenta de que por poco que valga has tirado esos euros que mejor estarían invertidos en cervezas (vale, o en otros juegos).

El juego, básicamente, consiste en zurrarle a los bichos que aparecen en la pantalla. Oh, sí, puedes hacer misiones... que consisten en zurrarle a los bichos que aparecen en pantalla. Oh, sí, hay varios tipos de personajes... para zurrarles a los bichos que aparecen en pantalla. Y si el combate al menos fuera divertido u original no tendría queja, pero puedes conseguir lo mismo si tienes 1d20 y una hoja de papel (o 1d6 si no te gusta el D&D). 

Y que nadie me venga con el rollo de 'lo hizo un estudio indie con más ilusión que capacidad'. Que no cuela. Esto como juego de móvil (gratuito) igual tiene un pase, pero como juego de PC es una pérdida de tiempo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994247840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1392464881}
review:
I love how easy this game is to pick up and put down (though putting it down is harder and harder the more I get into it!). I love casual games of this kind, especially ones that are deep enough to really get into. I love the idea of the game with the players at the table as the main UI etc.

I too have been thoroughly enjoying the game and it's a shame those MicroTransaction (MT) haters can't see past their own hate of MTs to give this game a go. The MTs are such a non-issue, the game is not gimped in any way, shape or form without using the MTs. All I can say is, give the game a go.. you will genuine like it if you like old school rpgs.

One of the most enjoyable turn based RPGs I've played for a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046948033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1414280420}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003510415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 2156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1588, 'last_played': 1553806799}
review:
RPG no sentido mais clássico da palavra. Parafraseando um outro comentário: "Como ninguém fez um jogo parecido desse antes?!".
Jogo simples, com gráficos simples e jogabilidade simples. Mas que proporciona muita diversão e entretenimento por horas a fio! 
Super recomendado para aqueles que já se sentaram ao menos 1 vez em volta de uma mesa para jogar RPG com os amigos.
Trailers e/ou videos não demonstram quão legal esse jogo pode ser. Pelo preço, recomendo para aqueles que se encontram em dúvida darem uma chance ao game, com certeza não se arrependerão. 
Jogo comprado na época por R$4,00 +-.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968687228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1391435585}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011268290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1129, 'last_played': 1391323249}
review: So this is a money game where you can pay IRL dollars for in-game gold, and like most games that follow this model, the game is annoying if you try to play it without spending real money on in-game currency. Even if that doesn't bother you, the game is long and repetitive and riddled with lame pop culture references. The idea of a digital RPG that mimics a tabletop RPG is cool, but I recommend avoiding this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017223587', 'num_games_owned': 1849, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1398188315}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition is an example of what is wrong with the gaming industry, publishers and developers working together to make a game that is less than a full and proper experience without first investing heavily in it.  In most cases, that means you must use real world money to make your game run the way it should in the first place.  Luckily the game gives players a choice, you have the choice to play the game a great deal, or to buy shortcuts to make the game better.  Everywhere you turn there is a price attached to everything, you can gain the currency with playing or with plastic, and playing takes way too long.

I would say that the game itself, when you ignore this horrible choice of microtransactions, is mediocre, not exceptional.  It has several novel ideas, but it lacks any real pay off, there is nothing revolutionary or deeply engaging about it.  Even the flavour text, the stuff you would hope would be most entertaining in a dungeons and dragons type of game feels weak and boring, as though the developers were not into it.

Overall, I was quite disappointed with this title and I don't think many people will be able to enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972271187', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 2753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2753, 'last_played': 1391297866}
review:
Firstly I will tell you this game is a mobile port.Second it has a microtransaction of buying ingame gold for cash,but you never  and I mean never need to use it.There are plenty of items ingame that increase the amount of gold you get dropped that have other stats to them.Now to the review.

[b]Short Review:[/b]
Game has classes you can swap in and out,skills that you can level individually,upgradeable class locked weapons/armor and plenty of item accessories and consumables.The game has pop culture reference comedy all throughout it,hardly any variation in quest types and is grindy since you only turn-base fight your way through each situation for the most part.Plenty of boss fights in the game,no puzzles, and a small learning curve on how to handle things. Uses dice roll to determine things such as crafting chance,battles,etc. 

If you like games you can play 5min-1hr + at a time,do not mind grind , a pop culture heavy comedic story, and little varation in gameplay then pick it up on sale, or in a bundle. I would not pay full price,just does not feel like a $10 game , more like a $2.50-$5 one.

[b]Regular Review:[/b]
The game itself is a comedic sort of table top dice roll turned into a video game.The dialog trees,characters, and the story have comedy all throughout them. The game has tons of pop culture references from 1970s- onward in both enemies,outfits and dialog.

Gameplay mechanic wise you pretty much fight turn based fight your way through all the quests you do.There is hardly any variation in the quests escort,item fetch/deliever,rescue, and fight/slay. They incorporate you grind fighting your way through.There are no puzzles or anything so do not expect much outsite of witty dialog and fights.

Items in the game are what you would expect, consumables with stat buffs that last for a certain time.Weapons/armor are not sold but are upgraded by blacksmiths.They are only found in towns as well as item purchases.There are different character classes each with 4 skills that you can level up individually.When you decide what character classes you want you have to pick a person whom hs their on special stat they add to be that class.You can swap in and out character classes that you level up when you are at towns with taverns.

The game can be played for 5min- 1hr+ depending on how much grinding and story you are willing to play through. There is a NG+ when you beat the game to continue on your adventures which resets all the quests making the mobs tougher at the beginning onward.

My final verdict on this game is if you do not mind the grind,it is a enjoyable title.Its simple yet to the point.I played it in spurts and had fun playing it.Its deffinately not for everyone but no game out there is.Get it on sale or in a bundle, not worth $10 to me more like $2.50-$5 game.Not for lack of content,more for lack of variations in quests and gameplay mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021697412', 'num_games_owned': 1285, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 5838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 1379, 'last_played': 1709868547}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067013589', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1181, 'last_played': 1397606693}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066162839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 1867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1460241210}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010129163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1559765048}
review:
Knight of Pen and Paper +1 is a pretty entertaining, simple but lovely designed dungeon crawler. It makes you feel like playing an oldschool pen and paper game, like spending the day in your friends basement, eating unhealthy chunk and having a good time with dungeons and dragons.
Although I don't feel challenged by the game, I have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108038493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1428250398}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053616460', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1415428443}
review:
[b][u]Grade[/u]:[/b] 96/100
[b][u]Difficulty[/u]:[/b] Easy.
[b][u]Pros[/u]:[/b] If you've ever played a tabletop game, this is a walk in the park. The humor and references make it fun to play. The variety of options adds a lot of depth to the game, and any one campaign will likely take you several play sessions to complete.
[b][u]Cons[/u]:[/b] It can be a real grind to earn your in-game gold to purchase game table elements or the player character gear and upgrades. There is an option to buy the gold, but I don't recommend it when a few rounds in a dungeon with adequate healing potions will do the trick. The music can also get redundant very quickly unless you learn to tune it out.
[b][u]Replayable[/u]:[/b] Yes. Very yes. Simple enough to pick up on a whim, immersive enough to feel different every time you play without becoming boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028054269', 'num_games_owned': 1295, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 982, 'last_played': 1391478345}
review:
If you like turn-based fantasy combat and have nostalgia for tabletop RPGs, this just might be the game for you!

Gameplay can be a bit repetitive, so it's not really a game you can sit and play for six hours, but but half an hour here, two hours there? It's lovely! And there are some interesting story turns I've encountered so far.

Mostly I love it because it's not too serious, not too involved, perfect for a short gaming session, and has a great sense of humor. Perfect for when I've got a bit of time to kill. Tough battles can also require some careful thought or you'll find your party dead! And it's great how you can adjust the battles yourself, decide how tough it'll be, and challenge yourself as much as you like. Lot of customization in the gaming experience.

Plus, so many things to buy in the shops and so many items to find!

Seriously, I love the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107447193', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1391977568}
review:
O jogo em si é bem divertido...
Mas se você quer um conselho:
 - Desligue o som do jogo. Ele só é divertidinho de se ouvir nos primeiros 20 minutos, meia hora, no máximo.
 - Tenha noção que você vai clicar muito, e ue é um horror upar o ferreiro, e NEM pensar em upar suas armas antes de chegar em 50% de exito, pois nunca dá certo.

Mas tirando isso, é um jogo divertido para quando não se tem nada para fazer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034159108', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1436575246}
review:
Gördüğüm en komik oyunlardan biri. Espriler, görseller falan çok hoş. Dr. Who, sponge bob gibi kült şovlara ve daha bir sürü şeye gönderme var. 

Role playing kısmına gelince de, oyunun zorlayıcı bir tarafı mevcut ve küçük ali cengizlerle zorlukların etrafından geçemiyorsunuz. demeye çalıştığım şey, her türlü exploitation'ı engellemişler. Oyunu ilk aldığımda sağ üst köşede coin'i ve yanında + işaretini gördüm. tıkladığımda ise iOS'lardaki gibi in-app purchase bişey çıkması moralimi bozmuştu, ama oynadıkça anlıyorsunuz ki, oyunda hile yapmak için konulmuş bir + işareti yani parayı veren düdüğü çalıyor ama oyunda para vermeye falan kesinlikle bir ihtiyaç yok.

Görsel olarak, 10 üzerinden 8, müzik ve ses olarak sa 10 üzerinden 6 veririm. Çok güzel bi' müziği yada yaratıcı ses efektleri olduğu söylenemez. Hikaye olarak çok iyi, karakter etkileşimleri çok iyi, Gameplay olarak da çok sade ve güzel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093853239', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 5908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1102, 'last_played': 1581246868}
review: This game feels like those old school Japanese Home Console RPGs like the "Final Fantasy" & "Dragon Quest/Warrior" series, which is a good thing seeing as modern RPGs are starting to be more scenematic, as in they're starting to feel more like a movie you are watching instead of a game you are playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037910663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1005, 'last_played': 1534387837}
review:
Depois de um bom tempo de jogo na versão de mobile, vim testar esta versão da steam, posso dizer que o começo é exatamente igual ao mobile, mas quando começa a chegar no end game (lvl 35 +-) começa a aparecer algumas coisas diferentes, referências ao Gabe Newell, no jogo chamado de Nabe Gewell (haha). Existem algumas fases a mais, como se fosse um dlc em cima do final do jogo mobile (quando falo do jogo mobile, falo do primeirão que saiu), alterando um pouco a reta final, deixando certamente o jogo mais divertido, porém no meio de toda essa diversão você vai se deparar com o GRIND.

GRIND, Esse terror que me deparei nas reviews de muitas pessoas, mas acredito que não é todo esse terror, se você for esperto fazendo as quest do seu nivel, sendo orientado pelo mapa, você escapa um pouco. UM POUCO, você pode até no momento desse GRIND pensar e ficar com raiva das transações in-game (gold extra), porém se você tiver um pouco de paciência, e estiver disposto a continuar, acredito que você passe despercebido por isso, enfim, gostei muito do jogo.

Tem muitas pessoas que dizem que o jogo não vale ao seu preço, mas vale o seu preço sim, o jogo é uma bela obra!

author: {'steamid': '76561198084304582', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1440865748}

author: {'steamid': '76561198117336033', 'num_games_owned': 1011, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2081, 'last_played': 1449883834}
review:
The fact that I've amassed 30 hours on this since its most recent sale a week ago should suggest just how much I'm enjoying this game. While at times it has seemed to drag on (particularly with some of the fetch quests, but what game with fetch quests DOESN'T drag at those points really), I have thoroughly enjoyed the experience of what is effectively D'n'D in video game form.

I think the one thing I've enjoyed the most about this experience though is that you control exactly how easy/hard the game is for more or less the duration of the game. For about 90% of the battles, [b]you[/b] decide just how many monsters you face, whether you make it easy on yourself and just take on one small bat for minimal but easy exp, or whether you take on a horde of Invaders for major risk/reward exp/gold - a concept which I thought is pretty damn neat. Along with being able to change your party at any point in the game (with more classes to unlock as you playthrough), you can really make the experience your own every time and try all sorts of weird and wonderful combinations.

Fun addicting title with neat graphics and a good soundtrack that I'm sure I'll be playing for many many moons to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017945768', 'num_games_owned': 1163, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1380775858}

author: {'steamid': '76561198122321610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 773, 'last_played': 1434767887}
review: Не часто jRPG может привлечь неискушенного  всякими Финальными Фантазиями человека, да еще и учитывая весьма своеобразную графическую оболочку, которая отпугнет любого современного любителя FPS, родившегося после конца прошлого века. На вид очень своеобразно и, как говорится, «не для всех». Но только на вид. Что имеем после покупки? Отличную ролевую систему, вполне приятную визуализацию, разнообразие геймплея, просто ОЧЕШУИТЕЛЬНЫЕ диалоги и превосходное чувство юмора разработчиков. Про звуковую составляющую можно и не говорить, ибо на высоте. Из минусов можно выделить только несколько незначительных багов и 3 сломанных ачивки.  В любом случае, мастхэв для любого уважающего себя любителя инди, jRPG и вселенной D&D.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024379228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1391662693}
review:
If you've ever been a fan of table-top fantasy games, you need to buy this ASAP.

It has a lot of other aspects that would certainly appeal to a lot of other people, but that's what drew me in, and that's what's going to keep me playing.  If you want another opinion, read another review.

10/10 this game is what it says it is, does what it says it does, and does not disappoint.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995868536', 'num_games_owned': 2897, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1510978098}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024882016', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1456297078}
review: A fun little indie RPG! It's in a DnD Style and full of pop culture refrences. This is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985072747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 433, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1390514099}
review:
Genre - Turn Based Fantasy/Real World RPG
A fun take on the genre with quite a bit of humour included, you are playing at a table wuith a DM but you are situated in the games world. It doesn't take itself to seriously, although you can purchase Gold with real money, but there doesn't seem any real need so I would avoid this. You can farm monsters and do numerous quests like any good RPG. Quests normally revolve around killing monsters and trravelling a bit, so nothing new there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117737153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1390691980}
review:
I've played this game for 17 hours and completed it 100% This is a fun addictive game that takes you back to the joy of old-fashioned turn based games. 

A well thought game where each different class comes with special abilities, if played correctly you can compliment other characters styles (I had it to where I could avoid any character being hit while still attacking the enemies!)

Overall a fun game, which I have already started my 2nd play through!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066030990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1395616942}
review: The mechanics of the game are simple.  If you enjoy(ed) table top gaming this game is a great little satire of that.  It has almost every trope in the genre.  While I can't say if it is worth its full price, if given the chance to get it on sale I would definitely do it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998063143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 322, 'playtime_forever': 1310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1309, 'last_played': 1409770612}
review:
Good fun for the price; >>>but buyer beware!!<<<

I got this on Friday and have played the hell out of it this weekend.  Super addictive little RPG game that has a great angle with the way you are people playing a D&D campaign.  Love the retro graphics and all the homages to pop-culture. Worth $3.00 for the +1 version? Absolutely.

Here is the caveat; this game is broken and has been since June 2013.  Developers are to busy making a new game to fix the unattainable Steam Achievements for KOPAP+1 so if you like/don't mind having a half empty achievements list this is the game for you.  Personally I was pissed, they should remove achievements from the list if they just don't work in the current version of the game.  Also there is some sloppy dialouge skipping. 

When I played this I always felt that no matter what classes I chose that the combat was still on the simple side.  This game will never be able to shake the feeling that you're playing a micro-transaction based iPhone/Andriod game because that is what it is, just now on Steam.  There are a total of 3 interesting dungeons but the reward for running them isn't nearly where it should be.

All in all it's a great time killer and for the price you can't go wrong.  Maybe one tday they'll patch the issues but after 6 months of knowing about it and doing nothing don't hold your breath.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978999239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1409973790}
review: This is a fun game if you are into D&D or any other table top RPGs. This is a very casual game, great for sitting on the couch to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009960702', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1392000438}
review: This is a tongue-in-cheek, charming little gem of a casual game. If you are a D&D fan: even better, as a lot of the jokes in here will be funnier for you. If not, there is still more than enough here to keep you interested. Now, would I recommend this for your next RPG binge? No. Not a deep enough game to keep you playing it and wanting to push further though if this is what you're going to sit down to play for hours. However, if you're looking for something you can do during the slow parts of the day, or while you're waiting on something: give this one a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027776314', 'num_games_owned': 1632, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1419853253}
review:
Купил эту игру по скидке, так как на кошельке завалялись деньги, а тут их хватило как раз на игру. Решил их потратить. Скачал, поиграл... Затянуло сразу на 2 часа. 
Шутки ГМа и "игроков", отсылки к известным играм, пиксельная графика - не единственные достоинства данной игры. 
Да, квесты немного однообразны, есть донат... Но однообразность разбавляют юмором, а донатить никто не заставляет. Вполне возможно заработать монетки своим трудом! 
Игру рекомендую! Моя оценка ей - 7/10! Поиграть стоит!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034130975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1390758741}
review:
I've seen the reviews from the lovers and the haters of this game.  I really like this game.  It is quirky, fun, and has a tight storyline.  I've been playing RPGs for more than two decades, both tabletop and computer and console.  I have recommended this games to many friends, they in turn have purchased it and played.  They really like it so I will continue to recommend the game.
I know that it doesn't have the best graphics but it does have good music and story.  It is fun to play.  Buy it, try it and decide on your own.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994388319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1404442978}
review: Kinda reminds me of an old NES Final Fantasy game...but in the style of D&D. So not only is this a simple, fun game. It's a great primer for someone interested in how playing a game of Dungeons & Dragons works. I'm having a lot of fun with it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047459113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1422158881}
review:
ok so i seem to be the only person on the internet who can enjoy a game without it having to meet the graphic quality of pc
and i agree it is a higher price than it should be but i got the digital deluxe edition and love it and i care for microtransactions as they don't force you to buy gold in this game you earn it from doing quests and killing monster and there are even items the improve the gold you get. as for the battles: i find that they can still be tough no matter what level you are. my only problem with this game is the black smith as you'll spend loads of gold getting him up to 50% and still waste gold when you fail to craft an item other than that i think that this is better than the ios relese mainly because of the new content in the digital deluxe edition. but i at least recomend getting this game and giving it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978848249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1401296369}
review:
I picked this game for the concept alone.  A game about characters playing a tabletop RPG.  While the premise sounds promising, it doesn't exactly follow that format which would have turned this game into a sim of sorts.  What it does present is an amusing Turn Based RPG game of the old days, from classics like Dragon Warrior to D&D.

As someone who actually played D&D for a few years, this game was rather appealing.  Select your team of generic players and their class (and will wear a matching hat for said class) and start an adventure.  The game provides you what most RPG games tend to have: a sense of direction.  You're provided with the main storyline and a few side-quests to pick up some extra gold and exp.

Be warned, this game has micro-transactions.  It is not a vital aspect of the game as you can earn gold by farming but it's only optional.  I personally do not approve of it but that should not stop other people from doing so.  Your money.

If you are looking for a charming, turn-based RPG that is a bit out of the ordinary, check this title out.  I'm enjoying it so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015135618', 'num_games_owned': 535, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1522205066}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198085991757', 'num_games_owned': 541, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1444829352}
review:
Il gioco è davvero molto bello! Particolare e speciale su tutti i punti di vista.
Difficile dire le meccaniche ecc. del gioco, perchè ci sono tantissime cose che potrebbero piacere a qualsiasi giocatore.
Subito dopo comprato ( durate gli sconti l'ho pagato 2€ circa) e sono contentissimo di questo acquisto, assolutamente non bisogna pagarlo a prezzo pieno perchè il gioco dopo un bel po di ore consecutive può scocciare ma quando lo riprenderete totalizzerete sempre più ore.

Ottimo lavoro, graficamente fatto bene, suoni e musiche ben bilanciate e traduzione Italiana che scarseggia un po (sfortunatamente, ma fa niente... se vi da fastidio potete scegliere fra le altre 3 lingue a disposizione, tra cui, ovviamente l'Inglese)
