author: {'steamid': '76561197992856964', 'num_games_owned': 1025, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 3865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1621, 'last_played': 1494968175}
review:
This is a distressingly accurate tabletop simulator.

It sort of feels like "Dungeons of Dredmore Does Tabletop" to me.  The sense of humor is mildly more down-to-earth, the battles are turn-based RPG style (with no tile-based / movement aspect), but the character progression is similar and the visual style reminds me of it in a good way.  The actual game mechanics are heavily simplified, and seem to be based as much off of japanese computer RPGs as they are off of any particular tabletop game.  The players for your party bicker and banter at eachother with one-liners now and again, I've found at least one quest that seems specifically designed to encourage lateral thinking ("why go to the area ten levels higher than you, when you can /buy/ the quest drop at a store?"), and there seems to be some kind of over-arching storyline that I haven't really gotten far with.

DoD is on my computer as sort of an equivalent / replacement for solitaire -- Knights of Pen and Paper is happily getting added into the same category.

[Edit]  On later reflection, it also reminds me of MMO's with the get quest / kill X things / get next quest / move to new area dynamic.  Unfortunately, they roam all over the world map and you can only hold one of them at a time -- meaning it's impossible to prioritize what order you want to do them in, particularly when many of them are multi-stage with each step in a different place.  There is very little strategy.  That said, it's still a good mindless game if you like the combat style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043661335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1390633686}
review:
It's a pretty cute game. Casual in the extreme, with just enough grindy-ness that fills the ragged hole in my life that was never filled with proper D&D (never was "cool" enough to play with the D&D nerds, sadly enough). Cute enough dialogue, colourful enough sprites, nifty backgrounds...

...but one thing I do find eyebrow-raising is the fact that there's frigging micro-transactions! In a paid PC game! Yeah, it has the makings of having been ported over from the iOS/Google app store - but for the love of all things good, why didn't they remove the freaking micro-transactions?

No, they're not required. 
Yes, I bought the +1 edition which came with a sack o' gold to begin with, but I just wish the micro-transactions weren't even there. Yes, I can just ignore them...but I'm of the opinion that they shouldn't be there to begin with. 

Rar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087856960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1498065382}
review: I enjoy the game! So much fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993225309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1390599338}
review:
Its a neat concept, but the gameplay boils down to grinding and spending money (and you can only get money by grinding or paying real cash).

In addition, its one of those games where upgrading equipment has a failure chance. When you fail (and you only have a 35% success chance), the money is lost and you have nothing to show for the 20 minutes of your life that you spent grinding to get it. There's no skill involved in this either. The only thing you could have done to increase your chance of success was to buy certain items beforehand, which you can only pay for through relentless grinding, or paying real cash. You may be noticing a trend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035630711', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1466447862}
review:
An absolutely ridiculous game, the good kind.
I find references here more often than I do in World of Warcraft, it's insane, I mean the starting "Master", is the fat Comic Store guy from The Simpsons, and another of the starting "Bonus objects", is a Tardis.
Even if you go to a certain place, you find the top of a Stargate, it's horrifically funny in my opinion.
On a more serious note, the gameplay itself is more simple than it may seem, sure it's tactical, being a WoW veteran, I had to go for a "Tank, healer, dps and offtank/dps" kinda thing, with a Paladin tank, Warrior offtank and Druid healer, obviously later on I added a Rogue and a Hunter for dps, but you can do any combination possible.

All-in-all, simple, funny, and easy game, I'm going to let you decide on the rest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044421187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1434895500}
review:
이게임은 TRPG를 게임으로 플래이합니다.
그러니까 브루마블같이 주사위 굴리고 룰읽고 하면서 하는 보드게임 형식의 테이블 알피지를 게임으로 플래이함.
개인적으로 일본산 고전 RPG나 턴제 게임을 매우 좋아하기 떄문에 이런류 정말 스키함
그런이유에서 파판이나 드퀘도 죨라 좋아합니다. 파판 최신작은 별로 '-`..

뭐 이 게임자체는 취향좀 많이타겠지만 저는 죨라 재밌습니다.
음 ios판이랑 안드판도 있으니 뭐 굳이 pc로 안하셔도 되겠지만..
드립요소도 많고 영어도 간단하니 간단하게 즐길거라면 추천.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980910801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1390536183}
review: It's not often that after only an hour of gameplay I don't feel the need to press on. The graphics are cute and the game sounds nice, but the gameplay and story are just not where they need to be. Yeah, the idea of playing a computer RPG about Pen & Paper RPGs is a cute idea, but the game is so damn meta that it actually feels like an amateur effort. Prepare to fight rats, goblins and evil wizards. Yawn. The character creation system looks very detailed at first, but then you realize that of the six initial classes, most only have 3 active skills and one passive skill for the ENTIRE game, and one or two have - gasp - FOUR skills. Here's every encounter in the game: rogue/mage use stuns, paladin use taunt, cleric heal, then attack, attack, attack, attack... Leveling up consists of upgrading one of your four skills, and weapons/armor upgrades require extreme grinding to level up your blacksmith to get a CHANCE at getting a straight upgrade. Oh and what's this? MICROTRANSACTIONS? In a game I already paid for? Even as a casual RPG, I would avoid getting this game at any price point. On a tablet? Maybe. On PC there are just way too many better indie titles at the same price point.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998460830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1445378882}
review:
This is quite possibly one of the more interesting games I've played in the past couple years and mind you I own 400+ games because it takes the classic Dungeons and Dragons board game and turns it into a sprite game while poking fun at the fact its all essentially imaginary and your characters make some funny comments now and then out of character lol.

Overall the its a very well rounded game and I definately can't stop playing it.


I'd say the only thing that is a negative point about the game is that to upgrade your gear you need to level up the blacksmith by collecting a literal f'ing s**t ton of an item called a Grindstone which to get them you buy them from the shop(waste of money) or mine them which takes f'ing forever. I found an exploit though that makes it easier to double the amount of grindstones you get. When you start the game to the east of the starting town is a cave where you can mine grindstones. When you click on one and the dice rolls up you need 6 or higher to get the grindstone. The key here is after clicking on the ore deposit just start pressing spacebar because once the dice stops rolling and you do or don't get the grindstone the act of pressing spacebar triggers the dice to reroll giving you another chance to get a grindstone. I went from getting around 10 grindstones every minute to around 20-25 grindstones in the same amount of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968569741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1390527524}
review: Don't buy it, even on sale. The graphics are awful and the gameplay is worse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024440251', 'num_games_owned': 806, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1571719219}
review:
If you're a GFX junkie, then this game certainly is not for you. Graphics and mucis are all 8bit and at first glance the game itself seems to be written in some old version of BASIC on a Comodore 64 (which is actually quite possible :D). But underneat that layer of all that 8bit gloss there's an extremely fun game!

This game is full of humor and all standard old-school pen-n-paper RPG clichés that you have probably done when you actually played those pen-n-paper games with friends. Sadly though, that DM kinda sucks. If I had him for a DM in my pen-n-paper sessions, we'd have long discussions about NPC naming, story telling and such. But I think this is most likely yet an other prank from the developers :p

I picked it up for €2,50 on the sale today, but if I knew this game was so much fun, I would have bought it earlier and have paid the €10 as well. It's really worth it, so much fun this game gives me!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978155021', 'num_games_owned': 1103, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1390518924}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072973093', 'num_games_owned': 694, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1417985566}
review:
Very good game. 
I particularly had never played tabletop RPG, but seeing this game opened up a new horizon and I got an urge to learn and play XD. 
I thought unnecessary buying gold in the game, but it does not impact anything in the game continues to be fun and the developer is to be congratulated. 
This game made me even more proud of Brazilian developers and show that they are capable.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Muito bom o jogo.
Eu particularmente nunca tinha jogado RPG de mesa, mas vendo esse jogo me abriu um novo horizonte e fiquei com uma vontade imensa de aprender e jogar XD.
Achei desnecessário a compra de gold no game, porem não impacta em nada o jogo, continua ser divertido e o desenvolvedor está de parabéns.
Esse jogo me fez ter mais orgulho ainda dos desenvolvedores brasileiros e mostrar que são capazes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992206547', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 1468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1246, 'last_played': 1394124866}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046797523', 'num_games_owned': 1796, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1390488371}
review:
遊戲內容呈現的是現在電腦角色扮演遊戲RPG的前身，桌上角色扮演遊戲TRPG，如果曾經玩過TRPG的玩家看到遊戲中各式各樣熟悉的情境與細節，肯定不由自主地會心一笑。

本遊戲原先出在觸控手機介面上，轉到電腦上後變成滑鼠走天下，本來在手機上算是方便的觸控操作，在電腦滑鼠環境下卻成了唯一缺陷，需要不停下戰鬥指令對於玩家來說變成反覆而疲乏的事情，真心希望能添加電腦版的鍵盤操作～撇開操作問題，遊戲中充滿了幽默，從玩家角色到劇情任務，可以看見細節與用心，想體驗此遊戲的魅力又想避免操作問題的話，推薦購買手機版本。

雖然電腦版有操作問題，但我仍然推薦此遊戲給大家！

author: {'steamid': '76561198020125851', 'num_games_owned': 15649, 'num_reviews': 840, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1390477514}
review:
Don't let the complaints fool you. This is actually a great arcade classic turn-based RPG experience. 

Think of the original Final Fantasy games, in a much more fun, comedic fashion, but still has the challenge, and core elements you love. You will go on grand adventures, fighting many various foes with a pretty good storyline.

There's options to increase the challenge for even greater rewards / xp, loot, etc. etc. vamping the difficulty that suits you.

It's hard to explain all the qualities that makes this game so cute, and enjoyable, but I think it's definitely something every RPG fan would love to play for a few hours. 

The main downside people seem to complain about is that there's one very small in-game real money shop, which you can pay like $1-5 for in-game gold. The game is not balanced around this shop, and I've never once understood why it was in the game. Perhaps it's for "stupid people" who make foolish decisions, or need a "boost", but I did not need it.

However, I did decide to go with the digital deluxe edition for $1 more, which comes with a lot of goodies, including a new character, 800 starting gold, some minor boosts and a new area with a monster super effective to all dmg. (fast easy xp + gold)

I paid: $3.75 (digital deluxe)
Reccomended price: $5

author: {'steamid': '76561198094503430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1390388671}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999588246', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1390455667}
review:
I wanted to like this game, I really did. It had a nice aesthetic, nice music, and it was from a small studio. Had I been aware that this was an iOS app before it was a PC game, I might've been more wary. The first couple hours went by relatively nicely, but after that, not so much. 

If you buy the Deluxe Edition DLC, you get the Magika Wizard, a character with a better passive skill advantage than most other (see next point) characters. Around level 15, you unlock the Developer Player Characters, self-inserts that have even better passives, making whatever current party you're using seem feeble in comparison. 

Also around this time, you'll notice your strength isn't getting you as far as it did in the beginning, so you go to buy gear. Only, the blacksmith, by default, has a 30-some percent chance at actually crafting the item you pay him for. So, either you toss bags of money at the him, praying that he succeeds (because of course he doesn't reimburse you), or you get grindstones, items that let you "level him up". It takes around 2000 grindstones at 25 gold apiece to have him reach 100%. That's 50,000 gold. At level 15, you might gain 200 per fight. 

Oh, but what's this? You can buy gold in-game for real money! Of course you can. Sadly, this game really was designed as a cash-hungry iOS game first and foremost. 4/10, for the initial hour or two of fun before the grind.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997968880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1461, 'last_played': 1662340857}
review:
So I've spent the last 5 hours playing this, and I think its well worth the $3.74 for the deluxe version. I bought it on today's daily deal, then sent one to my husband as well. He's a long time D&D nerd and I've played on occassion as well.

I'm only around levels 19-24 in my characters and spent most of my inital gold opening up full party options and some table add-ons, so I've been doing a lot of dungeon crawling to earn money for armor/weapons upgrades. There is an option to buy gold with real money, but I'm finding it easy to earn the gold I need so it's really just a time saver, and the cash shop is not quite the money-grab a lot of other cash shops are.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045973115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1427068000}
review: Way better than I thought it was going to be. Only have played like 1 hour of the game, but I can say that I'm really enjoying it so far. Looks like it has a lot of things to keep me busy playing and looks like chances to goof around and try other things for laughs. However, my only gripe with the game so far is there isn't much classes or kinds of players to pick from. Yet, I'm really looking forward to playing more of this game when I get the chance. This is a very simple load up and play game. Totally recommended if you enjoy D&D. Worth the $2.49 I spent on this game, easily!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027182896', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1390524823}
review: Fantastic game; totally worth buy at the discount. Its basically a parody d&d 8/16bit game. Develop a party of up to 5, with a few different classes (pally, druid, rogue, mage, cleric, warrior), each with their own abilities, grind enemies, or do quests. Kill enemies, get gold/loot to buy better gear. Upgrade your gear at the blacksmith. Lots of replay value imho. It may get grindy for certain buffs, but battles can be made easier or harder and you can always rest to recoup health/mana.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020576701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1389634638}
review: This little game, a nostalgic blend of retro-console RPG's and old-school D&D, is novel and amusing. I love the interface, with the DM seated on one side of a table and the players (characters) on the other side, and with the scenery changing around them and the ranks of opponents springing up from behind the DM's shoulders. Character development and turn-based combat are simplistic and two-dimensional, but interesting and challenging. However, it all starts to get repetitive and a little monotonous after a half-dozen or so hours of play. If you can get this game on sale for under $5, it's worthwhile. As for the in-game gold that can be bought with real-world money: It's totally unnecessary, and buying some may even spoil the game for you, since it will make the game too easy and reduce the number of enjoyable hours you'll get out of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058133656', 'num_games_owned': 862, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 3193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1645996122}
review:
This is a really fun game.

PROS- Nice pixelart with plenty of eastereggs in each scene, A funny story with even more references littered throughout, A solid soundtrack, A solid comabt system with clear meanings for every stat, A variety of classes and upgrades for different playstyles and differing playthroughs.

CONS- You are going to have to grind quite a bit, the difficulty curve could use some rebalancing for early game to require less grinding.

NEUTRAL- There are microstransactions in the game for gold. They are NOT required in any way though for the actual game. They act as time savers allowing you to buy better items and xp potions faster. You will likely make enough gold just playing the game anyways.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992898485', 'num_games_owned': 1850, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1381155324}
review:
Un juego de rol en el que controlas a gente jugando a un juego de rol. No, no me estoy repitiendo, tu no estás jugando al mismo juego que están jugando tus personajes, y mola mucho. Con artistas invitados como el Doc (Regreso al Futuro), el Amo del Calabozo (♫ Dragones y Mazmorras, un mundo infernal ♫), Missigno (famoso glitch de Pokémon) y Obélix (¡Están locos estos roleros!).
Tus personajes son tan variopintos como: El niño, la profe, la abuela, el autónomo, el pizzero, los programadores, el bruto, la madre, la pija...
Está cargado de topicazos y te lo pasas bien, con roturas del cuarto muro cuando menos te lo esperas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034552591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1610368782}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993554052', 'num_games_owned': 3129, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1385, 'last_played': 1416073296}
review:
While the microtransations aren't absolutely needed, it's bullshit to have them in a single-player game at all. You CAN get all the in-game money you need, in-game, it just takes a while.

Also, a lot of achievements are broken. There are a few that remain from an earlier version about areas that aren't accessible in the Steam version, for example.

It also gets boring very very fast. I guarantee after like six or seven quests you'll stop reading the dialogue and just click furiously to get through it (I didn't, but I know a bunch of people who had).

author: {'steamid': '76561198012820905', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1527186792}
review: Knights of Pen and Paper +1 is a fun, tongue and cheek, silly play on tabletop role play games. It may not be the most engrossing game, but it's enjoyable all the same, and well worth it if it is on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031330148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1390408147}
review:
You play a small group of players in a D&D tabletop adventure controlled by a DM. Camera is angled from behind the players and the events take place in the backgroud. Mechanics are solid enough and the game is presented very well. has a clever idea and good dialogue.

However this game is a port from a mobile format and has all the grind and micotransactions you would expect from the platform at a 10/15euro asking price. Gameplay boils down to farming easy monsters for gold (which could be purchased for real world money instead) Gameplay gets dull and repetitive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052455213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1228, 'last_played': 1392409516}
review: Fun and hilarious. Redefining breaking the fourth wall. Requires some grind. All in all, a huge time-sink.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014757855', 'num_games_owned': 1678, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1384359470}
review: Haha, this was such a dumb game, and yet I kept playing.  Why??  I've been trained too well a la Pavlov's Dog by decades of JRPG repetition to blindly chase after stats, gear and rare loot.  Knights has a good premise and the class combinations are pretty fun, but in the end the gameplay was too simple to really care about.  I also think you earn gold at a really slow pace, probably to incentivize IAP.  Ugh, IAP in a paid game... good thing I got it in a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064037266', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1082, 'last_played': 1472262777}
review: jogabilidade simples é nostálgica (para quem foi da era 8 bits) com vários desafios ao longo do caminho, tem muitos personagens para ser criados trilhar sonora bem elaborada tornando em um jogo bem divertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057200912', 'num_games_owned': 1087, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 1208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 956, 'last_played': 1508377788}
review:
Retornando às origens do "papel e caneta" do velho RPG de mesa!

Gosta de RPG de mesa? Sim?! COMPRE AGORA!
Se não gosta, ou está com um pé atrás, vá ver alguns gameplays antes ou deixe pra lá..

Este não é só mais um indie qualquer no Steam. É um jogo de RPG de mesa, no qual você incorpora TODOS os jogadores da mesa para controlá-los. Isso deixa o jogo mais desafiador.
Variados itens para comprar, missões legais, lugares para viajar (com direito a icosaedro e tudo ^^)

Mas o que mais me chamou a atenção nesse game, foi o modo de como os produtores inseriram falas, contextos e ambientação com uma série de humor nonsense e internetês. Acho que isso, juntamente com a a categoria, digamos.. remodelada, do game, foi o que o deixou mais atrativo.

Super recomendado!


10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197979130712', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1377208158}
review: if you enjoy pen and paper rpg games you will love this. Lots of jokes and lots of fun. Its not a super serious game so its a nice break from other stressful games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012349483', 'num_games_owned': 1237, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1070, 'last_played': 1389957118}
review:
I really loved the game. It took me 20 hours to complete, which includes a restart after some hours when I had unlocked more interesting characters than the starting lineup. I'll have to go back and finish it with the ones I missed in the future. 

The game was a lot of fun, and definitely worth the asking price. It made me smile many times, what with all those wacky references to other games and developers. I bought the Deluxe edition to support the developers as much as I could, as I had researched the game prior to buying it, and I'm glad I did. The extra gold you start with is nice (but doesn't provide any sort of advantage other than when you get a full lineup but let's face it, it doesn't matter).

If you're on the fence, then just go ahead and spend the 10 euro or whatever the price is in your region. It's a fun throwback to the golden ages of gaming, and it's just well done through and through. I doubt very much you'll regret it. Don't worry about the ingame cash shop. I never used it, and NEVER had a reason to. You earn redicilous amounts of gold in this game just doing the main quest line, and the extra gold you can buy for real money is so useless, I'm puzzled why they added it at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962217207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1387376972}
review: Если вы соскучились по классическим пошаговым RPG, то Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition создана специально для вас. Все, что от вас требуется, так это выбрать класс — рыцарь или маг, — решить, в каком направлении развиваться и отправиться в длительное путешествие по виртуальным просторам вселенной. При этом вы можете постоянно улучшать свое оружие и доспехи у кузнецов, изучать новые заклинания, в общем, заниматься привычными вещами в пиксельной среде.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017972349', 'num_games_owned': 677, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 921, 'last_played': 1389941328}
review: 3 Stars. It was OK at first, but it got very tedious towards the end and I don't want to grind for money and XP for so little payoff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042603995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1387616358}
review: This game was developed with a mobile market in mind, and it shows. While the jabs at RPG norms are humorous and appreciated, the rest of this game is a shallow time waster that would be more enjoyable on the crapper or in the check out line at a grocery store. Oh yeah, and there are microtransactions, though they aren't invasive. If the meta humor alone is enough for you to part with 10 bucks, go for it. If you're looking for a charming indie rpg with some depth, there are some much better options out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987547840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1136, 'last_played': 1388321196}
review:
aaaah this game is so fun i spent so much allnighters playing this game
the only downside is that it seems like the only way to beat the game is to have a specific team of specific skillset on each classes. like later on i had a warrior, rogue, mage, cleric, druid, and was going so much into the game epically, but later on i realized that this team cannot beat the later enemies due to too much constant stuns and my lack of magic resistance (which I have no idea where to find at all...)
so the only way for me to progress was to either redo the game or choose new classes and grind them to level up. both which i find quite tedious. so although the game was epic and amazing, my poor choice in the beginning made me stop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091683732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1389903374}
review:
Ein interessantes Spielkonzept, dass in seiner Umsetzung leider nicht sehr lange motiviert.
Während ich mich zu Beginn noch über den augenzwinkernden Humor und die liebevolle Parodie auf vertraute Rollenspielerlebnisse gefreut habe, fing der eintönige Spielablauf schon nach sehr kurzer Zeit an zu nerven.
Wenn wenigstens der "Loot" weniger albern und sinnvoller gestaltet währe, so hätte mich das Spiel eventuell über das erste Kapitel hinaus motivieren können.
Ich könnte mir vorstellen, dass dieses Spiel auf einem Smartphone als "Zeittöter" in der Bahn oder im Wartezimmer funktionieren würde. Es gibt sogar einen Handyspiel-typischen Ingame-Shop, den ich jedoch auch eher als Parodie verstehe. Am PC habe ich deutlich unterhaltsamere Alternativen, auch gerade im Bereich der Retrospiele. Schade um die zugrunde liegende Spielidee. Daraus hätte man mehr machen können.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999111837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1577, 'last_played': 1393461635}
review: Surprisingly addictive.  A very original idea--playing both the game master and the players of a pen-and-paper RPG within the context of a computer game--that actually works very very well.  The graphics are retro but appealing, as is the music.  The story does not take itself seriously at all, but this is a good thing, as it makes for some very fun casual gameplay and a lot more content and play time than I expected.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031294963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1442776909}
review:
J'ai joué dans plusieurs groupes de RPG sur table, dans la réalité et je crois que c'est une des raisons pour laquelle j'aime autant jouer à Knight of pen and paper. Ça me rappel les soirées passé à brasser des dés et à vivre des aventure uniquement raconté par un DM. 

J'aime beaucoup que la table de jeu soit toujours présente, avec les joueurs et le DM, afin de rappeler que c'est un jeu sur table, tout en montrant le monde et les créature, de l'aventure, comme si les joueurs avaient une visions partagé de l'histoire. Les personnages sont cliché et me rappel certain joueurs réel ( sauf peut-être l'extraterrestre, je ne crois pas en avoir déjà eu un dans la réalité à ma table). 

Le commentaire "hors-jeu" des personnages font aussi classique de D&D sur table.

Bref pour tout les nostalgiques des jeux de tables ou "Pen and paper", c'est un bon achat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016908748', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1502025155}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034614210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1381848513}
review:
TRPG 그 자체를 RPG로 옮겨놓은 듯한 게임으로
이곳저곳 유쾌한 센스가 돋보입니다.

태생이 스마트폰 게임이라 그런지 몰라도
퀘스트 > 전투 > 레벨업 > 전투 > 장비업 > 전투...
...식의 전형적인 노가다가 주가 되는 게임이긴 하지만
가볍게 즐기기에는 괜찮게 잘 만들어져 있습니다.

다만 PC로 하기에는 2% 심심한 부분이 있으니
이왕 즐기실 거면 차라리 스마트폰으로 즐기시는 건 어떤가 싶습니다.

상세리뷰 : http://ellenuen.egloos.com/2992461

author: {'steamid': '76561198107466003', 'num_games_owned': 1158, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1240, 'last_played': 1392843588}
review:
Últimamente he estado decepcionado con los juegos de rol que adquiero, no se si es que me estoy haciendo viejo, o ya no los hacen con la ''mágia'' con la que los hacían antes...

Sin embargo hace poco me vi sorprendido por un juego, se trata de Knights of pen and paper +1 edition, un videojuego de rol que simula un juego de rol de mesa, ¿un poco lío no? pues no, es simplemente genial.

Es un juego de rol por turnos como los de mis tiempos mozos, hecho en pixel art, y con cameos a otras sagas y personas, tales como las tortugas ninja, Gabe Newell, Mario bros, teleñecos etc...

Podría deciros todo lo que me gusta o disgusta, pero creo que lo vais a ver mejor en el siguiente vídeo que hice, y enseño prácticamente todo lo interesante de el juego. Un saludo.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=16EGOqG6SGo

author: {'steamid': '76561197998628765', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1388643129}
review:
I'm slightly disappointed by this game, but play it anyway.  The mechanics are pretty decent, and I like that it's got a DND type feel to it (not to mention the excellent dialog!) but it really just feels like a cellphone game that was ported over to PC and shoved out the door.  I just feel like they could have done a better job with it.

It's slightly too simplistic for my taste, but when I play it, it does scratch a turn based itch that I get from time to time.  Probably not worth full price, but if you see it on sale it might be worth picking up.  Just try and keep your expectations a bit low and you won't be too let down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002975872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1433433385}
review:
По сути, Knights of Pen and Paper - симулятор игры в типичную настольную RPG. Выбранные вами в отряд маг, паладин, клирик, вор, друид, воин и вор не бегут на подвиги в пещеры и казематы, а садятся за игровой стол, где их уже ждет бородатый «гейм-мастер».
Геймастер рассказывает сидящим за столом подчеркнуто типичную историю про борьбу «бобра с ослом», предлагает бросать кубик и идти по глобальной карте на подвиги. И самый первый из них — это, конечно, избиение крыс. Авторы откровенно издеваются и хихикают, заставляя нас снова и снова сражаться с грызунами — до тех пор, пока у виртуальных героев и у самого игрока не начнется истерика.
В таком пародийном духе выдержана вся игра. Так, первая встреченная нами деревня называется Default Village, а некоторые ее жители откликаются на имя «Random NPC». В тоже время Knights of Pen and Paper — это полноценная олдскульная RPG с шопингом, прокачкой умений, сбором трофеев, посещением кузнеца, побочными квестами и пошаговыми боями в духе Might&Magic и Wizardry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077657828', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1397947218}
review: RPG de turnos à moda antiga, com gráficos e trilha sonora retrô, recheado de citações bem humoradas de todo o universo geek e gamer... É literalmente uma viagem no tempo, um jogo aparentemente simples, mas com jogabilidade complexa, no melhor sentido da palavra... Extremamente viciante, e foi feito por brasileiros! Recomendo a compra!

author: {'steamid': '76561197983755693', 'num_games_owned': 1222, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1388562495}
review: This game was super-addicting when I played it on my phone, and it still is now. Getting gold and the game in general can be a bit of a grind, so it's a little obvious that microtransactions are being pushed. Still, it's fun and the humour hits far more often than it misses.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015030233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1595735305}
review:
SO GOOD. If you play D&D, if you play RPGs, and are not averse to casual-tier play, this is an excellent pick,
The class/race combinations allow some basic entry-level optimizing, as does skill advancement. The loot pool is doesn't really have strong variety; there's a few weak over-specialized items and a few strong general stats-on-stats items. But, the storyline is entertaining in a quirky way as is the dialog. There isn't a lot of grinding, you can level quickly via the quest line if you play well. I consider KoPnP+1 one of the safest bets for your money.

review:
TRPGをモチーフとしたユニークなRPG
探索のような要素は殆どなく戦闘がメイン
集まったコインで装備を買ったり鍛えたりユニークアイテムを設置したりの繰り返しが面白い

英語があまり得意でなくても一目で分かるパロディ要素等も多いためクスリとさせられる
おすすめ

author: {'steamid': '76561198045776524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1700080601}
review: A very good RPG/D&D Style game. Pixelated and all. The only thing i have to say i do not like about this game is the in game currency. You can earn gold by Grinding and stuff like that, but they have the "Purchase gold here" for actual money, which is quite a disapointment, but besides that, fantastic game, great art, and fun atmosphere. The thing that really suprised me was the detail that you can apply to your room. When i say room, i mean the actual room that you and your friends are playing in, like the pet, door, carpet, book, ect. It lets you have different styles while also increasing atributes like, exp gain, money gain, strength, etc. 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198019428081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1384810242}
review:
Despite no mention of it anywhere, this game contains microstransactions that will make the game easier. This means that on top earning money through game sales themselves, the game is continually monetised through the sale of more in game currency. It also suggests that the difficulty and the amount of mindless grinding required in the game to progress is geared toward frustrating you into getting out your wallet to buy progress with real world cash.

This business model is unacceptable. If I pay money for a game I expect there to be a final transaction for me to enjoy the game as is. When I'm expected to buy my progress through the game on the other hand, under no circumstances do I want to pay money up front, especially not without being notified of these transactions. I don't want to pay a fair price for a game only to find out that I will have to invest a lot more to really enjoy it.

The game itself seemed clever at times, but I soon felt forced to either grind through enemies at a boringly slow pace or fork over real cash.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044651411', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1574474433}
review: O jogo que, em conjunto com Oniken, me fez perceber que o cenário indie brasileiro está muito mais além do que aquilo que imaginei. As falas são ótimas, a aventura é totalmente digna, as opções de customização envolvem tipo de mesa, artigos no cenário, itens, paredes, portas. Tudo com diversas referências, incluindo DoctorWho, LOTR, StarWars, e diversas outras coisas do nível. Óbvio, por ser feito por brasileiros, possui opção de idioma em PT-BR, o que faz toda uma diferença, já que se trata de um RPG de mesa quase que cru. Pra quem gosta de RPG "for real", não ter esse jogo é como jogar D&D 3.5 sem o Livro do Mestre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070501411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1604720308}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper +1 brings back memories of poorly lit basements and sitting on steel folding chairs next to a double set of card tables. Cans of Mountain Dew strewn about the floor from exciting fights and pulling out the natural 20 when you needed it. 

KPP+1 contains all the tabletop RPG elements with a highly customizable experience. You can select from several people for your PCs, You can unlock more people within the game as well as unlock more classes to play after completing adventure paths. The feature of the game that keeps me playing is the location changes. You start by sitting in a basement. Starting the game changes the surroundings and you are transported to a town, field, or cave! 

The culture references are plentiful and will make any geek giggle and say "No Way!" a few times. I've counted over 20 references so far and I'm pretty sure I haven't found them all. 

A few people seem upset about the microstransactions. That is completely optional. You can earn gold in the game. It will take you a while longer, but buying gold isn't required. 

I'd buy this game for any geek I know, probably even the deluxe edition for those I know who would appreciate it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995183614', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1529919965}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995169868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 983, 'last_played': 1388622780}
review: I feel torn about this game.  At first it was interesting in the simplicity and style, yet as the game progresses it feel immensely tedious.  There will be quests where you are required to go from one location to another and have to fight at each step along the way, sometimes up to five or six battles.  Then once you arrive the quest is to slay a number of monsters repeatedly.  The endgame seems almost unfair, requiring a lot of grinding unless you spend a lot of time exploring sidequests.  Based on the price, I think the game has a niche in the category of game where you advance through it periodically while taking a break from other games.  Could improvements be made? Absolutely, but for an indie title with some creative 4th wall shattering, it serves it's place decently.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058428244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1419011234}

author: {'steamid': '76561198059637592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1384085822}
review:
Appealing idea at first: table-top RPG simulation.
Turns out, the game is about grind. There is a story, but it is only about "move, grind next 10 battles and 1 boss". All battles could be won using the same tactics, with numerous menu invokes and the same skill rotations. Couldn't finish the game, though grinded with all my force to make it to the end and delete a game.
Graphics is bad for my taste. Pixel-art by itself is not a justification for a tasteless. Music is below average, sound is annoying. Not that it's matters anyway with boring gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113045548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 930, 'last_played': 1590218283}
review:
นอกจากภาพแบบ 8-bit แล้ว รูปแบบการเล่นของ  Knights of Pen and Paper ก็ Retro ย้อนยุค ไม่แพ้กัน  กับ การเล่าเรื่องที่เหมือนกับ การเล่นเกม RPG ยุคแรก ที่เป็นแบบการเล่าเรื่อง และการใช้บทบาทสมมุติ (Role Play) ตัวเกมมี Class ให้เลือกเล่นและปลดล็อคเพิ่มได้อีกภายหลัง รวมทั้ง Ability เฉพาะตัวของตัวละคร ทำให้เพิ่มความหลากหลายในการเล่นได้พอสมควร ระดับความยากของ Battle ที่ปรับแต่งเองได้    Item ต่าง ๆ ที่ช่วยเพิ่มค่าสถานะ  ระบบตีบวกอัพเกรดอาวุธและเกราะ  ระบบทำเควสที่เน้นแจก Exp เป็นหลัก และ มีดันเจี้ยน ให้ลงไปทดสอบฝีมือ   
   โดยรวม ๆ แล้วก็มีทุกอย่างในเกม RPG พึงมี ถึงแม้ว่าเนื้อเรื่องอาจจะค่อนข้างธรรมดา แต่ก็มีมุกตลกสอดแทรกให้ได้ขบขันบ้างในบางที รวมทั้ง Parody ล้อเลียนอีกเป็นกระบุงโกย  ส่วนใครที่ต้องการ กราฟฟิคสวยล้ำ หรือ เนื้อเรื่อง เข้มข้น ก็มองข้ามไปได้เลย เพราะเกมนี้เหมาะสำหรับเล่นเพลิน ๆ ไม่ซีเรียส ซะมากกว่า แต่โดยส่วนตัว ถือว่าสนุกใช้ได้เลยทีเดียวครับ

author: {'steamid': '76561198043238459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1497750579}
review: I'm really bored at my computer one night and find a game that is having a sale that just covers my left over money from my steam wallet. So I buy it after realizing how little space it occupies, and have the time of my life. The game is about a group of people (that you choose, each having their own perks in the game) play a game of D&D. You start off slowly, but then begin find a sense of fun in it somewhere. This game can get a bit repetitive and boring at times, but it's really worth it. I can't get too excited with it, but you can easily lose yourself in this game when you get down to the grind and try to clear a dungeon. There can be cheap situations where you die easily, but for me, it wasn't unbearable. I don't normally appreciate these kinds of games, with this being a major exception. Although I can't give it a high rating, I can at least recommend it to my friends and family.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118094500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2355, 'last_played': 1393142069}
review:
I grew up on the NES and DOS-era RPGs, but I have not played any edition of Dungeons and Dragons earlier than third.  That said, I am quite familiar with the mechanics and culture that this game is paying homage to.  It fits the feel of an 8-bit RPG and a 1980s homebrew campaign world quite well, with its crunchy (mechanics-focused) gameplay and cobbled-together story.

I love this game so far, despite the grind, but it is most certainly not for everyone. I got it for Christmas, and if one can find it for $5 or less, it is worth buying if you like that sort of thing. I do, and they fixed their issues with microtaransaction elements, so I'm editing my review to reflect that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070776295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 982, 'last_played': 1437147419}
review:
Quite an addicting little game. Tne story involves a group of good ol' table-top rpg players trying to define the thin line that separates the game fro reality. It is a turn-based RPG where you choose what kind of adventurers you want in your group and level their character sheets as you would in a traditional table-top RPG, with dice rolls and everything. The story is the main selling point of the game and it does have its' own little charm to it, I did laugh at most of the jokes, though some of them fall a bit flat (it is mostly reference-based humour). There's a lot of text to go through, so it is not recommended for people who like to skip most of the dialogue in games. Good for playing if you have a bit of time on your hands, however I would not recommend it for "hardcore" players - they might be disappointed with the combat system (which is a bit simplistic and does not involve a lot of management) and find the game too repetitive. The progress does feel rewarding, however, there is quite a high level of grinding involved which should be taken into consideration. The art style and character design match the tone of the game well and the simple animation feels natural. The music could be better, after some time it can get a bit repetitive.
Overall - I do like the game and I do recommend it if you are just looking for a little time waster.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036677191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1480088299}
review: Pensate quanto può apparire esotico un dado con venti facce per chi non ha mai partecipato a un gioco di ruolo cartaceo in vita sua. Per gli altri invece riporta quasi sempre alla mente ricordi di pomeriggi e serate interminabili, stretti con gli amici intorno a un tavolo a impersonare chierici, maghi, ladri e guerrieri in lotta contro ogni sorta di nemico, dall'infimo goblin al subdolo mimic. Tutto per l'oro, i punti esperienza e la gloria che solo un'arma potente sa regalare al suo possessore. Ma soprattutto per il gusto di raccontare una storia insieme al narratore, quella santa donna o sant'uomo che perdeva ore a preparare un'avventura per un gruppo di giocatori che appena vedeva un villaggio pensava solo a come saccheggiarlo e darlo alle fiamme, sgranocchiando patatine nei momenti di pathos, commentando i gol della domenica durante il gioco e in generale interpretando una versione di se stessi che riscattasse su villici senza colpe le frustrazioni di una vita scolastica poco esaltante. Ripensate a quei momenti, o provate a immaginarli, e poi aprite gli occhi su Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition, che ci mette proprio nei panni di giocatori che, insieme al narratore, stanno partecipando a una sessione di gioco di ruolo cartaceo. Un meta gioco di ruolo quindi, perché i giocatori sono anche i personaggi dell'avventura, e mentre li interpretano fanno commenti sul gioco stesso, entrando e uscendo dal proprio ruolo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021064648', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1380905268}
review: Confesso que comprei esse jogo apenas por saber que era um jogo feito por brasileiro, com a intenção de conhecer e fortalecer as produções nacionais, mas acabei gostando do jogo, pesquisei e descobri que a princípio era um jogo para portáteis, android se eu não me engano, porém esta versão da Steam possui um conteúdo maior. Sobre o jogo, apesar de ser em 2D e parecer pequeno o jogo é grande, não cheguei a terminar porque tive que formatar meu PC quando estava perto do final, e não tive pique para continuar novamente. O jogo te coloca na situação de um jogador de RPG de tabuleiro, o mestre irá contando a história e os desafios e irão aparecer na tela, você seleciona quantos inimigos quer lutar por turno, ou seja isso definirá a dificuldade do jogo, achei essa dinâmica boa, pois você pode variar para lutar mais difíceis quando estiver com condições melhores, e lutas mais fáceis caso esteja meio fraco. Os gráficos são no estilo retro, 16 bits, não posso dizer que seja artístico nem nada, apenas retro. Há um sistema de compra de melhorias com o gold que você ganha durante o jogo, você compra itens que coloca na mesa, decora o fundo do quarto onde está jogando e ganha bônus por isso. Minha surpresa foi saber que existe um recurso de micro transação para adquirir esse gold, pois é amigos isso está chegando até nos pequenos jogos indies. Mas não senti que isso estragou a experiência de jogo, os diálogos são em português e tentam ser engraçadinhos e leves, acompanhando o clima de diversão do jogo. Acredito que demora umas 12 horas para terminar o game, porém ele oferece possibilidade para se jogar mais, possui sistema de conquistas Steam, falar nisso, foi um ponto positivo do jogo, são conquistas que me motivariam a buscar se eu não tivesse tido esse problema. Bom cheguei na conclusão de ser um jogo legalzinho para passar o tempo, seria ideal jogar em um celular por exemplo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025527703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1388819395}
review:
(this review mainly looks at microtransactions)

I initially was really excited about this game, as I find the premise and art style quite appealing. 

The problem lies, as many reviewers prior to me noticed, within built-in microtransactions. Ability to bypass the grind paying for in-game currency ruins any kind of trust in the economy at all. Some people might be OK with this, but I do have a couple points of contention:

 - The financial aspect introduces a bias from the point of developer, conscious or otherwise, to balance a game in a way that will push a player to use microtransactions. From that point on, hitting a wall, you can never possibly know either you are bad at game or the game is rigged. 
- Basically what a player pays for is something that earlier would've been archived by using CheatEngine or similar software. I want to stress that my point here is not "paying for something that could be free", but rather introducing the idea of cheating from the get-go. On top of that paying to not play game is plain weird to me. 

A bonus point - Steam page for the game doesn't have any mention of in-app purchases (aside from user reviews). 

With those points in mind, the choice comes down to whether you are willing to invest time into something that shouldn't be trusted by design.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971190695', 'num_games_owned': 1377, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1698706863}
review:
The first 4-5 hours are great, when you are exploring the world, unlocking new classes and testing different groups. Sadly, afterwards the game becomes a massive grind of fighting the same enemies over and over, going back and forth the same places and every battle feels exactly the same...

It has a lot of flavor and cool references, but still I couldn't even force myself to reach the end of the game. There's micro-transactions in-game, but honestly they don't get in the way, the massive grind at end-game and lack of interesting battles are this game's major flaws.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995330335', 'num_games_owned': 1096, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1397338949}
review:
This game is based heavily on grinding, which I guess is par for the course for what was originally a phone title. Gotta sell those IAPs!

This would not be so bad if the game was actually free-to-play, or if the RPG mechanics were any good. After all, lots of titles in the genre have a bunch of grinding at their core and still manage to be fun.
Unfortunately, combat is shockingly shallow, character building and crafting might as well not be there, and while the quest structure is framed in an original/cute way, it just underlines how barebones everything is.

I was also put off by the shameless, constant nerd pandering -- which mostly takes the form of (you guessed it) lazy pop-culture references, but you also get healthy doses of terrible banter of course.

Not the most enjoyable way to waste your time, even if you can get it for cheap/free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067114552', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1382199584}
review:
Having never played the classic tabletop D&D myself, I at first find the concept interesting however this turns up becoming a disappointment. The enjoyment value in this game is pretty inadequate.

1) Clicking fiesta
You basically just need to click when you want to do almost anything. Just click the shop icon to buy item, just click the map button to travel, etc. You have control of the dungeon master. You get to choose what and how many enemies you want to fight with the limit of 7 (after unlocking it) same type of creature (combination is not possible). The combat system is pretty much lacking, and no brainer. There are only three damage type, physical, nature and magic. It doesn't matter if you hit enemies with ice or fire. The only option you have in organizing your party is pretty much who you want to include in the party (max. 5), no formation whatsoever. The "threat level" system is at best vague and unclear. 

2) Unclear storyline and boring quest
After playing this game for so long, I still have no idea what the story is about. Comments from the "players" range from boring to cheezy at best. The variations of sidequest are too little. Collect certain item from certain monster drop, kill certain amount of certain monster, escort someone (and 100% encounter at every place when you do this quest) and go to certain dungeon to fight with the developer. There ain't a puzzle for me to solve.

3) Character creation
Character creation is pretty much simple. Every "player" have his own bonus and you might want to make use of this bonus for the most fitting job. Each have 4 skills and set stats built. Everytime you level up, you have one skill point to spent. At first this seems okayish but as your level goes up, balance issue will be a slap on the face. Physical attack easily overpower magic skill. Leaving spellcasters as useless ragdoll.

4) Bad economy and Microtransaction
The main argument in the forum dwell on this "innocent" button on the top right corner. You can buy in game gold that you can earn by slaying monsters with real money. Why the heck it is there in a paid content anyway? Let me skip that annoyingly long argument. There are a few things that make people upset with the economy of the game. Firstly, the blacksmith. The only way to have better equipment is to go to the blacksmith (that can be found in some places) and have them upgraded for a fee. This process involve probabilistic element with success rate proportional with the level of the blacksmith. There are ways to reduce the cost and leveling the blacksmith without risking your gold but those are pretty much grinding. Secondly, you "buy" "players" with gold to start the game. There are "players" that are so expensive that it is impossible to start the game with without buying gold (on your first run). Thirdly, the gold is tied to your account, meaning that after your first run, you can start a second run with that amount that is left. This make second run pretty much broken as you probably have too much gold.

5) The music is bad and annoying. It is getting on my nerves after a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015507927', 'num_games_owned': 2037, 'num_reviews': 346, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1386251324}
review:
Prima di iniziare ammetto di aver giocato poco, solo 3 ore.

Pro:
-Umorismo e citazioni
-Struttura di combattimento ben strutturato 
-Classi strutturate discretamente bene

"Contro":
-La storia non mi è sembrata molto bella (ametto di non aver finito il gioco, da quello che ho fatto non mi sembrà un granchè)
-Può diventare molto noioso, purtroppo i combattimenti non cambiano mai, e per allenarti decidi te i mostri da affrontare, ripetività moltissima 
-Microtransazioni , anche se non sono obbligatori e che potete benissimo farne a meno, resta comunque fastidioso che un gioco come questo abbia delle Microtransazioni

Gioco che va sicuramente giocato col Tablet (costa anche poco) , per pc costa parecchio ed è pure "scomodo" se si può dire.

Consigliare lo consiglio perchè è un idea originale ed è strutturato molto bene. A me non è piaciuto per la ripetività purtroppo, ma è un mio capriccio

author: {'steamid': '76561198043177466', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1396325620}
review:
This is an example of how games of old should be made anew.

Everything is fully customizable, from the role of each class you pick to your next quest;
The gameplay is solid, comparable to classic JRPGs like Phantasy Star II and Dragon Quest V,
But with a "do what you want, when you want, the way you think you can handle" touch.
The graphics are reminiscent of Kairosoft's cellphone games (Game Dev Story), and look very good.

Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019715562', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1259, 'last_played': 1392427696}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper is a fantasy RPG, which plays like tabletop RPGs. The twist is that you're playing as both the dungeon master and the players. Basically that means you can decide yourself what kind of quests you want (to some extent) and how difficult you want to make the fights by choosing how many enemies you want to fight against. And because the game is like tabletop RPGs, there are several situations where you'll throw a virtual D20 dice.

When you first start the game you get to choose from about 10 characters to be the players and 5 classes for them. Each character has a different passive bonus that increases some attributes, which actually leads to choosing the characters based on the bonuses and the class you're going to pick. When starting a new game you get to choose 2 players for free and the remaining 3 seats in the table you can fill by buying the players with in-game gold. You can swap the players in places that have a tavern.

If I remember correctly, you first have 5 classes available, but you can unlock a few more by completing side-quests. You can only have one of each class, so for example you can't have 5 warriors as your party. You wouldn't want to either. The reason being that each class has its purpose. Some classes are healers, some are tanks and the rest are either melee fighters or spellcasters of some description. Each class has 4 skills, which are either passive or spells and skills that you can use during combat. The passive skills usually boost some attribute, but some of them also have special stat boosts like life steal. The active skills are pretty basic fantasy RPG skills. You can increase one of the skills every time you level up, which just made the skills more powerful or increased the attribute bonus. So it isn't very deep skill system.

The combat is turn based and the players and the enemies all have a box either on top of or below the sprite, which shows the number of their turn. On the player's turns you choose to either attack, use a skill/spell, use an item, defend or run away from the battle. You quite rarely want to use anything other than a skill or spell, because those are the most effective way for beating the enemies. As I mentioned earlier, you get to choose how many and what kind of enemies you want to fight against. Once you buy a certain item from a special shop you can fight 7 enemies at a time, but before that the maximum was 5, I think. I bought that item very early on and didn't check the maximum amount before that. The enemies you can choose from vary quite a lot and you can often choose to fight tougher elite monsters, which give better rewards.

I thought the combat was quite fun, but it got kinda boring after 8 hours because in the end it was just the same thing over and over again. At least they kept things fresh with different enemies. The difficulty ramped up quite a lot after about halfway into the game, when the enemies suddenly became very high-leveled compared to the players. Surprisingly enough, I could survive against much higher level enemies than my players were provided I only fought against 3 at a time. It could take a long time to kill them all, but I still could do it. I suppose I played it quite safe since most of the time I fought battles I knew I could win and as a result my whole party died only 3 times during the time I played the game.

When you're not in combat you can choose from several options depending on your location in the world. In almost every place you can choose to rest, start a quest specific to the location, use items, check the equipment of the players or travel to some other place. Cities usually also have shops for buying potions and equipment, a tavern and a blacksmith. The blacksmith can upgrade your equipment, but you shouldn't do that until you have increased the blacksmith's level enough for the odds to be on your side. The upgrading is chance based and it happens by throwing the dice. The range of "winning" numbers increases as the blacksmith levels up, which makes it easier to win. It's also a good idea to have level 16 players, because then you can equip items that decrease the equipment upgrading cost. I wasted several hundreds of in-game gold before I found about those items.

Moving in the world happens by opening the world map and then choosing the location. Traveling costs some gold and every time you move on the map, you throw the D20 dice and depending the roll you might get a random battle. That would get annoying very quickly, if you had to fight some low level monsters when moving around the starting area with high level players, but luckily the chance for the random battle depends on the players' levels and the levels of the monsters in the area you're travelling to. You can also a buy an item that permanently increases your dice rolls by 1, which makes it impossible to get random battles in low level areas. I thought the time it took to travel between each place was a bit too long, but you could reduce that to half if you had a certain game master active.

Quests were quite repetitive and not very fun. There is basically 3 types of quest: kill x amount of certain monsters, escort/deliver something and "fetch" some items by going to a certain place and killing the enemies there for the items and then return to the place where you started the quest. On the upside the quests gave a lot of experience. There were also some story quests as this game has a (boring) story about saving the pen and paper world. I think the dialog should have been funny, but I didn't find it funny. There were quite many references, but those weren't funny either. At one point I stopped caring about the story entirely and just skipped through the dialog. I just didn't find it interesting at all.

The game also has a special store that you can access anytime you're not in combat or in the middle of some conversation. The store has items like furniture, which boost something permanently, and snacks, which give a boost that only lasts for about 15 minutes. You can switch between the furniture you have bought without having to buy them again. I usually switched them based on the situation I was in. Everything bought in this store transferred to other saves too, so you only had to buy the stuff once.

I believe the game was originally designed for phones and tablets as there is an in-game store, from which you can buy in-game gold for real money. However, using the in-game store is never required and it can be completely ignored. Once you reach a certain point in the game, you can easily get around 300 gold from a fight that lasts for a minute. The in-game gold is transferred between saves so you can have a save for farming gold for the other save. The real money store in the game seems to be a thing that makes some people skip the game entirely, even though you never have to use the store.

The graphics are 2D pixel art and the sounds effects are pretty old-school bleeps and bloops. There is no voice acting, so you have to read through all the dialog. I thought the music was repetitive so I ended up muting it.

Overall I thought it was pretty enjoyable game and I was quite addicted to it for a while. I played it for 21 hours in total, which included me first going through half the game and then starting a new save to get couple of achievements. I finished the story in the second game I started and also beat the optional boss. I also got every achievement aside from the 3 broken ones. The boring story and the in-game real money store are definite cons, but the rest of the game is fun even without very deep character development or combat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034382226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1378714026}
review:
Looking for a game that you can pick up or leave on the fly? Then this is it. think of it as an actual pen and paper game like Dungeons and Dragons. then sprinkle in the NES Final Fantasy graphics and battle system and there you go you have this game.

The battles are pretty quick, and you can save in the middle of things making it nice to come back to.  

Nice features to the game are the power ups you can purchase for your room that offer bonuses to your team, like extra gold when you defeat foes or extra Xp (the power ups are like pictures on the wall or snacks on the table).  I also liked that the game size was pretty small  around 100mb, which means I can leave it on my computer  for when I want a quick game.  I definitly suggest getting the +1 edition  since it offers a few extras that you can not get  on the  normal version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064250648', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1388262007}
review:
Do you like Dungeons and Dragons? Do you like turn-based RPGs? Pixel-art? Yes?
This is your game.
This is a great D&D style RPG without the faux real-time of Baldur's Gate and Dragon Age: Origins
It is a very simple game, but thats what makes it so easy to pick up in play.
Not to mention that you can also controll the Dungeon Master(Narrator) which makes the game more or less challenging depending on your play style. (Although fighting low-level enemies gives you low-level rewards)
The game also has a very nice Pixel-art style that is not only beautiful to look at but nice to play through. The music is also one of the best parts of the game, with a pixelated style that reminds me of old-school western RPG with a battle theme as addictive as that of any Final Fantasy game.
Overall this is probably the most genuine fun I've had with an RPG in a long time, and easily one of my best finds/purchases.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994195296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1024, 'last_played': 1401517512}
review:
This has the appearance of a nostalgic D&D tabletop setting, but is more like a poorly-translated turn-based JRPG, where tactical positioning and well-timed skill choices are not the focus. Instead, players find themselves killing hordes upon hordes of monsters to make numbers go up so they can kill bigger hordes of scarier monsters. The story tries to be humorous about a D&D group finding the line between fantasy and reality blurred with numerous shoe-horned cameos, but the writing itself is unnatural to the point that it feels like a high-schooler's fan-fiction. In fact, if you're looking for a game the emulates the D&D experience, I recommend Cardhunter, a free-to-play tactical game with better writing and more involved gameplay.

Even if you're in the market for a mindless grind-a-thon, don't buy this on the PC. Opt for the mobile version instead, since the game also constantly puts you through miniscule but unskippable animations that would be more bearable if you could look out the window while they play. Hell, I'd recommend other mobile games entirely, but some people like their skinner boxes and this is one of the skinneriest boxes I've ever seen.

P.S.: This game *had* micro-transactions, but those have been removed. According to an anonymous source (see comment), the microtransaction was originally forced on by a publisher. A sad case of publisher overruling developer control. The game is still a terrible grind though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021827200', 'num_games_owned': 950, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1450635543}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043933684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1385740792}
review:
I picked up this game because it seemed to be a novel experience. Admittedly the first hour or so was very entertaining. The witty dialogue constantly breaks the fourth wall, and the Rollplay mechanics where fun for a while. 

Unfortunately the gameplay does not change very much after the first hour. The quests lack any distinction(the game breaks all quests down into a few archetypes), the progression system deteriorates into bland stat increases(each character has only 4 abilities), and the game's pacing entices the player to utilize the game's microtransactions to level quicker or buy better gear.

There are unlockable characters, but to use them in the current playthrough you would need to spend some time leveling them from lvl 1 or use them in a a new playthrough.

After a while the game slows to an almost literal grind. Enjoyment is derived by being able to jump in and out of over a VERY long period of time. Haven't beaten it yet but, it's pretty light and shallow so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037864828', 'num_games_owned': 582, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1434704509}
review:
My #1 old school 8bit RPG. Got plenty of hours ingame on my android phone ;)

Full of black humour and great gameplay! You play a round of pen&paper players including game masters and random encounters. Like back in the old days. The comments of the "players" are great, with comments like "No Cheats, please" and "Let´s play all night"!

And for all "boooh, Microtransaction" Whiners: You really don´t need to buy gold. This is just a way to support the devs if you want to!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047192854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1407, 'last_played': 1385619212}
review: This game is EPIC! A cute but highly customisble turn based RPG with tones of classes/races, at least 30hrs of game play. Try spot all the game and pop culture references, honestly one of the best RPG's ive played in years. Well worth its cost.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036725520', 'num_games_owned': 750, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1389250525}
review: It's all you could want out of a Pen and Paper game. I rank it right on up with Legends of Grimrock. Get this game if you like D&D or other PnP games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008261054', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1387527635}
review:
Per qualsiasi appassionato di giochi di ruolo l’uscita di Knights of Pen&Paper aveva significato una grandiosa summa dei clichè e di situazioni al limite che qualsiasi giocatore (o master) si era ritrovato a sperimentare durante le lunghe sessioni ruolistiche (rigorosamente da tavolo) collezionate nella propria carriera. L’umorismo viscerale, misto ad un buon sistema di combattimento a turni, formavano il cuore pulsante di questo giochino all’apparenza casual ma che invece sapeva garantire una buona profondità nonchè svariate ore di gioco di qualità. L’uscita di una versione riveduta e corretta, che inoltre garantiva anche nuovi contenuti e una revisione del sistema di combattimento, non poteva che essere accolta con gioia.

Se il core del gioco rimane pressochè immutato il più del lavoro fatto è stato quello di aumentare la longevità della campagna principale. La scelta fatta è stata quella di eliminare il concetto di campagna stessa lasciando un’unica grande “trama” su cui innestare tutti i contenuti, compresi quelli che potrebbero venire da future espansioni o DLC. Dimenticatevi quindi la modalità arena e future campagne tutte nuove, ma preparatevi ad un numero davvero buono di nuovi dungeon, mostri nonchè ad una revisione delle abilità dei personaggi e del bilanciamento del sistema di combattimento.

Leggi la recensione completa su TheNetworkShelter.com: http://theshelternetwork.com/knights-of-penpaper-1-edition-tra-critici-e-maldestri/

author: {'steamid': '76561198024786813', 'num_games_owned': 969, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 809, 'last_played': 1389492755}
review: Such a simple game, yet very entertaining. The DLC and buying gold are kind of meh, but nothing you can't earn with enough time in the game. This game reminds me of classic table top RPG, but thats about where it stops. There are a few funny lines in the game and while they are repeated, it isn't often enough to annoy me. I would highly recommend getting it while on sale, but if you need something to do the regular price isn't too bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026775025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1390694919}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024912828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1425697916}
review: Instead of cutting the griding and making the gameplay a better experience, this game instead makes it easier for you to battle endlessly on the quest for more levels and delivers a shallow story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006898454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1380123372}
review: Το Knights of Pen and Paper αποτυγχάνει πλήρως ως PC game, καθώς είναι υπερβολικά ρηχό ακόμα και για τα δεδομένα της κατηγορίας τιμής στην οποία ανήκει (9,99€). Όταν με αυτά τα χρήματα ο καθένας μπορεί να αγοράσει καταφανώς ανώτερα indie games ή πλήρεις εμπορικούς τίτλους σε προσφορά, η τιμολόγηση ενός τόσο απλοϊκού παιχνιδιού σε αυτά τα επίπεδα δεν έχει καμία απολύτως λογική. Το όποιο ενδιαφέρον για το gameplay κρατά περίπου μισή ώρα συνολικά, μέχρι να καταστεί σαφές οτι ο παίκτης δε μπορεί να περιμένει τίποτα περισσότερο. Η ποιότητα των γραφικών είναι χαμηλή, ο ήχος επαναλαμβανόμενος, το replayability ελάχιστο. Πιστεύω οτι ακόμα και για τα δεδομένα των mobile games το Knights of Pen and Paper χαρακτηρίζεται από μετριότητα, πόσω μάλλον αν κριθεί ως PC game. Αν για κάποιο λόγο θέλετε να παίξετε οπωσδήποτε το συγκεκριμένο παιχνίδι, προτιμήστε τουλάχιστον την έκδοση για Android και iOS η οποία είναι τιμολογημένη πιο ρεαλιστικά. Η δική μου πρόταση πάντως είναι να ψάξετε για κάτι άλλο. Διαβάστε το πλήρες review στη διεύθυνση http://ragequit.gr/reviews/item/knights-of-pen-and-paper-pc-review

author: {'steamid': '76561197997576331', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 992, 'last_played': 1693171982}
