author: {'steamid': '76561198051451442', 'num_games_owned': 1084, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1454032474}
review:
This beings back so many great memories of playing the original table top Dungeons and Dragons. I have only put in a few hours but for being an old school gamer, this game is what I was hoping it would be, fun and attention grabbing. You start out with 2 characters and you start doing quest, mostly by killing mosters, which you gain XP and coins. With the coins you can unlock more characters, buy equipment, pay for travel, buy additional tables, buy bonuses, etc. If you are bored easy, do not like 8-bit graphics, never played D&D, or do not want to grind out some levels, then this game might not be for you.

Pros: 

-Adjustable screen resolution
-Like you are playing a D&D game
-Replayable

Cons:

-Music (8-bit music but mute works great)
-Grindy

author: {'steamid': '76561198068133951', 'num_games_owned': 858, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1382849226}
review: 可能很多人都是因为慈善包才有的这个游戏吧，可能只是用来挂卡，压根没玩过，然而我倒是在杉果买的，39大洋，这个游戏缺点很明显，内购，没错，虽然游戏中的金币确实可以从游戏过程中获得，可是并不足以支持你的使用，当然你可以选择反复的刷刷刷……这是因为这个游戏的道具可以分为两部分，一部分是游戏过程中的道具，譬如说加血药啊，刀剑啊之类的，另一部分是游戏外的道具（诚如你所见，这个游戏是在游戏中玩DND跑团游戏……），这些道具对游戏本身影响很大，譬如说圣杯，能够让你进入游戏的角色变多，可惜需要金币购买，这是这个游戏很过分的一个地方，虽然说金币在后期很充足，但是我必须要批评这种行为。就游戏本身的品质而言，它是从手机游戏移植而来，所以整体游戏显得紧张而又短促，流程、过程很快，剧情本身还算是有趣，角色的培养也是有板有眼，每个职业的制作也是用心，在手机上确实很适合打发时间，可惜现在是电脑

author: {'steamid': '76561198014963564', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 967, 'last_played': 1454038071}
review: A surprisingly fun game, with quirky humor and fun, blocky graphics. If you've ever played pen and paper RPGs, this game is a fun diversion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028615861', 'num_games_owned': 1136, 'num_reviews': 650, 'playtime_forever': 1366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1347, 'last_played': 1380220040}
review:
El planteamiento de Knights of Pern and Paper es muy bueno, invitándonos a jugar no un juego de rol, sino una partida de rol. Ahí, con continuas roturas de la cuarta pared y referencias frikis, es donde vamos a estar. Sin embargo, este prometedor comienzo, que nos tendrá pillados la primera media hora acaba pronto oxidándose ante el hecho de que en el fondo, todos los diálogos son pseudo aleatorios y repetitivos y no afectan a la jugabilidad (incluso cuando los jugadores dicen que van a llamar por teléfono siguen jugando al mismo tiempo); en ese entorno en que las bromas y las tramas se deshacen en lo rutinario, nos encontramos con que la única dinámica jugable, que repetiremos hasta la saciedad, es el combate, que usa un mecanismo clásico pero también aburrido al cabo de un rato. Con lo cual nos pasaremos horas matando bichos básicamente haciendo los mismos combos en el mismo orden con los mismos personajes. Así que la propuesta inicial es muy buena, pero la realización flojea. 
A nivel de gráficos pues son gráficos 8 bit que no están mal pero tampoco particularmente inspirados, y la escasez de músicas y sonidos acaba siendo enormemente cansina. Un 4.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042118407', 'num_games_owned': 6189, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 2369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1751, 'last_played': 1464719861}
review: Hmm, the story is actually quite interesting at times. Can't quite say the same for the play. Get onto an early optimal strategy, and you can just ride it through the entire time. Eh, it's alright I guess, but there's better pen and paper nostalgia trips out there. Actually comes out much better on a mobile platform, able to quickly pick up and play for a few minutes and get sucked in for an hour or three til the battery smacks you upside the head. Still could do with more side stuff to do, less linear direction, and more varied strategy. 3/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197986003679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1380013227}
review: I didn't enjoy this game. Expect a LOT of grinding brainless tasks to progress, OR you could pay real money to quicken the grinding (which is garbage).

author: {'steamid': '76561197981669870', 'num_games_owned': 951, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3241, 'last_played': 1473068035}
review:
This game is really fun......mainly because it makes fun of the RPG genre! The gameplay is basically turn-based, and there is also character levelling! The dialogue in this game is especially hilarious, making references to Lord of the Rings, Steam and even Gabe Newell(and Gordon Freeman's crowbar). Music is stereotypical 90's era RPG style, which goes well with all the pixels! A must buy in my opinion, especially if you are an RPG fan!

11/10 
Would crawl through pixellated dungeons again!

author: {'steamid': '76561197966527290', 'num_games_owned': 3788, 'num_reviews': 473, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1380090632}
review:
"Entièrement réalisé en 2D, en pixels, avec des musiques chiptunes du plus bel effet, le jeu n’a vraiment rien à envier aux pros du genre. Mais surtout, ce sont les très nombreuses références insérées dans chaque plan du jeu qui rendent l’aventure amusante. Celles-ci ne sont pas toutes évidentes car classiques. Elles vont de Doctor Who aux Muppets, en passant par les Gremlins, Asterix, Stargate, Donjons & Dragons (évidemment) et bien d’autres encore. En fin de jeu, vous découvrirez même Gabe Newell en costume de Gordon Freeman à la recherche de son pied de biche légendaire. Du grand n’importe quoi à tous les niveaux ! Vous pourrez même acheter des objets venant décorer votre chambre de jeu, changer le MeuJeu (pour avoir un ersatz de Yoda ou Doc Brown à la place), placer à boire et à manger pour des bonus temporaires et ainsi modifier un peu les statistiques de vos parties.

Et tout cela est passionnant au plus haut point et permet au joueur de s’accrocher, de vouloir aller toujours plus loin, malgré une répétitivité assez effroyable. En effet, on effectue toujours les mêmes actions, des allers-retours incessants sur la carte et bien des combats juste pour obtenir un peu d’expérience et d’argent. Même à haut niveau, les personnages sont assez “faibles” et cela rend les affrontements assez longs même quand on en connait l’inévitable victoire finale. Ajoutez à cela un jeu toujours pas traduit en français (alors que bien des pays ont eu le droit à leur version) et vous comprendrez aisément que le jeu n’est pas totalement accessible au plus grand nombre." GameSideStory.com

review: It's so cute and funny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079964843', 'num_games_owned': 5872, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1385310971}
review: Эта великолепная RPG несет в себе дух олдсульных пошаговых стратегий. По сути это настольная ролевая игра, но тем не менее всеми битвами управляем мы сами, "представляя" врагов. Возможность менять ведущего, стол, коврик, и даже дверь, стены, а также поставить в игровой комнате интерьер, все это будет давать какой-то бонус игрокам. Переходы между локациями, возможность спокойно поспать, а также Dungeon-ы - все это построено на теории вероятности(нужно кинуть кости). Приятная ненавязчивая музыка и греющие душу звуки вкупе в вышенаписанным сделали свое дело, и игра получилась действительно достойная.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961093505', 'num_games_owned': 4612, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1381268266}
review:
This has all the elements of a biting, creative satire, with a setup where you pick from stereotypes of PNP players, embark on lampshadedly obvious quests and can buy nachos and soda as powerups.

Then it turns out they're completely serious.

Then you uninstall the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028357706', 'num_games_owned': 897, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1384717464}
review: Ciekawy RPG w klasycznym stylu. Gra jest moich ulubionych klimatów, lecz niektórzy pewnie by się znudzili po dłuższym czasie grania w to przez powtarzalność czynności w grze. Moja ocena to 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004006644', 'num_games_owned': 2633, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 1537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1195, 'last_played': 1425756314}
review:
Awesome fun game , going back classic roll dice for luck mechanism extremely good time killer , was mislead by reading on forums that this is a p2w game where you have to buy coins to get good items.
After playing this for a while , its not true , sure the game uses coins for everything but if you nail down a good group , you can earn coins in no time, most of the items can also be found seperately and via quests.
Works great , a must play

EDIT: try to get the deluxe edition if possible it has some locked achievements and not sold as dlc

author: {'steamid': '76561198032788858', 'num_games_owned': 1105, 'num_reviews': 678, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1384306843}
review:
D&D  в миниатюре, где ведущего заменил ИИ. 

Изначально вы создаете партию которой и будете проходить всю игру. Выбор довольно большой как среди типажей, так и среди классов, причем по мере прохождения вам станут доступны новые классы персонажей (оборотень-рыцарь, круто же). Механика боевой части просто и понятна - ваши герои и противники совершают действия по ходам (друг за другом). В плане графики все от и до построено из пикселей, что не мешает игрушке выглядеть хорошо. Юмор здесь стоит отдельно, его так много, что это реальный элемент игры. 

Спустись в пещеру! 7,5 из 10 :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198064474700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1520600932}
review: best game i have ever played

author: {'steamid': '76561198090318755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1250, 'last_played': 1383427871}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper вызывает двоякие чувства. С одной стороны, вроде бы, добротная ролевка с золотом, прокачкой, магией, квестами и интересной задумкой ведения истории, а с другой - однообразие, быстрое надоедание и возможностью доната. 

Да, о донате, он там есть и это бред ума лишенного!!! Перенесли с мобильных устройств игру, а донат не убрали. Но расстраиваться незачем, есть много способов быстро заработать деньжат и приобрести все плюшки в магазине. Еще из недостатков - в игре, отсутствует возможность получить 3 ачивки, что очень раздражает, а разработчики молчат по этому поводу.  Так же напрягает отсутствие реиграбельности. Нет, она есть: другие классы, другие персонажи, но они так похожи, что это не засчитываеться.

Из положительных моментов запомнились лишь некоторые моменты. В Knights of Pen and Paper встречаются отсылки к другим играм и игровой культуре, а это радует. Так же, есть какой-то волшебный шарм в пиксельной графике.

UPD:
Прошло время. Во мне заснул, нет, скорее задремал перфикционист, и я не так яростно отношусь к халатности разработчиков. Слегка изменил оценку, всего на одну десятую. Но игру, как и раньше - не рекомендую.

Сюжет / игровой мир: 5
Графика / стилистика: 7
Анимация: 5
Звук: 5
Геймплей: 5
Реиграбельность: Нет

Для ролевки - слабо, и факт что это инди, никак не облегчает. 4.4/10

review:
The game in essence is sound even if it gets too repetitive and tedious as you yearn to finish the damn thing halfway through. 

What annoyed me is the lame ass port that doesn't use the keyboard period... for a PC RPG game that could make great use of it thats just plain fucking stupid. Another big issue is the deluxe edition thing is a rip off and that 'extra' stuff should be included in the regular game price (especially that area that adjust to your level so you can easily grind out the levels you WILL need to get anywhere in this game).

Basically I'm sorry I started playing it and felt compelled to finish it. Fuck this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019205444', 'num_games_owned': 4251, 'num_reviews': 323, 'playtime_forever': 3104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1938, 'last_played': 1512928287}
review:
I can describe Knights of Pen and Paper as a Dungeons & Dragons simulator instead of your typical RPG. There is no exploration or movement. It is all menu and dialog based. The map is pretty segmented like a Mario map and there are not maps so much as there are quests. These quests revolve around typical and simplified RPG turn based combat. The catch is you also play your own dungeon master, so you can select your enemies to fight and how many you will fight. Its as if you're making your own busy work. The classes feel balanced, but the battles begin feel too long for the never ending grind that this game becomes. Unless you want to spend real money to buy in game gold.

The game has a lot of personalization. You start the game selecting characters and their classes. Each character has its own passive ability and then you assign a class. You can only have one of a class per party. Each class has 4 upgradeable abilities, some are passives like regenerate HP per turn and most are combat abilities. When you level up through experience defeating enemies, you can level up a skill. Leveling up skills increases the MP they use, so its a double edged sword where eventually you can only use a skill once or twice before you need to rest or use potions. There are items that will regenerate MP and HP along with increase maximums.

The combat abilities feel useful. Paladins have a leader strike that is a powerful attack. The strike will increase their threat to enemies driving the majority of attacks to that character. To balance the attention, the paladin has a temporary shield power, a flash heal for themselves and devotion that increases the base HP. A cleric can heal the entire party or focus healing on one character. They can also use a smite skill that damages an enemy and heals themselves. To round things out there is a weakening spell to debuff enemy attack power for three enemies. Mages have a single enemy damaging fireball that will burn them, damaging HP each turn. They also have a deep freeze that damages and stuns an enemy. Mages also have a meteor that damages an entire enemy party and finally a passive stream that increases the base MP. I can't cover all the classes, but they feel well rounded. 

The classes have to feel well rounded, because the game is nothing but combat. A chess game between you and enemies that you chose to fight. The game has plenty of quests to give you and you can tackle them one at a time. Nothing that will stump you, since all the 'quests' seem to be collect X amount of Y or defeat X amount of Y enemies. Escort X from point A to B and then fight a battle. It wouldn't seem like such a grind if your travel had more exploration instead of moving along a line from location to location. There is some banter along the way, but its just your party sitting at a table facing a dungeon master with different beautiful backgrounds. The battles get long, even with better equipment. It gets frustrating when you complete a quest to kill 7 plants only to get another quest to kill 9 plants. Then that quest followed by another quest to get 19 carrots. How? By killing the same plants you've just slaughtered. You can always pick your quests, but its useless when you'll end up doing them all anyway.

When you visit a town, you don't walk to a store, you just click on an icon that will open up the store. The items are nice. Upgrading weapons and armor involves a gambling system. Sure it costs 150 gold to have a blacksmith upgrade your gear, but there's only a 35% chance he'll succeed. Seems like a gamble and a waste of gold. The blacksmith will get better with every try . You can even increase the blacksmith's experience by using grindstones that you'll buy or find in caves.

That leads me to warn you of this. Microtransactions. Why grind for gold when you can just buy it with real life money? The microtransactions aren't in your face or annoying, but they are there and some people have problems with that. If you want gold, go kill some enemies, there's nothing else to do in the game.

If someone in your party dies, that costs gold. Since resurrection costs gold, when your party gets wiped out and you don't have enough gold to resurrect one of them, that's it. It was originally a gameover, because the game will save itself preventing you from going back to a previous point when your party was alive. So you'd have to buy gold with real life money. Luckily, there is now a free continue that will resurrect everyone, but reset their level experience. I'm thankful of that. If you don't want to grind to level up your characters, you can always buy experience with gold. There is always a need for gold. Whether its experience, resurrection, traveling, or gambling to upgrade your equipment. Oh and don't forget buying stuff.

At some point, this game is busy work and you know some people are ok with that. In all, I would say its a fun game, but other RPGs are better. Since this is trying to be a Dungeons & Dragons simulator without being a true RPG its just lacking in some areas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006636652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 1799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1756, 'last_played': 1382096916}
review:
What can i say....
I spent way to many hours on this one. It's silly, old-school, simple yet addictive RPG.

I stopped playing it during the NewGame+ mode. It became over the top grindy at that point. I'd love to try the other classes, but their just way under-leveled and i'd have to grind even more to get those up to speed.

It's got a lot of quirks and issues, but it gets away with them. As a windowed game on the side as you listen to an audiobook or something this game is perfect.

Like old-school RPGs and have lots of time on your hand? Get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979939042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1375, 'last_played': 1423617122}
review:
In a word: Avoid. Read on for reasons.

A game that simulates pen and paper RPGs? Sounds great, doesn't it? This game will do just that, but the Dungeon Master is largely unamusing, which leads to a mundane story. The comments your party makes are usually cheesy one-liners or memes, or video game references. You roll a d20 for quests, upgrading gear, getting grindstones in caves, resting in non-towns, and travelling, and failing a dice roll only makes the game more tedious. The battle system is all turn-based, and order is loosely based on initiative, but it's mostly random.

A more minor point though are the microtransactions for in-game gold which are COMPLETELY UNNECESSARY but for some reason every day some guy will complain about "ermergerd microtransactions" in the community hub. The microtransactions are NOT REQUIRED at any point in the game; the microtransactions only help you by shaving off a few minutes of your time that would otherwise have been spent doing what you already have to do for the entire game. The microtransactions only give you gold. You get gold from fighting monsters. 

For the obsessive, completionist players:
As of typing up this post there are at least 5 broken achievements out of 43. Apparently there have been inquiries sent to the developers asking when the achievements will be fixed, and the answer provided was that the devs were busy working on another project that isn't Knights of Pen and Paper. 

tl;dr:

Do not buy, because:
1. Unoriginal plot
2. Ridiculously random
3. Unnecessarily tedious
4. Broken achievements

author: {'steamid': '76561198028179042', 'num_games_owned': 5917, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 1182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1426201096}
review:
Para cualquier veterano de los RPG es imprescindible puro revival.

De forma simple trae de vuelta la experiencia de los primeros RPG en paln hack'n slash  donde se simula una mesa de juego con diferentes jugadores que van eligiendo personajes  y jugando diferentes misiones que van de lo más simple como matar 6 ratas a una larga sucesión de viajes y combates para conseguir que una princesa se reuna con el bardo que adora y que ha desaparecido.

Tiene muchos guiños, unos gráficos simples y divertidos y muchas opciones diferentes para probar.

review: At first I was worried that this would be a horrible game.  I'm glad to say that I was VERY wrong.  I truly enjoyed this game and all of the references it makes.  There are a ton of clever easter eggs and the story is suprisingly well done all things considered.  It's worth it's weight in pixels.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996017890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1646499962}
review: Bel gioco in pixel art che prende in giro simpaticamente i gdr riproponendo le classiche quest e situazioni che tutti i giocatori un po navigati avranno sicuramente affontato. Buon sistema di combattimento (a turni) e si livellamento. Unica barbonata il sistema di microtransazioni per acquistare pacchetti di monete d'oro a colpi di denaro vero, messa li per spremere gli stupidi dato che se ne può fare palesemente a meno.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020489546', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1640372350}
review: Não deixe se enganar pelos gráficos pixelados, Knights of Pen and Paper tem muito a oferecer. A idéia brilhante de contar uma história "medieval" através de um simulador de "RPG de mesa", incluindo diversas referências contemporâneas merece ser aplaudida de pé! E não se engane com os comentários negativos: ao contrário do que dizem, o sistema de microtransações não atrapalha em nada o jogo e, a menos que você seja um daqueles que corre chorando pra mamãe em qualquer dificuldade, é totalmente dispensável, podendo ser ignorado sem medo!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999734532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1343, 'last_played': 1393164814}
review:
This game ate up an entire Tuesday and Wednesday for me.
Seriously.  I haven't even moved.  Just sat here, playing.

It's sad that some achievements are bugged and can't be gotten, otherwise I'd have 100%'d this gem.  There's micro transactions in the game but they're totally optional.  I completed the game without spending any more money on the game than the pennies I bought it for.

If you like pen and paper RPGs like Dungeons and Dragons and Pathfinder, you might enjoy this tribute.  Many gaming easter eggs, some laughs, fun storyline.  

Replayability? Hm.. I don't know, probably not much.  I think you'd finish it twice but that's about it.

If this comes on sale, give it a go, I bought it for £4 and was highly worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988252651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1402464086}
review:
8Bit graphics and 8Bit sound. Brings you right back to the old school feel. There is even the added humor in the game of the players questions and quips.

I did enjoy the game and its not a bad little game but I wouldn't pay more then $1.50 for it.

The game seems to be built on micro transactions where you need to buy gold to get some uber items, purchase trinkets to get the option to fill up the other three chairs.

You start off with selecting 2 players for the game and have to spend 10gold to open a third spot and more top open the rest, allot more.

I kinda like it but its a Facebook game that found its way onto Steam. It would be better enjoyed on the iPad then on the PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999477940', 'num_games_owned': 618, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1184, 'last_played': 1380233685}
review:
Get this guys: Single-player Earthbound / Mother style graphics transformed into a board game. You get to choose your events and your own spawned monsters since you take the role as a player and a GM at the same time.

The +1 expansions makes the game worth playing. But the Blacksmith is very unforgiving. 40% success rate as a base to upgrade your items. \

The control scheme makes it ideal for touch tablet/touch screen users, but if you don't mind moving your mouse around and clicking a lot. GET A BIT OF THAT OSU WORKOUT!... Then you should be fine.

I got it on a daily deal for 60% off. It's worth it big time for that.
But when it's not on sale and it's 10 dollars? 15 dollars? What... WHATTTTTTTT!?

What slightly made me frown were two things: A) Their Android/iPhone App Version costs $2.99. B) There is the option to buy more gold with Microtransactions (convenience, they say.) While the only thing you can buy is currency, it really makes most users very discouraged to buy it. But trust me, it's a lot better to play it at a normal rate. You'll grow to love your characters more.

Given that some builds are worth more than others, you'll see that all the passives are worth leveling a lot in the early levels. There are unlockable classes, and loot to gather. The start of the game gets very slow, but hey. This game's a neat RPG to burn your time. While exponentially better for touch users, it's a neat little gem to stumble upon. BUT WHATEVER YOU DO, DO NOT PRESS THAT "+" SIGN ON THE TOP RIGHT CORNER.

Play the game for what it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004631713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1593442364}
review: A great game for anyone who enjoys D&D style games. Knights of Pen and Paper is a fantastic game which strangely addicting, great fun and has a lot of replay value. Sadly, it appears that no more updates are on the way for this game due to lack of interest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052673908', 'num_games_owned': 1374, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1428928321}
review: 很有龙与地下城的感觉！简单但又有很高的可玩性，剧情幽默！内购也比较合理。不过出在steam上的游戏做内购是不是太坑爹了啊！总之，大作不想玩的时候，玩玩这个满轻松愉快的！

author: {'steamid': '76561197988922281', 'num_games_owned': 3128, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1380070912}
review:
Metagaming.. a thing that's rather hard to avoid nowadays, so here's a tabletop RPG to perfectly match that criteria. Cause we all know the 'urge' and appeal of metagaming.

As off-putting as that may sound, it's actually a fun and enjoyable game.. ..and really now, if you want to play a traditional RPG a la D&D you would have hard time finding a decent and/or long lasting one online - at least not in the shape of an actual game like this.

The game has scripted segments which is to be expected but there is still a lot of depth and freedom for the player to customize their own party and course of adventure. Fans of D&D will probably find more enjoyment than the average layman but in the end it boils down to personal opinion.

There are a few people that call this game pay-to-win because it offers the option to buy gold for IRL money but that's a serious facepalm. For one, being a singleplayer game there's not really much to 'win' other than a hearty laugh from people like me. And two, gold is so easy to get in game that it becomes a total a waste of money unless you're one of those people who likes to show their support if it even does anything for them.

Aside from all those ignorant fools, the game is really fun and a definite recommendation for D&D / Tabletop fans or newcomers interested in the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010577733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1380197610}
review:
This game is awesome in so many ways.

Its charming presentation, tongue in cheek style, actually takes me back to the days when I used to play AD&D.

Easily worth the normal price, let alone the great deal currently on.  I don't know that the 'Deluxe' edition is worth it, but I'm quite glad I paid the extra $2 just so the devs get a little more.

My only complaint is the in-game micro-transaction store, though it's completely not required in the slightest.  Especially since you can hack the gold perfectly fine.

BUY THIS NAO!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053271326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 2992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1586071160}

author: {'steamid': '76561198047581178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1421210180}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034663705', 'num_games_owned': 8151, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1387409579}
review:
Knights of Pen & Paper, originally for iOS, is a turn-based RPG with a novel concept: you take on the role of real-life players in a tabletop game.  The camera is set behind a table where up to five of your characters are seated, with the dungeon master on the other side leading you through the story.  Dialogue tends to be humorous and frequently goes out of character.

The game begins with character creation, where you must assign your players a real-life persona and one of a dozen traditional RPG classes, each with four skills.  The actual gameplay takes place around your table, as if you’re in the middle of all the action, and consists of traveling to locations on a world map and completing quests, which are really just more battles in disguise.  In fact, the entire game is simply one battle after another and becomes very repetitive, very fast.

As expected, level-ups provide stat bonuses and allow you to upgrade your skills and wear better equipment.  Armor and weapons may only be improved at the blacksmith, but each character has four additional slots for equipping various accessories.  In addition to in-game shops, there is a “real-life” shop where you may purchase snacks that provide temporary buffs for your players, as well as decorations and furniture that confer permanent bonuses.

Overall, Knights of Pen & Paper is passable in the context of mobile gaming but completely forgettable when compared to quality games on the PC platform.  Considering the price is $9.99 on Steam vs a mere $2.99 on iOS and Android, it’s borderline offensive that the devs left in-app purchases in the game, allowing you to buy gold with your Steam wallet funds.  Such a shameless exhibit of its mobile origins is a fitting red flag for a game that also fails to break away from the shallow, repetitive gameplay those origins typically entail.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077868694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1467944248}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966019915', 'num_games_owned': 2111, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1418544485}
review:
Knights of Pen and Paper +1 Edition is a strange little game that takes the fourth wall and breaks it. It doesn't just take a sledgehammer to it or anything, it demolishes that wall and lets you view a weird (but amusing) hybrid of a pen-and-paper RPG with the characters as well.

Visually the game manages to hold it's unique touch, even on the PC platform. Music also does fairly well at making itself memorable in terms of it's melody but to some it could get extremely repetitive over time.

While this game does have an in-game-store with which you can buy "gold" (the game's currency for getting buffs and permanent benefits, but the gold is just as easily earned by playing making the in-game-store a bit useless except to those who are extremely impatient.

The game can be a great time waster for people wanting to poke a little fun at the D&D genre and has taken a good number of hours from me. Without the timed waits that the mobile version has, this is a much better build that just lets you play without interference.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095007864', 'num_games_owned': 1176, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1494736206}

review: One of the best RPG's I'd never heard of. You create characters and play a game of those characters palying a game of D&D. Including dice rolls, skills, and equipment. It also features plenty of upgrades to your table and room, giving you buffs to stats for your characters. Knights of Pen and Paper is fun, creative, a little witty, and deffinitly worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073487741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1486226313}

IMPERDIVEL!

AWESOOOME!  Worth every penny! Great game with all aspects related to the real pen and paper RPG of old. Extremely addicted and fun at same time. If dont´have KPP+1, you must buy it! Hours of fun and adventure!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969385956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1867, 'last_played': 1392522525}
review:
The game is advertised as you playing the *players* of people playing D&D. the gameplay honestly is just watered down D&D with the cast replaced by a table full of players though. 

It's a cute game for a bit. It cameos or references various topical humor bits liek Gremlins, Scooby Doo, Star wars, TMNT, Short Circut (the list goes on amazingly and would probably be the main reason to keep playing when the gameplay starts being a bore: Just to see what else they show us).

But it doesn't really keep your interest too well as a game. The classes don't branch out or anything. Every class has the same 3 or 4 moves they started with. It also suffers from "FF7 status effect syndrome"; where only pure damage and buff moves matter as anytime a debuff would be theoretically useful the monster is immune to it anyway - usually a boss, but not always.

It's a cheap game though so you can't really go wrong if you just want to goof around and mess with something that doesn't take itself seriously. In small doses it's fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987945573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1234, 'last_played': 1375810653}
review:
Not really a fun game... more of a satire/parody, and kinda bland compared to what I researched before buying.

Bugged achievements also bug the hell out of me.

The random dice rolls aren't really a sense of random, its not something you have control over as in it doesn't need to be there, it's like a sign saying You Suck rather than just hide it. Unlike old Final Fantasy games your random encounters just occur randomly, you don't need a dice that you have 0 control over to place it in your face.

I feel it's there just to piss me off, and there's no benefit to having a success roll except for enchanting weapons.

Game is also extremely short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006873223', 'num_games_owned': 3163, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1380515424}
review:
Knights of Pen & Paper is a pixelated prowess, the best way to describe this game is to say "Yo dawg, I heard you like RPG so we put them brothers roleplaying in your RPG". The best meta-game experience ever created for portable devices now on your desktop and with a +1 bonus. Grab your cardboard sword and get ready to challenge your own players to save the day while you're playing the players and saving the day!

Interview with one of the developers (Brazilian Portuguese)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8AXA0p8mvxU

Knights of Pen & Paper é uma piração pixelada, a melhor maneira de descrever o jogo é dizer que é um jogo RPG dentro de uma partida de RPG. Parece esquisito mas é exatamente isso, a melhor experiência meta game já criada para aparelhos portáteis agora disponível no seu computador e ainda veio com um bônus de +1 de quebra. Pega o seu d20 da sorte e se prepare para desafiar os seus jogadores a salvar o dia enquanto você controla eles para salvar o dia!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

author: {'steamid': '76561197995243553', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1433877663}
review: Great RPG. Instead of races you pick stereotypes/characters and then assign them a class. Each class has four skills. You can have a party of up to five. Everything in the game uses the same currency. It does offer more gold for microtransactions but I think it's pretty well implemented. You don't have to spend a million dollars to get a bunch of gold. It starts as low as 99 cents for 300 gold and the top is $5 for 10,000 gold which is very reasonable I think. The gameplay is turn based fighting with all the strategy you expect. Your tank can tank, your mage can magic, your rogue can stealth etc. I am really diggin this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095512967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1484, 'last_played': 1398987704}
review: Oh my gosh! If you're a fan of old-school pen and paper roleplaying or old school Final Fantasy you will love this game. It's fun to play, has a great story, it's funny, and theres a ton of pop-cultural, RPG or gaming references within!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974985005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 828, 'last_played': 1444609902}
review: Very fun to play that brings a classic table top game to the video game land with visuals. Complete with dice rolls, comedic dialogs, and pop culture references.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979084213', 'num_games_owned': 4492, 'num_reviews': 1009, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1392328060}
review:
I expected Knights Of Pen And Paper +1 to be an old school RPG with a full story mode, but instead it's a game where you create and complete your own quests. It sounds clever as your characters are also placed behind a table and there's a guy that acts as a dungeon master, but so far I've been doing nothing but completing boring quests and grinding so I can level up my characters.
*This is not the game you're looking for.* It's not the one I'm looking for, anyway.

[Rating: 64/100]

author: {'steamid': '76561198023058866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1446256769}
review: An amazing design and idea for this game. The classes and characters are all unique and well made. The over all idea that this is all just a game in a house as you sit in your chairs with the 'dungeon master' is great. Not to mention the buyable foods/drinks that sit on the table and give you buffs are amusing and helpful. I recommend this for any RPG/DnD lover.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017657822', 'num_games_owned': 1112, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1681460317}
review: It's not a bad little game.  It's a port/adaptation of a game originally developed for smart devices, but it plays quite well in translation. There are a few small design changes I'd have made differently, and it's not as funny as I had expected, but it's a neat turn-based RPG done simply with a couple cool extras that provide some depth and customization. My overall impression after about ten hours would be a solid 8/10.  I don't feel the need to seek out a RL game of D&D afer playing this, but at least I can dork out over a D20 in secret thanks to Knights of Pen and Paper.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976543406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 754, 'last_played': 1371959595}
review:
KPP is a small, yet clever and fun game. You build your party of players, and let the DM take you through the magical, tedious universe of a classic D20 tabletop game.

Travel to different areas on the map to battle monsters and complete quests. Collect gold and use it to buy items, equipment, even go meta and spend your gold on a pizza for the table. It's everything you might expect from the title.

Overall, it's pretty straight-forward, simple, classicly repititve, and surprisingly charming. $10-15 is a little much, but definitely grab it when it goes on sale.

Sidenote: Plays well on an x86 tablet, using only touch gestures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005643963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1408302102}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987853448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1374249249}
review:
Noooossstaaaaaaaallllggaaaaaa!

This is a really addictive little game, Full to the brim with pop-culture references and fairly hilarious diologue to boot.

There's plenty of ways to personalize your party and decorate your room, Large amount of (fairly standard) monsters and an engaging questline.

Worth the money :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197998896178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 2199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1695, 'last_played': 1440196788}
review:
Curator Review:

7/10. Good for one playthrough. Got my 1$ per hour out of it.

The Knights of Pen and Paper +1 is a game set in the world of "Pen and Paper" where your glorious team of heroes sets off on a great adventure to save the world.

It is like playing from a pre-made campaign in D&D, only you play the part as the Dungeon Master AND the Player Characters. The story takes about six hours to complete the first time through. Microtransactions are optional but unnecessary.

Overall, I give it a 7/10. I enjoy D&D greatly so my score may be slightly biased. However, I don't see much in the way of replayability. Once you learn how the game works it is fairly easy to complete. If the game offered more campaigns, I might step in and play one through.

https://youtu.be/Wg6A0j2IlFA

author: {'steamid': '76561197968147924', 'num_games_owned': 896, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1495400718}
review:
This game. This game.

If it's not enough yet that you, as a player, are playing players who play a tabletop RPG in which they play their characters while you also play the DM...
...then the amazing amount of references to popular media from Doctor Who to Monty Python to The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy to Star Wars to Back to the Future to too many to name... (Oh, and it also has a bunch of past game references in it.)
...or the wonderful humor that's in the game..
...or the fact you can play with your granny, little brother, and even the pizza guy...
...or at the very least the fact this kind of a gem only shows itself every once in a blue moon should convince you to get this game and play it to death and back.

Seriously, go get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042890140', 'num_games_owned': 2477, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1392662390}
review: Ever wanted to play a DnD styled game that makes the actual DMing and other real life aspects of tabletop games an actual game mechanic?  Then this is the game for you!  With quirky humor, tons of content, and interesting and deep mechanics, this game is a steal for its price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017906585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1528130640}
review:
What started out as a mobile app with more features and content imaginable for its RIDICULOUSLY low price ($2 for over 50 hours worth of content without needing to grind like it's an MMO), has now come to the PCs! Even if you're one of the gamers who feel they're "entitled to exclusive features just cause it's a 500% price hike", you definitely need to give this a try if you love old-school pen and paper tabletop RPGs. It's the perfect homage to those games.

BAZINGA!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002953992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 910, 'last_played': 1384900799}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020839154', 'num_games_owned': 773, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 914, 'last_played': 1382034546}
review: Игра предствляет из себя настольную игру (а-ля D&D) в 8-бит стиле. Все ярко, красочно и с доброй порцией юмора. Впечатления от первых минут игры только положительные. Баланс на хорошем уровне, а если вы слабы в подобном жанре, то можете сами выбрать количество монстров с которыми будете сражаться.  РПГ тоже не отстет, левел апы, шмотки, спеллы, все прокачивается/покупается/лутается. Для меня этот жанр открытие, и я без доли сомнений ставлю "ДЕСЯТЬ ИЗ ДЕСЯТИ ГОСПОДИ, ДЕСЯТЬ ИЗ ДЕСЯТИ!!!!"
